name: cancel
trans: 取消， 废除； 删去， 删除； 抵消

sentences.english: Our flight was cancelled.
sentences.chinese: 我们的航班取消了。

sentences.english: I’m afraid I’ll have to cancel our meeting tomorrow.
sentences.chinese: 恐怕我得取消我们明天的会议。

sentences.english: You’ll just have to ring John and cancel.
sentences.chinese: 你只能打电话给约翰取消了。

detailed_translations.english: to decide that something that was officially planned will not happen

sentences.english: She proceeded to recline on a chaise longue.
sentences.chinese: 她开始斜靠在一个躺椅上。

detailed_translations.english: to lie or lean back in a relaxed way

name: explosive
trans: 爆炸的，爆发的；使人冲动的

sentences.english: ...one-hundred-and-fifty pounds of Semtex explosive.
sentences.chinese: …150磅的塞姆汀塑料炸药。

sentences.english: Because the gas is highly explosive, it needs to be kept in high-pressure containers.
sentences.chinese: 由于这种气体极易爆炸，因此需要保存在高压容器内。

detailed_translations.english: a substance that can cause an explosion
able or likely to explode

sentences.english: The prosecution wanted more time to prepare their case.
sentences.chinese: 原告想要有更多的时间来准备诉讼。

detailed_translations.english: to make plans or arrangements for something that will happen in the future

name: crusade
trans: 加入十字军， 投身正义运动

sentences.english: Dante: I took up the crusade. The bishop assured us that our sins would be absolved.
sentences.chinese: 但丁： 我参与了十字军东征。主教向我们保证我们的罪会被赦免。

sentences.english: Hard to believe that a life of glamour and wealth would be able to rob Xuande of his noble ambitions and crusade to give peace and prosperity to the common people.
sentences.chinese: 很难相信一个生命充满魅力和财富的玄德会用抢和类似十字军东征的方式实现他高尚的抱负并给普通百姓带来安定与和平。

detailed_translations.chinese: 十字军东征， 宗教战争
detailed_translations.english: one of a series of wars fought in the 11th, 12th, and 13th centuries by Christian armies trying to take Palestine from the Muslims

sentences.english: Barker was soon supplanted as party leader.
sentences.chinese: 巴克在党内的领导地位很快就被人取代了。

detailed_translations.english: to take the place of a person or thing so that they are no longer used, no longer in a position of power etc

sentences.english: ...a heart surgeon.
sentences.chinese: …一位心脏外科医生。

detailed_translations.english: a doctor who does operations in a hospital

name: abrupt
trans: 突然的， 意外的； 唐突的， 鲁莽的

sentences.english: an abrupt change of plan
sentences.chinese: 计划的突然改变

detailed_translations.chinese: 生硬的；突然的；唐突的；陡峭的
detailed_translations.english: sudden and unexpected

name: discourage
trans: 使泄气， 使灰心； 阻止， 劝阻

sentences.english: Aspirin may discourage tumour growth in some types of cancer.
sentences.chinese: 阿司匹林可能遏制某些恶性肿瘤的生长。

detailed_translations.english: to make something less likely to happen

name: predispose
trans: 事先影响某人； 易受感染

sentences.english: They take pains to hire people whose personalities predispose them to serve customers well.
sentences.chinese: 他们煞费苦心雇用那些具备把顾客服务好的个性的人。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone more likely to suffer from a particular health problem

name: spontaneous
trans: 自发的， 自然产生的； 自然的， 无雕饰的

sentences.english: The crowd gave a spontaneous cheer.
sentences.chinese: 人群自发地欢呼起来。

sentences.english: My spontaneous reaction was to run away.
sentences.chinese: 我的本能反应就是逃跑。

detailed_translations.chinese: 自发的， 无意识的； 自然的， 天真率直的
detailed_translations.english: something that is spontaneous has not been planned or organized, but happens by itself, or because you suddenly feel you want to do it

sentences.english: ...clouds which lift warm, moist air by convection high into the atmosphere.
sentences.chinese: ...云层通过对流把温暖湿润的空气送到高的大气层中。

detailed_translations.english: the movement in a gas or liquid caused by warm gas or liquid rising, and cold gas or liquid sinking

sentences.english: Divers discovered the wreck of an old German warship.
sentences.chinese: 潜水员发现了一艘沉没的德国旧军舰。

sentences.english: Injury threatened to wreck his sporting career.
sentences.chinese: 伤病可能会毁了他的运动生涯。

detailed_translations.english: a ship that has sunk
to completely spoil something so that it cannot continue in a successful way

sentences.english: On a clear night, I could see stars twinkling in the sky.
sentences.chinese: 在晴朗的夜晚，我可以看见星星在天空闪烁。

sentences.english: Miss heart only stars know, heart desire only you know, when you see the stars twinkling in the sky, is my best wishes to you.
sentences.chinese: 思念的心只有星星知道，心中的愿望只有你知道，当你看见星星闪烁的夜空，就是我的祝福在向你致意。

detailed_translations.english: very quickly

name: gloomy
trans: 忧郁的， 令人沮丧的； 昏暗的， 阴暗的， 阴沉的

sentences.english: The report paints a gloomy picture of the economy.
sentences.chinese: 这篇报告描绘了一幅惨淡的经济现状。

detailed_translations.chinese: 忧郁的， 沮丧的； 令人沮丧的； 昏暗的， 阴沉的
detailed_translations.english: making you feel that things will not improve

name: reproach
trans: 指责， 斥责， 批评

sentences.english: ‘You don’t need me,’ she said quietly, without reproach.
sentences.chinese: “你不需要我。”她语气平静，没有丝毫责备。

detailed_translations.english: criticism, blame, or disapproval

name: customs
trans: 关税， 进口税； 海关

sentences.english: What right does Customs have to search my car?
sentences.chinese: 海关有什么权力搜查我的车？

detailed_translations.chinese: 海关；风俗（custom的复数）；习惯；关税
detailed_translations.english: Customs is the official organization responsible for collecting taxes on goods coming into a country and preventing illegal goods from being brought in

name: warrant
trans: 授权，批准；许可证；委任状，执行令
保证， 担保； 使正当

sentences.english: Therefore, it is important to note that individual situations may warrant including additional characters in the list of special characters.
sentences.chinese: 因此，要注意可能保证把额外字符包括到特殊字符列表中的个别情况，这一点很重要。

sentences.english: Learning incessantly is the surest way to keep pace with the times in the information age and an infallible warrant of success in times of uncertainty.
sentences.chinese: 持续的学习是在资讯时代中跟时代并驾齐驱的最稳当的方法，也是在变动的世代中成功的可靠保证。

sentences.english: At Dean Miller's suggestion, I have allowed her to give the current student organizers the opportunity to propose a program for next semester that might warrant continuation of this event on campus.
sentences.chinese: 根据米勒学监的建议，我允许她给学生机会，让他们给下学期的活动提出一个方案，保证这个活动得以在校园内继续开展。

detailed_translations.english: to promise that something is true

detailed_translations.chinese: 正当理由；许可证，委任状
detailed_translations.english: a legal document that is signed by a judge, allowing the police to take a particular action

name: sake
trans: 缘故， 理由； 好处

sentences.english: He moved to the seaside for the sake of his health.
sentences.chinese: 他为了健康而迁居海滨。

sentences.english: I only went for Kay’s sake.
sentences.chinese: 我是为了凯才去的。

sentences.english: I hope he’s told the truth for his own sake (= because it will be good for him ) .
sentences.chinese: 为了他自己好，我希望他已经说出了真相。

detailed_translations.english: in order to help, improve, or please someone or something

name: conceal
trans: 隐蔽； 隐瞒； 覆盖

sentences.english: The shadows concealed her as she crept up to the house.
sentences.chinese: 她借着阴影蹑手蹑脚地走向房子。

sentences.english: The path was concealed by long grass.
sentences.chinese: 小路隐藏在长长的草里。

sentences.english: a concealed weapon
sentences.chinese: 藏匿的武器

detailed_translations.english: to hide something carefully

name: solid
trans: 固体的；实心的；结实的，稳固的；可靠的；连续的

sentences.english: The lake was frozen solid .
sentences.chinese: 湖水冻得结结实实。

sentences.english: It was good to be back on solid ground again.
sentences.chinese: 又能踏上坚实的土地感觉真好。

sentences.english: Is the baby eating solid food (= bread, meat etc ) yet?
sentences.chinese: 宝宝吃固体食物了吗？

sentences.english: The ship’s sonar can detect the presence of solid objects in the water.
sentences.chinese: 船上的声呐能够探测出水中的固体物。

sentences.english: the properties of liquids and solids
sentences.chinese: 液体和固体的特性

detailed_translations.english: hard or firm, with a fixed shape, and not a liquid or gas
a firm object or substance that has a fixed shape, not a gas or liquid

sentences.english: The novel contains more narrative than dialogue.
sentences.chinese: 这部小说里的叙述比对话多。

sentences.english: If this story must be written, we must have the courage to eliminate all adjectives that tend to excite wonder: they would achieve the opposite effect, of impoverishing the narrative.
sentences.chinese: 如果必须要写这篇故事，我们必须要有勇气剔除易于激发我们想入非非的所有形容词：这些词会使叙述贫瘠无力，起到相反的效果。

detailed_translations.english: a description of events in a story, especially in a novel

name: coincide
trans: 同时发生； 一致， 相符； 重合

sentences.english: When our vacations coincided, we often holidayed together.
sentences.chinese: 我们的假期要是凑巧赶在一起，我们常常会一同去度假。

sentences.english: The interests of the US and those of the islanders may not coincide.
sentences.chinese: 美国的利益和这些岛民的利益可能并不一致。

detailed_translations.english: to happen at the same time as something else, especially by chance

name: circular
trans: 圆形的， 环形的； 循环的； 绕行的

sentences.english: a circular table
sentences.chinese: 圆桌

sentences.english: a circular bus route
sentences.chinese: 环行公共汽车路线

detailed_translations.english: shaped like a circle

sentences.english: John yawned and scratched his leg.
sentences.chinese: 约翰打了个呵欠，挠了挠腿。

sentences.english: Try not to scratch.
sentences.chinese: 尽量别挠。

detailed_translations.english: to rub your skin with your nails because it feels uncomfortable

detailed_translations.chinese: 抓痕， 划痕； 抓， 搔， 刮
detailed_translations.english: a small cut on someone’s skin

name: require
trans: 需要； 要求， 命令

sentences.english: Campbell’s broken leg will probably require surgery.
sentences.chinese: 坎贝尔的一条腿骨折，可能需要手术。

sentences.english: What’s required is a complete reorganization of the system.
sentences.chinese: 需要做的是彻底整顿整个系统。

sentences.english: Most house plants require regular watering.
sentences.chinese: 大多数室内盆栽植物需要定期浇水。

sentences.english: The bill failed to get the required number of votes.
sentences.chinese: 法案没有得到规定的票数。

detailed_translations.english: to need something

sentences.english: He was doing his best to be cooperative.
sentences.chinese: 他在尽全力配合。

sentences.english: a cooperative witness
sentences.chinese: 肯配合的目击者

detailed_translations.english: willing to cooperate

name: willow
trans: 柳， 柳树； 柳木制品

sentences.english: The willow trees cast their shadows all around.
sentences.chinese: 柳荫匝地。

sentences.english: He worships that big willow south of the house.
sentences.chinese: 他很崇拜房子南面的那颗大柳树。

sentences.english: He has also captured pollen from alder, pine and willow.
sentences.chinese: 他还从桤树、松树和柳树上捕捉到了花粉。

detailed_translations.english: a type of tree that has long thin branches and grows near water, or the wood from this tree

name: corporeal
trans: 肉体的， 身体的； 物质的； 实体的

sentences.english: corporeal desires
sentences.chinese: 肉欲

detailed_translations.chinese: 肉体的， 身体的； 物质的
detailed_translations.english: relating to the body, rather than to the mind, feelings, or spirit

name: irritable
trans: 急躁的， 易怒的； 易受刺激的； 过敏的

sentences.english: Jo was tired, irritable, and depressed.
sentences.chinese: 乔疲惫暴躁，而且情绪低落。

detailed_translations.english: getting annoyed quickly or easily

name: triple
trans: 三部分的； 三方的； 三倍的

sentences.english: a triple murder investigation
sentences.chinese: 对一宗三重谋杀案的调查

sentences.english: a triple bill of horror movies
sentences.chinese: 三部恐怖电影的连续放映

sentences.english: the triple world champion
sentences.chinese: 三连冠世界冠军

sentences.english: a triple bypass heart operation
sentences.chinese: 三重心脏搭桥手术

detailed_translations.chinese: 三部分的，三方的；三倍的，三重的
detailed_translations.english: having three parts or involving three groups, people, events etc
to increase by three times as much, or to make something do this

sentences.english: Pete hit his brother in a fit of temper .
sentences.chinese: 皮特一气之下打了他弟弟。

detailed_translations.english: the way you are feeling at a particular time, especially when you are feeling angry for a short time

detailed_translations.chinese: 调和， 使缓和； 【冶】使回火
detailed_translations.english: to make something less severe or extreme

sentences.english: Her handwriting was so tiny it was barely legible.
sentences.chinese: 她的字写得这么小，简直都看不清楚。

detailed_translations.chinese: 清晰的；易读的；易辨认的
detailed_translations.english: written or printed clearly enough for you to read

sentences.english: Stop tickling me!
sentences.chinese: 别挠我痒痒！

detailed_translations.english: to move your fingers gently over someone’s body in order to make them laugh
if something touching your body tickles you, it makes you want to rub your body because it is slightly uncomfortable
a feeling in your throat that makes you want to cough

sentences.english: cardiac surgery
sentences.chinese: 心脏手术

detailed_translations.chinese: 心脏的；心脏病的；贲门的
detailed_translations.english: relating to the heart

name: accessible
trans: 易接近的； 可得到的； 可进入的

sentences.english: The island is only accessible by boat.
sentences.chinese: 这个岛只有坐船才能到。

sentences.english: There is a church which is easily accessible from my home.
sentences.chinese: 有座教堂离我家很近。

detailed_translations.chinese: 易接近的；可进入的；可理解的
detailed_translations.english: a place, building, or object that is accessible is easy to reach or get into

sentences.english: The problem of ageism in the workplace often goes unrecognized.
sentences.chinese: 工作场所的年龄歧视问题常被忽视。

sentences.english: The International Day of Older Persons is our chance to take a stand against the destructive problem of ageism.
sentences.chinese: 国际老年人日是我们采取立场，反对年龄歧视这一具有破坏性问题的机会。

detailed_translations.english: unfair treatment of people because they are old

sentences.english: The car rolled over the edge of a cliff.
sentences.chinese: 汽车翻下了悬崖边。

detailed_translations.english: a large area of rock or a mountain with a very steep side, often at the edge of the sea or a river

name: roll
trans: 滚动，转动；卷，绕；摇摆，摇晃
卷； 卷形物； 名单， 花名册

sentences.english: The ball rolled into the street.
sentences.chinese: 球滚到了街上。

sentences.english: There was silence as the cameras started to roll.
sentences.chinese: 摄影机开始转动，大家安静了下来。

detailed_translations.english: if something rolls, especially something round, or if you roll it, it moves along a surface by turning over and over

name: notable
trans: 值得注意的，明显的；显著的；著名的；重要的

sentences.english: If there are any notable inconsistencies or discrepancies, think through how you are going to explain the situation.
sentences.chinese: 如果有任何显著的不相符或让人起疑的情况，要想好该如何去解释这个情况。

detailed_translations.english: important, interesting, excellent, or unusual enough to be noticed or mentioned

name: concede
trans: 承认； 让步； 允许

sentences.english: ‘That’s the only possible solution.’ ‘Yes, I suppose so,’ Charles conceded.
sentences.chinese: “那是唯一可行的解决办法。”“对，我想是。”查尔斯承认道。

detailed_translations.chinese: 承认， 承认…为真； 承认失败； 允许， 让予； 让步， 认输
detailed_translations.english: to admit that something is true or correct, although you wish it were not true

sentences.english: an achievement unparalleled in sporting history
sentences.chinese: 体育史上空前的成就

detailed_translations.chinese: 无比的；无双的；空前未有的
detailed_translations.english: bigger, better, or worse than anything else

name: evaporate
trans: 蒸发； 消失， 不复存在

sentences.english: Most of the water had evaporated.
sentences.chinese: 大部分的水都蒸发了。

sentences.english: The sun evaporates moisture on the leaves.
sentences.chinese: 太阳会蒸发叶子上的水分。

detailed_translations.english: if a liquid evaporates, or if heat evaporates it, it changes into a gas
if a liquid evaporates, or if heat evaporates it, it changes into a gas

name: luminosity
trans: 亮度， 发光度； 光明

sentences.english: For a few years its luminosity flared up to about 10,000 times the present-day luminosity of the Sun.
sentences.chinese: 有几年它的亮度一度达到了现在的太阳亮度的一万倍左右。

detailed_translations.english: The luminosity of a star or sun is how bright it is

name: commission
trans: 授权，委任；委员会；佣金，回扣

sentences.english: The Government set up a commission to investigate allegations of police violence.
sentences.chinese: 政府成立了一个委员会调查对警察施暴行为的指控。

detailed_translations.chinese: 委任状；委员会；佣金，回扣；授权，委托
detailed_translations.english: a group of people who have been given the official job of finding out about something or controlling something
to formally ask someone to write an official report, produce a work of art for you etc

name: policy
trans: 政策， 方针； 原则； 保险单

sentences.english: US policy towards China
sentences.chinese: 美国的对华政策

detailed_translations.english: a way of doing something that has been officially agreed and chosen by a political party, a business, or another organization

sentences.english: She hopes to resume work after the baby is born.
sentences.chinese: 她想生完孩子后继续工作。

sentences.english: The rebels have resumed hostilities against government troops.
sentences.chinese: 叛乱分子继续与政府军发生冲突。

detailed_translations.chinese: 重新开始， 继续， 恢复
detailed_translations.english: to start doing something again after stopping or being interrupted

detailed_translations.chinese: 摘要， 概要； 简历
detailed_translations.english: a short account of something such as an article or speech which gives the main points but no details

name: provocative
trans: 挑衅的， 煽动性的； 惹人讨厌的； 挑逗的

sentences.english: a provocative act by a terrorist group
sentences.chinese: 恐怖团体的挑衅行为

sentences.english: She was accused of being deliberately provocative .
sentences.chinese: 她被指责故意挑衅。

detailed_translations.chinese: 挑衅的， 煽动的， 刺激的； 挑逗的
detailed_translations.english: provocative behaviour, remarks etc are intended to make people angry or upset, or to cause a lot of discussion

name: address
trans: 作讲话； 写姓名地址

detailed_translations.english: if you address a problem, you start trying to solve it

name: spiral
trans: 盘旋；盘旋上升；急剧增长
螺旋形； 螺旋式的上升

sentences.english: ...a spiral staircase.
sentences.chinese: …一段旋梯。

sentences.english: The maze is actually two interlocking spirals.
sentences.chinese: 这个迷宫实际上是两个连锁的螺旋体。

sentences.english: The damaged plane spiralled to the ground.
sentences.chinese: 受损的飞机盘旋坠地

detailed_translations.english: moving in a continuous curve that winds around a central point
a line in the form of a curve that winds around a central point, moving further away from the centre all the time
to move in a continuous curve that gets nearer to or further from its central point as it goes round

name: artistic
trans: 艺术的； 富有艺术性的， 精美的； 有艺术天赋的

sentences.english: artistic work
sentences.chinese: 艺术作品

sentences.english: Opinion about the artistic merit of his paintings has been mixed.
sentences.chinese: 对于他的绘画作品的艺术价值，人们褒贬不一。

detailed_translations.english: relating to art or culture

sentences.english: I quite like the idea of going for a ramble one weekend.
sentences.chinese: 我觉得找个周末去乡下走走这个主意不错。

detailed_translations.english: a walk in the countryside for pleasure
to go on a walk in the countryside for pleasure

name: vocation
trans: 职业； 使命感； 圣召

sentences.english: At 17 she found her true vocation as a writer.
sentences.chinese: 17岁时她找到了自己真正的使命——当一名作家。

detailed_translations.english: a particular type of work that you feel is right for you

sentences.english: Heavy snowfalls brought traffic to a halt (= made it stop moving ).
sentences.chinese: 大雪使得交通陷于停顿。

sentences.english: The World Championship was brought to a temporary halt (= was stopped from continuing ).
sentences.chinese: 世界锦标赛暂停举行。

sentences.english: The President has called for a halt to the wave of emigration.
sentences.chinese: 总统呼吁遏制移民国外的热潮。

detailed_translations.english: a stop or pause
to prevent someone or something from continuing - used especially in news reports

name: throw
trans: 投，掷，抛；丢，扔；使陷入，使处于；使困惑，使吃惊
投， 掷， 抛； 投掷的距离

sentences.english: The bus stopped suddenly and we were all thrown forwards.
sentences.chinese: 公共汽车猛地停住，我们都往前栽。

detailed_translations.chinese: [threw-thrown] 投， 扔， 抛； 使突然陷入； 使困惑， 使吃惊
detailed_translations.english: to make an object such as a ball move quickly through the air by pushing your hand forward quickly and letting the object go

sentences.english: a glorious sunset
sentences.chinese: 壮丽的日落景象

detailed_translations.english: the time of day when the sun disappears and night begins

name: stature
trans: 身材， 身高； 地位， 声望， 名望

sentences.english: Bernard was short in stature, with a large head.
sentences.chinese: 伯纳德个子矮，头很大。

detailed_translations.chinese: 身高，身材；（精神、道德等的）高度
detailed_translations.english: someone’s height or size

name: dogged
trans: 顽强的， 坚持不懈的； 顽固的， 固执的

sentences.english: a dogged determination to succeed
sentences.chinese: 不屈不挠的成功决心

detailed_translations.english: dogged behaviour shows that you are very determined to continue doing something

sentences.english: Now there are no gaps, so this is the state of matter, and this was the state of a plasma.
sentences.chinese: 现在没有任何间隙，这样这是物质的状态，而以前是一个等离子体状态。

sentences.english: Scientists think this plasma represents the state of the whole universe justmoments after it was born in the Big Bang, when the universe was extremely hotand dense.
sentences.chinese: 科学家认为这种等离子体代表整个宇宙在它出生的大爆炸之后瞬间的状态，那时的宇宙是非常炎热和致密的。

sentences.english: It receives only in lymph, it gives the emotion through the blood and the right current, what you call, through the nerve system, and it changes to be the same plasma the skin of the man or your nail.
sentences.chinese: 它只会在淋巴中接收，而通过血液和合适的电流来给予情感，也就是通过你们所说的神经系统，然后它就变成与你的皮肤或者指甲相同的等离子体。

detailed_translations.english: a gas that contains about the same numbers of positive and negative electric  charge s  and is found in the sun and most stars

sentences.english: Exorbitant housing prices have created an acute shortage of affordable housing for the poor.
sentences.chinese: 过高的房价使穷人负担得起的房源严重短缺。

detailed_translations.english: an exorbitant price, amount of money etc is much higher than it should be

name: surgery
trans: 外科手术； 外科学； 手术室， 诊疗室

sentences.english: major/minor surgery
sentences.chinese: 大 / 小手术

detailed_translations.english: medical treatment of injuries or diseases that involves cutting open a person's body and often removing or replacing some parts; the branch of medicine connected with this treatment

name: violent
trans: 暴力的； 感情强烈的， 激情的； 强烈的， 激烈的

sentences.english: the increase in violent crime
sentences.chinese: 暴力犯罪的增多

sentences.english: violent clashes between the police and demonstrators
sentences.chinese: 警方与示威者之间发生的暴力冲突

sentences.english: 31 people have been injured in violent incidents throughout the day.
sentences.chinese: 今天一天有31人在暴力事件中受伤。

sentences.english: The riots ended in the violent deaths of three teenagers.
sentences.chinese: 动乱以三名少年的惨死而告终。

detailed_translations.english: involving actions that are intended to injure or kill people, by hitting them, shooting them etc

name: inaccessible
trans: 难达到的， 不可及的； 不能得到的

sentences.english: In winter, the villages are inaccessible by road.
sentences.chinese: 冬天时，进入这些村子的路很难走。

detailed_translations.chinese: 难达到的；难接近的；难见到的
detailed_translations.english: difficult or impossible to reach

name: resolve
trans: 解决；决定，决心；分解；显现

sentences.english: Barnet was desperate for money to resolve his financial problems.
sentences.chinese: 巴尼特急需钱来解决他的经济问题。

sentences.english: After the divorce she resolved never to marry again.
sentences.chinese: 离婚以后，她决心永不再嫁。

sentences.english: Recent events strengthened her resolve to find out the truth.
sentences.chinese: 最近发生的事件坚定了她找出真相的决心。

detailed_translations.english: to find a satisfactory way of dealing with a problem or difficulty
strong determination to succeed in doing something

name: choreograph
trans: 设计舞蹈动作， 编舞

sentences.english: The show is very cleverly choreographed.
sentences.chinese: 这个节目的舞蹈动作设计得非常好。

detailed_translations.chinese: 设计舞蹈动作， 编舞
detailed_translations.english: to arrange how dancers should move during a performance

name: confront
trans: 使面临， 使遭遇； 对抗

sentences.english: The problems confronting the new government were enormous.
sentences.chinese: 新政府面临的难题是巨大的。

sentences.english: I confronted him with my suspicions, and he admitted everything.
sentences.chinese: 我当面向他提出我的怀疑，他什么都承认了。

detailed_translations.english: (of problems or a difficult situation) to appear and need to be dealt with by sb

sentences.english: nonverbal forms of communication
sentences.chinese: 非语言交际形式

detailed_translations.english: not using words

name: deploy
trans: 部署， 调度； 利用

sentences.english: So far, however, we have said nothing about how to deploy it.
sentences.chinese: 到现在，我们还没说任何如何部署的内容。

sentences.english: You can then customize and deploy these artifacts in the usual way.
sentences.chinese: 然后，您可以以常规的方式定制和部署这些工件。

sentences.english: Now that you have seen the anatomy of each component, you can deploy them.
sentences.chinese: 您已经了解了对每个组件的剖析，现在可以部署它们了。

name: reproduce
trans: 繁殖， 生育； 复制； 再现

sentences.english: Klimt’s artwork is reproduced in this exquisite book.
sentences.chinese: 这本精美的书里翻印了克里木特的艺术作品。

detailed_translations.english: to make a photograph or printed copy of something

name: skeleton
trans: 梗概， 提纲； 骨架， 骨骼； 框架

sentences.english: We agreed on a skeleton outline of the proposal.
sentences.chinese: 我们给提案商定了一个基本框架。

detailed_translations.chinese: 骨架，骨骼；纲要；骨瘦如柴的人
detailed_translations.english: the most important parts of something, to which more detail can be added later

detailed_translations.chinese: 骨骼的；骨瘦如柴的；概略的

name: huddle
trans: 聚集在一起， 挤作一团； 蜷缩， 缩成一团， 蜷缩

sentences.english: We lay huddled together for warmth.
sentences.chinese: 我们紧紧挤在一起取暖。

sentences.english: Off to one side, Sticht, Macomber, Jordan, and Kreps huddled to discuss something.
sentences.chinese: 史蒂希特、麦康伯、乔丹和克雷普斯走到一边，私下商量起事情。

sentences.english: The president has been huddling with his most senior aides.
sentences.chinese: 总统一直在和他的顶级高级助理们秘密地聚到一起进行商谈。

detailed_translations.chinese: 聚集在一起，挤作一团；把身子蜷成一团，蜷缩
detailed_translations.english: if a group of people huddle together, they stay very close to each other, especially because they are cold or frightened
If people huddle in a group, they gather together to discuss something quietly or secretly

detailed_translations.chinese: 挤在一起的人； 一堆杂乱的东西
detailed_translations.english: a group of people or things that are close together, but not arranged in any particular order, pattern, or system

name: syntactic
trans: 句法的； 按照句法的

sentences.english: syntactic structure
sentences.chinese: 句法结构

detailed_translations.chinese: 句法的；语法的；依据造句法的
detailed_translations.english: relating to syntax

name: rendition
trans: 表演， 演唱； 提供， 给予； 翻译

sentences.english: He gave a moving rendition of Lennon’s ‘Imagine’.
sentences.chinese: 他深情地演唱了列侬的《想象》。

detailed_translations.chinese: 译文；演奏；提供；引渡逃奴
detailed_translations.english: someone’s performance of a play, piece of music etc

name: intersection
trans: 交点； 十字路口， 道路交叉口

sentences.english: We crossed at a busy intersection.
sentences.chinese: 我们穿过了一个繁忙的道路交叉口。

detailed_translations.chinese: 交叉；十字路口；交集；交叉点
detailed_translations.english: a place where roads, lines etc cross each other, especially where two roads meet

name: scholarship
trans: 奖学金； 学问， 学识

sentences.english: She won a scholarship to Iowa State University.
sentences.chinese: 她获得了艾奥瓦州立大学的奖学金。

sentences.english: Her latest publication is a fine piece of scholarship.
sentences.chinese: 她最新出版的作品是一部优秀的学术著作。

detailed_translations.english: an amount of money that is given to someone by an educational organization to help pay for their education

sentences.english: the myriad causes of homelessness
sentences.chinese: 导致人们无家可归的种种原因

detailed_translations.english: very many

detailed_translations.chinese: 无数，极大数量；无数的人或物
detailed_translations.english: a very large number of things

sentences.english: I need the money. And besides, when I agree to do something, I do it.
sentences.chinese: 我需要这笔钱，而且，我一旦答应做什么事情就会做到。

sentences.english: The area has stunning scenery, beautiful beaches, and much more besides.
sentences.chinese: 那个地方有迷人的景色、美丽的沙滩，除此之外还有很多很多。

detailed_translations.english: used when adding another reason

name: implement
trans: 使生效， 执行， 实施

sentences.english: ...writing implements.
sentences.chinese: …书写用具。

sentences.english: We have decided to implement the committee’s recommendations in full.
sentences.chinese: 我们已决定全面实施委员会提出的建议。

detailed_translations.english: a tool, especially one used for outdoor physical work
to take action or make changes that you have officially decided should happen

name: disperse
trans: 分散， 散开； 疏散； 散布

sentences.english: Police used tear gas to disperse the crowd.
sentences.chinese: 警察用催泪瓦斯驱散人群。

detailed_translations.chinese: 分散， 赶散； 消散， 驱散
detailed_translations.english: if a group of people disperse or are dispersed, they go away in different directions

detailed_translations.chinese: 使分散，散开；使消散，消失
detailed_translations.english: if a group of people disperse or are dispersed, they go away in different directions

name: erratic
trans: 古怪的， 反复无常的； 不规则的； 不稳定的

sentences.english: His breathing was becoming erratic.
sentences.chinese: 他的呼吸越来越不均匀。

sentences.english: his erratic behaviour
sentences.chinese: 他难以捉摸的行为

detailed_translations.english: something that is erratic does not follow any pattern or plan but happens in a way that is not regular

detailed_translations.chinese: 漂泊无定的人；古怪的人

sentences.english: All the infected clothing was incinerated.
sentences.chinese: 所有沾染了细菌的衣服都被焚化了。

detailed_translations.english: to burn something completely in order to destroy it

sentences.english: I used to have fantasies about living in Paris with an artist.
sentences.chinese: 我过去常幻想着在巴黎与一位艺术家同住。

sentences.english: sexual fantasies
sentences.chinese: 性幻想

sentences.english: Young children sometimes can’t distinguish between fantasy and reality.
sentences.chinese: 小孩子有时不能区分幻想与现实。

sentences.english: He lived in a fantasy world of his own, even as a small boy.
sentences.chinese: 甚至还是个小孩子的时候，他就生活在一个幻想世界里。

detailed_translations.chinese: 想象， 幻想； 想象的产物
detailed_translations.english: an exciting and unusual experience or situation you imagine happening to you, but which will probably never happen

name: capillary
trans: 毛状的； 毛细血管的

sentences.english: When air cools at night, dew collects on the lizard’s skin and is pulled to its mouth by capillary action.
sentences.chinese: 待晚间空气温度下降，凝结在蜥蜴皮肤上的露珠就可以通过毛细管作用输送到它的口中。

sentences.english: On one side of the sheet, blood-vessel cells mimic a capillary wall; on the other, lung-cancer cells mimic lung epithelial cells.
sentences.chinese: 在这张图的上边，血管壁细胞模仿毛细血管，，在另一边，模拟肺癌细胞的肺上皮细胞。

sentences.english: One study published in 2007 on the cosmetic benefit of drinking water suggests that 500 ml of water increases capillary blood flow in the skin.
sentences.chinese: 2007年公布的一项饮用水的美容效益研究表明，饮用500毫升的水可加快皮肤下毛细血管内的血液流动。

detailed_translations.english: the smallest type of  blood vessel (= tube carrying blood )  in the body

sentences.english: Wearing badly-fitting shoes can deform your feet.
sentences.chinese: 穿不合脚的鞋会使脚变形。

detailed_translations.english: if you deform something, or if it deforms, its usual shape changes so that its usefulness or appearance is spoiled

sentences.english: The cliffs are being constantly eroded by heavy seas.
sentences.chinese: 悬崖正不断受到汹涌海浪的侵蚀。

sentences.english: The rocks have gradually eroded away.
sentences.chinese: 岩石逐渐风化。

detailed_translations.english: if the weather erodes rock or soil, or if rock or soil erodes, its surface is gradually destroyed

name: informative
trans: 提供消息的， 给予知识的； 见闻广博的

sentences.english: Both men termed the meeting friendly and informative.
sentences.chinese: 他们两人都称这次会晤亲切友好，使双方增进了解。

detailed_translations.chinese: 提供消息的, 情报的
detailed_translations.english: Something that is informative gives you useful information

sentences.english: Check the tiles carefully before you buy them.
sentences.chinese: 购买之前要把瓷砖仔细检查一下。

sentences.english: A first rule in solving any mystery is to check the facts.
sentences.chinese: 揭开谜团的第一条规则是核查事实。

sentences.english: The police are failing to take adequate measures to check the growth in crime.
sentences.chinese: 警方未能采取适当的措施来阻止犯罪率上升。

sentences.english: Conduct regular checks on your water quality.
sentences.chinese: 要经常检查水质。

detailed_translations.english: to do something in order to find out whether something really is correct, true, or in good condition
the process of finding out if something is safe, correct, true, or in the condition it should be

name: frustrate
trans: 使感到灰心， 挫败； 阻止

sentences.english: Their attempts to speak to him were frustrated by the guards.
sentences.chinese: 他们想跟他说话，但被警卫拦住了。

detailed_translations.english: to prevent someone’s plans, efforts, or attempts from succeeding

name: sparse
trans: 稀疏的， 稀少的； 贫乏的

sentences.english: his sparse brown hair
sentences.chinese: 他那稀疏的棕色头发

sentences.english: rural areas with sparse populations
sentences.chinese: 人口稀少的农村地区

detailed_translations.english: existing only in small amounts

name: gorgeous
trans: 漂亮的； 令人愉快的； 华丽的， 灿烂的

sentences.english: ‘What do you think of my new flatmate?’ ‘He’s absolutely gorgeous !’
sentences.chinese: “你觉得我的新室友怎么样？”“他帅极了！”

sentences.english: exotic birds with feathers of gorgeous colours
sentences.chinese: 长着绚丽羽毛的异国的鸟

detailed_translations.chinese: 极其漂亮的，极其吸引人的；绚丽的，华丽的
detailed_translations.english: extremely beautiful or attractive

name: pragmatic
trans: 务实的， 注重实效的， 实用的

sentences.english: Williams took a more pragmatic approach to management problems.
sentences.chinese: 威廉斯在管理问题上采用的是一种更务实的做法。

detailed_translations.chinese: 实际的；实用主义的；国事的
detailed_translations.english: dealing with problems in a sensible practical way instead of strictly following a set of ideas

name: erosion
trans: 腐蚀， 侵蚀； 削弱， 减少

sentences.english: the problem of soil erosion
sentences.chinese: 水土流失的问题

sentences.english: the erosion of the coastline
sentences.chinese: 海岸线受到的侵蚀

detailed_translations.english: the process by which rock or soil is gradually destroyed by wind, rain, or the sea

sentences.english: Methane is one of the principal gases contributing to the greenhouse effect.
sentences.chinese: 甲烷是造成温室效应的主要气体之一。

detailed_translations.chinese: [有化] 甲烷；[能源] 沼气
detailed_translations.english: a gas that you cannot see or smell, which can be burned to give heat

sentences.english: tectonic movements
sentences.chinese: 地壳构造运动

detailed_translations.english: relating to  plate tectonics

name: superstitious
trans: 迷信的， 受迷信思想支配的

sentences.english: a superstitious woman
sentences.chinese: 一个迷信的女人

detailed_translations.english: influenced by superstitions

name: ascend
trans: 上升， 升高； 攀登

sentences.english: The plane ascended rapidly.
sentences.chinese: 飞机迅速爬升。

detailed_translations.english: to move up through the air
to climb something or move to a higher position

sentences.english: the skin’s natural elasticity
sentences.chinese: 皮肤天生的弹性

detailed_translations.english: the ability of something to stretch and go back to its usual length or size

name: proactive
trans: 积极主动的； 先发制人的

sentences.english: a proactive approach to staffing requirements
sentences.chinese: 对人事需求的积极处理方法

detailed_translations.chinese: 积极主动的； 先发制人的
detailed_translations.english: making things happen or change rather than reacting to events

name: aboriginal
trans: 原始的；土著的，土生土长的

sentences.english: ...Aboriginal art.
sentences.chinese: …土著艺术。

detailed_translations.english: relating to the Australian aborigines
an aborigine

sentences.english: Mobile phones have become an indispensable part of our lives.
sentences.chinese: 移动电话已经成为我们生活中的必需品。

detailed_translations.english: someone or something that is indispensable is so important or useful that it is impossible to manage without them

name: lens
trans: 透镜； 镜头； 镜片

sentences.english: a standard 50mm lens
sentences.chinese: 50毫米标准镜头

detailed_translations.chinese: 透镜， 镜片； 镜头
detailed_translations.english: the part of a camera through which the light travels before it reaches the film

name: embody
trans: 表达， 体现； 含有

sentences.english: She embodies everything I admire in a teacher.
sentences.chinese: 她具备了我所钦佩的教师该具备的一切素质。

detailed_translations.chinese: 体现，使具体化；具体表达
detailed_translations.english: to be a very good example of an idea or quality

name: verifiable
trans: 可证实的， 可核实的

sentences.english: This is not a romantic notion but verifiable fact.
sentences.chinese: 这不是一个不切实际的念头，而是一个有依据的事实。

detailed_translations.chinese: 可证实的；能作证的；可检验的
detailed_translations.english: Something that is verifiable can be proved to be true or genuine

name: comprehensible
trans: 可理解的， 能懂的， 能充分理解的

sentences.english: Her speech was slurred and barely comprehensible.
sentences.chinese: 她的发言含混不清，几乎无法听懂。

detailed_translations.english: easy to understand

name: motive
trans: 发动的； 导致运动的

sentences.english: What do you suppose the killer’s motive was?
sentences.chinese: 你认为凶手的动机是什么？

sentences.english: The violence was clearly prompted by political motives.
sentences.chinese: 这次暴力事件显然是由政治动机引发的。

sentences.english: It’s not the kind of thing he’d do unless he had an ulterior motive (= a reason he kept hidden ) .
sentences.chinese: 他不会做这种事的，除非他另有隐情。

detailed_translations.english: the reason that makes someone do something, especially when this reason is kept hidden
the motive power or force for a machine, vehicle etc makes it move

name: elliptical
trans: 椭圆的； 隐晦的； 省略的， 简略的

sentences.english: Kepler published his discovery of the elliptical orbits of planets in 1609. 1609
sentences.chinese: 年开普勒公布他的发现，认为行星轨道为椭圆形。

detailed_translations.english: having the shape of an ellipse

sentences.english: Slaves were emancipated in 1834.
sentences.chinese: 奴隶于1834年获得了解放。

detailed_translations.english: to give someone the political or legal rights that they did not have before

name: romantic
trans: 爱情的； 浪漫的， 富有情调的； 多情的； 不切实际的， 幻想的； [R-]浪漫主义的

sentences.english: ‘Tom always sends me red roses on my birthday.’ ‘How romantic!’
sentences.chinese: “我过生日时汤姆总是给我送红玫瑰。”“多浪漫啊！”

detailed_translations.english: showing strong feelings of love

sentences.english: A good teacher has to be able to motivate her students.
sentences.chinese: 好教师必须能够激发学生的积极性。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone want to achieve something and make them willing to work hard in order to do this

name: spoil
trans: 破坏； 宠坏， 溺爱； 变质

sentences.english: The whole park is spoiled by litter.
sentences.chinese: 整个公园环境都给垃圾破坏了。

sentences.english: We didn’t let the incident spoil our day.
sentences.chinese: 我们没有让这件事破坏我们一整天的气氛。

sentences.english: I don’t want to spoil your fun.
sentences.chinese: 我不想扫你的兴。

sentences.english: Why do you always have to spoil everything ?
sentences.chinese: 你为什么老是要把一切都弄糟呢？

detailed_translations.english: to have a bad effect on something so that it is no longer attractive, enjoyable, useful etc

sentences.english: Children will learn to multiply in the second grade.
sentences.chinese: 儿童在二年级学习乘法。

detailed_translations.chinese: 乘；使增加；使繁殖；使相乘
detailed_translations.english: to do a calculation in which you add a number to itself a particular number of times

sentences.english: large areas of rough upland pasture
sentences.chinese: 大片起伏的山地牧场

sentences.english: the lush pastures of the southern counties
sentences.chinese: 南部各郡茂盛的牧场

detailed_translations.english: land or a field that is covered with grass and is used for cattle, sheep etc to feed on
to put animals outside in a field to feed on the grass

name: conducive
trans: 有助于…的， 有益于…的

sentences.english: an environment conducive to learning
sentences.chinese: 有助于学习的环境

detailed_translations.english: if a situation is conducive to something such as work, rest etc, it provides conditions that make it easy for you to work etc

name: pilot
trans: 驾驶， 领航； 试行， 试用； 使通过， 引导

sentences.english: an airline pilot
sentences.chinese: 航空公司飞行员

sentences.english: a fighter pilot
sentences.chinese: 战斗机驾驶员

sentences.english: The official report into the accident says that it was caused by pilot error (= a mistake by the pilot ) .
sentences.chinese: 那宗事故的官方报告称事故是由飞行员失误造成的。

sentences.english: The plan is to launch a pilot programme next summer.
sentences.chinese: 计划是在明年夏天实施一个试验性方案。

detailed_translations.english: someone who operates the controls of an aircraft or spacecraft
A pilot plan or a pilot project is one that is used to test an idea before deciding whether to introduce it on a larger scale
to guide an aircraft, spacecraft, or ship as its pilot

name: curative
trans: 有助于治疗的，有疗效的

sentences.english: the spring’s alleged curative properties
sentences.chinese: 这处泉水号称能治病的功效

detailed_translations.chinese: 有助于治疗的，有疗效的
detailed_translations.english: able to or intended to cure illness

sentences.english: Andre Agassi has pulled out of next week's Grand Slam Cup after tearing a cartilage in his chest.
sentences.chinese: 安德烈·阿加西胸部软骨拉伤后已退出了下周的大满贯赛事。

detailed_translations.english: a strong substance that can bend, which is around the joints in your body and in your outer ear

name: snide
trans: 伪造的； 不诚实的； 讽刺的， 挖苦的， 含沙射影的

sentences.english: He made a snide comment about her weight.
sentences.chinese: 他说了一句刻薄的话评论她的体重。

detailed_translations.english: if you say something snide, you say something unkind, often in a clever, indirect way

sentences.english: Baxter was rushed to the hospital with multiple stab wounds.
sentences.chinese: 巴克斯特因多处刺伤被紧急送往医院。

sentences.english: Having multiple partners increases your risk of sexual diseases.
sentences.chinese: 性伴侣多会增加得性病的风险。

sentences.english: His new album includes multiple versions of the same songs.
sentences.chinese: 他的新专辑包括同一些歌曲的多种版本。

detailed_translations.english: many, or involving many things, people, events etc
a number that contains a smaller number an exact number of times

name: expose
trans: 暴露， 显露； 揭露， 揭穿； 使接触， 使面临

sentences.english: He lifted his T-shirt to expose a jagged scar across his chest.
sentences.chinese: 他撩起T恤衫，露出横贯胸部的锯齿状伤疤。

detailed_translations.english: to show something that is usually covered or hidden

name: magnet
trans: 磁铁， 磁体； 有吸引力的人

sentences.english: It's possible to hang a nail from a magnet and then use that nail to pick up another nail.
sentences.chinese: 把一颗钉子挂在一个磁体上再用这颗钉子去吸起另一颗钉子是可能的。

detailed_translations.english: a piece of iron or steel that can stick to metal or make other metal objects move towards itself

name: versatile
trans: 多才多艺的； 多用途的

sentences.english: The potato is an extremely versatile vegetable.
sentences.chinese: 马铃薯是一种用途极广的蔬菜。

detailed_translations.english: having many different uses

sentences.english: Now please concentrate.
sentences.chinese: 现在请集中注意力。

sentences.english: Adrian was finding it difficult to concentrate.
sentences.chinese: 阿德里安觉得自己很难集中注意力。

sentences.english: Italian industry is concentrated mainly in the north.
sentences.chinese: 意大利的工业主要集中在北部。

sentences.english: orange juice made from concentrate
sentences.chinese: 用浓缩橙汁冲兑的橙汁

detailed_translations.english: to think very carefully about something that you are doing

name: versus
trans: 对， 对抗； 与…相对， 与…相比

sentences.english: the New York Knicks versus the LA Lakers
sentences.chinese: 纽约尼克斯队对洛杉矶湖人队

sentences.english: the Supreme Court decision in Roe vs. Wade
sentences.chinese: 最高法院关于罗诉韦德案的判决

detailed_translations.english: used to show that two people or teams are competing against each other in a game or court case

sentences.english: children practicing their penmanship
sentences.chinese: 练习书法的儿童

detailed_translations.english: the art of writing by hand, or skill in this art

name: tundra
trans: 苔原， 冻原， 冻土地带

sentences.english: Frozen dog dirt stipples the tundra of the golf course.
sentences.chinese: 冻成冰块的狗屎点缀着高尔夫球场的苔原。

sentences.english: The park contains 150 lakes and 450 miles of streams, plus ecosystems ranging from wetlands to pine forests to montane areas to alpine tundra.
sentences.chinese: 这个国家公园包括150个湖泊和450英里河流以及从湿地到松林、从山丘到高山冻原等各种生态系统。

detailed_translations.english: the large flat areas of land in the north of Russia, Canada etc, where it is very cold and there are no trees

name: explosion
trans: 爆炸； 爆发； 激增

sentences.english: We heard a loud explosion.
sentences.chinese: 我们听到一声巨大的爆炸声。

sentences.english: It was an explosion of anger against the practices of the occupying forces.
sentences.chinese: 这是人们不满占领军行为而爆发的怒火。

detailed_translations.english: the act of deliberately causing sth to explode

sentences.english: Arcane nullifiers recognize Common, but only an experienced tinker, shouting out the correct codes, may command them.
sentences.chinese: 虽然奥术消除者被认可为是公民，但只要是一名经验丰富的修补匠，高喊出正确的指令，就可以命令它们。

detailed_translations.english: in the past, a tinker was someone who travelled from place to place selling things or repairing metal pots, pans etc

sentences.english: The highlands are populated mainly by peasant farmers.
sentences.chinese: 高原人口主要是农民。

detailed_translations.english: if an area is populated by a particular group of people, they live there

sentences.english: She was cycling home when she had a puncture .
sentences.chinese: 她骑车回家途中轮胎被扎破了。

detailed_translations.english: a small hole made accidentally in a tyre
if a tyre punctures, or if you puncture it, a small hole appears in it

sentences.english: Smoking is only permitted in the public lounge.
sentences.chinese: 只允许在公共休息室里抽烟。

sentences.english: He had more than the permitted level of alcohol in his blood.
sentences.chinese: 他血液中的酒精含量超出了允许的水平。

detailed_translations.english: to allow something to happen, especially by an official decision, rule, or law
an official written statement giving you the right to do something

name: translation
trans: 翻译； 译文， 译本

sentences.english: She read the letter and gave us a rough translation (= she did not translate everything exactly ) .
sentences.chinese: 她看了信，给我们大概翻译了一下。

sentences.english: I’ve only read ‘Madame Bovary’ in translation (= not in its original language ) .
sentences.chinese: 我只读过《包法利夫人》的翻译本。

sentences.english: Much of the book’s humour has been lost in translation (= is no longer effective when translated ) .
sentences.chinese: 本书的许多幽默元素已在翻译过程中丢失。

detailed_translations.english: when you translate something, or something that has been translated

sentences.english: All personnel are to receive security badges.
sentences.chinese: 所有人员都将拿到安保徽章。

detailed_translations.english: the people who work in a company, organization, or military force

name: splash
trans: 重点文章；溅上的液体；斑点

sentences.english: Water splashed onto the floor.
sentences.chinese: 水哗的一声泼洒在地板上。

sentences.english: He splashed cold water on his face.
sentences.chinese: 他把冷水往脸上泼。

sentences.english: We heard the splash when she fell into the pool.
sentences.chinese: 她掉进游泳池时我们听见扑通的一声。

detailed_translations.english: (of liquid) to fall noisily onto a surface
the sound of sth hitting liquid or of liquid hitting sth

name: fountain
trans: 喷泉； 丰富来源， 源泉

sentences.english: The fountain wells its cold water.
sentences.chinese: 喷泉涌出清凉的泉水。

sentences.english: He was a fountain of information on Asian affairs.
sentences.chinese: 他是亚洲事务的信息源。

detailed_translations.english: a structure from which water is pushed up into the air, used for example as decoration in a garden or park

sentences.english: a porcelain vase
sentences.chinese: 瓷花瓶

detailed_translations.english: a hard shiny white substance that is used for making expensive plates, cups etc

sentences.english: Can you catalog all these books?
sentences.chinese: 你能给所有这些书编目录吗？

sentences.english: Well. this is our latest catalog.
sentences.chinese: 嗯，这是我们最新的产品目录。 。

sentences.english: Can you send me a catalog?
sentences.chinese: 你能给我寄一份商品目录吗？

name: part-time
trans: 兼职的； 部分时间的

sentences.english: a part-time job
sentences.chinese: 兼职工作

sentences.english: women wishing to return to work on a part-time basis
sentences.chinese: 希望以兼职形式重返职场的女性

detailed_translations.english: someone who has a part-time job works for only part of each day or week

sentences.english: the early pioneers of the Dakota territory
sentences.chinese: 达科他地区的早期拓荒者

detailed_translations.english: someone who is important in the early development of something, and whose work or ideas are later developed by other people
to be the first person to do, invent or use something

name: chilly
trans: 寒冷的； 冷淡的， 不友好的

sentences.english: Getting chilly, isn’t it?
sentences.chinese: 天冷了，是不是？

sentences.english: The bathroom’s a bit chilly.
sentences.chinese: 浴室里有点冷。

detailed_translations.english: chilly weather or places are cold enough to make you feel uncomfortable

name: flagellum
trans: [昆] 鞭毛；鞭子；鞭状匍匐枝

sentences.english: That vibration can then be coupled to another structure to turn a rotor, which in turn operates a flagellum-like tail.
sentences.chinese: 这个颤动能够随即作用到另一个装置以启动马达，后者接着操纵像鞭毛一样的尾巴。

sentences.english: Using special stains, one can see that some bacteria have attached to them wavy-looking “hairs” called flagella. Others have only one flagellum.
sentences.chinese: 用特殊的着色剂后，你会发现有的细菌上长着不少波状的"毛发"即鞭毛，而有的细菌只有一根鞭毛。

sentences.english: Thefinal evolution of the flagellum might then have involved only thenovel recombination of sophisticated parts that initially evolved forother purposes.
sentences.chinese: 鞭毛的最终出现，可能仅仅来自本来向其它方向进化的复杂器官的重新组合。

detailed_translations.english: a long whiplike outgrowth from a cell that acts as an organ of locomotion: occurs in some protozoans, gametes, spores, etc

sentences.english: In this island is also found the rhinoceros, an animal less than the elephant, but larger than the buffalo.
sentences.chinese: 在这个岛上还能找到犀牛，一种比大象小一点的动物，可是比水牛大。

sentences.english: Contrary to its name, the black rhinoceros is actually grey in color.
sentences.chinese: 有别于它的名字，黑犀牛事实上是灰色的。

detailed_translations.english: a large heavy African or Asian animal with thick skin and either one or two horns on its nose

name: implication
trans: 含义； 暗示， 暗指； 卷入， 牵连

sentences.english: They are called ‘Supertrams’, the implication being that (= which is meant to suggest that ) they are more advanced than earlier models.
sentences.chinese: 它们被称作“超级电车”，这是暗指它们比先前的型号更先进。

detailed_translations.english: a suggestion that is not made directly but that people are expected to understand or accept

name: fierce
trans: 凶猛的， 残忍的； 狂热的， 强烈的； 激烈的， 猛烈的

sentences.english: fierce guard dogs
sentences.chinese: 凶猛的看门狗

sentences.english: fierce fighting in the city
sentences.chinese: 城里的激烈战斗

detailed_translations.english: a fierce person or animal is angry or ready to attack, and looks very frightening

name: reservation
trans: 预约， 预订； 保留意见， 疑惑； 居留地

sentences.english: a dinner reservation
sentences.chinese: 预订晚餐

sentences.english: Customers are advised to make seat reservations well in advance.
sentences.chinese: 建议顾客提前订座。

detailed_translations.english: an arrangement which you make so that a place in a hotel, restaurant, plane etc is kept for you at a particular time in the future

name: block
trans: 大块； 街区； 障碍物

sentences.english: a wall made of concrete blocks
sentences.chinese: 由混凝土块砌成的墙

detailed_translations.english: a piece of hard material such as wood or stone with straight sides
to prevent anything moving through a space by being or placing something across it or in it

detailed_translations.chinese: 成批的，大块的；交通堵塞的

sentences.english: The talks were conducted in a cordial atmosphere.
sentences.chinese: 会谈在友好的气氛中进行。

detailed_translations.english: friendly but quite polite and formal

name: odorous
trans: 有气味的， 难闻的； 香的， 芬芳的

sentences.english: odorous gases
sentences.chinese: 有气味的气体

detailed_translations.english: having a smell

sentences.english: the need to strengthen international co-operation
sentences.chinese: 加强国际合作的需要

detailed_translations.english: when you work with someone to achieve something that you both want

sentences.english: The conceit of the woman!
sentences.chinese: 这个自负的女人！

detailed_translations.english: an attitude that shows you have too high an opinion of your own abilities or importance

name: modulate
trans: 调整， 调节； 调制

sentences.english: He carefully modulated his voice.
sentences.chinese: 他仔细地调节了自己的声音。

detailed_translations.english: to change the sound of your voice

sentences.english: His red, mottled face showed the effect of too much whisky.
sentences.chinese: 他那张红红的、满是斑点的脸表明，他威士忌喝得太多了。

detailed_translations.english: covered with spots or coloured areas

sentences.english: The rash morphology progresses from papules to pustules and finally to crusting lesions.
sentences.chinese: 皮疹的形态从最初的丘疹发展至脓疱，最终局部脱屑。

sentences.english: In fact, a major theme in research here is how the morphology of the bird influences its behavior.
sentences.chinese: 实际上，探寻鸟类形态如何影响它的行为是该实验室的主要研究课题。

sentences.english: In fact, a major theme in research here is how the morphology of the bird influences its behavior.
sentences.chinese: 事实上，该实验室研究的一个主要方向是鸟儿的形态是如何影响它们的动作的。

detailed_translations.chinese: 形态学(尤指动植物形态学或词语形态学)
detailed_translations.english: the study of the  morpheme s  of a language and of the way in which they are joined together to make words

name: distant
trans: 远离的， 遥远的； 疏远的， 冷淡的； 久远的； 不同的

sentences.english: the sound of distant gunfire
sentences.chinese: 远处的炮火声

sentences.english: Her honeymoon seemed a distant memory.
sentences.chinese: 她的蜜月似乎成了遥远的记忆。

sentences.english: That affair was in the dim and distant past (= a long time ago ) .
sentences.chinese: 那件事已成为遥远的过去了。

sentences.english: The President hopes to visit Ireland in the not too distant future (= quite soon ) .
sentences.chinese: 总统希望在不久的将来访问爱尔兰。

sentences.english: After the quarrel Sue remained cold and distant.
sentences.chinese: 那次争吵之后，休一直冷淡疏远。

detailed_translations.english: far away in space or time

name: resonance
trans: 共振， 共鸣； 回声， 反响

sentences.english: a tradition that has little resonance in the 21st century
sentences.chinese: 在21世纪难以引起共鸣的传统

sentences.english: His words will have resonance for many musicians.
sentences.chinese: 他的话将在很多音乐家心里产生共鸣。

detailed_translations.english: the special meaning or importance that something has for you because it relates to your own experiences

name: propose
trans: 建议， 提议； 提名， 推荐； 打算， 计划； 求婚

sentences.english: the changes currently proposed by the local planning authorities
sentences.chinese: 目前由地方规划局提议的改革

sentences.english: the proposed budget cuts
sentences.chinese: 所提出的预算削减

detailed_translations.english: to suggest something as a plan or course of action

sentences.english: The spearhead is made of hard flint and it's about the size of a small, slim mobile phone, but it's in the shape of a long thin leaf.
sentences.chinese: 这矛头是由一颗坚硬的燧石制成的，大概一部超薄手机大小，细细长长的叶子状。 它的矛锋完好无损，仍然相当的尖锐。

detailed_translations.english: a person or group of people who lead an attack or organized action
to lead an attack or organized action

sentences.english: On the right waist have a seismograph, it tender prior to the earthquake forecast the earthquake.
sentences.chinese: 在右腰上有一个地震仪，它嫩在地震前预报地震。

sentences.english: People always make some misunderstanding for the sampling rate and dynamic range of shallow seismograph.
sentences.chinese: 人们对浅层地震仪的采样率及动态范围这两个指标往往产生某些误解。

detailed_translations.english: an instrument that measures and records the movement of the earth during an  earthquake

name: reform
trans: 改革， 改造， 革新； 改正， 改过自新

sentences.english: plans to radically reform the tax system
sentences.chinese: 彻底改革税收制度的计划

detailed_translations.chinese: 改革， 改良， 改造； 改正， 改过自新
detailed_translations.english: to improve a system, law, organization etc by making a lot of changes to it, so that it operates in a fairer or more effective way

name: angular
trans: 有角的， 尖角的； 消瘦的， 瘦骨嶙峋的

sentences.english: a cubist painting with angular shapes
sentences.chinese: 一幅有棱角图案的立体派绘画

detailed_translations.chinese: [生物] 有角的；生硬的，笨拙的；瘦削的
detailed_translations.english: having sharp and definite corners

sentences.english: The park is open to the public during daylight hours .
sentences.chinese: 公园白天对公众开放。

sentences.english: If possible, it’s better to work in natural daylight.
sentences.chinese: 如果条件允许的话，最好在自然日光下工作。

detailed_translations.english: the light produced by the sun during the day

name: podium
trans: 讲坛， 讲台； 指挥台

sentences.english: Unsteadily he mounted the podium, adjusted the microphone, coughed, and went completely blank.
sentences.chinese: 他摇摇晃晃地走上讲台，调好麦克风，咳嗽了几声，接着脑子就一片空白。

detailed_translations.english: a small raised area for a performer, speaker, or musical  conductor  to stand on

name: binary
trans: 二进制的； 二元的； 由两部分组成的

sentences.english: a binary star system
sentences.chinese: 双星系

detailed_translations.chinese: [数] 二进制的；二元的，二态的
detailed_translations.english: a system of counting, used in computers, in which only the numbers 0 and 1 are used

name: ensue
trans: 继而发生， 接着发生

sentences.english: If the Europeans did not reduce subsidies, a trade war would ensue.
sentences.chinese: 如果欧洲不减少补贴，贸易战将随即爆发。

detailed_translations.english: If something ensues, it happens immediately after another event, usually as a result of it

name: crazy
trans: 疯狂的， 不理智的； 狂热的， 热衷的； 精神失常的

sentences.english: The neighbours must think we’re crazy.
sentences.chinese: 邻居一定会认为我们疯了。

sentences.english: It’s an absolutely crazy idea .
sentences.chinese: 那绝对是个荒唐的想法。

sentences.english: I know this idea sounds crazy , but it may be worth a try.
sentences.chinese: 我知道这个主意听起来很荒唐，但也许值得一试。

sentences.english: He often works 12 hours a day – it’s crazy .
sentences.chinese: 他常常一天工作12个小时——简直疯了。

detailed_translations.english: very strange or not sensible

name: microscopic
trans: 用显微镜可见的； 极小的

sentences.english: a microscopic speck of dust
sentences.chinese: 微小的尘粒

sentences.english: Inspectors discovered microscopic cracks in the hull of the submarine.
sentences.chinese: 检测人员发现潜艇的船身有细微的裂缝。

detailed_translations.english: extremely small and therefore very difficult to see

sentences.chinese: 她的画作让人想起早期的印象派作品。

sentences.chinese: 有人指出创建者并非真正的爱国者，而是一些维护自己利益的人。

sentences.chinese: 杰克逊说她的老板变得越来越抑郁，又重新大量吸烟了。

sentences.chinese: 更多的第二次婚姻比第一次更差。伴随更多同居被接受，为什么要再婚？为什么要再冒险那个噩梦？

sentences.chinese: 可能你会说我是素食者，但科学家称我为草食动物，因为我只吃叶子、草和其它植物。

name: successive

sentences.chinese: 历届政府都试图解决这个问题。

detailed_translations.english: coming or following one after the other

sentences.english: a great adventure
sentences.chinese: 一大奇遇

sentences.english: Ahab’s adventures at sea
sentences.chinese: 亚哈的海上历险

sentences.chinese: 一个历险故事

name: ceremony

sentences.chinese: 婚礼

sentences.chinese: 奥运会开幕式

detailed_translations.english: an important social or religious event, when a traditional set of actions is performed in a formal way

sentences.chinese: 为想提高英语水平的学生开设的一门课
