sentences.english: He will be inaugurated (as) President in January.
sentences.chinese: 他将于一月份就任总统。

sentences.english: The moon landing inaugurated a new era in space exploration.
sentences.chinese: 登陆月球开创了太空探索的新纪元。

detailed_translations.english: to introduce a new public official or leader at a special ceremony

sentences.english: Several players were suffering from cramp.
sentences.chinese: 有几名球员抽筋了。

sentences.english: muscle cramps
sentences.chinese: 肌肉痉挛

detailed_translations.chinese: 痉挛，绞痛；[五金] 铁夹钳
detailed_translations.english: a severe pain that you get in part of your body when a muscle becomes too tight, making it difficult for you to move that part of your body

detailed_translations.chinese: 束缚，限制；使…抽筋；以铁箍扣紧
detailed_translations.english: to prevent the development of someone or something

detailed_translations.chinese: 狭窄的；难解的；受限制的

name: academy
trans: 学会， 研究院； 专科院校

sentences.english: the American Academy of Arts and Letters
sentences.chinese: 美国艺术和文学学会

detailed_translations.chinese: 学院；研究院；学会；专科院校
detailed_translations.english: an official organization which encourages the development of literature, art, science etc

name: solitude
trans: 孤独， 单独； 独处， 独居； 隐居处

sentences.english: the solitude of her house on the lake
sentences.chinese: 她湖边那所房子的清静

detailed_translations.english: when you are alone, especially when this is what you enjoy

name: reward
trans: 奖赏， 奖励， 给以报酬

sentences.english: The school has a system of rewards and punishments to encourage good behaviour.
sentences.chinese: 学校有奖惩制度以鼓励良好行为。

sentences.english: The club’s directors rewarded him with a free season ticket.
sentences.chinese: 俱乐部的董事们奖给他一张免费季票。

detailed_translations.english: something that you get because you have done something good or helpful or have worked hard
to give something to someone because they have done something good or helpful or have worked fo

sentences.english: ...a new hockey arena.
sentences.chinese: …一个新的冰球场。

detailed_translations.english: a game played on grass by two teams of 11 players, with sticks and a ball

sentences.english: fields where they used to graze their sheep
sentences.chinese: 他们过去放羊的田野

detailed_translations.english: if an animal grazes, or if you graze it, it eats grass that is growing
to accidentally break the surface of your skin by rubbing it against something
a wound caused by rubbing that slightly breaks the surface of your skin

name: swallow
trans: 吞，咽；吞没，侵吞；轻信，轻易接受；默默忍受；使不流露，抑制

sentences.english: He swallowed the last of his coffee and asked for the bill.
sentences.chinese: 他喝完最后一口咖啡，要求结账。

sentences.english: Most snakes swallow their prey whole .
sentences.chinese: 大多数蛇都是把猎物囫囵吞下。

detailed_translations.english: to make food or drink go down your throat and towards your stomach

name: perquisite
trans: 津贴， 利益； 特权

sentences.english: In so many countries that I covered in Southeast Asia it was a given that the elites would take over public land as a kind of perquisite of power.
sentences.chinese: 在我报道过的许多东南亚国家，精英阶层拥有将公有土地挪为私用的特权，是人尽皆知的常态。

sentences.english: A hominid is really any extinct ape more closely related to us than the chimpanzee.
sentences.chinese: 原始人类中任何一个灭绝的猿物种和我们的关系都比黑猩猩更密切。

sentences.english: From one perspective, the development of a very small penis could be considered the next step in male hominid evolution.
sentences.chinese: 从这一角度看，在原始男性进化中，非常小阴茎的男人在下一步可能优先考虑发展。

sentences.english: H. erectus is generally believed to be the direct ancestor of modern humans and also the first hominid to live in caves and tame fire.
sentences.chinese: 人们通常认为直立人是现代人的直接祖先，也是第一个生活在洞穴中和学会用火的原始人类。

detailed_translations.english: any primate of the family Hominidae, which includes modern man (Homo sapiens) and the extinct precursors of man

sentences.english: Neutrons and protons are bound together in the nucleus of an atom.
sentences.chinese: 在一个原子的核内，中子和质子聚合在一起。

sentences.english: the nucleus of an effective team
sentences.chinese: 高效团队的核心

detailed_translations.english: the central part of an atom, made up of neutrons, protons, and other elementary particles

sentences.english: She felt the sting of tears in her eyes.
sentences.chinese: 她感觉泪水刺痛了眼睛。

sentences.english: He was stung by a bee.
sentences.chinese: 他被蜜蜂蜇了。

detailed_translations.english: a sharp pain in your eyes or skin, caused by being hit, by smoke etc
(of an insect or plant) to touch your skin or make a very small hole in it so that you feel a sharp pain

sentences.english: a carton of orange juice
sentences.chinese: 一纸盒橙汁

sentences.english: A Coke and a tomato juice, please.
sentences.chinese: 请来一杯可乐和一杯番茄汁。

detailed_translations.english: the liquid that comes from fruit and vegetables, or a drink that is made from this

sentences.english: Spelling mistakes are often just the result of haste.
sentences.chinese: 拼写错误经常是由于匆忙而造成的。

sentences.english: And if haste is the accelerator pedal, multitasking is overdrive.
sentences.chinese: 如果匆忙是加速器的踏板，一心多用就是超速档。

sentences.english: My workmate gestured, clarifying his intentions of using a forged(faked) passport in haste.
sentences.chinese: 我的同事打着手势，匆忙地解释着他使用假护照的意图。

detailed_translations.chinese: 匆忙， 急速； 草率
detailed_translations.english: great speed in doing something, especially because you do not have enough time

name: nurture
trans: 养育，养护，培养；扶植，支持；滋长，助长

sentences.english: plants nurtured in the greenhouse
sentences.chinese: 在温室里培育的植物

detailed_translations.english: to feed and take care of a child or a plant while it is growing
the education and care that you are given as a child, and the way it affects your later development and attitudes

name: buckle
trans: 扣紧； 变形， 弯曲

sentences.english: The steel pillars began to buckle.
sentences.chinese: 这些钢柱开始变形了。

detailed_translations.english: to become bent or curved because of heat or pressure, or to make something bend or curve in this way
a piece of metal used for fastening the two ends of a belt, for fastening a shoe, bag etc, or for decoration

sentences.english: Inactivity can make your joints stiff, and the bones may begin to degenerate.
sentences.chinese: 不活动会使关节僵硬，骨骼因此可能会开始退化。

detailed_translations.english: to become worse
morally unacceptable
someone whose behaviour is considered to be morally unacceptable

name: destructive
trans: 破坏性的， 毁灭性的

sentences.english: the destructive power of modern weapons
sentences.chinese: 现代武器的破坏力

detailed_translations.english: causing damage to people or things

sentences.english: They found an icon in the monastery.
sentences.chinese: 他们在修道院中发现了一个圣像。

sentences.english: The monastery is in a remote mountain pass.
sentences.chinese: 那个修道院在一个偏远的山口中。

sentences.english: You know, my dear child, in peace, in the work is not found, it is not in joy, nor in the world or the monastery, it exists only in the human soul.
sentences.chinese: 你知道，我亲爱的孩子，安宁，在工作中是找不到的，它也不在欢乐中，也不在这个世界上或者这所修道院中，它仅仅存在于人的灵魂里。

detailed_translations.english: a place where  monk s  live

sentences.english: a devout Catholic
sentences.chinese: 虔诚的天主徒

detailed_translations.english: someone who is devout has a very strong belief in a religion

sentences.english: The information given to the press was carefully censored by the Ministry of Defence.
sentences.chinese: 发布给报界的信息经过了国防部的仔细审查。

detailed_translations.english: to examine books, films, letters etc to remove anything that is considered offensive, morally harmful, or politically dangerous etc

detailed_translations.chinese: 检查员；[心理] 潜意识压抑力；信件检查员
detailed_translations.english: someone whose job is to examine books, films, letters etc and remove anything considered to be offensive, morally harmful, or politically dangerous

name: devour
trans: 狼吞虎咽地吃， 吞食； 吞没， 吞噬； 如饥似渴地读

sentences.english: Her body had been almost entirely devoured by the disease.
sentences.chinese: 她的身体几乎完全被疾病摧毁。

detailed_translations.english: to destroy someone or something

name: stir
trans: 搅拌；煽动；激发，打动；行动，活动
搅拌， 搅动； 激动， 震动

sentences.english: Give that pan a stir , will you?
sentences.chinese: 把那锅东西搅一搅，好吗？

detailed_translations.english: an act of stirring something
to move a liquid or substance around with a spoon or stick in order to mix it together

sentences.english: Nobody insults my family and gets away with it!
sentences.chinese: 谁也别想侮辱了我的家人之后就这么算了！

sentences.english: I hope Andy won’t be insulted if I don’t come.
sentences.chinese: 如果我不来，希望安迪不要介意。

sentences.english: 200 for all that work? It’s an insult.
sentences.chinese: 文例句：干那么多工作才给200美元？这简直是侮辱。

detailed_translations.english: to offend someone by saying or doing something they think is rude
a remark or action that is offensive or deliberately rude

name: existence
trans: 存在， 实在； 生存， 生活

sentences.english: Scientists have many theories about how the universe first came into existence (= started to exist ).
sentences.chinese: 关于宇宙的起源，科学家有多种理论。

sentences.english: Pablo led a miserable existence when he first moved to San Juan.
sentences.chinese: 巴勃罗刚搬到圣胡安时，生活很悲惨。

detailed_translations.english: the state of existing

sentences.english: traditional rural crafts
sentences.chinese: 传统的乡村手工艺

sentences.english: arts and crafts
sentences.chinese: 手工艺

detailed_translations.english: a job or activity in which you make things with your hands, and that you usually need skill to do
to make something using a special skill, especially with your hands

name: axis
trans: 轴； 轴线， 中心线

sentences.english: The Earth rotates on an axis between the north and south poles.
sentences.chinese: 地球绕着南北两极之间的地轴自转。

detailed_translations.english: the imaginary line around which a large round object, such as the Earth, turns

name: maze
trans: 迷宫；复杂难懂的细节；困惑，迷惘
使混乱； 使困惑， 迷惑

sentences.english: We got completely lost in the maze.
sentences.chinese: 我们在迷宫中彻底迷了路。

sentences.english: the famous Hampton Court maze
sentences.chinese: 著名的汉普顿宫迷宫

detailed_translations.english: a specially designed system of paths, often in a park or public garden, which is difficult to find your way through

name: float
trans: 漂浮， 浮动； 飘动

sentences.english: I looked up at the clouds floating in the sky.
sentences.chinese: 我仰望着天上的浮云。

sentences.english: Leaves floated gently down from the trees.
sentences.chinese: 叶子从树上轻轻飘落。

detailed_translations.english: if something floats, it moves slowly through the air or stays up in the air

detailed_translations.chinese: 彩车，花车；漂流物；浮舟；浮萍
detailed_translations.english: a large vehicle that is decorated to drive through the streets as part of a special event

sentences.english: Freon exists both in liquid and gaseous states.
sentences.chinese: 氟利昂既有液态也有气态。

detailed_translations.english: like gas or in the form of gas

name: negligent
trans: 忽略的； 疏忽的； 粗心大意的

sentences.english: Mr Brown was found guilty of negligent driving.
sentences.chinese: 布朗先生被判疏忽驾驶罪。

detailed_translations.english: not taking enough care over something that you are responsible for, with the result that serious mistakes are made

name: expressive
trans: 有表现力的， 富有表情的； 表示…的， 表现…的

sentences.english: You can train people to be more expressive.
sentences.chinese: 你可以培训人们使其更富于表现力。

sentences.english: ...the present fashion for intuitive, expressive painting.
sentences.chinese: …当前凭直觉的、富于表现力的绘画风尚。

detailed_translations.chinese: 表现的；有表现力的；表达…的
detailed_translations.english: If you describe a person or their behaviour as expressive, you mean that their behaviour clearly indicates their feelings or intentions

sentences.english: It possesses incredible strength and elasticity, while its exceptionally high conductivity and use in flexible semiconductors  could soup up computing.
sentences.chinese: 它具有难以置信的强度和弹性，而其异常的高导电性和半导体中灵活的应用可以提高计算能力。

sentences.english: They discovered a first order phase transition, a discontinuity, in liquid hydrogen between a molecular state with low conductivity and a highly conductive atomic state.
sentences.chinese: 他们发现了一个不连续的一级相变，这个相变是在液态氢低电导率的分子态和高电导率的原子态之间。

name: desolate
trans: 荒凉的， 无人烟的； 不幸的， 忧伤的
使感到悲惨， 使感到凄凉； 使荒芜

sentences.english: a desolate landscape
sentences.chinese: 荒凉的景色

detailed_translations.english: a place that is desolate is empty and looks sad because there are no people there
a place that is desolate is empty and looks sad because there are no people there
someone who is desolate feels very sad and lonely

sentences.english: a jacket of coarse wool
sentences.chinese: 粗羊毛夹克衫

detailed_translations.english: having a rough surface that feels slightly hard

name: evade
trans: 逃避， 回避； 躲开， 避开

sentences.english: You can’t go on evading your responsibilities in this way.
sentences.chinese: 你不能这样继续逃避责任。

sentences.english: You’re simply trying to evade the problem.
sentences.chinese: 你根本是在设法逃避问题。

detailed_translations.english: to not do or deal with something that you should do

name: associative
trans: 联想的； 结合的； 关联的

sentences.english: the brain’s ability to form associative links between different things
sentences.chinese: 大脑通过联想把不同事物联系起来的能力

detailed_translations.chinese: 联想的； 结合的； 关联的
detailed_translations.english: reminding you of something else

sentences.english: I couldn’t sleep for three days – I’m not exaggerating.
sentences.chinese: 我三天没睡觉了——一点不夸张。

detailed_translations.english: to make something seem better, larger, worse etc than it really is

sentences.english: ...the cerebral cortex.
sentences.chinese: ...大脑皮层。

detailed_translations.english: the outer layer of an organ in your body, especially your brain

name: imply
trans: 意味着， 暗示； 说明， 表明； 使有必要

sentences.english: an implied threat
sentences.chinese: 隐含的威胁

sentences.english: The high level of radiation in the rocks implies that they are volcanic in origin.
sentences.chinese: 这些岩石内的高辐射水平显示它们是由火山作用形成的。

detailed_translations.english: to suggest that something is true, without saying this directly

sentences.english: He was able to offset his travel expenses against tax.
sentences.chinese: 他可以用旅费抵税。

sentences.english: What expenses can you offset against tax ?
sentences.chinese: 什么开支可以获得税项减免？

detailed_translations.english: to use one cost, payment or situation in order to cancel or reduce the effect of another

sentences.english: She practised her backhand.
sentences.chinese: 她练习反拍。

detailed_translations.english: a way of hitting the ball in tennis and some other games, in which the back of your hand is turned in the direction of the ball when you hit it

detailed_translations.chinese: 反手的（网球等运动中的动作）

sentences.english: Her thick black hair cascaded down below her waist.
sentences.chinese: 她那浓密的黑发瀑布般垂过腰际。

sentences.english: Gallons of water cascaded over the side of the bath.
sentences.chinese: 大量的水从浴缸边溢出来。

detailed_translations.english: a small steep  waterfall  that is one of several together

detailed_translations.chinese: 像瀑布般大量倾泻下来
detailed_translations.english: to flow, fall, or hang down in large quantities

name: cavity
trans: 腔； 洞， 穴， 窟窿； 龋洞

sentences.english: Put herbs inside the body cavity of the fish.
sentences.chinese: 把香草放进鱼肚里。

sentences.english: I have no cavities (= no holes in my teeth ) .
sentences.chinese: 我没有蛀牙洞。

detailed_translations.english: a hole or space inside something

name: sequence
trans: 一系列，一连串；顺序，次序，序列

sentences.english: Be careful to perform the actions in the correct sequence.
sentences.chinese: 注意要按正确的顺序来完成动作。

detailed_translations.english: the order that something happens or exists in, or the order it is supposed to happen or exist in

name: provision
trans: 供应， 供应品； 条款； 准备， 预备

sentences.english: The agreement includes a provision for each side to check the other side’s weapons.
sentences.chinese: 协议有项规定，允许双方互查武器。

sentences.english: Under the provisions of the Act, employers must supply safety equipment.
sentences.chinese: 该法令规定，雇主必须提供安全设备。

detailed_translations.english: a condition in an agreement or law

sentences.english: We’re having difficulty recruiting enough qualified staff.
sentences.chinese: 我们难以招聘到足够的合格职员。

sentences.english: Many government officials were recruited from private industry.
sentences.chinese: 很多政府官员是从私营企业招募来的。

sentences.english: Drill sergeants have eight weeks to turn fresh recruits into soldiers.
sentences.chinese: 操练军士要在八个星期之内把新兵训练成真正的士兵。

detailed_translations.english: to find new people to work in a company, join an organization, do a job etc
someone who has just joined the army, navy, or  air force

name: thrust
trans: 戳， 刺； 要旨； 驱动力

sentences.english: He jumped back to avoid another thrust of the knife.
sentences.chinese: 他往后一闪，躲避再次捅来的一刀。

sentences.english: She thrust her way into the crowd.
sentences.chinese: 她挤进了人群。

detailed_translations.english: a sudden strong movement in which you push something forward
If you thrust your way somewhere, you move there, pushing between people or things which are in your way

name: abolition
trans: 废除， 废止； 废奴运动

sentences.english: The abolition of slavery in Brazil and the Caribbean closely followed the pattern of the United States.
sentences.chinese: 巴西和加勒比海地区对奴隶制的废除很大程度上遵循了美国的模式。

detailed_translations.english: when a law or a system is officially ended

name: sporadic
trans: 偶发的， 间或出现的， 零星的

sentences.english: There has been sporadic violence downtown.
sentences.chinese: 市中心时有暴力事件发生。

detailed_translations.english: happening fairly often, but not regularly

name: turnout
trans: 出席人数； 产量， 产额

sentences.english: I was disappointed by the turn-out for our home match.
sentences.chinese: 我对我们主场比赛的观众到场人数感到失望。

detailed_translations.chinese: 产量；出席者；参加人数；出动；清除；[公路] 岔道
detailed_translations.english: the number of people who vote in an election

name: configuration
trans: 布局， 格局； 结构， 构造， 形状； 配置

sentences.english: ...Stonehenge, in southwestern England, an ancient configuration of giant stones.
sentences.chinese: …史前巨石柱群，位于英国西南部，是一座古代巨石阵列。

detailed_translations.chinese: 配置， 布局， 构造
detailed_translations.english: the shape or arrangement of the parts of something

name: scientific
trans: 科学的； 细致严谨的

sentences.english: We believe in investing in scientific research.
sentences.chinese: 我们相信科学研究的投资价值。

sentences.english: the limits of scientific knowledge
sentences.chinese: 科学知识的极限

sentences.english: decisions based on scientific evidence
sentences.chinese: 根据科学证据作出的决定

sentences.english: the international scientific community (= scientists )
sentences.chinese: 国际科学界

detailed_translations.english: about or related to science, or using its methods

sentences.english: ...purple and gold spherical earrings.
sentences.chinese: ...紫色和金色的球形耳环。

detailed_translations.english: having the shape of a sphere

name: chunk
trans: 厚片， 大块； 相当大的部分； 矮胖的人

sentences.english: ice chunks
sentences.chinese: 大冰块

detailed_translations.chinese: 厚片， 大块； 相当大的部分
detailed_translations.english: a large thick piece of something that does not have an even shape

sentences.english: Astronomers have detected an asteroid not far from Earth, moving in the same orbit around the Sun.
sentences.chinese: 天文学家在距离地球不远处发现一颗与地球绕日轨道相同的小行星。

sentences.english: Look at the movies that we see all the time. It's easy to imagine the end of the world. An asteroid destroying all life and so on.
sentences.chinese: 瞧瞧那些我们一直在看的电影，要想像世界末日那是很容易的事，比如一个小行星毁灭了所有生命之类的。

sentences.english: Moving on through the asteroid belt we enter the realms of the gas giant planets: Jupiter, Saturn, Uranus and Neptune, all of which dwarf the Earth.
sentences.chinese: 穿过小行星带继续前进，我们进入了气体巨行星区域：木星、土星、天王星、海王星，所有这些都使地球看起来像个侏儒。

detailed_translations.english: one of the many small  planet s  that move around the Sun, especially between Mars and Jupiter

sentences.english: Car thefts are commonplace in this part of town.
sentences.chinese: 镇上的这个地段盗车案屡见不鲜。

sentences.english: It is a commonplace to say that Northern Ireland is a backwater in the modern Europe.
sentences.chinese: 说北爱尔兰是现代欧洲死气沉沉的落后地区已是陈词滥调了。

detailed_translations.english: happening or existing in many places, and therefore not special or unusual
something that has been said so often that it is no longer interesting or original

sentences.english: restrictions on press freedom, such as libel laws
sentences.chinese: 诽谤法之类对新闻自由的限制

detailed_translations.chinese: 诽谤罪；诋毁；毁坏名誉的东西；控诉书
detailed_translations.english: when someone writes or prints untrue statements about someone so that other people could have a bad opinion of them
to write or print a libel against someone

name: parameter
trans: 参量， 参数； 界限， 范围

sentences.english: ...some of the parameters that determine the taste of a wine.
sentences.chinese: …一些决定葡萄酒味道的参数。

detailed_translations.english: Parameters are factors or limits that affect the way something can be done or made

name: extinct
trans: 灭绝的， 不存在的； 不再活跃的

sentences.english: Dinosaurs have been extinct for millions of years.
sentences.chinese: 恐龙已灭绝数千万年了。

sentences.english: Pandas could become extinct in the wild.
sentences.chinese: 熊猫在野生环境中可能会绝种。

sentences.english: an extinct species
sentences.chinese: 已灭绝的一个物种

detailed_translations.english: (of a type of plant, animal, etc.) no longer in existence

name: forerunner
trans: 先驱者， 开路人； 先兆， 预兆

sentences.english: ...a machine which, in some respects, was the forerunner of the modern helicopter.
sentences.chinese: …一台在某些方面是现代直升飞机的前身的机器。

detailed_translations.english: someone or something that existed before something similar that developed or came later

sentences.english: Pablo Picasso played a principal role in the early movement of cubism.
sentences.chinese: 帕勃洛•毕加索在立体派早期发展中起首重要的推动作用。

detailed_translations.english: a 20th-century style of art, in which objects and people are represented by  geometric  shapes

name: agonize
trans: 苦苦思索； 焦虑不已

sentences.english: As a mother, I agonize over what my children will inherit.
sentences.chinese: 作为一个母亲，我对我的孩子们将要继承的东西感到极度痛苦。

name: percolate
trans: 过滤；渗入，渗透；逐渐流传，传开

sentences.english: Rain water will only percolate through slowly.
sentences.chinese: 雨水只会慢慢地渗进来。

detailed_translations.english: if liquid, light, or air percolates somewhere, it passes slowly through a material that has very small holes in it

name: opaque
trans: 不透明的， 不透光的； 难懂的， 晦涩的

sentences.english: a shower with an opaque glass door
sentences.chinese: 装有不透明玻璃门的淋浴间

detailed_translations.chinese: 不透明的；不传热的；迟钝的
detailed_translations.english: opaque glass or liquid is difficult to see through and often thick

sentences.english: Younger workers tend to be at an advantage (=  have an advantage  ) when applying for jobs.
sentences.chinese: 年轻点的工人申请工作时往往处于优势地位。

sentences.english: One of the many advantages of living in New York is that you can eat out at almost any time of day.
sentences.chinese: 住在纽约的诸多好处之一是几乎任何时候都可以外出吃饭。

detailed_translations.english: something that helps you to be more successful than others, or the state of having this

sentences.english: a clerical assistant
sentences.chinese: 文书助理

sentences.english: ...the assistant secretary of defence.
sentences.chinese: …助理国防部长。

detailed_translations.english: someone who helps someone else in their work, especially by doing the less important jobs

detailed_translations.chinese: 辅助的，助理的；有帮助的
detailed_translations.english: Assistant is used in front of titles or jobs to indicate a slightly lower rank. For example, an assistant director is one rank lower than a director in an organization.

name: humid
trans: 湿的， 潮湿的； 湿润的

sentences.english: Tokyo is extremely humid in mid-summer.
sentences.chinese: 仲夏的东京十分潮湿。

detailed_translations.english: if the weather is humid, you feel uncomfortable because the air is very wet and usually hot

name: instead
trans: 代替， 顶替； 反而， 却

sentences.english: You probably picked up my keys instead of yours.
sentences.chinese: 你可能没拿你的钥匙而错拿了我的。

sentences.english: Could I have tuna instead of ham?
sentences.chinese: 我可否要金枪鱼来代替火腿？

sentences.english: Instead of being annoyed, he seemed quite pleased.
sentences.chinese: 他没有生气，反而似乎很高兴。

detailed_translations.english: used to say what is not used, does not happen etc, when something else is used, happens etc

sentences.english: a political controversy
sentences.chinese: 政治争议

sentences.english: the controversy surrounding Skinner’s theories
sentences.chinese: 围绕斯金纳的理论的争议

sentences.english: (= began ) over the use of the chemicals on crops.
sentences.chinese: 对庄稼施用化学品的做法引起了争论。

detailed_translations.english: a serious argument about something that involves many people and continues for a long time

name: command
trans: 命令； 指挥， 统率

sentences.english: He commanded his men to retreat.
sentences.chinese: 他命令手下撤退。

sentences.english: He commands the 4th Battalion.
sentences.chinese: 他指挥第四营。

sentences.english: the power and finances commanded by the police
sentences.chinese: 警方掌握的权力和资金

detailed_translations.english: (of sb in a position of authority) to tell sb to do sth

name: compulsory
trans: 必须做的， 义务的； 强制性的； 必修的

sentences.english: the threat of compulsory redundancies
sentences.chinese: 强制性裁员的威胁

sentences.english: Car insurance is compulsory.
sentences.chinese: 汽车保险是强制性的。

detailed_translations.english: that must be done because of a law or a rule

sentences.english: an abortive military coup
sentences.chinese: 一场未遂的军事政变

detailed_translations.english: an abortive action is not successful

name: swarm
trans: 密集， 云集； 成群地飞行

sentences.english: Within minutes the area was swarming with officers who began searching a nearby wood.
sentences.chinese: 几分钟之内这个地方挤满了警官，他们开始搜查附近的一片树林。

detailed_translations.english: If a place is swarming with people, it is full of people moving about in a busy way
a large group of insects, especially  bee s  ,moving together

name: anticipate
trans: 预见， 预期； 先于…行动

sentences.english: Sales are better than anticipated.
sentences.chinese: 销量比预期要好。

sentences.english: A good speaker is able to anticipate an audience’s needs and concerns.
sentences.chinese: 好的演讲者能够预先考虑到听众需要什么、关注什么。

sentences.english: Daniel was eagerly anticipating her arrival.
sentences.chinese: 丹尼尔热切地期待着她的到来。

detailed_translations.english: to expect that something will happen and be ready for it

sentences.english: Expect variable cloudiness and fog tomorrow.
sentences.chinese: 预计明天多云有雾，天气多变。

sentences.english: Interest rates can be highly variable.
sentences.chinese: 利率有时会大幅波动。

detailed_translations.chinese: 变量的；可变的；易变的，多变的；变异的，[生物] 畸变的
detailed_translations.english: likely to change often

detailed_translations.chinese: [数] 变量；可变物，可变因素
detailed_translations.english: something that may be different in different situations, so that you cannot be sure what will happen

name: temple
trans: 寺庙， 教堂； 太阳穴

sentences.english: They lighted the temple with many candles.
sentences.chinese: 他们用许多蜡烛照亮这个寺庙。

sentences.english: The entire valley reverberated with the sound of the temple bells.
sentences.chinese: 整个山谷回荡着庙宇的钟声。

sentences.english: After the fire, nothing remained of the magnificent buildings of the temple.
sentences.chinese: 大火过后， 寺院里的那些雄伟建筑已荡然无存。

detailed_translations.english: a building where people go to  worship  , in the Jewish, Hindu, Buddhist, Sikh, and Mormon religions

name: slash
trans: 砍痕， 伤痕； 斜线号

sentences.english: Someone had slashed the tires.
sentences.chinese: 有人把轮胎割破了。

detailed_translations.english: to cut or try to cut something violently with a knife, sword etc

detailed_translations.chinese: 砍， 砍痕； 斜线号
detailed_translations.english: a line (/) used in writing to separate words, numbers, or letters

sentences.english: The police were accused of fabricating evidence.
sentences.chinese: 警方被控捏造证据。

sentences.english: The discs are expensive to fabricate.
sentences.chinese: 这些磁盘的生产成本很高。

detailed_translations.english: to invent a story, piece of information etc in order to deceive someone

sentences.english: India's evil caste systemremains entrenched in spite of government efforts to uproot it, a racist systemthat condemns darker skinned Indians to a life of penury and servitude.
sentences.chinese: 尽管政府努力根除印度罪恶的等级制度，但其仍然根深蒂固，这是一个种族歧视制度，使得深色皮肤的印度人生活贫苦，受奴役。

sentences.english: They do not keep a tally of visitors to the palace, but it is very popular.
sentences.chinese: 他们没有对来宫殿的游客作一个记录，不过这个地方非常受欢迎的。

detailed_translations.english: A tally is a record of amounts or numbers which you keep changing and adding to as the activity which affects it progresses
if numbers or statements tally, they match exactly

name: landscape
trans: 风景，景色；地貌，地形；风景画

sentences.english: the beauty of the New England landscape
sentences.chinese: 新英格兰风光之美

detailed_translations.english: an area of countryside or land of a particular type, used especially when talking about its appearance
to make a park, garden etc look attractive and interesting by changing its design, and by planting trees and bushes etc

sentences.english: It’s been cold, but today’s an exception.
sentences.chinese: 天气一直寒冷，但今天是个例外。

sentences.english: The law applies to all EU countries; Britain is no exception.
sentences.chinese: 这项法律适用于所有欧盟国家，英国也不例外。

sentences.english: We don’t usually accept checks, but for you we’ll make an exception (= not include you in this rule ).
sentences.chinese: 我们一般不接受支票，但对你我们就破个例。

sentences.english: The spelling of this word is an interesting exception to the rule.
sentences.chinese: 这个单词的拼法是该规则一个有趣的例外。

sentences.english: Successful two-career couples are still the exception, not the rule (= used to emphasize that something is unusual ).
sentences.chinese: 夫妇俩都事业有成的仍不常见。

detailed_translations.english: something or someone that is not included in a general statement or does not follow a rule or pattern

name: prevailing
trans: 普遍的； 流行的； 一地常刮的， 盛行的

sentences.english: The prevailing mood of public opinion remained hostile.
sentences.chinese: 公众仍普遍持敌对情绪。

sentences.english: the prevailing economic conditions in Northern Ireland
sentences.chinese: 北爱尔兰普遍的经济状况

detailed_translations.english: existing or accepted in a particular place or at a particular time

sentences.english: temporary pain relief
sentences.chinese: 疼痛的暂时缓解

sentences.english: I’m living with my parents, but it’s only temporary.
sentences.chinese: 我和父母住在一起，但这只是暂时的。

sentences.english: You might want to consider temporary work until you decide what you want to do.
sentences.chinese: 在你定下来想做什么之前，也许可以考虑干点临时性工作。

sentences.english: She was employed on a temporary basis .
sentences.chinese: 她是受雇干临时性工作的。

detailed_translations.english: continuing for only a limited period of time

sentences.english: watching monkeys in their natural habitat
sentences.chinese: 观察自然生活环境中的猴子

sentences.english: The grassland is an important habitat for many wild flowers.
sentences.chinese: 这片草原是很多野花的重要生长地。

detailed_translations.english: the natural home of a plant or animal

sentences.english: Why do we need optimal sleep?
sentences.chinese: 我们为什么需要最佳的睡眠？

sentences.english: However, if you want optimal shadow quality and performance, there are some additional things to consider.
sentences.chinese: 不过，如果你想要最佳的阴影质量和性能，有一些其他的事情要考虑。

sentences.english: Although the optimal user path is a straight line from search and results to customization and purchase, the interface offers several detours from this route.
sentences.chinese: 尽管最佳的用户路径是从搜索和结果到定制和购买的直线路径，但该界面却提供了一些迂回的路径。

detailed_translations.english: the best or most suitable

name: desperate
trans: 绝望的； 不顾死活的， 拼命的； 极度渴望的

sentences.english: I had no money left and was desperate.
sentences.chinese: 我身无分文，已经走投无路了。

sentences.english: Time was running out and we were getting desperate .
sentences.chinese: 时间越来越少，我们越来越感到绝望。

sentences.english: the missing teenager’s desperate parents
sentences.chinese: 失踪少年绝望的父母

detailed_translations.english: willing to do anything to change a very bad situation, and not caring about danger

name: awful
trans: 不舒服的； 糟糕的； 可怕的； 非常的

sentences.english: The weather was awful.
sentences.chinese: 天气很糟糕。

detailed_translations.english: very bad or unpleasant

sentences.english: The charity urged quick action.
sentences.chinese: 慈善机构敦促迅速采取行动。

sentences.english: I got a note from Moira urging me to get in touch.
sentences.chinese: 我收到莫伊拉的一封短信，一定要我保持联系。

detailed_translations.english: to strongly suggest that someone does something

name: handy
trans: 可用的； 易使用的， 便利的； 手巧的

sentences.english: It’s quite a handy little tool.
sentences.chinese: 这件小工具非常有用。

sentences.english: It’s very handy having a light above your desk.
sentences.chinese: 书桌上方有盏灯很有用。

sentences.english: Take your swimming trunks with you – they might come in handy (= be useful ).
sentences.chinese: 带上你的游泳裤，可能会派上用场的。

detailed_translations.english: useful

sentences.english: And we know of your anguish.
sentences.chinese: 我们了解你们的痛苦。

sentences.english: She suffered the anguish of despair.
sentences.chinese: 她忍受着绝望的痛苦。

sentences.english: And in their anguish, they both forgot the nearness of my bedroom.
sentences.chinese: 极度的痛苦让他们忘记我的卧室就在附近。

detailed_translations.english: mental or physical suffering caused by extreme pain or worry

sentences.english: If water had a negative index of refraction, then a straw placed in a glass would appear to bend back under itself.
sentences.chinese: 如果水具有负折射率，那么放在玻璃杯中的吸管似乎可能弯曲到自身下方。

sentences.english: With all that reflection and refraction, modernism creates the illusion that there is an illusion when in fact it is a straightforward statement of money and power.
sentences.chinese: 通过反射和折射，现代主义创造了一个幻觉存在的假象，而实际上它是对金钱和权力不加掩饰的声明。

sentences.english: Rapidly changing refraction due to turbulence along the line of sight affects different colors of light by different amounts and generally produces a twinkling effect for stars.
sentences.chinese: 由于湍流而快速变化的折射在视线中会影响到光的不同颜色，这种影响也各不相同，一般会给恒星产生一种闪烁的效果。

sentences.english: Artists translate their ideas into visual images.
sentences.chinese: 画家把自己的思想转换成视觉画面。

detailed_translations.english: relating to seeing

name: sanctuary
trans: 禁猎区， 动物保护区； 庇护所， 避难所； 圣所， 圣殿

sentences.english: His church became a sanctuary for thousands of people who fled the civil war.
sentences.chinese: 他的教堂成了数千逃避内战的人们的一个避难所。

detailed_translations.chinese: 避难所；至圣所；耶路撒冷的神殿
detailed_translations.english: a peaceful place that is safe and provides protection, especially for people who are in danger

sentences.english: Water aerobics can be performed just about anywhere; from health and fitness clubs to public or private swimming pools to even shallow lakes.
sentences.chinese: 水中有氧运动没有地方限制，从健康和健身俱乐部，到公共或私人泳池，甚至浅水湖泊，都可以进行；

sentences.english: They not only do it with great workout equipment and well-designed aerobics classes, but with answers to every detail of the working professional's personal needs.
sentences.chinese: 他们不仅有优质的健身器材，精心设计的有氧运动课程，而且对个人专业健身问题和需求也作出详尽的解答。

detailed_translations.chinese: 有氧运动法，增氧健身法
detailed_translations.english: a very active type of physical exercise done to music, usually in a class

name: inviting
trans: 动人的， 诱人的； 引人注目的

sentences.english: The log fire looked warm and inviting.
sentences.chinese: 篝火看上去温暖诱人。

detailed_translations.english: something that is inviting is very attractive and makes you want to be near it, try it, taste it etc

sentences.english: Eva went straight to the hotel, as instructed (= as she had been told ).
sentences.chinese: 伊娃按照指示径直去了宾馆。

sentences.english: Greater effort is needed to instruct children in road safety.
sentences.chinese: 在指导儿童注意道路安全方面需要更大的努力。

sentences.english: I was instructed that £20,000 had been paid into my account.
sentences.chinese: 我得到通知两万英镑已存入我的账户。

detailed_translations.english: to officially tell someone what to do

name: agreeable
trans: 使人愉快的； 欣然同意的

sentences.english: We spent a most agreeable couple of hours.
sentences.chinese: 我们非常愉快地度过了几个小时。

sentences.english: My parents are quite agreeable to my studying abroad.
sentences.chinese: 我父母很同意我去国外留学。

detailed_translations.english: pleasant

sentences.english: the son of a wealthy merchant
sentences.chinese: 一名富商的儿子

sentences.english: There's been a big reduction in the size of the merchant fleet in recent years.
sentences.chinese: 近年来商船队的数量大为缩减。

detailed_translations.english: someone who buys and sells goods in large quantities
Merchant seamen or ships are involved in carrying goods for trade

name: community
trans: 社会； 社团； 群落； 共同体

sentences.english: The new arts centre will serve the whole community.
sentences.chinese: 这座新的艺术中心将为整个社区服务。

sentences.english: the Polish community in London
sentences.chinese: 在伦敦的波兰侨民团体

detailed_translations.english: the people who live in the same area, town etc

sentences.english: {"COLLOINEXA":["minor ailments"]}
sentences.chinese: 小恙

detailed_translations.english: an illness that is not very serious

name: version
trans: 译文， 译本； 版本

sentences.english: Is the coffee break the adult version of recess?
sentences.chinese: 工间喝咖啡是成人的休息方式吗？

detailed_translations.english: a way of explaining or doing something that is typical of a particular group or period of time

name: charismatic
trans: 蒙受神恩的； 有超凡魅力的

sentences.english: Martin Luther King was a very charismatic speaker.
sentences.chinese: 马丁•路德•金是个很有感召力的演说家。

detailed_translations.chinese: 超凡魅力的；神赐能力的
detailed_translations.english: having charisma

name: overload
trans: 使超载， 使过载； 使超负荷； 给…增加负担

sentences.english: 57 percent complained of work overload.
sentences.chinese: 57%的人抱怨工作负担过重。

detailed_translations.english: too much of sth

name: bronze
trans: 青铜；青铜色；青铜制品；铜牌

sentences.english: a bell cast in bronze
sentences.chinese: 青铜浇铸的一口钟

detailed_translations.english: a hard metal that is a mixture of  copper  and  tin
made of bronze

sentences.english: a staunch conservative
sentences.chinese: 忠实的保守党党员

detailed_translations.english: giving strong loyal support to another person, organization, belief etc
to stop the flow of liquid, especially of blood from a wound

name: selection
trans: 选择， 挑选； 精选； 被挑选出来的人， 精选品； 可供选择的事物

sentences.english: The judges have made their final selection.
sentences.chinese: 评委已经作出最后的评选。

sentences.english: These drawings represent a selection from a larger exhibition.
sentences.chinese: 这些画作是从一个规模更大的展会上选出来的。

detailed_translations.english: the careful choice of a particular person or thing from a group of similar people or things

sentences.english: Some young people suddenly become self-conscious and tongue-tied in early adolescence.
sentences.chinese: 一些年青人在青春期早期突然变得害羞结舌。

detailed_translations.english: the time, usually between the ages of 12 and 18, when a young person is developing into an adult

sentences.english: Cut a notch near one end of the stick.
sentences.chinese: 在手杖的一端刻一个V形记号。

detailed_translations.english: a V-shaped cut or hole in a surface or edge

name: subculture
trans: 亚文化行为观念， 次文化

sentences.english: the drug subculture of the inner city
sentences.chinese: 旧城区的吸毒亚文化群

detailed_translations.english: a particular group of people within a society and their behaviour, beliefs, and activities – often used to show disapproval

sentences.english: Take a deep breath, then exhale slowly.
sentences.chinese: 深吸一口气，然后慢慢呼出。

detailed_translations.english: to breathe air, smoke etc out of your mouth

name: appropriate
trans: 拨款； 占用， 挪用

sentences.english: The timing of the announcement was particularly appropriate .
sentences.chinese: 通告发布的时机很合适。

sentences.english: Where appropriate , I delegate as much work as possible.
sentences.chinese: 只要合适，我就尽量把工作分派出去。

sentences.english: Mark box 1 or 2, as appropriate .
sentences.chinese: 把方框1和2中的合适者标出来。

sentences.english: I can assure you that appropriate action will be taken.
sentences.chinese: 我向你保证会采取适当的行动。

detailed_translations.english: correct or suitable for a particular time, situation, or purpose
to take something, especially money, to use for a particular purpose

name: least
trans: 最小； 最少； 微不足道
最小的；最少的；最不重要的

sentences.english: He's the best teacher, even though he has the least experience.
sentences.chinese: 他虽然经验最少，却是最出色的老师。

sentences.english: He’s my least favourite member of staff.
sentences.chinese: 他是最不讨我喜欢的员工。

detailed_translations.english: smallest in size, amount, degree, etc.
less than anything or anyone else

name: utility
trans: 功用， 效用； 公用事业

sentences.english: Does your rent include utilities?
sentences.chinese: 你的房租包括公用事业费吗？

detailed_translations.chinese: 公用事业〔如煤气、电力等〕
detailed_translations.english: a service such as gas or electricity provided for people to use

sentences.english: She was treated for cuts and abrasions.
sentences.chinese: 她因划伤和擦伤而接受治疗。

detailed_translations.english: an area on the surface of your skin that has been injured by being rubbed against something hard

name: symphony
trans: 交响乐， 交响曲； 和谐， 协调

sentences.english: Bruckner’s Fifth Symphony
sentences.chinese: 布鲁克纳的《第五交响曲》

detailed_translations.english: a long piece of music usually in four parts, written for an orchestra

sentences.english: an eloquent appeal for support
sentences.chinese: 极具说服力的求助呼吁

detailed_translations.english: able to express your ideas and opinions well, especially in a way that influences people

name: observatory
trans: 天文台， 天文观测站

sentences.english: An observatory on the back side of the Moon would be a giant leap for astronomy, but there is a for more important reason to return.
sentences.chinese: 即使仅仅在月球的背面设置一个天文台，也将为天文学带来革命性的突破，何况月球的价值远远不止这些。

sentences.english: With a full-power observatory in place, that explanation, as well as a better explanation of high-energy astrophysical phenomena throughout the universe, may be available in the years to come.
sentences.chinese: 一个满负荷运作的观测站的到位，对那些热点的解释，以及对遍及宇宙的高能天文学现象的更好的解释，将会在今年内成为可能。

sentences.english: Andrew took a more optimistic view.
sentences.chinese: 安德鲁抱有更为乐观的想法。

detailed_translations.english: believing that good things will happen in the future

sentences.english: Halsey was identified as a leading proponent of the values of progressive education.
sentences.chinese: 哈尔西被认为是进步教育价值观的首要支持者。

detailed_translations.chinese: 支持者；建议者；提出认证遗嘱者
detailed_translations.english: someone who supports something or persuades people to do something

name: insolvent
trans: 财力不足的， 破产的

sentences.english: The company was later declared insolvent (= officially said to be insolvent ).
sentences.chinese: 公司随后被宣布破产。

detailed_translations.english: not having enough money to pay what you owe

sentences.english: submarine plant life
sentences.chinese: 海生植物

detailed_translations.english: growing or used under the sea
a ship, especially a military one, that can stay under water

sentences.english: Action and experimentation are the cornerstones of empiricism.
sentences.chinese: 行动和尝试是经验主义的基石。

sentences.english: Another kind of empiricism has to do with where we get our knowledge.
sentences.chinese: 另一种经验主义与我们从哪里获取知识有关。

sentences.english: OK, so that's one kind of empiricism.
sentences.chinese: 好，这是一种经验主义。

detailed_translations.english: the belief in basing your ideas on practical experience

name: sleek
trans: 光滑而有光泽的；线条流畅的；时髦的

sentences.english: the sleek lines of the new Mercedes
sentences.chinese: 这款新梅赛德斯汽车的优美外形

detailed_translations.english: sleek hair or fur is straight, shiny, and healthy-looking
to make hair or fur smooth and shiny by putting water or oil on it

name: particle
trans: 微粒， 颗粒； 【语】小品词

sentences.english: dust particles
sentences.chinese: 尘埃

sentences.english: the sub-atomic particles that make up matter
sentences.chinese: 构成物质的次原子微粒

detailed_translations.english: a very small piece of something

sentences.english: a talented young musician
sentences.chinese: 有天赋的年轻音乐家

detailed_translations.english: a person who plays a musical instrument or writes music, especially as a job

name: typify
trans: 是…的典范； 成为…的特征

sentences.english: the features which typify a Scottish Highland landscape
sentences.chinese: 苏格兰高地典型的地貌特征

sentences.english: non-violent protest, typified by Gandhi
sentences.chinese: 以甘地为典型代表的非暴力抗议

detailed_translations.chinese: 代表；作为…的典型；具有…的特点
detailed_translations.english: to be a typical example of something

name: stagnant
trans: 不景气的； 停滞的； 迟钝的； 因不流动而污浊的

sentences.english: a stagnant pond
sentences.chinese: 死水塘

detailed_translations.chinese: 停滞的；不景气的；污浊的；迟钝的
detailed_translations.english: stagnant water or air does not move or flow and often smells bad

name: perceptive
trans: 感知的， 知觉的； 有洞察力的， 理解力强的

sentences.english: He was one of the most perceptive U.S. political commentators.
sentences.chinese: 他曾是美国最具洞察力的政治评论员之一。

detailed_translations.chinese: 感知的，知觉的；有知觉力的
detailed_translations.english: If you describe a person or their remarks or thoughts as perceptive, you think that they are good at noticing or realizing things, especially things that are not obvious

sentences.english: She retained a number of copies for further annotation.
sentences.chinese: 她为进一步解释保留了好多复印件。

detailed_translations.english: Annotation is the activity of annotating something

name: minimize
trans: 将…减到最少， 使最小化； 降低， 贬低

sentences.english: Every effort is being made to minimize civilian casualties.
sentences.chinese: 正在尽最大努力减少平民伤亡。

sentences.english: The rail company is bringing in more trains in an effort to minimize disruption to travellers.
sentences.chinese: 铁路公司正投入更多的列车来减少旅客的不便。

detailed_translations.english: to reduce something that is difficult, dangerous, or unpleasant to the smallest possible amount or degree

name: sweep
trans: 打扫；席卷，横扫；挥动，舞动；迅速传播；

sentences.english: Bert swept the path in front of the house.
sentences.chinese: 伯特清扫了屋前的小路。

sentences.english: Thunderstorms swept the country.
sentences.chinese: 雷暴横扫全国。

detailed_translations.english: to clean the dust, dirt etc from the floor or ground, using a brush with a long handle

name: descend
trans: 遗传； 下降； 起源； 降临， 来临

sentences.english: Our plane started to descend.
sentences.chinese: 我们的飞机开始下降。

sentences.english: I heard his footsteps descending the stairs.
sentences.chinese: 我听到他下楼的脚步声。

detailed_translations.english: to move from a higher level to a lower one
to move from a higher level to a lower one

name: mechanics
trans: 机械学， 力学； 技巧， 方法

sentences.english: He has not studied mechanics or engineering.
sentences.chinese: 他没有学习过力学或者工程学。

detailed_translations.english: the part of physics that deals with the natural forces that act on moving or stationary objects

sentences.english: They then found the same virus lurking in the genome of the three-toed sloth .
sentences.chinese: 然后他们发现同样的病毒也潜伏在三趾树懒基因组里。

sentences.english: Women should go for close-toed heels, and if they wear a dress suit, the skirt should fall at or below the knee.
sentences.chinese: 女士则应穿不露脚趾的高跟鞋，如穿着裙装套装，那么裙子要及膝或到膝盖以下。

detailed_translations.english: having a part resembling a toe

sentences.english: The engine for maglev trains is rather in noticeable.
sentences.chinese: 磁悬浮列车的车头是相当值得注意的。

sentences.english: A good example of how transportation is changing is the new maglev train, which is environmentally friendly, energy-saving and travels at an amazing 430 km/h.
sentences.chinese: 新型的磁悬浮列车就是交通运输变化的一个很好的例子。它既环保，又节约能源，还能以430公里的惊人时速行驶。

detailed_translations.english: a type of high-speed train that runs on magnets supported by a magnetic field generated around the track

name: logical
trans: 逻辑的； 符合逻辑的， 合理的； 有逻辑头脑的

sentences.english: It’s a logical site for a new supermarket, with the housing development nearby.
sentences.chinese: 附近有住宅区，新的超级市场选址在此是合情合理的。

sentences.english: a logical conclusion
sentences.chinese: 合理的结论

detailed_translations.chinese: 逻辑的， 合乎常理的
detailed_translations.english: seeming reasonable and sensible

name: characterize
trans: 以…为特征； 刻画； 描述

sentences.english: Bright colours characterize his paintings.
sentences.chinese: 明亮的色彩是他绘画作品的特点。

detailed_translations.chinese: 描绘…的特性；具有…的特征
detailed_translations.english: to describe the qualities of someone or something in a particular way

name: descent
trans: 血统， 世系； 下降

sentences.english: Passengers must fasten their seat belts prior to descent.
sentences.chinese: 乘客在飞机降落之前必须系好安全带。

sentences.english: young men and women of Asian descent
sentences.chinese: 亚裔男女青年

sentences.english: There is a gradual descent to the sea.
sentences.chinese: 有一片斜坡缓缓伸延到海边。

detailed_translations.english: the process of going down

name: stunt
trans: 特技表演； 噱头； 愚蠢行为

sentences.english: Todd flew over the city in a hot-air balloon as a publicity stunt .
sentences.chinese: 作为一种宣传噱头，托德乘坐热气球飞越城市上空。

detailed_translations.english: something that is done to attract people’s attention, especially in advertising or politics

detailed_translations.chinese: 阻碍…的正常生长或发展
detailed_translations.english: to stop something or someone from growing to their full size or developing properly

sentences.english: A really weird thing happened last night.
sentences.chinese: 昨晚发生了一件非常奇怪的事。

sentences.english: He’s a weird bloke.
sentences.chinese: 他是个古怪的家伙。

sentences.english: They sell all sorts of weird and wonderful (= very strange ) products.
sentences.chinese: 他们出售各种稀奇古怪的产品。

detailed_translations.chinese: 古怪的， 离奇的； 怪诞的， 神秘而可怕的
detailed_translations.english: very strange and unusual, and difficult to understand or explain

name: farce
trans: 笑剧， 滑稽剧； 闹剧

sentences.english: She admitted that the interview had been a complete farce from start to finish.
sentences.chinese: 她承认，采访从头到尾完全是一场闹剧。

detailed_translations.english: an event or a situation that is very badly organized or does not happen properly, in a way that is silly and unreasonable

sentences.english: That’s a ridiculous idea!
sentences.chinese: 那主意很荒唐！

sentences.english: Don’t be ridiculous!
sentences.chinese: 别傻了！

sentences.english: I’d look ridiculous in a dress like that.
sentences.chinese: 我穿那样的裙子会显得很可笑。

detailed_translations.english: very silly or unreasonable

name: intrusion
trans: 侵扰， 干扰； 侵犯； 侵入， 闯入

sentences.english: the unwelcome intrusion of the press
sentences.chinese: 不受欢迎的新闻界的侵扰

detailed_translations.english: when someone does something, or something happens, that affects your private life or activities in an unwanted way

sentences.english: It was the kind of rumour that it is impossible to refute.
sentences.chinese: 这是那种不可能推翻的谣言。

detailed_translations.english: to prove that a statement or idea is not correct

name: severe
trans: 严重的； 严厉的； 剧烈的； 严峻的， 艰巨的； 朴素的， 不加装饰的

sentences.english: His injuries were quite severe.
sentences.chinese: 他的伤势很严重。

sentences.english: She’s suffering from severe depression.
sentences.chinese: 她患有严重的抑郁症。

sentences.english: The US faces severe economic problems.
sentences.chinese: 美国面临严重的经济问题。

sentences.english: The storm caused severe damage.
sentences.chinese: 这场暴风雨造成了严重的破坏。

detailed_translations.chinese: 严重的； 严厉的， 严格的； 严峻的， 艰难的； 朴素的， 不加装饰的
detailed_translations.english: severe problems, injuries, illnesses etc are very bad or very serious

name: exemplify
trans: 是…的典型； 例示， 举例证明

sentences.english: Problems are exemplified in the report.
sentences.chinese: 问题都在报告中作了举例说明。

detailed_translations.english: to give an example of something

name: emerge
trans: 显露， 暴露； 出来， 现出

sentences.english: The flowers emerge in the spring.
sentences.chinese: 花儿在春天开放。

sentences.english: After the elections opposition groups began to emerge.
sentences.chinese: 经过选举，反对派开始露头。

detailed_translations.english: to appear or come out from somewhere

sentences.english: The landlord refused to renew his lease.
sentences.chinese: 房东拒绝和他续签租约。

sentences.english: The 99-year lease expired in 1999.
sentences.chinese: 99年期的租约于1999年到期。

sentences.english: Do you understand all the terms of the lease?
sentences.chinese: 租约条款你都理解吗？

detailed_translations.english: a legal agreement which allows you to use a building, car etc for a period of time, in return for rent

detailed_translations.chinese: 出租； 租得， 租有
detailed_translations.english: to use a building, car etc under a lease

name: exploit
trans: 开发； 利用； 剥削
英勇行为， 业绩， 功绩

sentences.english: the urgent need to exploit the resources of the Irish Sea
sentences.chinese: 开发爱尔兰海资源的迫切需要

detailed_translations.english: to develop and use minerals, forests, oil etc for business or industry

sentences.english: He’s a bright kid and eager to learn.
sentences.chinese: 他是个聪明的孩子，热爱学习。

sentences.english: She’s a very hard worker and very eager to please.
sentences.chinese: 她工作很卖力，而且很希望别人满意。

sentences.english: A crowd of eager young students were already waiting outside.
sentences.chinese: 一群急不可待的青年学生已经在外面等着。

detailed_translations.english: very keen and excited about something that is going to happen or about something you want to do

name: evidence
trans: 证据； 迹象； 根据

sentences.english: We found further scientific evidence for this theory.
sentences.chinese: 我们找到了进一步证实这种理论的科学根据。

sentences.english: I was asked to give evidence (= to say what I knew, describe what I had seen, etc.)
sentences.chinese: 我被要求出庭作证。

detailed_translations.english: facts or signs that show clearly that something exists or is true

sentences.english: the former Federal Republic of Germany
sentences.chinese: 前德意志联邦共和国

sentences.english: Nine republics took part in the referendum.
sentences.chinese: 有九个共和国参加了全民公决。

detailed_translations.english: a country governed by elected representatives of the people, and led by a president, not a king or queen

sentences.english: Everybody rushing about on some incomprehensible errand someone forced him to do at pain of death.
sentences.chinese: 大家都忍受着死亡的痛苦被迫地抢着做一些令人难以理解的差事。

sentences.english: They can view a list of errands that match their interest profile, and, by entering a price, can bid to perform the errand.
sentences.chinese: 他们可以查看与他们的兴趣简档匹配的差事列表，并且，通过输入价格，可以为执行差事投标。

sentences.english: Get them a drink or a coffee, do a chore for them, offer to do an errand, anything they’d appreciate, really.
sentences.chinese: 为人递上一杯饮料或咖啡，做一些零星杂务，为别人提供一份差使等等使人感激的事情。 真的。

name: flamboyant
trans: 艳丽的， 绚丽夺目的； 炫耀的

sentences.english: He lifted his arms in a flamboyant gesture .
sentences.chinese: 他抬起胳膊，做了个炫耀的手势。

detailed_translations.chinese: 艳丽的；火焰似的；炫耀的
detailed_translations.english: behaving in a confident or exciting way that makes people notice you

name: lethal
trans: 致命的； 破坏性极大的， 极其有害的

sentences.english: a lethal dose of heroin
sentences.chinese: 致命剂量的海洛因

sentences.english: a lethal weapon
sentences.chinese: 致命的武器

sentences.english: death by lethal injection
sentences.chinese: 注入致命剂量造成的死亡

sentences.english: a lethal cocktail of drink and pills
sentences.chinese: 一种酒和药的致命混合物

detailed_translations.english: causing death, or able to cause death

name: stun
trans: 使昏迷； 使震惊； 使…目瞪口呆， 给以深刻印象

sentences.english: Redfern stunned the crowd with a last-minute goal.
sentences.chinese: 雷德芬在最后一分钟进球，使观众很是震惊。

detailed_translations.chinese: 使震惊， 使目瞪口呆； 把…打昏， 使昏迷
detailed_translations.english: to surprise or upset someone so much that they do not react immediately

name: repetition
trans: 重复， 反复； 重复的事

sentences.english: Children used to learn by repetition.
sentences.chinese: 过去小孩子是通过背诵来学习的。

detailed_translations.english: doing or saying the same thing many times

sentences.english: She tumbled over a sled.
sentences.chinese: 她被雪橇绊了一跤。

sentences.english: When his sled broke down, he repaired it.
sentences.chinese: 当他的雪橇坏掉时，他自己维修。

sentences.english: The hut stands at the foot of a near vertical wall of rock in an icy fjord in the high Arctic, a week away by dog sled from the nearest human settlement.
sentences.chinese: 小屋坐落在高纬度北极地区峡湾边一座几乎是垂直的山岩下，从最近的有人居住的地方到此地，狗拉的雪橇要走一个星期。

detailed_translations.english: A sled is the same as a

name: polygamous
trans: 一夫多妻的， 一妻多夫的

sentences.english: Less than 1 percent of the men in any Muslim country are polygamous.
sentences.chinese: 任何一个穆斯林国家都有不到1%的男子是有多位妻子的。

detailed_translations.chinese: 一夫多妻的， 一妻多夫的
detailed_translations.english: In a polygamous society, people can be legally married to more than one person at the same time. A polygamous person, especially a man, is married to more than one person.

name: suspense
trans: 担心， 焦虑； 悬念， 不确定

sentences.english: Come on then, tell me what happened; the suspense is killing me (= I feel very excited or anxious because I do not know what will happen next ) .
sentences.chinese: 快来，告诉我发生了什么事。急死我了。

sentences.english: She couldn’t bear the suspense a moment longer.
sentences.chinese: 这样提心吊胆，她再也受不了了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 悬念；悬疑；焦虑；悬而不决
detailed_translations.english: a feeling of excitement or anxiety when you do not know what will happen next

sentences.english: Blue turquoise is valued as a gemstone.
sentences.chinese: 蓝色的绿松石被视为宝石。

sentences.english: Ruby, the common name for the mineral corundum in its red form, is a precious gemstone.
sentences.chinese: 红宝石是对红色矿物刚玉的俗称，它是一种珍贵的宝石。

sentences.english: In particular, we carefully selected for you 12 beautiful gemstone pendants in the hope it can help you resist following illness.
sentences.chinese: 我们特别为您精心挑选了12种漂亮的宝石垂饰，希望它能助您抵抗以下病痛。

detailed_translations.english: A gemstone is a jewel or stone used in jewellery

sentences.english: The main character narrates the story.
sentences.chinese: 主人公讲述故事。

detailed_translations.english: to tell a story by describing all the events in order, for example in a book

name: spring
trans: 跳跃；涌现，突然出现；突然提出
泉； 弹簧， 发条； 春天； 跳， 跃

sentences.english: He sprang to his feet (= stood up suddenly ) and rushed after her.
sentences.chinese: 他腾地站起身，冲过去追她。

sentences.english: There are several hot springs in the area.
sentences.chinese: 这地区有几处温泉。

sentences.english: With a spring, the cat leapt on to the table.
sentences.chinese: 猫一跃跳上桌子。

detailed_translations.english: to move suddenly and quickly in a particular direction, especially by jumping
a place where water comes up naturally from the ground

name: autonomy
trans: 自治， 自治权； 自主， 自主权

sentences.english: campaigners who want greater autonomy for Corsica
sentences.chinese: 希望科西嘉有更多自治权的活动家

detailed_translations.english: freedom that a place or an organization has to govern or control itself

sentences.english: It's impolite to gibe at a foreign student's English.
sentences.chinese: 嘲笑外国学生的英语是不礼貌的。

sentences.english: It's unkind to gibe at a foreign student's english even though it may sound amusing.
sentences.chinese: 嘲笑一个外国学生的英语是不应该的，就算他的英语令人捧腹。

sentences.english: "Please don't gibe me, " Lydia said. "I feel as repulsive and small as one of those deadly germs often portrayed in the horror movie genre. "
sentences.chinese: “请不要嘲笑我，”利迪娅说。“我觉得自己令人讨厌，渺小，像恐怖类电影描述的那些致命的细菌那样。”

name: fitness
trans: 健康， 健壮； 适合

sentences.english: He questioned McNeil’s fitness for high office.
sentences.chinese: 他质疑麦克尼尔是否适合身居高位。

sentences.english: Running marathons requires a high level of physical fitness.
sentences.chinese: 跑马拉松需要身体十分强健。

detailed_translations.english: the degree to which someone or something is suitable or good enough for a particular situation or purpose

sentences.english: Cut the cabbage into fine long shreds.
sentences.chinese: 把这棵卷心菜切成细长条。

detailed_translations.english: a small thin piece that is torn or cut roughly from something
to cut or tear something into small thin pieces

name: kindle
trans: 点燃， 开始燃烧； 激起

sentences.english: We watched as the fire slowly kindled.
sentences.chinese: 我们看着火慢慢地燃烧起来。

detailed_translations.english: to start burning; to make a fire start burning

name: surrender
trans: 投降； 屈服， 屈从； 放弃

sentences.english: Germany surrendered on May 7th, 1945.
sentences.chinese: 德国于 1945 年 5 月 7 日投降。

sentences.english: The terrorists were given ten minutes to surrender.
sentences.chinese: 恐怖分子被限定在十分钟之内投降。

detailed_translations.english: to say officially that you want to stop fighting, because you realize that you cannot win
to give up something or someone, especially because you are forced to
when you say officially that you want to stop fighting because you realize that you cannot win

name: faint
trans: 模糊的，不清楚的；无力的，虚弱的；眩晕的

sentences.english: She gave a faint smile.
sentences.chinese: 她淡淡一笑。

sentences.english: a very faint noise
sentences.chinese: 很微弱的声响

sentences.english: the faint light of dawn
sentences.chinese: 微弱的晨光

detailed_translations.chinese: 模糊的；头晕的；虚弱的；[医] 衰弱的
detailed_translations.english: difficult to see, hear, smell etc

detailed_translations.chinese: 昏倒；变得微弱；变得没气力
detailed_translations.english: to suddenly become unconscious for a short time
an act of becoming unconscious

sentences.english: It was a good table too, sturdily constructed of elm.
sentences.chinese: 这也是一张好桌子，榆木做的，很结实。

detailed_translations.english: a type of large tree with broad leaves, or the wood from this tree

name: shade
trans: 阴凉处，遮光物；阴暗；色度；差别

sentences.english: a delicate/pale/rich/soft shade of red
sentences.chinese: 淡 / 浅 / 艳 / 柔和的红色

detailed_translations.english: a particular type of red, green, blue etc

name: collide
trans: 碰撞， 互撞； 冲突， 抵触

sentences.english: A car and a van collided on the motorway.
sentences.chinese: 一辆汽车和一辆小型货车在高速公路上相撞了。

sentences.english: Two trains collided head-on (= when they were moving directly towards each other ) .
sentences.chinese: 两辆火车迎头相撞。

detailed_translations.english: to hit something or someone that is moving in a different direction from you

sentences.english: Having clean hands is one of the cardinal rules when preparing food.
sentences.chinese: 双手洁净是准备食物时的一项最基本要求。

sentences.english: an issue of cardinal importance
sentences.chinese: 至关重要的问题

detailed_translations.chinese: 红衣主教；枢机主教；鲜红色；【鸟类】(北美)主红雀
detailed_translations.english: a priest of high rank in the Roman Catholic Church

detailed_translations.chinese: 主要的，基本的；深红色的
detailed_translations.english: very important or basic

name: insist
trans: 坚持要求； 坚决主张

sentences.english: Stay for supper – I insist!
sentences.chinese: 留下来吃晚餐——一定的！

detailed_translations.english: to demand that something should happen

sentences.english: Holly, like ivy and mistletoe, is an evergreen.
sentences.chinese: 冬青与常春藤和槲寄生一样，也是一种常绿植物。

detailed_translations.english: a tree or bush that does not lose its leaves in winter
an evergreen tree or bush does not lose its leaves in winter

name: staggered
trans: 交错的， 错开的； 震惊的

sentences.english: I was absolutely staggered when I saw the bill.
sentences.chinese: 看到账单时，我大吃一惊。

detailed_translations.chinese: 交错的， 错开的； 震惊的

name: volume
trans: 体积， 容积， 容量； 音量； 卷， 册； 书

sentences.english: Can you turn the volume up?
sentences.chinese: 请你把音量调大好吗？

sentences.english: The volume of the container measures 10,000 cubic metres.
sentences.chinese: 这个容器的容量是1万立方米。

sentences.english: The period from 1940 – 1945 is in volume 9.
sentences.chinese: 1940年至1945年这段时间在第9卷。

detailed_translations.english: the amount of sound produced by a television, radio etc

name: transact
trans: 交易； 执行， 处理

sentences.english: Most deals are transacted over the phone.
sentences.chinese: 大多数生意都是在电话里成交的。

detailed_translations.english: to do business with someone

name: catalyst
trans: 催化剂， 触媒； 促使变化的人

sentences.english: I very much hope that this case will prove to be a catalyst for change.
sentences.chinese: 我非常希望这件事终将成为促成变化的催化剂。

detailed_translations.english: a substance that makes a chemical reaction happen more quickly without being changed itself

sentences.english: This chapter gives you some guidelines to help you in your work.
sentences.chinese: 本章将介绍一些指导性原则，为你的工作提供帮助。

detailed_translations.english: rules or instructions about the best way to do something

name: loose
trans: 松散的， 宽松的； 不精确的， 不严密的； 不牢固的； 自由的， 散漫的

sentences.english: a loose floorboard
sentences.chinese: 松动的地板

sentences.english: This tooth feels very loose.
sentences.chinese: 这颗牙感觉松动得厉害。

sentences.english: The screw has come loose (= become loose ) .
sentences.chinese: 螺丝松了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 宽松的；散漫的；不牢固的；不精确的
detailed_translations.english: not firmly fastened in place
to make something unpleasant begin

name: loathsome
trans: 令人厌恶的， 讨厌的

sentences.english: that loathsome little man
sentences.chinese: 那个讨厌的小男人

detailed_translations.english: very unpleasant or cruel

sentences.english: ...a flint arrowhead.
sentences.chinese: ...一个燧石箭头。

detailed_translations.english: a type of smooth hard stone that makes a small flame when you hit it with steel

sentences.english: Bombastic boasts—"We are positioned to become the preeminent provider of XYZ"—do not constitute a position.
sentences.chinese: 言过其实的自夸——“我们定位于成为XYZ的卓越供应商”——并不能构建其地位。

sentences.english: And there is every reason to think America will once again regain its preeminent role as an American powerhouse.
sentences.chinese: 我们也完全有理由相信，美国将再次赢得美利坚强国的卓越地位。

sentences.english: Sweden cars are extremely prestigious and reliable in the world for its preeminent safety performance, including SAAB.
sentences.chinese: 瑞典制造的轿车在世界上最为有口皆碑的是其超群的安全性能，萨博也不例外。

sentences.english: an indignant reply
sentences.chinese: 愤慨的回复

detailed_translations.chinese: 愤怒的， 愤慨的， 义愤的
detailed_translations.english: angry and surprised because you feel insulted or unfairly treated

sentences.english: changing to a decimal system
sentences.chinese: 改为十进制

sentences.english: calculations accurate to three decimal places
sentences.chinese: 精确到小数点后三位的计算

detailed_translations.english: a decimal system is based on the number 10
a  fraction (= a number less than 1 )  that is shown as a  full stop  followed by the number of  tenth s  ,  hundredth s  etc. The numbers 0.5, 0.175, and 0.661 are decimals.

name: hardly
trans: 几乎不， 简直不； 刚刚， 仅仅

sentences.english: My parents divorced when I was six, and I hardly knew my father.
sentences.chinese: 我六岁时父母离婚，我对父亲几乎一无所知。

sentences.english: The children were so excited they could hardly speak.
sentences.chinese: 孩子们兴奋得几乎连话都说不出来了。

sentences.english: I can hardly believe it.
sentences.chinese: 这简直让我难以置信。

sentences.english: (= almost no one ) writes to me these days.
sentences.chinese: 如今几乎没有人给我写信了。

sentences.english: Dad ate hardly anything (= almost nothing ).
sentences.chinese: 爸爸几乎没吃什么东西。

sentences.english: There was hardly any (= very little ) traffic.
sentences.chinese: 路上车少人稀。

sentences.english: She lives in Spain, so we hardly ever (= almost never ) see her.
sentences.chinese: 她住在西班牙，所以我们几乎见不到她。

detailed_translations.english: almost not

sentences.english: The reforms will bring lasting benefits.
sentences.chinese: 改革将带来长久的利益。

sentences.english: Their generosity made a lasting impression on me.
sentences.chinese: 他们的慷慨给我留下了难忘的印象。

sentences.english: a solution that would bring lasting peace
sentences.chinese: 将带来持久和平的解决方案

detailed_translations.english: strong enough, well enough planned etc to continue for a very long time

name: cynical
trans: 愤世嫉俗的， 冷嘲热讽的

sentences.english: a cynical view of human nature
sentences.chinese: 认为人性本恶的一种观点

detailed_translations.chinese: 愤世嫉俗的， 怀疑的
detailed_translations.english: unwilling to believe that people have good, honest, or sincere reasons for doing something

name: technical
trans: 技术的， 工艺的； 专业的

sentences.english: Our staff will be available to give you technical support .
sentences.chinese: 有我们的员工向你提供技术支持。

sentences.english: I have no technical knowledge at all.
sentences.chinese: 我一点技术知识都没有。

sentences.english: technical training
sentences.chinese: 技术培训

detailed_translations.english: connected with knowledge of how machines work

name: outermost
trans: 最外面的， 离中心最远的

sentences.english: the outermost stars
sentences.chinese: 最远的恒星

detailed_translations.chinese: 最外方的,离中心最远的
detailed_translations.english: furthest from the middle

sentences.english: For ten years he had been her constant companion .
sentences.chinese: 十年来他一直陪伴她左右。

sentences.english: His dog became his closest companion .
sentences.chinese: 他的狗成了他最亲密的伙伴。

sentences.english: a travelling companion
sentences.chinese: 旅伴

detailed_translations.english: someone you spend a lot of time with, especially a friend

name: culminate
trans: 达到顶点； 告终； 【天】到中天

sentences.english: All aspects of the printers system performance culminate at this point.
sentences.chinese: 在这一点上的所有方面的印表机系统的性能达到高潮。

sentences.english: We are approaching a Galactic wave right now and it will culminate in the Event.
sentences.chinese: 我们现在即将迎接一道银河能量波，而事件会在这道能量波达到高潮时发生。

name: tortuous
trans: 折磨人的， 令人痛苦的； 曲折的， 蜿蜒的； 含混不清的， 拐弯抹角的

sentences.english: a tortuous path over the mountains to Kandahar
sentences.chinese: 翻山越岭通往坎大哈的一条蜿蜒小径

detailed_translations.english: a tortuous path, stream, road etc has a lot of bends in it and is therefore difficult to travel along

sentences.english: Even the film's impressive finale can't hide the first hour's paucity of imagination.
sentences.chinese: 这部电影在开头一个小时中毫无想象力，即使有个让人印象深刻的结局也无法掩盖这个缺憾。

detailed_translations.english: less than is needed of something

sentences.english: Carl sat up in bed, yawned, and stretched.
sentences.chinese: 卡尔从床上坐起来，打了个呵欠，伸了伸懒 腰。

sentences.english: Always stretch before exercising.
sentences.chinese: 锻炼之前都要做伸展运动。

detailed_translations.english: to straighten your arms, legs, or body to full length
to reach a long way for something

detailed_translations.chinese: 一段时间； 一段距离；延伸， 连绵； 连绵的一片
detailed_translations.english: a continuous period of time

sentences.english: She tried to blow a grey strand of hair from her eyes.
sentences.chinese: 她试图吹开眼前的一缕白发。

sentences.english: The climbers had been stranded by a storm.
sentences.chinese: 这些登山者被暴风雨困住了。

detailed_translations.english: a single thin piece of thread, wire, hair etc
If you are stranded, you are prevented from leaving a place, for example because of bad weather

name: accomplish
trans: 达到； 完成； 实现

sentences.english: We have accomplished all we set out to do.
sentences.chinese: 所有计划要做的事情，我们都已完成。

sentences.english: Mission accomplished(=  we have done what we intended to do  ) .
sentences.chinese: 大功告成。

detailed_translations.english: to succeed in doing something, especially after trying very hard

name: constituent
trans: 有宪法制定或修改权的； 组成的， 构成的

sentences.english: the EU and its constituent members
sentences.chinese: 欧盟及其成员国

sentences.english: He told his constituents that he would continue to represent them to the best of his ability.
sentences.chinese: 他告诉他的选民们他会继续竭尽所能代表他们。

detailed_translations.english: being one of the parts of something
someone who votes in a particular area

sentences.english: Or you can choose to accelerate your growth and intentionally devour life and all it offers .
sentences.chinese: 或者你可以选择加速你的成长，有意地吞噬生活及生活所赐予你的一切。

sentences.english: But in the past, we almost never intentionally or successfully utilized such wealth of information in creating, and reusing our knowledge and developed capability.
sentences.chinese: 但是在过去，我们几乎从未有意或成功地利用这些丰富的信息创建、重用我们的知识和拓展我们的能力。

sentences.english: Before it was fired, it was perfectly round, but the artist intentionally roughed up the edges.
sentences.chinese: 在它被烧制出来前，它相当的圆润。 但艺术家有意地把它的边缘弄粗糙。

name: irritate
trans: 激怒， 使烦躁； 刺激

sentences.english: It really irritates me when he doesn’t help around the house.
sentences.chinese: 家里的事情他一点都不帮忙，真让我恼火。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone feel annoyed or impatient, especially by doing something many times or for a long period of time

sentences.english: The earthquake wreaked havoc on the city.
sentences.chinese: 地震对这座城市造成了大破坏。

sentences.english: He points out that some past offenders in Michigan have been released only to cause havoc and end up in jail again.
sentences.chinese: 他指出，过去密歇根释放的一些犯人只是与造成严重破坏的人有关，而且最后又都重新回到监狱里。

sentences.english: The earthquake wreaked havoc on the city.
sentences.chinese: 地震对这个城市造成了大破坏。

name: responsible
trans: 有责任感的， 负责的； 需负责任的； 责任重大的， 重要的

sentences.english: We are determined to bring the people responsible to justice.
sentences.chinese: 我们决意要将肇事者绳之以法。

detailed_translations.english: if someone is responsible for an accident, mistake, crime etc, it is their fault or they can be blamed

sentences.english: We met a band of vagrant beggars there .
sentences.chinese: 我们在那里遇到了一伙流浪的乞丐。

sentences.english: Alternate status: life as a homeless vagrant really isn?t so bad after all. Why did I go to college again?
sentences.chinese: 我现在觉得，做一个无家可归的流浪者没有什么不好啊。 为什么我还要回学校继承上学呢？

sentences.english: Port City North Carolina: During a routine camp out| a local vagrant discovers plans for an invasion in America.
sentences.chinese: 港口城市北卡罗来纳州：在例行营地| 一个当地的流浪者发现了在美国入侵的计划。

detailed_translations.english: someone who has no home or work, especially someone who begs

sentences.english: She won a gold medal at the last Olympics.
sentences.chinese: 她在上届奥运会上赢得一枚金牌。

sentences.english: The two boys were awarded medals for their bravery.
sentences.chinese: 这两个男孩因勇敢而获得勋章。

detailed_translations.english: a flat piece of metal, usually shaped like a coin, that is given to someone who has won a competition or who has done something brave

sentences.english: a linen jacket
sentences.chinese: 亚麻布夹克

detailed_translations.chinese: 亚麻布，亚麻线；亚麻制品
detailed_translations.english: cloth made from the flax plant, used to make high quality clothes, home decorations etc

sentences.english: the launch of a communications and weather satellite
sentences.chinese: 气象通信卫星的发射

detailed_translations.english: a machine that has been sent into space and goes around the Earth, moon etc, used for radio, television, and other electronic communication

sentences.english: a packed courtroom
sentences.chinese: 挤满人的法庭

detailed_translations.english: extremely full of people

name: illuminate
trans: 照亮； 启发， 启迪； 阐明， 说明

sentences.english: A single candle illuminated his face.
sentences.chinese: 一支蜡烛照亮了他的脸。

sentences.english: The report illuminated the difficult issues at the heart of science policy.
sentences.chinese: 报告阐明了科学方针核心部分的难点。

detailed_translations.english: to make a light shine on something, or to fill a place with light

sentences.english: Neither the lizard nor the glass has any secrets.
sentences.chinese: 无论是蜥蜴还是玻璃，都没有任何秘密。

sentences.english: A lizard will regenerate its tail if it's cut off.
sentences.chinese: 蜥蜴的尾巴如被切掉，它会重新生出一条尾巴。

sentences.english: Meetings are just one symptom of anorganization run by the lizard brain.
sentences.chinese: 会海只是这类靠蜥蜴脑运作的组织的一个症状。

detailed_translations.english: a type of reptile that has four legs and a long tail

name: delirium
trans: 精神错乱， 神志失常

sentences.english: Before she died she had fits of delirium.
sentences.chinese: 去世前她一阵阵地胡言乱语。

detailed_translations.chinese: 神智昏迷，说胡话；极度兴奋
detailed_translations.english: extreme excitement

name: preoccupation
trans: 主要考虑因素； 全神贯注

sentences.english: Karouzos's poetry shows a profound preoccupation with the Orthodox Church.
sentences.chinese: 卡鲁佐斯的诗歌表现出对东正教的深切关注。

detailed_translations.chinese: 全神贯注，入神；当务之急；关注的事物；抢先占据；成见
detailed_translations.english: when someone thinks or worries about something a lot, with the result that they do not pay attention to other things

sentences.english: Jim made a vow that he would find his wife’s killer.
sentences.chinese: 吉姆发誓要找到杀害他妻子的凶手。

sentences.english: While many models vow to go back to college, few do.
sentences.chinese: 很多模特儿发誓要重返大学，但几乎无人做到。

sentences.english: I solemnly vowed that someday I would return to live in Europe.
sentences.chinese: 我郑重起誓总有一天我要重回欧洲生活。

detailed_translations.english: a serious promise
If you vow to do something, you make a serious promise or decision that you will do it

sentences.english: an expert in ciphers
sentences.chinese: 密码专家

sentences.english: messages written in cipher
sentences.chinese: 用密码写的信息

detailed_translations.english: a system of secret writing

sentences.english: ...a huge round mass of smooth rock protruding from the water.
sentences.chinese: …从水中突出来的一块光滑的圆形巨石。

detailed_translations.english: to stick out from somewhere

sentences.english: The flies leave a sticky residue on crops.
sentences.chinese: 苍蝇在庄稼上留下黏糊糊的分泌物。

sentences.english: Rinse off any soap residue.
sentences.chinese: 冲净残留的肥皂。

detailed_translations.english: a substance that remains on a surface, in a container etc and cannot be removed easily, or that remains after a chemical process

sentences.english: a noted author
sentences.chinese: 著名作家

detailed_translations.english: well known or famous, especially because of some special quality or ability

name: frenzy
trans: 狂暴， 狂热， 疯狂

sentences.english: Doreen had worked herself into a frenzy .
sentences.chinese: 多琳一阵狂怒。

detailed_translations.english: a state of great anxiety or excitement, in which you cannot control your behaviour

sentences.english: the new national forum on the environment
sentences.chinese: 新的全国性环境论坛

detailed_translations.english: an organization, meeting, TV programme etc where people have a chance to publicly discuss an important subject

name: contempt
trans: 轻视， 鄙视， 轻蔑

sentences.english: The public is treated with contempt by broadcasters.
sentences.chinese: 公众受到了节目主持人的轻蔑对待。

sentences.english: How could she have loved a man who so clearly held her in contempt ?
sentences.chinese: 她怎么会爱上一个明显看不起她的男人呢？

detailed_translations.english: a feeling that someone or something is not important and deserves no respect

sentences.english: In the distance, the dot of a boat appeared on the horizon.
sentences.chinese: 远处小黑点般的一条小船出现在地平线上。

sentences.english: a course of study that will broaden your horizons
sentences.chinese: 一门能开阔眼界的课程

detailed_translations.english: the line far away where the land or sea seems to meet the sky

name: undertaking
trans: 任务， 项目； 事业， 企业； 承诺， 保证

sentences.english: Starting a new business can be a risky undertaking.
sentences.chinese: 创办新企业有时是一件有风险的事情。

sentences.english: Both organizations gave an undertaking to curb violence among their members.
sentences.chinese: 两个组织都作出承诺要约束其成员的暴力行为。

detailed_translations.english: an important job, piece of work, or activity that you are responsible for

name: figurative
trans: 比喻的， 借喻的， 象征的； 形象的

sentences.english: He’s my son, in the figurative sense of the word.
sentences.chinese: 打个比方，他就像是我的儿子。

detailed_translations.chinese: 比喻的；修饰丰富的；形容多的
detailed_translations.english: a figurative word or phrase is used in a different way from its usual meaning, to give you a particular idea or picture in your mind

sentences.english: Ian came off the squash court dripping with sweat .
sentences.chinese: 伊恩大汗淋漓地离开壁球场。

sentences.english: Beads of sweat appeared on his forehead.
sentences.chinese: 他的额头上冒出了汗珠。

sentences.english: I was sweating a lot despite the air conditioning.
sentences.chinese: 尽管开着空调，我仍是满头大汗。

detailed_translations.english: drops of salty liquid that come out through your skin when you are hot, frightened, ill, or doing exercise
to have drops of salty liquid coming out through your skin because you are hot, ill, frightened, or doing exercise

name: progressive
trans: 进步的； 逐步的， 渐进的； 【语】进行时的

sentences.english: a progressive administration
sentences.chinese: 进步的政府

sentences.english: progressive and forward-looking policies
sentences.chinese: 有前瞻性的进步政策

sentences.english: The Republicans were deeply split between progressives and conservatives.
sentences.chinese: 共和党进步派和保守派之间分歧很大。

detailed_translations.english: supporting new or modern ideas and methods, especially in politics and education
A progressive is someone who is progressive

name: betray
trans: 出卖， 泄露； 辜负， 对…不忠； 流露情感

sentences.english: He felt that she had betrayed him.
sentences.chinese: 他感觉她背叛了自己。

sentences.english: She had betrayed her parents' trust .
sentences.chinese: 她辜负了父母对她的信任。

sentences.english: I would never betray a confidence (=  tell a secret that someone has trusted me with  ) .
sentences.chinese: 我永远不会泄露秘密。

detailed_translations.chinese: 背叛， 出卖； 失信于， 辜负； 泄露； 暴露， 显露
detailed_translations.english: to be disloyal to someone who trusts you, so that they are harmed or upset

sentences.english: But in the stratosphere they can stay aloft for years, spread by fast winds known as jets, meaning the threat is global.
sentences.chinese: 但在平流层，它们可以在高处停留数年，高速的风对其进行传播，这意味着全球都受到了威胁。

detailed_translations.english: high up in the air

name: contributory
trans: 贡献的； 捐助的； 促进的

sentences.english: Smoking is a contributory factor in lung cancer.
sentences.chinese: 抽烟是导致肺癌的一个因素。

name: deliberate
trans: 故意的， 蓄意的； 审慎的， 深思熟虑的

sentences.english: a deliberate attempt to humiliate her
sentences.chinese: 对她的故意羞辱

sentences.english: The attack on him was quite deliberate.
sentences.chinese: 对他的袭击完全是有预谋的。

detailed_translations.chinese: 故意的， 蓄意的； 慎重的， 深思熟虑的
detailed_translations.english: intended or planned
to think about something very carefully

name: swear
trans: 诅咒； 宣誓， 发誓

sentences.english: Remember that you have sworn an oath and so must tell the truth.
sentences.chinese: 记住你已经宣过誓了，所以必须讲真话。
