detailed_translations.english: to copy something exactly

name: affable
trans: 和蔼可亲的， 易于交谈的， 友善的

sentences.english: an affable guy
sentences.chinese: 一个平易近人的人

detailed_translations.english: friendly and easy to talk to

sentences.english: The number of people who have the disease has decreased significantly in recent years.
sentences.chinese: 近年来，这种病的患者人数明显下降。

sentences.english: They want to decrease their reliance on oil.
sentences.chinese: 他们想减少对石油的依赖。

sentences.english: There has been a steady decrease of temperature.
sentences.chinese: 气温在持续下降。

detailed_translations.english: to become less or go down to a lower level, or to make something do this
the process of becoming less, or the amount by which something becomes less

sentences.english: There's so little to go on, we can only surmise what happened.
sentences.chinese: 几乎没有什么可继续进行的，我们只能猜测发生过的事。

sentences.english: It is mere surmise that Bosch had Brant's poem in mind when doing this painting.
sentences.chinese: 博斯画这幅画时头脑里想着勃朗特的诗，这只是猜测而已。

detailed_translations.english: to guess that something is true, using the information you know already
If you say that a particular conclusion is surmise, you mean that it is a guess based on the available evidence and you do not know for certain that it is true

sentences.english: an attempt to eradicate inflation
sentences.chinese: 为消除通货膨胀所作的努力

sentences.english: This problem has now been completely eradicated.
sentences.chinese: 这个问题现已彻底杜绝。

detailed_translations.english: to completely get rid of something such as a disease or a social problem

name: germinate
trans: 发芽， 萌芽； 发展

sentences.english: Some seed varieties germinate fast, so check every day or so.
sentences.chinese: 有一些品种的种子发芽快，所以差不多每天都要察看一下。

detailed_translations.english: if a seed germinates, or if it is germinated, it begins to grow

sentences.english: They are proudly trumpeting the fact that they are creating more jobs.
sentences.chinese: 他们得意地宣扬他们是在创造更多的工作岗位。

detailed_translations.english: to tell everyone about something that you are proud of, especially in an annoying way

sentences.english: Conservationists say the law must be strengthened.
sentences.chinese: 环保主义者称必须加强法制。

name: despondent
trans: 垂头丧气的， 沮丧的

sentences.english: Gill had been out of work for a year and was getting very despondent.
sentences.chinese: 吉尔失业一年了，开始变得非常消沉。

detailed_translations.english: extremely unhappy and without hope

name: trifle
trans: 少许；琐事，小事；无价值的东西

sentences.english: There’s no point in arguing over trifles.
sentences.chinese: 为琐事争吵毫无意义。

detailed_translations.english: something unimportant or not valuable

sentences.english: People migrate to cities like Jakarta in search of work.
sentences.chinese: 人们移居到雅加达这样的城市找工作。

sentences.english: Most birds have to fly long distances to migrate.
sentences.chinese: 大多数的鸟类不得不飞行很长的距离进行迁徙。

detailed_translations.english: if people migrate, they go to live in another area or country, especially in order to find work

sentences.english: on Easter Sunday
sentences.chinese: 在复活节星期日

detailed_translations.english: a Christian holy day in March or April when Christians remember the death of Christ and his return to life

name: string
trans: 细绳，带子；一串；一系列；弦

sentences.english: Her key hung on a string around her neck.
sentences.chinese: 她的钥匙穿了根绳子挂在脖子上。

sentences.english: a ball of string
sentences.chinese: 一团细绳

sentences.english: I need a piece of string to tie this package.
sentences.chinese: 我需要一根绳子来捆这个包裹。

sentences.english: a string of pearls
sentences.chinese: 一串珍珠

detailed_translations.english: a strong thread made of several threads twisted together, used for tying or fastening things

name: submit
trans: 提交， 呈递； 屈从； 主张， 建议

sentences.english: In desperation, Mrs. Jones submitted to an operation on her right knee to relieve the pain.
sentences.chinese: 绝望中，琼斯夫人不得已接受了一次她右膝的手术以减轻疼痛。

detailed_translations.chinese: 屈从， 听从； 忍受； 甘心
detailed_translations.english: If you submit to something, you unwillingly allow something to be done to you, or you do what someone wants, for example because you are not powerful enough to resist

detailed_translations.chinese: 屈从，听从，服从；呈送，提交；主张，建议
detailed_translations.english: to give a plan, piece of writing etc to someone in authority for them to consider or approve

name: occupy
trans: 占用； 占据， 占领； 使忙于

sentences.english: Football occupies most of my leisure time.
sentences.chinese: 足球占去了我大部分的闲暇时间。

detailed_translations.english: if something occupies you or your time, you are busy doing it

name: import
trans: 进口， 输入； 意义， 要旨， 重要性

sentences.english: a ban on beef imports
sentences.chinese: 禁止进口牛肉

sentences.english: In 2001, Britain exported more cars than it imported.
sentences.chinese: 2001年英国的汽车出口量大于进口

detailed_translations.english: a product that is brought from one country into another so that it can be sold there, or the business of doing this
to bring a product from one country into another so that it can be sold there

sentences.english: affluent families
sentences.chinese: 富裕的家庭

sentences.english: The diet of the affluent has not changed much over the decades.
sentences.chinese: 富人的饮食数十年来没怎么变。

detailed_translations.english: having plenty of money, nice houses, expensive things etc
The affluent are people who are affluent

sentences.english: The boy had indigestion,and he regurgitated all his food.
sentences.chinese: 这个男孩消化不良，把吃下的东西全吐了出来。

sentences.english: So do not think that you are collectively having heart attacks, indigestion, or anything else.
sentences.chinese: 不要认为你们是全体心脏病发作，消化不良，或者其它任何疾病。

sentences.english: Aspirin may occasionally cause irritation of the stomach and so if symptoms of indigestion or heartburn develop it should be stopped.
sentences.chinese: 阿斯匹林有时导致胃部不适，所以如果发生消化不良或胃灼热那么应该停药。

detailed_translations.english: pain that you get when your stomach cannot break down food that you have eaten

name: intrude
trans: 侵入， 闯入； 打扰， 侵扰

sentences.english: The press has been blamed for intruding into people's personal lives in an unacceptable way.
sentences.chinese: 新闻媒体因以一种令人无法接受的方式侵入人们的私生活而受到谴责。

detailed_translations.english: to come into a place or situation, and have an unwanted effect

name: simplicity
trans: 简单， 容易； 朴素， 质朴

sentences.english: Mona wrote with a beautiful simplicity of style.
sentences.chinese: 莫娜的文笔朴实优美。

sentences.english: For the sake of simplicity, the tax form is divided into three sections.
sentences.chinese: 为简明起见，税单分成三个部分。

sentences.english: James’ solution to this problem was simplicity itself (= very simple ) .
sentences.chinese: 詹姆斯对这个问题的解决办法十分简单。

detailed_translations.english: the quality of being simple and not complicated, especially when this is attractive or useful

sentences.english: I blinked as I came out into the sunlight.
sentences.chinese: 我走出来，在太阳光下直眨眼睛。

detailed_translations.english: to shut and open your eyes quickly
very quickly

name: summit
trans: 最高点， 峰顶， 极点； 峰会

sentences.english: the European summit
sentences.chinese: 欧洲首脑会议

sentences.english: The two presidents agreed to hold a summit in the spring.
sentences.chinese: 两位总统商定在春天举行一次首脑会议。

sentences.english: a five-nation summit meeting
sentences.chinese: 五国峰会

detailed_translations.chinese: 最高点， 峰顶； 最高级会议
detailed_translations.english: an important meeting or set of meetings between the leaders of several governments

name: perfume
trans: 使充满香气； 洒香水于

sentences.english: She was wearing the perfume that he’d bought her.
sentences.chinese: 她擦了他买给她的香水。

detailed_translations.english: a liquid with a strong pleasant smell that women put on their skin or clothing to make themselves smell nice
to put perfume on something

name: magnify
trans: 放大， 扩大； 夸大

sentences.english: At the Sheffield arena, the speakers were magnified ten times on a giant screen.
sentences.chinese: 在谢菲尔德体育馆，演讲者在一个巨大的屏幕上被放大了十倍。

sentences.english: A public address system magnifies all the little noises and coughs.
sentences.chinese: 扩音系统会放大任何细小的噪音和咳嗽声。

sentences.english: The report tends to magnify the risks involved
sentences.chinese: 这份报告有夸大所涉风险的倾向。

detailed_translations.english: to make something seem bigger or louder, especially using special equipment

sentences.english: Seventy factory workers were made redundant in the resulting cuts.
sentences.chinese: 在继而发生的裁员中，70名工厂工人被解雇。

detailed_translations.chinese: 过剩的；失业的，被解雇的
detailed_translations.english: if you are redundant, your employer no longer has a job for you

sentences.english: Wood is a durable material.
sentences.chinese: 木头是耐用材料。

detailed_translations.english: staying in good condition for a long time, even if used a lot

name: impose
trans: 把…强加于； 征； 处以

sentences.english: Parents should beware of imposing their own tastes on their children.
sentences.chinese: 父母应该提防把自己的兴趣强加给孩子。

sentences.english: A new tax was imposed on fuel.
sentences.chinese: 当局开始对燃油征收一项新税。

detailed_translations.english: If you impose your opinions or beliefs on other people, you try and make people accept them as a rule or as a model to copy

sentences.english: A whale is a kind of mammal.
sentences.chinese: 鲸是一种哺乳动物。

sentences.english: The whale is a mammal.
sentences.chinese: 鲸鱼是哺乳动物。

sentences.english: The problem with that theory is that no other mammal has resorted to this method of cooling down.
sentences.chinese: 这一理论的问题在于，没有其他的哺乳动物采取了这种降低体温的方式。

detailed_translations.english: a type of animal that drinks milk from its mother’s body when it is young. Humans, dogs, and whales are mammals.

name: preliterate
trans: 文字出现以前的， 没有文字的

sentences.english: Similar tales were told by various preliterate peoples in Asia, Africa, and the Americas.
sentences.chinese: 在亚洲、非洲和美洲各国，文字出现之前，也有相似的传说。

sentences.english: When millions watch the same programs, the whole world becomes a village, and society is reduced to the conditions which obtain in preliterate communities.
sentences.chinese: 当数以百万计的人观看着相同的电视节目的时候，整个世界就变成了一个村落，社会也就退化到文字出现前的状态。

detailed_translations.chinese: 文字出现以前的， 没有文字的
detailed_translations.english: a society that is preliterate has not developed a written language

name: factor
trans: 要素， 因素； 因数； 系数

sentences.english: The rise in crime is mainly due to social and economic factors.
sentences.chinese: 犯罪率上升主要由社会和经济因素造成。

detailed_translations.chinese: 因素， 因子； 系数
detailed_translations.english: one of several things that influence or cause a situation

sentences.english: funeral rites
sentences.chinese: 殡葬仪式

sentences.english: ancient fertility rites
sentences.chinese: 古代的生殖崇拜仪式

sentences.english: These traditional rites are performed only by the women of the village.
sentences.chinese: 这些传统仪式只由村里的女人来进行。

detailed_translations.english: a ceremony that is always performed in the same way, usually for religious purposes

name: pinch
trans: 捏， 掐； 一撮， 微量

sentences.english: We have to stop her pinching her baby brother.
sentences.chinese: 我们不能让她再掐她小弟弟了。

sentences.english: He pinched her cheek.
sentences.chinese: 他捏了一下她的脸颊。

sentences.english: Put all the ingredients, including a pinch of salt, into a food processor.
sentences.chinese: 将所有的配料，连同一撮盐，放进食品加工机里。

detailed_translations.english: to press a part of someone’s skin very tightly between your finger and thumb, especially so that it hurts
A pinch of an ingredient such as salt is the amount of it that you can hold between your thumb and your first finger

name: mischievous
trans: 恶作剧的， 顽皮的， 淘气的； 恶意的

sentences.english: Their sons are noisy and mischievous.
sentences.chinese: 他们的几个儿子又吵又淘气。

detailed_translations.chinese: 淘气的；（人、行为等）恶作剧的；有害的
detailed_translations.english: someone who is mischievous likes to have fun, especially by playing tricks on people or doing things to annoy or embarrass them

name: conquer
trans: 战胜， 征服； 克服

sentences.english: The Normans conquered England in 1066.
sentences.chinese: 诺曼人于 1066 年征服英格兰。

sentences.english: Egypt was conquered by the Persian king Kambyses.
sentences.chinese: 埃及被波斯国王冈比西斯征服。

detailed_translations.english: to get control of a country by fighting

name: wan
trans: 苍白的， 无血色的； 憔悴的

sentences.english: She gave a wan smile.
sentences.chinese: 她无力地笑了一下。

detailed_translations.english: looking pale, weak, or tired

sentences.english: We should ensure continuity of care between hospital and home.
sentences.chinese: 我们应当保证医院护理和家庭护理的连续性。

detailed_translations.english: the state of continuing for a period of time, without problems, interruptions, or changes

name: sculpture
trans: 雕像， 雕塑品； 雕刻术

sentences.english: a sculpture of an elephant
sentences.chinese: 一尊大象雕塑

sentences.english: the techniques of sculpture in stone
sentences.chinese: 石雕技艺

detailed_translations.english: an object made out of stone, wood, clay etc by an artist

sentences.english: the realization of his dreams
sentences.chinese: 他的梦想成真

detailed_translations.english: when you achieve something that you had planned or hoped for

sentences.english: wax crayons
sentences.chinese: 蜡笔

detailed_translations.english: a solid substance made of fat or oil and used to make candles, polish etc
to rub a layer of wax into a floor, surface etc to protect it or make it shine

sentences.english: However, contamination can occur at any point along the food chain, from field to table.
sentences.chinese: 然而，污染沿着食物链可能在任何的点上发生，从田地到餐桌。

sentences.english: There is no evidence of contamination in our lab, and we have controlled for that all along.
sentences.chinese: 我们的实验室不存在污染，在整个实验过程中我们都控制的很好。

sentences.english: Others have said that all of Mars should be protected as a wildlife preserve where we do everything possible to avoid contamination; on the assumption Martian microbes could exist.
sentences.chinese: 假设火星上可能存在微生物，其他人就认为火星应该是我们做任何事来避免污染的野生动物保护区那样来被保护着。

sentences.english: arable farming
sentences.chinese: 耕作农业

sentences.english: arable land (=  land that is suitable for growing crops  )
sentences.chinese: 可耕地

detailed_translations.english: relating to growing crops

name: gist
trans: 主旨， 要点， 大意

sentences.english: Don’t worry about all the details as long as you get the gist (= understand the main meaning ) of it.
sentences.chinese: 不要去管各个细节，只要理解主要意思就行了。

detailed_translations.english: the main idea and meaning of what someone has said or written

sentences.english: unemployment in urban areas
sentences.chinese: 城市地区的失业状况

sentences.english: the deprived sections of the urban population
sentences.chinese: 城市人口中的贫困群体

detailed_translations.english: relating to towns and cities

name: refer
trans: 提到， 谈及； 查阅， 参考

sentences.english: In his speech, he referred to a recent trip to Canada.
sentences.chinese: 在他的讲话中，他提到了最近的加拿大之行。

detailed_translations.english: If you refer to a particular subject or person, you talk about them or mention them

name: stellar
trans: 星的， 恒星的， 星球的； 精彩的； 优秀的

sentences.english: the company’s stellar growth
sentences.chinese: 这家公司辉煌的发展

detailed_translations.chinese: 星的；星球的；主要的；一流的
detailed_translations.english: relating to the stars

name: flame
trans: 火舌，火焰；光芒，光辉；强烈的感情

sentences.english: Flames poured out of the windows of the building.
sentences.chinese: 火焰从大楼窗口冒出来。

sentences.english: They rushed past us with buckets of water and tried to douse the flames .
sentences.chinese: 他们提着一桶桶水跑过我们身边去灭火。

sentences.english: They sat around the campfire, watching the flickering flames .
sentences.chinese: 他们围坐在篝火旁，看着跳动的火焰。

sentences.english: Flames quickly engulfed the building.
sentences.chinese: 火焰很快吞噬了大楼。

sentences.english: a candle flame
sentences.chinese: 烛焰

detailed_translations.english: hot bright burning gas that you see when something is on fire
to burn brightly

sentences.english: Read the manufacturer's guidelines before discarding the box.
sentences.chinese: 先阅读制造商的说明书再把盒子丢掉。

detailed_translations.chinese: 丢弃， 抛弃， 遗弃
detailed_translations.english: If you discard something, you get rid of it because you no longer want it or need it

sentences.english: European farmers are planning a massive demonstration against farm subsidy cuts.
sentences.chinese: 欧洲的农场主们正在策划一场反对削减农场补贴的大游行。

detailed_translations.english: money that is paid by a government or organization to make prices lower, reduce the cost of producing goods etc

sentences.english: The most important criterion for entry is that applicants must design and make their own work.
sentences.chinese: 参加的最重要标准就是申请人必须设计并制作自己的作品。

detailed_translations.english: A criterion is a factor on which you judge or decide something

name: obscene
trans: 淫秽的， 下流的； 骇人听闻的； 可憎的， 可恶的

sentences.english: Bradford made an obscene gesture.
sentences.chinese: 布拉德福德做了个下流手势。

sentences.english: {"GLOSS":["calls from an unknown person saying obscene things"],"COLLOINEXA":["obscene phone calls"]}
sentences.chinese: 下流骚扰电话

sentences.english: obscene photographs
sentences.chinese: 淫秽照片

detailed_translations.english: relating to sex in a way that is shocking and offensive

name: raft
trans: 用筏运送； 乘筏渡河

sentences.english: The company has launched a whole raft of new software products.
sentences.chinese: 公司推出了大量新软件产品。

detailed_translations.english: a flat floating structure, usually made of pieces of wood tied together, used as a boat
to convey on or travel by raft, or make a raft from

name: attentive
trans: 注意的， 专心的； 关心的

sentences.english: an attentive audience
sentences.chinese: 聚精会神的听众

detailed_translations.english: listening to or watching someone carefully because you are interested

name: prohibitive
trans: 禁止的， 抑制的； 高得令人难以承受的

sentences.english: prohibitive regulations
sentences.chinese: 禁律

detailed_translations.chinese: 禁止的，禁止性的；抑制的；（费用，价格等）过高的；类同禁止的
detailed_translations.english: a prohibitive rule prevents people from doing things

name: flair
trans: 才能， 本领； 天资

sentences.english: Jo has a flair for languages.
sentences.chinese: 乔有语言天赋。

detailed_translations.english: a natural ability to do something very well

sentences.english: You’re too modest! You’ve been a huge help to us.
sentences.chinese: 你太谦虚了！你帮了我们大忙呢。

sentences.english: a modest increase in costs
sentences.chinese: 成本的小幅上涨

detailed_translations.chinese: 谦虚的；不太大的；不很贵的
detailed_translations.english: someone who is modest does not want to talk about their abilities or achievements

name: crush
trans: 碾碎； 使变形； 镇压

sentences.english: His leg was crushed in the accident.
sentences.chinese: 他的腿在事故中被压断。

sentences.english: Two people were crushed to death in the rush to escape.
sentences.chinese: 两个人在逃生过程中被踩死。

detailed_translations.english: to press something so hard that it breaks or is damaged

sentences.english: Most things are balanced - with equal numbers of electrons and protons.
sentences.chinese: 大部分物体都是电荷平衡的——含等量的电子和质子。

detailed_translations.english: a very small piece of matter with a negative electrical charge that moves around the nucleus of an atom

name: embed
trans: 把…嵌入； 使深留脑中

sentences.english: Feelings of guilt are deeply embedded in her personality.
sentences.chinese: 负罪感在她的性格里根深蒂固。

detailed_translations.chinese: 把…嵌入， 扎牢； 使深留脑中
detailed_translations.english: to put something firmly and deeply into something else, or to be put into something in this way

sentences.english: The citadel at Besançon towered above the river.
sentences.chinese: 贝桑松城堡高过河面。

detailed_translations.english: a strong  fort (= small castle )  built in the past as a place where people could go for safety if their city was attacked

name: promising
trans: 有希望的； 有前途的

sentences.english: a promising career in law
sentences.chinese: 很有前途的法律职业

sentences.english: a promising young actor
sentences.chinese: 大有前途的年轻演员

sentences.english: a promising start
sentences.chinese: 良好的开端

detailed_translations.chinese: 有希望的， 有前途的
detailed_translations.english: showing signs of being successful or good in the future

name: ambivalent
trans: 对立的， 感情矛盾的

sentences.english: As a group, they are ambivalent about whether the quality of online content would suffer if companies could not charge for it—34% think so while 30% do not; and the remaining 36% have no firm opinion.
sentences.chinese: 对于如果网站对内容不收费这些内容的质量是否会变差的调查有矛盾：34%的人认为会变差，同时30%的认为不会，而36%的人没有固定的意见。

sentences.english: Looking back on it, I can see how the statement looked ambivalent and a touch arrogant, but it was an honest expression of how I felt, as I began the first campaign since 1982 that I could have lost.
sentences.chinese: 现在回头想想，我能够看出，在这个声明中，我所流露出的矛盾心理和些许的傲慢，但它确实是我内心感受的真实表达，因为这是自1982年以来，我第一次开始进行可能会失利的竞选活动。

detailed_translations.english: not sure whether you want or like something or not

name: practicable
trans: 能实行的， 可行的， 适用的

sentences.english: The only practicable course of action is to sell the company.
sentences.chinese: 唯一可行的做法是把公司卖掉。

sentences.english: at the earliest practicable opportunity
sentences.chinese: 在尽可能早的时机

detailed_translations.english: able to be done; likely to be successful

sentences.english: a book on biochemistry and physiology
sentences.chinese: 一本关于生物化学和生理学的书

detailed_translations.english: the science that studies the way in which the bodies of living things work

name: lofty
trans: 高耸的； 崇高的； 高傲的

sentences.english: He stayed at the Four Seasons Hotel, from whose lofty heights he could see across New York.
sentences.chinese: 他住在四季酒店，从酒店高处可以看到纽约的全景。

sentences.english: lofty ideals of equality and social justice
sentences.chinese: 平等和社会正义的崇高理想

detailed_translations.english: (of buildings, mountains, etc.) very high and impressive

sentences.english: The contrast could not have been made more explicit.
sentences.chinese: 这个对比再清楚不过了。

sentences.english: explicit knowledge of grammar
sentences.chinese: 清楚易懂的语法知识

sentences.english: The kidnappers gave us explicit instructions not to involve the police.
sentences.chinese: 绑匪明确告诉我们不许报警。

sentences.english: Be explicit when you talk about money with your family.
sentences.chinese: 与家人谈钱的问题要直截了当。

detailed_translations.english: expressed in a way that is very clear and direct

sentences.english: We must consider how best to utilize what resources we have.
sentences.chinese: 我们必须考虑怎样充分利用现有的资源。

detailed_translations.english: to use something for a particular purpose

name: prevail
trans: 盛行， 流行； 战胜， 压倒； 劝说

sentences.english: 英文编辑：the economic conditions which prevail in England and Wales
sentences.chinese: 英格兰和威尔士普遍的经济状况

sentences.english: Justice will prevail.
sentences.chinese: 正义终将获胜。

detailed_translations.english: if a belief, custom, situation etc prevails, it exists among a group of people at a certain time

sentences.english: chocolate flakes
sentences.chinese: 巧克力薄片

detailed_translations.english: a small thin piece that breaks away easily from something else
to break off in small thin pieces

sentences.english: a feature that allows you to browse your hard drive and choose the graphic you want to display
sentences.chinese: 让你可以浏览硬盘驱动器选择自己想要显示的图像的一个功能

sentences.english: ...a browse around the shops.
sentences.chinese: …在商店的一番闲逛。

detailed_translations.english: to look through the pages of a book, magazine etc without a particular purpose, just looking at the most interesting parts
Browse is also a noun

name: implicit
trans: 含蓄的； 绝对的； 内含的

sentences.english: ...an implicit warning to the Moroccans not to continue or repeat the military actions they began a week ago.
sentences.chinese: …叫摩洛哥人不要继续或重复一周前开始的军事行动的含蓄警告。

detailed_translations.chinese: 不言明的， 含蓄的； 内含的， 固有的； 无疑问的
detailed_translations.english: suggested or understood without being stated directly

name: purity
trans: 纯度； 纯洁， 纯净， 纯粹

sentences.english: the purity of tap water
sentences.chinese: 自来水的纯净度

sentences.english: {"COLLOINEXA":["spiritual purity"]}
sentences.chinese: 心灵的纯洁

detailed_translations.english: the quality or state of being pure

sentences.english: The front portion of the rocket breaks off.
sentences.chinese: 火箭的前部脱落了。

sentences.english: Do you have any children’s portions?
sentences.chinese: 你们有儿童餐吗？

detailed_translations.english: a part of something larger, especially a part that is different from the other parts

name: futile
trans: 无效的， 无用的， 无意义的； 琐细的； 没出息的

sentences.english: My efforts to go back to sleep proved futile.
sentences.chinese: 我努力想再次入睡，但怎么也睡不着。

detailed_translations.chinese: 无用的；无效的；没有出息的；琐细的；不重要的
detailed_translations.english: actions that are futile are useless because they have no chance of being successful

sentences.english: Jan looked pensive.
sentences.chinese: 简神情忧伤。

detailed_translations.chinese: 沉思的，忧郁的；悲伤的，哀愁的
detailed_translations.english: thinking a lot about something, especially because you are worried or sad

sentences.english: His business acumen helped him to succeed where others had failed.
sentences.chinese: 他在商业上的敏锐帮他在其他人失败的地方获得成功。

sentences.english: Science considers to make clear, the baby is to comparative to outside information of acumen, acceptance rate is quite rapid also.
sentences.chinese: 科学研究表明，婴儿对外界信息是相当敏锐的，接受的速度也相当快。

detailed_translations.english: the ability to think quickly and make good judgments

sentences.english: We waited for the storm to abate.
sentences.chinese: 我们等风暴减弱。

detailed_translations.english: to become less strong or decrease

sentences.english: The parents were not to blame for the tragic death of their son.
sentences.chinese: 儿子的惨死不是他父母的错。

sentences.english: a great tragic actor
sentences.chinese: 一名伟大的悲剧演员

detailed_translations.english: making you feel very sad, usually because sb has died or suffered a lot

name: eschew
trans: 避开， 戒除， 回避

sentences.english: I had eschewed politics in favour of a life practising law.
sentences.chinese: 我选择从事律师职业，有意避开了政治。

detailed_translations.english: to deliberately avoid doing or using something

sentences.english: your family physician
sentences.chinese: 你的家庭医生

detailed_translations.english: a doctor

sentences.english: In 1929 she shot to stardom on Broadway in a Noel Coward play.
sentences.chinese: 1929年，她以一部诺埃尔·科沃德的戏在百老汇一跃成为明星。

detailed_translations.chinese: 演员们；明星界；明星身份
detailed_translations.english: Stardom is the state of being very famous, usually as an actor, musician, or athlete

sentences.english: For 25 years, Darwin amassed evidence to support his theories.
sentences.chinese: 25年间，达尔文收集了大量证据来支持自己的理论。

sentences.english: He amassed a fortune after the war.
sentences.chinese: 战后，他积累了大量财富。

detailed_translations.english: if you amass money, knowledge, information etc, you gradually collect a large amount of it

name: venturesome
trans: 敢于冒险的； 有危险的

sentences.english: ...the venturesome graduate who is determined to succeed.
sentences.chinese: ...敢闯敢干、下决心要成功的毕业生。

detailed_translations.english: willing to take risks

sentences.english: a souvenir shop
sentences.chinese: 纪念品商店

detailed_translations.english: an object that you buy or keep to remind yourself of a special occasion or a place you have visited

name: quaint
trans: 古色古香的； 离奇有趣的

sentences.english: ...a small, quaint town with narrow streets and traditional half-timbered houses.
sentences.chinese: …一座古朴的小镇，有着狭窄的街道和传统的半木制房屋。

detailed_translations.chinese: 古雅的；奇怪的；离奇有趣的；做得很精巧的
detailed_translations.english: Something that is quaint is attractive because it is old-fashioned

name: grip
trans: 控制；紧握；吸引住…的注意
控制， 影响力； 紧握； 理解

sentences.english: Hold the microphone in a firm grip and keep it still.
sentences.chinese: 紧紧握住麦克风不要让它动。

sentences.english: She felt her wrist caught in a vice-like grip .
sentences.chinese: 她觉得手腕像是卡在铁钳里被牢牢地抓住了。

sentences.english: Don’t loosen your grip on the rope or you’ll fall.
sentences.chinese: 抓住绳索别松手，不然你会掉下去。

sentences.english: He released his grip and stepped back.
sentences.chinese: 他放开手往后退去。

detailed_translations.english: the way you hold something tightly, or your ability to do this

sentences.english: The tornado rubbished the whole village.
sentences.chinese: 龙卷风毁掉了整个村庄。

sentences.english: The tornado disrupted broadcasting along the entire coast.
sentences.chinese: 龙卷风使整个沿海的广播都中断了。

sentences.english: The tornado is coming, so we had better batten down the hatches here and get to the cellar.
sentences.chinese: 龙卷风即将来临，因此我们最好把这里的舱口封上，到地下室去。

detailed_translations.english: an extremely violent storm consisting of air that spins very quickly and causes a lot of damage

name: explore
trans: 探索， 勘探； 探险； 探究

sentences.english: Management need to explore ways of improving office security.
sentences.chinese: 管理层需要探讨如何加强办事处的安全措施。

sentences.english: I’m going to explore the possibility of a part-time job.
sentences.chinese: 我要好好想想兼职工作的可能性。

detailed_translations.chinese: 探险， 探索； 仔细查阅， 探究
detailed_translations.english: to discuss or think about something carefully

sentences.english: Every new acronym I hear turns out to be another dirty trick designed to allow rich countries to go on with business as usual.
sentences.chinese: 我所听到的每个新缩写词原来都是另一个鬼把戏，旨在允许富裕国家照常进行一切活动。

sentences.english: Al is considered to be one of the first high profile commercial artists and his initials are also conveniently the acronym of the club.
sentences.chinese: 铝被认为是第一个高调的商业艺术家之一，他的首字母是那么方便了俱乐部的首字母缩写。

detailed_translations.english: a word made up from the first letters of the name of something such as an organization. For example, NATO is an acronym for the North Atlantic Treaty Organization.

name: noteworthy
trans: 显著的， 值得注目的

sentences.english: a noteworthy achievement
sentences.chinese: 显著的成就

detailed_translations.chinese: 显著的， 值得注目的
detailed_translations.english: important or interesting enough to deserve your attention

sentences.english: He was fired for shirking.
sentences.chinese: 他因偷懒被解雇了。

detailed_translations.english: to deliberately avoid doing something you should do, because you are lazy

sentences.english: The farm was very isolated, but it had electricity.
sentences.chinese: 那个农场非常偏远，但有电力供应。

detailed_translations.english: the power that is carried by wires, cables etc, and is used to provide light or heat, to make machines work etc

name: tentative
trans: 试验性的； 不确定的， 暂定的； 犹豫的

sentences.english: I passed on my tentative conclusions to the police.
sentences.chinese: 我把我的初步结论递交给了警方。

sentences.english: The government is taking tentative steps towards tackling the country’s economic problems.
sentences.chinese: 政府正在采取临时性措施来解决国家的经济问题。

detailed_translations.chinese: 试验性的，暂定的；踌躇的
detailed_translations.english: not definite or certain, and may be changed later

sentences.english: ...the natural laws of the cosmos.
sentences.chinese: …宇宙的自然法则。

detailed_translations.english: the whole universe, especially when you think of it as a system

name: climate
trans: 气候； 气候区， 地带； 风气， 氛围； 思潮

sentences.english: Los Angeles’ warm dry climate
sentences.chinese: 洛杉矶温暖干燥的气候

detailed_translations.chinese: 气候； 风土， 地带； 风气， 气氛
detailed_translations.english: the typical weather conditions in a particular area

name: staggering
trans: 巨大的； 势不可挡的； 惊人的， 令人吃惊的

sentences.english: The cost was a staggering $10 million.
sentences.chinese: 费用竟高达 1,000 万美元。

sentences.english: The financial impact on the town was staggering.
sentences.chinese: 对这个镇所造成的财政影响令人惊诧。

detailed_translations.english: extremely great or surprising

name: crust
trans: 地壳； 外壳； 硬的表面； 面包片

sentences.english: sandwiches with the crusts cut off
sentences.chinese: 切去边皮的三明治

detailed_translations.chinese: 地壳；外壳；面包皮；坚硬外皮
detailed_translations.english: the hard brown outer surface of bread

name: criticize
trans: 批评； 吹毛求疵， 非难； 评论

sentences.english: Ron does nothing but criticize and complain all the time.
sentences.chinese: 罗恩什么也不干，只是一味指责和抱怨。

sentences.english: The new law has been widely criticized .
sentences.chinese: 这项新法律受到了广泛的批评。

sentences.english: We look at each other’s work and criticize it.
sentences.chinese: 我们交换作品，互相提出批评意见。

detailed_translations.english: to express your disapproval of someone or something, or to talk about their faults

sentences.english: ‘You sold the car?’ she asked, incredulous.
sentences.chinese: “你把车卖了？”她难以置信地问道。

detailed_translations.english: unable or unwilling to believe something

sentences.english: We condole with him on his loss.
sentences.chinese: 我们对他的损失深表同情。

name: grid
trans: 格子， 栅格； 地图上的坐标方格， 网格； 输电网， 煤气输送网

sentences.english: the national grid
sentences.chinese: 国家电网

detailed_translations.english: the network of electricity supply wires that connects  power stations  and provides electricity to buildings in an area

name: circumference
trans: 周围， 周边； 圆周； 周长

sentences.english: ...a scientist calculating the Earth's circumference.
sentences.chinese: …一位正在计算地球周长的科学家。

detailed_translations.english: the distance or measurement around the outside of a circle or any round shape

name: rage
trans: 猛烈地继续，激烈进行；发怒，怒斥；迅速蔓延，猖獗
风靡一时的事物， 时尚； 狂怒

sentences.english: Sobbing with rage, Carol was taken to the hospital.
sentences.chinese: 卡罗尔气得呜呜哭，被送往医院。

sentences.english: Richens was 17 when he flew into a rage and stabbed another teenager.
sentences.chinese: 里琴斯17岁那年一怒之下捅了一名少年。

detailed_translations.chinese: 愤怒；狂暴，肆虐；情绪激动
detailed_translations.english: a strong feeling of uncontrollable anger
to feel very angry about something and show this in the way you behave or speak

name: finalize
trans: 使完成； 把…最后定下来； 定稿

sentences.english: But if you lose your audience with technical explanations, you'll never get to what you want: a resolution so you can finalize your design.
sentences.chinese: 但是如果您用技术性的解释使受众迷惑，则您永远得不到希望达到的目的：完成设计的解决办法。

sentences.english: The hull had suffered extensive damage to the starboard side.
sentences.chinese: 船体右舷遭到大面积损坏。

detailed_translations.english: the main part of a ship that goes in the water
to take off the outer part of vegetables, rice, grain etc

name: preside
trans: 担任主席； 主持； 掌管

sentences.english: I shall be pleased to preside at your meetings.
sentences.chinese: 我很高兴主持你们的会议。

sentences.english: Mr Justice Waller, presiding judge for the northeast
sentences.chinese: 沃勒法官，东北地区的首席法官

detailed_translations.english: to be in charge of a formal event, organization, ceremony etc

name: board
trans: 登机， 上船； 搭伙， 寄宿
膳食费用；委员会，董事会；板，木板

sentences.english: a board meeting
sentences.chinese: 董事会会议

sentences.english: a board member
sentences.chinese: 董事会成员

detailed_translations.english: a group of people in a company or other organization who make the rules and important decisions

name: economic
trans: 经济的； 经济上的； 经济学的； 合算的

sentences.english: Economic growth is slow.
sentences.chinese: 经济增长缓慢。

sentences.english: the government’s economic policy
sentences.chinese: 政府的经济政策

sentences.english: Economic reform is needed.
sentences.chinese: 经济改革势在必行。

sentences.english: In the current economic climate (= conditions ), we must keep costs down.
sentences.chinese: 在当前的经济形势下，我们一定要控制好成本。

detailed_translations.english: relating to trade, in-dustry, and the management of money

name: stuff
trans: 填满， 塞满； 让…吃饱

sentences.english: I’ve got some sticky stuff on my shoe.
sentences.chinese: 我鞋子上有什么黏糊糊的东西。

sentences.english: How do you think you’re going to fit all that stuff into the car?
sentences.chinese: 你说这么多东西你怎么装进车里？

sentences.english: I felt sorry for the ones who had to eat the awful stuff.
sentences.chinese: 我很同情那些只能吃这种难吃东西的人。

sentences.english: Where’s all the camping stuff?
sentences.chinese: 野营用的东西都在哪儿？

detailed_translations.english: used when you are talking about things such as substances, materials, or groups of objects when you do not know what they are called, or it is not important to say exactly what they are

sentences.english: a young mother trying to control her offspring
sentences.chinese: 一个想管住自己孩子的年轻妈妈

detailed_translations.english: someone’s child or children – often used humorously

name: whim
trans: 一时的兴致， 冲动； 怪念头， 奇想

sentences.english: On arrival, she buys a glass factory on a whim, and challenges him to transport a church built entirely of glass by boat from Sydney 250 miles up the coast.
sentences.chinese: 到达目的地后，她突发奇想买了一个玻璃厂，并向他挑战，让他用船沿着 250 英里长的海岸线从悉尼运来建造一整座玻璃教堂。

sentences.english: An idle whim, I fear, sir,' was my answer; `or else an idle whim is going to spirit me away.
sentences.chinese: “恐怕是一种无聊的奇想，先生，”这是我的回答，“不然就是一种无聊的奇想又要诱使我走开。

detailed_translations.english: a sudden feeling that you would like to do or have something, especially when there is no important or good reason

name: arrest
trans: 逮捕， 拘留； 停止， 阻止； 吸引

sentences.english: He was arrested and charged with murder.
sentences.chinese: 他遭到逮捕并被指控谋杀。

sentences.english: I got arrested for careless driving.
sentences.chinese: 我因鲁莽驾驶被捕。

sentences.english: drugs used to arrest the spread of the disease
sentences.chinese: 用于控制疾病蔓延的药物

detailed_translations.english: if the police arrest someone, the person is taken to a  police station  because the police think they have done something illegal

sentences.english: They are all perforated by openings of their own, but few line up, meaning passersby are faced with an assortment of opaque surfaces.
sentences.chinese: 它们都是由自己的洞口穿孔，很少排列起来，意味着路人面对着各式各样的不透明表面。

detailed_translations.english: a mixture of different things or of various kinds of the same thing

name: section
trans: 部分； 地区； 部门； 段落， 章节； 截面， 剖面

sentences.english: The plane’s tail section was found in a cornfield.
sentences.chinese: 飞机的尾部在玉米田里找到了。

sentences.english: the smoking section (= where you can smoke )
sentences.chinese: 吸烟区

detailed_translations.english: one of the parts that something such as an object or place is divided into

sentences.english: The rumor rocked the whole city.
sentences.chinese: 谣言使整个城市惊慌不安。

sentences.english: In fact the rumor is without foundation.
sentences.chinese: 事实上，这个谣传没有根据。

name: overflow
trans: 溢出； 容纳不下的物

sentences.english: The drains flooded and water overflowed down the main street.
sentences.chinese: 下水道被淹，水溢到了大街上。

sentences.english: The river had overflowed its banks.
sentences.chinese: 河水漫堤了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 满得外溢，外流，泛滥；充满，洋溢
detailed_translations.english: if a river, lake, or container overflows, it is so full that the liquid or material inside flows over its edges

detailed_translations.chinese: 淹没， 从…中溢出， 多得无法容纳
detailed_translations.english: if a river, lake, or container overflows, it is so full that the liquid or material inside flows over its edges

detailed_translations.chinese: 容纳不下的物； 溢出， 满出； 溢流口， 溢流管
detailed_translations.english: the amount of something or the number of people that cannot be contained in a place because it is already full

name: provoke
trans: 挑动， 激怒， 挑衅； 引发， 引起

sentences.english: The dog would not have attacked if it hadn’t been provoked.
sentences.chinese: 如果不是被惹恼了，那狗原本不会攻击的。

sentences.english: Paul tried to provoke Fletch into a fight.
sentences.chinese: 保罗试图激怒弗莱琪打一架。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone angry, especially deliberately

name: enrich
trans: 使充实； 使肥沃； 使富裕， 使富有

sentences.english: Add fertilizer to enrich the soil.
sentences.chinese: 施上肥料使土壤肥沃。

sentences.english: Education can greatly enrich your life.
sentences.chinese: 教育可以大大充实生活。

detailed_translations.english: to improve the quality of something, especially by adding things to it

sentences.english: I’ve strained a muscle in my leg.
sentences.chinese: 我的腿有一处肌肉拉伤。

sentences.english: You’ll strain your eyes trying to read in this light.
sentences.chinese: 在这样的光线下看书会伤眼睛的。

detailed_translations.english: to injure a muscle or part of your body by using it too much or making it work too hard
to try very hard to do something using all your strength or ability

name: otherwise
trans: 另样，用别的方法；在其他方面

sentences.english: He was tired but otherwise in good health.
sentences.chinese: 他除了累身体很好。

sentences.english: I could hear the distant noise of traffic. Otherwise all was still.
sentences.chinese: 我能听见远处车流的声音，除此之外，一切都很安静。

sentences.english: This spoiled an otherwise excellent piece of work.
sentences.chinese: 这就把本来很出色的一件作品毁掉了。

sentences.english: Their arrival livened up an otherwise dull afternoon.
sentences.chinese: 他们的到来使原本沉闷的午后活跃起来了。

detailed_translations.english: except for what has just been mentioned

name: marked
trans: 显著的； 有记号的； 被监视的

sentences.english: a marked lack of enthusiasm
sentences.chinese: 明显缺乏热情

sentences.english: The patient showed a marked improvement in her condition after changing medication.
sentences.chinese: 换药治疗后病人的病情明显好转。

sentences.english: Miller’s organized desk stood in marked contrast to the rest of the office.
sentences.chinese: 米勒的桌子上整理得井井有条，和办公室里的其他桌子形成明显的对比。

detailed_translations.english: very easy to notice

detailed_translations.chinese: 表示（mark的过去分词）；作记号；打分数

name: pathological
trans: 病态的； 病理学的； 不理智的， 无道理的

sentences.english: a pathological hatred of women
sentences.chinese: 对女人的病态憎恨

sentences.english: a pathological liar
sentences.chinese: 病态说谎者

detailed_translations.chinese: 病态的， 不理智的； 病理学的
detailed_translations.english: pathological behaviour or feelings happen regularly, and are strong, unreasonable, and impossible to control

name: recital
trans: 音乐演奏会； 诗歌朗诵会； 赘述

sentences.english: a piano recital
sentences.chinese: 钢琴独奏会

detailed_translations.chinese: 独奏会， 独唱会， 小型舞蹈表演会； 吟诵
detailed_translations.english: a performance of music or poetry, usually given by one performer

sentences.english: The comet is visible to the naked eye (= can be seen without using special equipment ).
sentences.chinese: 这颗彗星肉眼看得见。

sentences.english: Check the plant for any visible signs of disease.
sentences.chinese: 检查一下植物是否有患病的迹象。

detailed_translations.english: something that is visible can be seen

sentences.english: Other people’s houses always intrigued her.
sentences.chinese: 别人的房子总令她好奇。

detailed_translations.english: to make secret plans to harm someone or make them lose their position of power
if something intrigues you, it interests you a lot because it seems strange or mysterious

detailed_translations.chinese: 阴谋， 诡计， 密谋
detailed_translations.english: the making of secret plans to harm someone or make them lose their position of power, or a plan of this kind

sentences.english: My hair tangles easily.
sentences.chinese: 我的头发很容易打结。

sentences.english: His parachute became tangled in the wheels of the plane.
sentences.chinese: 他的降落伞缠在了飞机的轮子上。

detailed_translations.english: to become twisted together, or make something become twisted together, in an untidy mass

detailed_translations.chinese: 乱糟糟的一堆， 混乱； 复杂的问题； 困惑
detailed_translations.english: a confused state or situation

name: orient
trans: 使适应； 确定方向， 定位

sentences.english: She looked at the street names, trying to orient herself.
sentences.chinese: 她看看街名，试图确定自己的方位。

detailed_translations.chinese: 使适应；确定方向；使朝东
detailed_translations.english: to find exactly where you are by looking around you or using a map
the eastern part of the world, especially China and Japan
to find exactly where you are by looking around you or using a map

name: recurring
trans: 往复的， 反复的， 再次发生的

detailed_translations.chinese: 反复的； 再次发生的

sentences.english: a small tranquil village
sentences.chinese: 宁静的小村庄

detailed_translations.english: pleasantly calm, quiet, and peaceful

name: pleasing
trans: 令人高兴的， 愉快的

sentences.english: a pleasing sound
sentences.chinese: 悦耳的声音

detailed_translations.chinese: 令人愉快的；讨人喜欢的；合意的
detailed_translations.english: giving pleasure, enjoyment, or satisfaction

sentences.english: an inner room
sentences.chinese: 内室

sentences.english: inner London
sentences.chinese: 伦敦中心区

sentences.english: the inner ear
sentences.chinese: 内耳

sentences.english: Yoga gives me a sense of inner calm.
sentences.chinese: 练习瑜伽使我感到内心平和。

detailed_translations.english: on the inside or close to the centre of something

sentences.english: The voyage from England to India used to take six months.
sentences.chinese: 过去从英格兰到印度要航行六个月。

sentences.english: the Titanic’s maiden voyage
sentences.chinese: “泰坦尼克”号的首航

sentences.english: I don’t want to make the voyage single-handed.
sentences.chinese: 我不想独自航行。

sentences.english: These are the voyages of the starship Enterprise.
sentences.chinese: 这些就是“企业”号星舰几次航行的经历。

detailed_translations.english: a long journey in a ship or spacecraft
to travel to a place, especially by ship

name: keen
trans: 灵敏的， 敏锐的； 热心的， 渴望的； 激烈的； 锋利的

sentences.english: keen students
sentences.chinese: 求知若渴的学生

sentences.english: The kids in my class are all very keen.
sentences.chinese: 我班上的学生都很好学。

sentences.english: She was new in the job and keen as mustard (= very keen ).
sentences.chinese: 她刚开始做这工作，热情很高。

detailed_translations.chinese: 热心的； 激烈的； 敏锐的
detailed_translations.english: someone who is keen is eager to work or learn, and enjoys doing it

sentences.english: Nutrition and exercise are essential to fitness and health.
sentences.chinese: 营养和运动是保持健康所必不可少的。

sentences.english: a nutrition expert
sentences.chinese: 营养专家

detailed_translations.english: the process of giving or getting the right type of food for good health and growth

sentences.english: His boss discharged him for habitual absenteeism.
sentences.chinese: 他的老板因他习惯性旷工而解雇了他。

sentences.english: School refusal — any kind of absenteeism, from phobia to truancy, that can be traced to the child’s own actions and wishes — is at the very intersection of education, psychology and pediatrics.
sentences.chinese: 拒学症---任何一种旷课，从恐惧到逃学，都能从孩子自身的品行和愿望上找到根源---而且是教育，心理学和儿科学等因素交织在一起。

detailed_translations.english: Absenteeism is the fact or habit of frequently being away from work or school, usually without a good reason

sentences.english: a bowl of breakfast cereal
sentences.chinese: 一碗早餐麦片

detailed_translations.chinese: 谷类，谷物；谷类食品；谷类植物
detailed_translations.english: a breakfast food made from grain and usually eaten with milk

sentences.english: a slow shuffling gait
sentences.chinese: 迟缓拖沓的步子

detailed_translations.english: the way someone walks

name: overhaul
trans: 仔细检查； 彻底检修
仔细检查； 彻底检修

sentences.english: The car needs a complete overhaul.
sentences.chinese: 这辆汽车需要大修。

detailed_translations.chinese: 仔细检查； 彻底检修
detailed_translations.english: necessary changes or repairs made to a machine or system

detailed_translations.chinese: 仔细检查； 彻底检修
detailed_translations.english: to repair or change the necessary parts in a machine, system etc that is not working correctly

name: elementary
trans: 初级的， 基础的； 基本的； 简单的

sentences.english: the elementary principles of justice and democracy
sentences.chinese: 正义和民主的基本信条

sentences.english: You’ve made a very elementary mistake.
sentences.chinese: 你犯了一个非常基本的错误。

sentences.english: I’m only familiar with the subject at an elementary level.
sentences.chinese: 我对这门学科的了解只是初级水平。

detailed_translations.english: simple or basic

name: solemn
trans: 庄严的， 严肃的； 隆重的

sentences.english: a solemn expression
sentences.chinese: 严肃的表情

sentences.english: Their faces suddenly grew solemn.
sentences.chinese: 他们的脸突然变得严肃起来。

sentences.english: a solemn procession of mourners
sentences.chinese: 庄重的送葬队伍

sentences.english: solemn ritual/ceremony
sentences.chinese: 隆重的仪式/典礼

detailed_translations.chinese: 严肃的，庄重的；庄严的,隆重的
detailed_translations.english: very serious and not happy, for example because something bad has happened or because you are at an important occasion

name: perceive
trans: 感知， 察觉； 理解

sentences.english: That morning, he perceived a change in Franca’s mood.
sentences.chinese: 那天早上，他注意到弗兰卡情绪的变化。

sentences.english: Cats are not able to perceive colour.
sentences.chinese: 猫不能辨别颜色。

detailed_translations.english: to notice, see, or recognize something

name: embarrass
trans: 使尴尬， 使困窘； 使困惑

sentences.english: He didn’t want to embarrass her by asking questions.
sentences.chinese: 他不想提问让她尴尬。

sentences.english: The revelations in the press have embarrassed the government.
sentences.chinese: 报纸披露的事实让政府很难堪。

detailed_translations.chinese: 使困窘,使局促不安；阻碍,麻烦
detailed_translations.english: to make someone feel ashamed, nervous, or uncomfortable, especially in front of other people

name: politics
trans: 政治； 政纲， 政见； 政治事务； 权术； 政治学

sentences.english: I assume her politics must be fairly conservative.
sentences.chinese: 我猜她的政治观点一定相当保守。

detailed_translations.english: someone’s political beliefs and opinions

name: acute
trans: 严重的； 极度的， 激烈的； 敏锐的

sentences.english: Young children have a particularly acute sense of smell.
sentences.chinese: 幼儿的嗅觉特别灵敏。

detailed_translations.english: acute senses such as hearing, taste, touch etc are very good and sensitive

name: stigma
trans: 污点， 耻辱； 烙印； 特征

sentences.english: There is a social stigma attached to single parenthood.
sentences.chinese: 单身父母在社会上的名声不光彩。

sentences.english: In the US, smoking carries a stigma .
sentences.chinese: 在美国，吸烟是不光彩的。

detailed_translations.chinese: [植] 柱头；耻辱；污名；烙印；特征
detailed_translations.english: a strong feeling in society that being in a particular situation or having a particular illness is something to be ashamed of

name: pathology
trans: 反常， 变态； 病理学； 病状

sentences.english: One person may show lots of pathology in their brain while another shows very little, yet both may have had dementia.
sentences.chinese: 即使两人都患有痴呆症，但一人的大脑可能在病理现象中呈现较多，而另一个人可能较少。

sentences.english: According to the scientific team, only one of these four categories of gamblers actually shows signs of a significant pathology.
sentences.chinese: 根据科学小组得知，事实上在这四种赌徒里只有一种显示出明显的病理学的迹象。

sentences.english: It makes sense to leave the ovaries if there is no risk factors or pathology at the time of surgery, especially in young women since those are the ones who seem to be most affected.
sentences.chinese: 斯科西亚说，“如果在手术时没有出现危险因素或病理原因，那么保留卵巢就是合理的，尤其是那些年轻妇女，因为她们似乎是受到影响最大的人群。”

detailed_translations.english: the study of the causes and effects of illnesses

name: silica
trans: 硅石， 硅土； 二氧化硅

sentences.english: While her team is confident that coal burning is causing the high rates of cancer, they are not certain it is due to silica.
sentences.chinese: 她的团队相信，煤的燃烧导致了肺癌的高发病率，但是他们不能确定这是二氧化硅引起的。

sentences.english: The basic ingredients in glass, including silica sand and soda ash, are found almost everywhere.
sentences.chinese: 玻璃的基本原料，包括硅砂和纯碱，几乎可以在任何地方找到。

sentences.english: The silica in cucumber is an essential component of healthy connective tissue, which includes muscles, tendons, ligaments, cartilage, and bone.
sentences.chinese: 黄瓜中的硅是健康的结缔组织的重要组成部分，结缔组织包括肌肉、肌腱、韧带、软骨和骨。

detailed_translations.english: a chemical  compound  that exists naturally as sand,  quartz  , and  flint  , used in making glass

name: crucial
trans: 至关重要的， 决定性的

sentences.english: The conservation of tropical forests is of crucial importance .
sentences.chinese: 保护热带雨林至关重要。

detailed_translations.english: something that is crucial is extremely important, because everything else depends on it

name: contribute
trans: 贡献， 捐赠； 有助于； 投稿

sentences.english: The U.S. is contributing $4 billion in loans, credits, and grants.
sentences.chinese: 美国以信贷和赠与的方式捐助了40亿美元。

sentences.english: Local businesses have agreed to contribute.
sentences.chinese: 当地的公司已经同意捐助了。

detailed_translations.english: To contribute money or resources to something means to give money or resources to help pay for something or to help achieve a particular purpose

name: remark
trans: 评论， 评语； 注释

sentences.english: to make a remark
sentences.chinese: 发表评论

sentences.english: Critics remarked that the play was not original.
sentences.chinese: 评论家们指出这部戏剧缺乏创意

detailed_translations.english: something that you say when you express an opinion or say what you have noticed
to say or write a comment about sth/sb

sentences.english: The slightest movement will defocus the microscope.
sentences.chinese: 最轻微的运动都会使显微镜散焦。

sentences.english: The microscope magnified the object two hundred times.
sentences.chinese: 这架显微镜把实物放大了200倍。

sentences.english: The microscope capacitates small objects to be observed.
sentences.chinese: 显微镜可以观察到微小的物体。

detailed_translations.english: a scientific instrument that makes extremely small things look larger

sentences.english: Political dissenters were imprisoned.
sentences.chinese: 持不同政见者遭到监禁。

detailed_translations.english: a person or organization that disagrees with an official decision or accepted opinion

name: strive
trans: 奋斗， 努力； 力求

sentences.english: I was still striving to be successful.
sentences.chinese: 我仍在努力争取成功。

sentences.english: We must continue to strive for greater efficiency.
sentences.chinese: 我们必须继续为提高效率而努力。

detailed_translations.english: to make a great effort to achieve something

sentences.english: a presidential candidate
sentences.chinese: 总统候选人

sentences.english: Candidates are not allowed to use a calculator in this exam.
sentences.chinese: 这次考试的应试者不可以使用计算器。

detailed_translations.english: someone who is being considered for a job or is competing in an election

sentences.english: The roses have fungus.
sentences.chinese: 玫瑰花长了真菌。

sentences.english: So how do you kill a fungus without harming its host?
sentences.chinese: 问题在于，我们如何才能做到不伤害宿主只杀死真菌呢?。

sentences.english: Monokaryons of this fungus will grow readily as saprophytes in plate or liquid culture .
sentences.chinese: 这种真菌的单核体在平板或液体培养时能像腐生菌那样容易生长。

detailed_translations.english: a simple type of plant that has no leaves or flowers and that grows on plants or other surfaces.  mushrooms  and  mould  are both fungi.

name: intelligible
trans: 聪明的， 理智的； 易懂的， 易理解的

sentences.english: His reply was barely intelligible.
sentences.chinese: 他的回复几乎让人听不懂。

detailed_translations.english: if speech, writing, or an idea is intelligible, it can be easily understood

sentences.english: We were driving along Follyfoot Road.
sentences.chinese: 我们沿着福莱福特路行驶。

sentences.english: She glanced anxiously along the line of faces.
sentences.chinese: 她焦急地扫视着这一排面孔。

sentences.english: He slid his hand along her arm.
sentences.chinese: 他的手顺着她的臂膀滑下。

sentences.english: I was driving along, thinking about Chris.
sentences.chinese: 我一边开车，一边想着克里斯。

detailed_translations.english: from one place on something such as a line, road, or edge towards the other end of it
going forward

sentences.english: Lines AB and CD are parallel. AB
sentences.chinese: 线与CD线平行。

sentences.english: two parallel roads
sentences.chinese: 两条平行的道路

sentences.english: Take the road running parallel to the main road just after the village.
sentences.chinese: 过那个村子后走与主干道平行的路。

detailed_translations.chinese: 并列的，平行的；类似的；对应的；并联的
detailed_translations.english: two lines, paths etc that are parallel to each other are the same distance apart along their whole length

detailed_translations.chinese: 可相比拟的事物，相似处；平行线，平行面；纬线
detailed_translations.english: a relationship or similarity between two things, especially things that exist or happen in different places or at different times

detailed_translations.chinese: 与…相似， 与… 相当， 比得上
detailed_translations.english: if one thing parallels another, they happen at the same time or are similar, and seem to be related

sentences.english: The cashier absconded with the money.
sentences.chinese: 出纳员携款潜逃。

sentences.english: The cashier had run out with eighty thousand pounds in cash.
sentences.chinese: 这个出纳员带着八万镑现钞消失得无影无踪。

detailed_translations.english: someone whose job is to receive or pay out money in a shop

name: inert
trans: 无活动的， 惰性的； 不活泼的， 迟钝的

sentences.english: inert gases
sentences.chinese: 惰性气体

detailed_translations.chinese: [化学] 惰性的；呆滞的；迟缓的；无效的
detailed_translations.english: not producing a chemical reaction when combined with other substances

sentences.english: She doesn’t eat a very healthy diet.
sentences.chinese: 她的饮食不是很健康。

sentences.english: It is important to have a balanced diet.
sentences.chinese: 饮食均衡很重要。

sentences.english: Rice is the staple diet (= the main food that a group of people usually eat ) .
sentences.chinese: 大米是主食。

detailed_translations.english: the kind of food that a person or animal eats each day

name: dissimulate
trans: 掩盖， 掩饰， 假装

sentences.english: This man was too injured to dissimulate well.
sentences.chinese: 这个男人伤得太重，不可能掩盖得住。

sentences.english: He didn't attempt to dissimulate or conceal his true feelings.
sentences.chinese: 他没有尝试着掩饰或隐瞒自己的感受。

detailed_translations.chinese: 掩盖， 掩饰， 假装
detailed_translations.english: When people dissimulate, they hide their true feelings, intentions, or nature

sentences.english: It is believed that it inhibits an enzyme that promotes cell proliferation in tumours.
sentences.chinese: 据信它能抑制一种能在肿瘤中促进细胞增殖的酶的生成。

sentences.english: This enzyme accumulates in the larvae to a level where it becomes toxic and kills them.
sentences.chinese: 这种酶在幼虫体内积累到一定浓度，就会变得有毒并杀死它们。

sentences.english: Apparently, though, CYP2E1 affects how sensitive the brain is to alcohol, perhaps because it —unlike the enzyme in the liver —generates free radicals, tiny molecules that can damage cells.
sentences.chinese: 虽然表面上是这样，CYP2E1却影响着大脑对酒精的敏感度，或许因为它—不像在肝脏中的酶—产生了自由基，能损害细胞的微小分子。

detailed_translations.english: a chemical substance that is produced in a plant or animal, and helps chemical changes to take place in the plant or animal

sentences.english: I never play soccer.
sentences.chinese: 我从来不踢足球。

sentences.english: France and Spain will meet in the soccer cup final.
sentences.chinese: 法国队和西班牙队将在足球锦标赛决赛中交锋。

sentences.english: It must be one of those soccer scarfs from England.
sentences.chinese: 那一定是某个英国足球队的围巾。

detailed_translations.english: a sport played by two teams of 11 players, who try to kick a round ball into their opponents’  goal

sentences.english: The congressman was accused of a breach of secrecy rules.
sentences.chinese: 这个国会议员被指控违反保密条例。

detailed_translations.english: an action that breaks a law, rule, or agreement
to break a law, rule, or agreement

sentences.english: Can I have some bread and butter?
sentences.chinese: 能给我一些面包和黄油吗?。

sentences.english: Do you like butter?
sentences.chinese: 你喜欢黄油吗？

sentences.english: We never use cheese, butter or something like that to cook it.
sentences.chinese: 我们从未使用乳酪，黄油或者类如此物来烹调食品。

detailed_translations.english: a solid yellow food made from milk or cream that you spread on bread or use in cooking
to spread butter on something

name: wit
trans: 智力， 才智； 风趣； 机智幽默的人

sentences.english: The information is there and waiting to be accessed by anyone with the wit to use it.
sentences.chinese: 信息是现成的，等着有头脑的人去获取和利用。

detailed_translations.english: If you say that someone has the wit to do something, you mean that they have the intelligence and understanding to make the right decision or take the right action in a particular situation
that is to say; namely (used to introduce statements, as in legal documents)

sentences.english: Because I wish I can respire the natural fresh air during exercise , which is more health and benefit to my body.
sentences.chinese: 因为我喜欢在运动的同时能呼吸到大自然的清新空气，这样更健康，更有益。

sentences.english: He also discovered that plants respire in the same way as animals, taking up oxygen and giving out carbon dioxide.
sentences.chinese: 另外，他还发现了植物拥有和动物相同的呼吸方式，即吸收氧气并释放出二氧化碳。

sentences.english: Some products, such as asparagus, corn, and strawberries, respire at a higher rate than other products, such as apples, oranges, and potatoes.
sentences.chinese: 一些农产品，比如芦笋、玉米和草莓，与其它农产品（如苹果、桔子和马铃薯）相比，其呼吸速率较大。

detailed_translations.english: to breathe

name: selective
trans: 选择的， 选择性的； 精挑细选的

sentences.english: selective schools
sentences.chinese: 择优录取学生的学校

sentences.english: He has a very selective memory (= he chooses what he wants to remember and what to forget ) .
sentences.chinese: 他的记忆选择性很强。

detailed_translations.english: careful about what you choose to do, buy, allow etc

sentences.english: The boy picked up a handful of stones and started throwing them at us.
sentences.chinese: 那男孩捡起一把石子，开始朝我们扔过来。

sentences.english: There were only a handful of people there.
sentences.chinese: 文例句：那里只有几个人。

detailed_translations.english: an amount that you can hold in your hand

name: rebate
trans: 回扣， 折扣； 退还款

sentences.english: Deposit any random checks you get - like rebate, rewards or reimbursement checks - into this fund.
sentences.chinese: 把你挣的随机钱——比如像回扣，鉴赏，或偿款等——存到这个基金里。

sentences.english: I placed an order for desktop pc memory which came with a $20 MIR [mail in rebate].
sentences.chinese: 我订购了一个价值20美元的桌面个人电脑存储器，可以申请回扣的。

sentences.english: Tax cuts provided the stimulus which the slow economy needed.
sentences.chinese: 减税为不景气的经济带来了其所需的刺激。

detailed_translations.english: something that helps a process to develop more quickly or more strongly

name: systematize
trans: 使系统化， 使条理化， 使成体系

sentences.english: This basic plugin is undoubtedly one of the important plugins to systematize the archives.
sentences.chinese: 这个插件无疑是系统化归档的重要插件之一。

sentences.english: The Global Vault is part of a broader effort to gather and systematize information about plants and their genes, which climate change experts say may indeed prove more valuable than gold.
sentences.chinese: 目前，世界上很多人士致力于收集种子及其种子基因的信息并使之系统化，全球种子地库是这种全球性努力的的一个缩影。 气候变化专家称，这些信息要比金子还要贵重。

detailed_translations.english: to put facts, numbers, ideas etc into a particular order

name: barter
trans: 实物交易， 以物易物

sentences.english: They have been bartering wheat for cotton and timber.
sentences.chinese: 他们一直在用小麦交换棉花和木材。

detailed_translations.chinese: 进行易货贸易；[贸易] 作物物交换；讨价还价
detailed_translations.english: to exchange goods, work, or services for other goods or services rather than for money

detailed_translations.chinese: 易货贸易；物物交换；实物交易
detailed_translations.english: a system of exchanging goods and services for other goods and services rather than using money

name: bewilder
trans: 使迷惑， 使不知所措

sentences.english: He was bewildered by his daughter’s reaction.
sentences.chinese: 他被女儿的反应弄糊涂了。

detailed_translations.english: to confuse someone

sentences.english: the regimented routine of boarding school
sentences.chinese: 寄宿学校严格的生活规律

detailed_translations.english: to organize and control people firmly and usually too strictly
a large group of soldiers, usually consisting of several  battalion s

sentences.english: a terminal branch of a tree
sentences.chinese: 树顶枝条

sentences.english: terminal examinations (= at the end of a course, etc.)
sentences.chinese: 期终考试

sentences.english: the airport’s passenger terminal
sentences.chinese: 机场航站楼

detailed_translations.english: at the end of sth

detailed_translations.chinese: 〔飞机、公共汽车、轮船客运或货物运输的〕集散站，终点站
detailed_translations.english: a big building where people wait to get onto planes, buses, or ships, or where goods are loaded

sentences.english: a kerosene lamp
sentences.chinese: 煤油灯

detailed_translations.english: a clear oil that is burnt to provide heat or light

name: diminish
trans: 降低， 贬低； 减少， 减弱

sentences.english: The party’s share of the electorate has diminished steadily.
sentences.chinese: 支持这个政党的选民比例持续下降。

sentences.english: These drugs diminish blood flow to the brain.
sentences.chinese: 这些药物会减少流向脑部的血液量。

detailed_translations.english: to become or make something become smaller or less

detailed_translations.chinese: 减少， 减小， 降低
detailed_translations.english: to become or make something become smaller or less

name: surpass
trans: 超过， 超越， 胜过

sentences.english: He had surpassed all our expectations .
sentences.chinese: 他超越了我们所有的预期。

sentences.english: The number of multiple births has surpassed 100,000 for the first time.
sentences.chinese: 多胎产首次突破了 10 万例。

detailed_translations.english: to be even better or greater than someone or something else

name: linguist
trans: 语言学家； 通晓数国语言的人

sentences.english: He had a scholarly air and was an accomplished linguist.
sentences.chinese: 他有一种学者的风度，而且是个熟练掌握多国语言的人。

detailed_translations.english: someone who studies or teaches linguistics

sentences.english: How can I pull the pearl from the burning oyster?
sentences.chinese: 我怎样做才能算是从燃烧的牡蛎中取出珍珠？

detailed_translations.english: a type of shellfish that can be eaten cooked or uncooked, and that produces a jewel called a pearl

name: aloof
trans: 远离的； 冷淡的， 冷漠的

sentences.english: Beneath that aloof exterior, Gayle is a warm, sympathetic person.
sentences.chinese: 在冷漠的外表下，盖尔是个有同情心的热心人。

detailed_translations.english: unfriendly and deliberately not talking to other people

sentences.english: Society continues to idealize the two-parent family.
sentences.chinese: 社会依然把双亲家庭视为理想家庭。

sentences.english: an idealized view of marriage
sentences.chinese: 理想化的婚姻观

detailed_translations.english: to imagine or represent something or someone as being perfect or better than they really are

sentences.english: He heard the heavy rounds gouge the ancient concrete, followed by the panicked cries of Grunts in the distance as they dove for cover—and into the semi-gelatinous, ankle-deep liquid.
sentences.chinese: 子弹凿击古老混凝土的声音清晰可辨，接着远处传来了野猪兽卧倒在深及脚踝的半凝胶状液体中隐蔽时恐慌的呼喊声。

name: attention
trans: 注意， 留心； 立正

sentences.english: My attention wasn’t really on the game.
sentences.chinese: 我的注意力其实不在比赛上。

sentences.english: She tried to pay attention to what he was saying.
sentences.chinese: 她尽量注意听他说话。

sentences.english: If you paid more attention in class, you might actually learn something!
sentences.chinese: 要是你上课更认真些，也许能实实在在地学到些东西！

sentences.english: Scott sat down at his desk and turned his attention to the file he had in front of him.
sentences.chinese: 斯科特在自己的办公桌前坐下，将注意力转向面前的文件。

sentences.english: As a society we need to give more attention to the needs of older people.
sentences.chinese: 生活在同一社会里，我们得更加关注长者的需求。

sentences.english: Now he’s gone, I can give you my undivided attention .
sentences.chinese: 现在他已经走了，我可以把全部注意力都放在你身上。

sentences.english: This game is fun and is sure to keep the attention of any young student.
sentences.chinese: 这个游戏很有趣，一定能使年幼学生保持注意力。

sentences.english: They listened to the speech with close attention .
sentences.chinese: 他们很认真地听演讲。

sentences.english: Attention to detail is essential in this job.
sentences.chinese: 关注细节是这份工作所必需的。

sentences.english: During the lecture Sarah’s attention began to wander .
sentences.chinese: 上课时，萨拉开始走神了。

detailed_translations.english: when you carefully listen to, look at, or think about someone or something

name: succumb
trans: 屈服， 屈从； 死亡

sentences.english: Don't succumb to the temptation to have just one cigarette.
sentences.chinese: 不要屈服于只抽一支烟的诱惑。

detailed_translations.english: to stop opposing someone or something that is stronger than you, and allow them to take control

sentences.english: the disproportionate amount of money being spent on defence
sentences.chinese: 比例失衡的国防开支

detailed_translations.english: too much or too little in relation to something else

sentences.english: Things are not yet carried to that extent.
sentences.chinese: 事情还没有发展到那种程度。

sentences.english: When the smoke blew away, we could see the extent of the damage.
sentences.chinese: 浓烟消散后， 我们就能看清破坏的程度了。

sentences.english: The extent of human cooperation is unique, but not cooperation itself.
sentences.chinese: 人类的合作程度，而非合作本身，是独一无二的。

sentences.english: Blue veins showed through her translucent skin.
sentences.chinese: 她半透明的皮肤下青筋显现。

detailed_translations.english: not trans-parent, but clear enough to allow light to pass through

sentences.english: The volcano threw new showers of magma and ash into the air.
sentences.chinese: 这座火山向空气中喷发了新的岩浆和火山灰。

detailed_translations.english: hot melted rock below the surface of the Earth

sentences.english: As a fossil hunter, Shubin distinguished himself by leading an expedition to the Arctic in 2004 which uncovered the remains of a fish with a wrist, a creature with part fin, part limb.
sentences.chinese: 作为一名化石搜寻者，舒宾的杰出成就是在2004年带领了一次北极探险。 在这次探险中，他们发现了一种半鳍半肢的动物——一条有腕的鱼化石。

detailed_translations.english: one of the thin body parts that a fish uses to swim

sentences.english: spaghetti sauces
sentences.chinese: 意大利面酱

detailed_translations.english: a thick cooked liquid that is served with food to give it a particular taste

sentences.english: There you are, in the coffin, or in an urn, your body reduced to a husk of meant-to-be's.
sentences.chinese: 你现在是这副样子，躺在棺材里，或者骨灰盒里。 你的身体沦为一张毫无意思的臭皮囊。

sentences.english: All the days of his separation shall he eat nothing that is made of the vine tree, from the kernels even to the husk.
sentences.chinese: 在一切离俗的日子，凡葡萄树上结的，自核至皮所作的物，都不可吃。

sentences.english: How can we remove the husk of the grains?
sentences.chinese: 我们怎样去掉谷物的外皮？

detailed_translations.english: to remove the husks from grains, seeds etc
the dry outer part of corn, some grains, seeds, nuts etc

name: fix
trans: 修理；使固定，安装；安排；找到，确定
解决方法； 困境， 窘境

sentences.english: The interest rate has been fixed at 6.5%.
sentences.chinese: 利率已经定为6.5%。

sentences.english: The shelves should be fixed to the wall with screws.
sentences.chinese: 架子应当用螺丝固定在墙上。

detailed_translations.english: to decide on a limit for something, especially prices, costs etc, so that they do not change

name: colonial
trans: 殖民的； 殖民国家的

sentences.english: the struggle against colonial rule
sentences.chinese: 反抗殖民统治的斗争

sentences.chinese: 那家工厂被纵火焚烧。

sentences.chinese: 管理层已同意延长最后期限。

sentences.chinese: 在热带的太平洋地区，这两种现象的交替周期超过了两到七年。

sentences.chinese: 要让老虎眨眼，可以通过在相应的 XML 中定位这两个区域及其路径来在两个区域间交替透明性。

two alternate things are placed one after the other in a regular pattern
An alternate is a person or thing that replaces another, and can act or be used instead of them

name: unbridgeable
trans: 不能架桥的； 不能逾越的

sentences.english: ...the so-called unbridgeable gap between the world of humans and that of chimpanzees.
sentences.chinese: ...人类社会和黑猩猩社会间所谓的不可逾越的鸿沟。

detailed_translations.chinese: 不能架桥的， 不能逾越的
detailed_translations.english: An unbridgeable gap or divide between two sides in an argument is so great that the two sides seem unlikely ever to agree

sentences.english: Her actions infuriated her mother.
sentences.chinese: 她的举动使她母亲极为生气。

sentences.english: It infuriated him that Beth was with another man.
sentences.chinese: 贝丝和另一个男人在一起，这使他极为愤怒。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone extremely angry

sentences.english: Steven’s still in bed with flu .
sentences.chinese: 史蒂文患了流感，仍卧病在床。

sentences.chinese: 她得了流感。

sentences.chinese: 我得了流感，去不了。

sentences.english: Doctors now fear a flu epidemic .
sentences.chinese: 医生现在担心会出现流感大爆发。

detailed_translations.english: a common illness that makes you feel very tired and weak, gives you a sore throat, and makes you cough and have to clear your nose a lot

trans: 跳水； 猛跌， 骤降； 卷入

sentences.chinese: 该政府的政治和经济改革有可能使这个国家陷入混乱之中。

sentences.chinese: 埃迪发现自己突然陷入了一个残酷暴力的世界。

sentences.english: So how do we strengthen our skeptical skills?
sentences.chinese: 那么，我们如何加强自身的怀疑技能呢？

sentences.english: Not all theory that we read in this course is skeptical.
sentences.chinese: 我们在这门课中提及的理论不全是怀疑性的。

sentences.english: L.M.:Well, I was skeptical myself in the beginning. But these are facts. The findings are very reproducible and we are waiting for confirmation by other labs.
sentences.chinese: 大爷：我老人家一开始也是很怀疑的。但是这个是事实。这个发现可以被反复验证，我们正在等待别的实验是的验证。

sentences.english: She studied the envelope, trying to decipher the handwriting.
sentences.chinese: 她仔细地看信封，试图辨认上面的字迹。

detailed_translations.chinese: 解释（过去式deciphered，过去分词deciphered，现在分词deciphering，第三人称单数deciphers，名词decipherer，形容词decipherable）；译解
detailed_translations.english: to find the meaning of something that is difficult to read or understand

sentences.chinese: 当春天到来的时候，所有树开始发芽。

sentences.chinese: 由于国内学术环境恶劣，出国留学造成人才外流的现象已经初显萌芽。

name: naive
trans: 天真的， 率真的， 质朴的； 幼稚的， 无知的， 轻信的； 稚拙派的

sentences.english: a naive young girl

sentences.chinese: 氯被用于污水处理。

sentences.chinese: 这家工厂偷偷地把几百万加仑未经处理的污水排放进了俄亥俄河。
