sentences.chinese: 警察盘问了这名嫌疑犯好几个小时。

detailed_translations.english: to ask someone a lot of questions for a long time in order to get information, sometimes using threats

sentences.english: an astute politician
sentences.chinese: 机敏的政治家

sentences.english: astute investments
sentences.chinese: 精明的投资

detailed_translations.chinese: 机敏的；狡猾的，诡计多端的
detailed_translations.english: able to understand situations or behaviour very well and very quickly, especially so that you can get an advantage for yourself

name: challenge
trans: 挑战；艰巨任务，难题；质疑，质问
向…挑战； 公然反抗； 对…质疑

sentences.english: They threw down the challenge that he couldn’t wash 40 cars in one hour (= invited him to try to do it ) .
sentences.chinese: 他们激将他，说他不可能在1小时内擦洗40辆汽车。

detailed_translations.chinese: 挑战，邀请比赛；艰巨的任务；怀疑，质问
detailed_translations.english: something that tests strength, skill, or ability, especially in a way that is interesting

detailed_translations.chinese: 反对， 公然反抗； 向…挑战； 对…质疑
detailed_translations.english: to refuse to accept that something is right, fair, or legal

name: dignity
trans: 尊严， 庄严； 高贵， 尊贵； 自尊， 自重

sentences.english: We do this because we believe in the dignity and value of every person.
sentences.chinese: 我们这样做是因为我们相信每个人的尊严和价值。

sentences.english: They have to be treated well, with dignity.
sentences.chinese: 必须善待申请人，让人有尊严。

sentences.english: This award must be shared with everyone who strives for justice and dignity.
sentences.chinese: 我一定要与所有为正义和尊严奋斗的人分享此奖。

detailed_translations.english: the ability to behave in a calm controlled way even in a difficult situation

name: unearth
trans: 掘出， 发掘； 揭露

sentences.english: Farmers still sometimes unearth human bones here.
sentences.chinese: 农民们有时仍然能在这里挖到人骨。

sentences.english: In one shop, I unearthed a wonderful collection of 1920s toys.
sentences.chinese: 在一家商店，我发现了一套非常好玩的 20 世纪 20 年代的玩具。

detailed_translations.chinese: 发掘；揭露，发现；从洞中赶出
detailed_translations.english: to find something after searching for it, especially something that has been buried in the ground or lost for a long time

name: emit
trans: 发出； 放射； 排放

sentences.english: The kettle emitted a shrill whistle.
sentences.chinese: 水壶发出了刺耳的鸣笛声。

detailed_translations.english: to send out gas, heat, light, sound etc

name: snap
trans: 猛咬；折断，断裂；打开，关上；呵斥，厉声说；拍照

sentences.english: A twig snapped under my feet.
sentences.chinese: 一根细枝在我脚下嚓一声断开了。

sentences.english: The wind snapped branches and power lines.
sentences.chinese: 大风刮断了树枝和输电线。

detailed_translations.chinese: 咔嚓折断， 啪地绷断； 猛咬； 猛然断裂 <；吧嗒一声；厉声说话， 怒声责骂
detailed_translations.english: to break with a sudden sharp noise, or to make something do this
a judgment or decision made quickly, without careful thought or discussion
to take a photograph
a sudden loud sound, especially made by something breaking or closing

sentences.english: The sleigh jingled along the snowy road.
sentences.chinese: 雪橇在积雪的路上丁当前进。

sentences.english: They believe that -- on the night before Christmas -- he travels through the air in a sleigh pulled by reindeer. He enters each house from the top by sliding down the hole in the fireplace.
sentences.chinese: 小孩子们相信：在圣诞节的前一夜，圣诞老人乘坐驯鹿拉的雪橇从空中而来，他从壁炉的烟囱进入到每家每户，他把给孩子们的圣诞礼物放在圣诞树下。

detailed_translations.english: a large open vehicle with no wheels that is used for travelling over snow and is pulled along by animals

name: govern
trans: 统治， 治理， 管理； 决定， 支配； 控制， 影响

sentences.english: the leaders who govern the country
sentences.chinese: 治理这个国家的领导人

sentences.english: The party had been governing for seven months.
sentences.chinese: 该党执政已经有七个月了。

sentences.english: The universe is governed by the laws of physics.
sentences.chinese: 宇宙受到物理法则的支配。

detailed_translations.english: to officially and legally control a country and make all the decisions about taxes, laws, public services etc

sentences.english: Numerous attempts have been made to hide the truth.
sentences.chinese: 为掩盖事实作了很多尝试。

sentences.english: The two leaders have worked together on numerous occasions.
sentences.chinese: 那两位领导人已经多次合作。

detailed_translations.english: many

name: seismic
trans: 地震的， 地震引起的； 影响深远的， 重大的

sentences.english: increased seismic activity
sentences.chinese: 越来越频繁的地震活动

detailed_translations.chinese: 地震的；因地震而引起的
detailed_translations.english: relating to or caused by  earthquakes

sentences.english: It’s amazing how closely Brian and Steve resemble each other.
sentences.chinese: 布赖恩和史蒂夫真是惊人地相像。

sentences.english: He grew up to resemble his father.
sentences.chinese: 他长大了，很像他父亲。

detailed_translations.english: to look like or be similar to someone or something

name: remote
trans: 偏僻的， 偏远的； 久远的； 远程的； 关系远的； 微乎其微的； 冷漠的

sentences.english: a remote border town
sentences.chinese: 一个偏远的边境小镇

sentences.english: a fire in a remote mountain area
sentences.chinese: 偏远山区的火灾

detailed_translations.chinese: 遥远的， 偏僻的； 关系疏远的； 脱离的； 绝少的； 微乎其微的； 孤高的， 冷淡的
detailed_translations.english: far from towns or other places where people live

name: cafeteria
trans: 自助餐厅， 自助食堂

sentences.english: the school cafeteria
sentences.chinese: 学校餐厅

detailed_translations.english: a restaurant, often in a factory, college etc, where you choose from foods that have already been cooked and carry your own food to a table

name: rupture
trans: 破裂； 决裂， 断绝

sentences.english: The pipe will rupture at its weakest point.
sentences.chinese: 管道最薄弱的地方会破裂的。

sentences.english: His liver was ruptured when a brick wall collapsed on him.
sentences.chinese: 一堵砖墙坍塌压住了他，导致他的肝脏破裂。

detailed_translations.english: to break or burst, or to make something break or burst
an occasion when something suddenly breaks apart or bursts
to affect someone or something in an unpleasant way, and make them suffer

sentences.english: Insect populations fluctuate wildly from year to year.
sentences.chinese: 昆虫的数量每年变化很大。

sentences.english: Prices were volatile, fluctuating between 20 and 40.
sentences.chinese: 价格不稳定，在20至40美元之间波动。

detailed_translations.english: to change frequently in size, amount, quality, etc., especially from one extreme to another

name: calculate
trans: 计算， 核算； 估计， 推测； 计划， 打算

sentences.english: These instruments calculate distances precisely.
sentences.chinese: 这些仪器计算距离非常精确。

detailed_translations.chinese: 计算， 推算； 计划， 打算
detailed_translations.english: to find out how much something will cost, how long something will take etc, by using numbers

name: rancorous
trans: 怨恨的， 满怀恶意的

sentences.english: The deal ended after a series of rancorous disputes.
sentences.chinese: 经过一连串充满敌意的争吵，该交易泡汤了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 怨恨的， 满怀恶意的
detailed_translations.english: A rancorous argument or person is full of bitterness and anger

name: persistent
trans: 坚持的， 百折不挠的； 持续的

sentences.english: persistent rumours
sentences.chinese: 持续流传的谣言

sentences.english: persistent headaches
sentences.chinese: 持续头疼

sentences.english: a persistent problem
sentences.chinese: 长期问题

sentences.english: persistent rain
sentences.chinese: 连绵的雨

detailed_translations.english: continuing to exist or happen, especially for longer than is usual or desirable

name: authorize
trans: 授权； 批准， 许可

sentences.english: an authorized biography
sentences.chinese: 授权传记

detailed_translations.english: to give official permission for something

name: trauma
trans: 精神创伤； 外伤； 痛苦经历

sentences.english: traumas such as death or divorce
sentences.chinese: 死亡、离婚等的巨大痛苦

detailed_translations.english: an unpleasant and upsetting experience that affects you for a long time

sentences.english: The horses were exercised and groomed with special care.
sentences.chinese: 这些马受到特殊的训练和照料。

detailed_translations.chinese: 整饰；推荐；喂马；刷洗（马等）
detailed_translations.english: to clean and brush an animal, especially a horse
a  bridegroom

name: audience
trans: 听众； 观众； 读者

sentences.english: The show attracts a regular audience of about 20 million.
sentences.chinese: 这个节目吸引了大约两千万固定观众收看。

sentences.english: Goya was one of the first painters to look for a wider audience for his work.
sentences.chinese: 戈雅是最早为自己的作品寻找更多观赏者的画家之一。

detailed_translations.english: the people who watch or listen to a particular programme, or who see or hear a particular artist’s, writer’s etc work

sentences.english: Different workers possess different skills.
sentences.chinese: 不同的工人拥有不同技能。

sentences.english: He no longer possessed the power to frighten her.
sentences.chinese: 他再也吓不倒她了。

detailed_translations.english: to have a particular quality or ability

name: dedication
trans: 献身， 奉献； 献词； 奉献仪式

sentences.english: To reach a high level of skill requires talent, dedication, and a lot of hard work.
sentences.chinese: 要达到高级水平需要天分，还需要全身心的投入和很多的努力。

detailed_translations.english: hard work or effort that someone puts into a particular activity because they care about it a lot

sentences.english: I always tried to remain neutral when they started arguing.
sentences.chinese: 他们争论起来的时候我总是努力保持中立。

sentences.english: Clive decided to adopt a neutral position.
sentences.chinese: 克莱夫决定采取中立立场。

sentences.english: The British government acted as a neutral observer during the talks.
sentences.chinese: 英国政府在会谈中扮演了中立观察员的角色。

sentences.english: the neutral language of an official news report
sentences.chinese: 官方新闻报道采用的中性语言

detailed_translations.english: not supporting any of the people or groups involved in an argument or disagreement

name: optional
trans: 可以任选的， 非强制的

sentences.english: three optional courses
sentences.chinese: 三门选修课

sentences.english: The other excursions are optional.
sentences.chinese: 其他的短途旅行是自选项目。

detailed_translations.english: if something is optional, you do not have to do it or use it, but you can choose to if you want to

name: analysis
trans: 分析； 分析报告； 分解

sentences.english: She’s been in analysis for three years.
sentences.chinese: 她接受精神分析治疗已经三年了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 分析， 分析报告； 分解， 解析
detailed_translations.english: a process in which a doctor makes someone talk about their past experiences, relationships etc in order to help them with mental or emotional problems

name: devise
trans: 设计； 发明； 想出； 策划， 图谋

sentences.english: She devised a method for quicker communications between offices.
sentences.chinese: 她想出一种加快办公室之间通信联络的方法。

detailed_translations.english: to plan or invent a new way of doing something

name: apparent
trans: 显然的， 明显的； 表面上的， 貌似的

sentences.english: The difference in quality was immediately apparent .
sentences.chinese: 质量的差异显而易见。

sentences.english: He left suddenly, for no apparent reason .
sentences.chinese: 不知什么原因，他突然离开了。

detailed_translations.english: easy to notice

sentences.english: a career in journalism
sentences.chinese: 新闻工作生涯

sentences.english: The hospital has been the target of investigative journalism(= journalism that examines an event or situation in order to find out the truth ).
sentences.chinese: 这家医院成了调查报道的目标。

detailed_translations.english: the job or activity of writing news reports for newspapers, magazines, television, or radio

name: chronical
trans: 慢性的， 延续很长的

name: exposure
trans: 暴露， 显露； 揭露； 曝光； 面临， 遭受

sentences.english: Prolonged exposure to the sun can cause skin cancer.
sentences.chinese: 长时间晒太阳会导致皮肤癌。

sentences.english: the exposure of his underground political activity
sentences.chinese: 对他地下政治活动的揭露

sentences.english: The failure of their marriage has got a lot of exposure recently.
sentences.chinese: 他俩婚姻失败一事最近被频频曝光。

detailed_translations.english: when someone is in a situation where they are not protected from something dangerous or unpleasant

name: evacuate
trans: 疏散， 撤离； 排空

sentences.english: Police evacuated the area.
sentences.chinese: 警方将该地区人员全部疏散。

detailed_translations.english: to send people away from a dangerous place to a safe place

name: clutch
trans: 一次所孵的卵；离合器；掌握，控制；把握，抓紧

sentences.english: Tony fell into the clutches of an attractive American who introduced him to drugs.
sentences.chinese: 托尼落入一个有魅力的美国人的掌控，那人给他介绍毒品。

sentences.english: I staggered and had to clutch at a chair for support.
sentences.chinese: 我踉跄了几步，不得不抓住一把椅子扶稳。

detailed_translations.chinese: 离合器；控制；手；紧急关头
detailed_translations.english: the  pedal  that you press with your foot when driving a vehicle in order to change  gear  , or the part of the vehicle that this controls
If you clutch at something or clutch something, you hold it tightly, usually because you are afraid or anxious

detailed_translations.chinese: 没有手提带或背带的；紧要关头的

name: dawn
trans: 破晓， 黎明； 开始， 发端

sentences.english: When dawn broke (= the first light of the day appeared ) , we were still 50 miles from Calcutta.
sentences.chinese: 破晓的时候，我们离加尔各答还有50英里。

sentences.english: I was up at the crack of dawn (= very early in the morning ) to get the plane.
sentences.chinese: 我一大早就起来赶飞机。

sentences.english: We worked from dawn to dusk (= through the whole day while it is light ) .
sentences.chinese: 我们从早干到晚。

sentences.english: the cold light of dawn
sentences.chinese: 清冷的晨曦

sentences.english: The morning dawned fresh and clear after the storm.
sentences.chinese: 暴风雨过后，破晓时天朗气清。

detailed_translations.english: the time at the beginning of the day when light first appears
if day or morning dawns, it begins

name: humble
trans: 谦卑的；卑贱的；简陋的，低劣的

sentences.english: a modest and humble man
sentences.chinese: 一个谦卑的男人

sentences.english: Honda won fame in the 1980s as the little car company that humbled the industry giants.
sentences.chinese: 20世纪80年代，本田作为一家小型汽车公司因一举击垮行业巨头而声名鹊起。

detailed_translations.chinese: 谦逊的；简陋的；（级别或地位）低下的；不大的
detailed_translations.english: not considering yourself or your ideas to be as important as other people’s

detailed_translations.chinese: 使谦恭；轻松打败（尤指强大的对手）；低声下气
detailed_translations.english: If you humble someone who is more important or powerful than you, you defeat them easily

sentences.english: agricultural commodities
sentences.chinese: 农业商品

sentences.english: Commodity prices fell sharply.
sentences.chinese: 商品价格急剧下跌。

detailed_translations.english: a product that is bought and sold

name: independent
trans: 独立的， 自主的； 自立的； 不相干的， 不受影响的； 无偏见的， 中立的； 私立的； 有主见的； 无党派的

sentences.english: There are plans to split the corporation into a number of smaller independent companies.
sentences.chinese: 有计划要把这家大企业分割成一些独立的小公司。

sentences.english: an independent charity
sentences.chinese: 独立的慈善机构

sentences.english: small independent bookshops
sentences.chinese: 私营小书店

sentences.english: schools in the independent sector
sentences.chinese: 私立学校

detailed_translations.english: an independent organization is not owned or controlled by, or does not receive money from, another organization or the government

name: glossy
trans: 光滑的； 光彩夺目的； 浮华的

sentences.english: her glossy black hair
sentences.chinese: 她那亮泽的黑发

sentences.english: the glossy surface of the leaves
sentences.chinese: 叶子光亮的表面

detailed_translations.english: shiny and smooth

name: blur
trans: 模糊形状； 模糊的记忆； 污点

sentences.english: The street lights were blurred by the fog.
sentences.chinese: 街灯在迷雾的笼罩下十分昏暗。

sentences.english: Many of the details in the picture are blurred.
sentences.chinese: 照片中的许多细节部分都模糊了。

detailed_translations.english: to become difficult to see, or to make something difficult to see, because the edges are not clear
a shape that you cannot see clearly

name: plausible
trans: 似有道理的， 似乎正确的

sentences.english: His story certainly sounds plausible.
sentences.chinese: 他的叙述听上去当然很合理。

sentences.english: a plausible explanation
sentences.chinese: 说得过去的解释

detailed_translations.chinese: 似有道理的， 似乎正确的， 貌似可信的
detailed_translations.english: reasonable and likely to be true or successful

sentences.english: At the bar he ordered a cider.
sentences.chinese: 他在酒吧点了一杯苹果汁。

detailed_translations.english: an alcoholic drink made from apples, or a glass of this drink

name: hearsay
trans: 谣言， 传闻， 道听途说

sentences.english: I wouldn’t take any notice of it – it’s just hearsay.
sentences.chinese: 我不会在意，这只不过是传闻而已。

detailed_translations.english: something that you have heard about from other people but do not know to be definitely true or correct

sentences.english: Initially, the work was pretty mundane.
sentences.chinese: 刚开始，这工作非常乏味。

sentences.english: The mundane task of setting the table can be fun on holidays.
sentences.chinese: 摆放餐具这种无趣的事情在假日里也会变得有意思起来。

detailed_translations.chinese: 世俗的，平凡的；世界的，宇宙的
detailed_translations.english: ordinary and not interesting or exciting

sentences.english: The extremely salty, alkali lake holds little life, but its waters are a favorite spot for wading birds.
sentences.chinese: 其味极咸，碱湖保存了湖中的小生命，但其水域仍为涉水鸟所喜欢的地方。

sentences.english: To get similar characteristics from composites, the carbon fibres are first chemically treated with an alkali which creates lots of tiny pits on their surface.
sentences.chinese: 为了在复合碳材料上获取与电容器相似的性质，这种碳纤维首先经过碱化学处理以令其表面生成许多细微的凹点。

sentences.english: After seeing how this air makes the ugly sagebrush and the patches of alkali and brown earth a feast to the eye, one can understand how the light of heaven may make the ugliest faces beautiful.
sentences.chinese: 这儿的空气能使丑陋的灌木和斑驳的盐碱地、褐色的泥土变成视觉盛宴。 只要见过这些，你就明白为什么说天堂的圣光能让最丑的脸变得美好。

detailed_translations.english: a substance that forms a chemical salt when combined with an acid

sentences.english: What is the process of colonization?
sentences.chinese: 殖民地化的过程又是怎样？

sentences.english: They have known colonization, revolution and emigration.
sentences.chinese: 他们了解殖民、革命还有移民。

sentences.english: We also substituted “settlement” for “colonization” in the title of the book.
sentences.chinese: 本书标题中原先使用的“殖民”一词，也用“移民”代替。

sentences.english: The meeting with Jack was fortuitous.
sentences.chinese: 遇到杰克是机缘巧合。

detailed_translations.english: happening by chance, especially in a way that has a good result

sentences.english: The United States is north of the equator.
sentences.chinese: 美国位于赤道以北。

sentences.english: In the hot zone near the equator the sun heats the air continually; hence the air there ascends.
sentences.chinese: 在靠近赤道的热带地区，太阳不断地加热那里的空气，于是那里的热空气就上升。

detailed_translations.english: an imaginary line drawn around the middle of the Earth that is exactly the same distance from the North Pole and the South Pole

sentences.english: sexism in the workplace
sentences.chinese: 工作场所的性别歧视

detailed_translations.english: the belief that one sex is weaker, less intelligent, or less important than the other, especially when this results in someone being treated unfairly

name: incapacitate
trans: 使无资格； 使失去能力； 使不胜任

sentences.english: Her mother has been incapacitated by a fall.
sentences.chinese: 她母亲摔了一跤后，失去了正常生活能力。

sentences.english: an incapacitating injury
sentences.chinese: 使人失去活动能力的伤

detailed_translations.chinese: 使无能力；使不能；使不适于
detailed_translations.english: to make you too ill or weak to live and work normally

name: deceitful
trans: 欺诈的， 惯于欺骗的， 不诚实的

sentences.english: His manner was sly and deceitful.
sentences.chinese: 他的态度诡诈而又不老实。

detailed_translations.chinese: 欺骗的；欺诈的；谎言的；虚伪的
detailed_translations.english: someone who is deceitful tells lies in order to get what they want

sentences.english: ...an audition for a Broadway musical.
sentences.chinese: …一部百老汇歌舞剧的试演。

detailed_translations.english: An audition is a short performance given by an actor, dancer, or musician so that a director or conductor can decide if they are good enough to be in a play, film, or orchestra
to take part in an audition

sentences.english: an editorial assistant
sentences.chinese: 编辑助理

detailed_translations.english: relating to the preparation of a newspaper, book, television programme etc for printing or broadcasting
a piece of writing in a newspaper that gives the editor’s opinion about something, rather than reporting facts

name: sharpen
trans: 削尖， 磨快； 使敏锐； 变得清晰

sentences.english: Her gaze sharpened, as if she had seen something unusual.
sentences.chinese: 她眼睛一亮，好像看到了不寻常的东西。

sentences.english: He will need to sharpen his diplomatic skills in order to work with Congress.
sentences.chinese: 他将需要增强外交技巧以与国会打交道。

detailed_translations.chinese: 削尖， 磨快； 使敏锐， 使敏捷
detailed_translations.english: If your senses, understanding, or skills sharpen or are sharpened, you become better at noticing things, thinking, or doing something

sentences.english: sedimentary rock
sentences.chinese: 沉积岩

sentences.english: sedimentary deposits
sentences.chinese: 沉积矿床

detailed_translations.english: made of the solid substances that settle at the bottom of the sea, rivers, lakes etc

sentences.english: a committee meeting
sentences.chinese: 委员会会议

detailed_translations.english: a group of people chosen to do a particular job, make decisions etc

name: kernel
trans: 仁； 粒； 核心， 要点

sentences.english: The kernel of that message was that peace must not be a source of advantage or disadvantage for anyone.
sentences.chinese: 那一信息的核心是和平绝不应该成为对任何人有利或不利的根源。

detailed_translations.chinese: 核心，要点；[计] 内核；仁；麦粒，谷粒；精髓
detailed_translations.english: the part of a nut or seed inside the shell, or the part inside the stone of some fruits

sentences.english: She’s too stingy to give money to charity.
sentences.chinese: 她很小气，不愿捐钱行善。

detailed_translations.chinese: 吝啬的，小气的；有刺的；缺乏的
detailed_translations.english: not generous, especially with money

sentences.english: Schliemann excavated the ancient city of Troy.
sentences.chinese: 谢里曼发掘出特洛伊古城。

detailed_translations.english: if a scientist or archaeologist excavates an area of land, they dig carefully to find ancient objects, bones etc

sentences.english: I'll just wipe the table.
sentences.chinese: 我只擦擦桌子。

detailed_translations.english: to remove liquid, dirt, or marks by wiping
a wiping movement with a cloth

name: subtle
trans: 细微的， 微妙的； 精巧的， 巧妙的； 狡猾的； 敏锐的

sentences.english: The pictures are similar, but there are subtle differences between them.
sentences.chinese: 这些图片很相似，但它们之间有细微的差别。

sentences.english: The warning signs of the disease are so subtle that they are often ignored.
sentences.chinese: 这种疾病的警示征兆不易察觉，因而往往被忽视。

sentences.english: a subtle form of racism
sentences.chinese: 隐性的种族歧视

sentences.english: The dish had a subtle hint of ginger.
sentences.chinese: 这道菜微微带点姜的味道。

detailed_translations.english: not easy to notice or understand unless you pay careful attention

sentences.english: dark green foliage
sentences.chinese: 墨绿色的叶子

detailed_translations.english: the leaves of a plant

sentences.english: a colour photograph
sentences.chinese: 彩色照片

sentences.english: a black and white photograph
sentences.chinese: 黑白照片

sentences.english: Tim was looking through an old photograph album (= book in which you put photographs ) .
sentences.chinese: 蒂姆在翻看一本旧相册。

sentences.english: Did you see Leo’s photograph (= a photograph of Leo ) in the newspaper?
sentences.chinese: 你看到报纸上利奥的照片了吗？

detailed_translations.english: a picture obtained by using a camera and film that is sensitive to light
to take a photograph of someone or something

sentences.english: Gorbachev failed to keep the component parts of the Soviet Union together.
sentences.chinese: 戈尔巴乔夫没能使苏联各组成部分保持在一起。

detailed_translations.english: the component parts of something are the parts that it consists of
one of several parts that together make up a whole machine, system etc

sentences.english: a honeymoon suite
sentences.chinese: 蜜月套房

sentences.english: a suite of rooms for palace guests
sentences.chinese: 王室贵宾套房

detailed_translations.chinese: 套间； 一套家具； 套， 组， 系列
detailed_translations.english: a set of rooms, especially expensive ones in a hotel

name: overwhelm
trans: 淹没， 漫过； 压倒， 击败， 制服； 使难以忍受； 使应接不暇

sentences.english: But the various pros and cons should not blindly overwhelm one another.
sentences.chinese: 但是，众多的利弊得失不应盲目的一个压倒另一个。

sentences.english: We try not to think about it because it would overwhelm us to an extent that we would just vegetate.
sentences.chinese: 我们尽量不去想它，因为在某种我们能够想像到的程度上他会压倒我们。

sentences.english: For example, in a situation in which several bystanders need to band together to overwhelm a perpetrator, they will be more likely to act collectively than to act alone.
sentences.chinese: 例如, 就有这样一种情况， 在只有几个旁观者需要联合起来才能压倒一个罪犯的情况下, 他们就可能会更多地采取集体行动。

detailed_translations.english: if water overwhelms an area of land, it covers it completely and suddenly

sentences.english: Police came and took her gently aside and told her they would try to find the name of the morgue.
sentences.chinese: 警察温和地把她拉到了一边，告诉她他们会尽力寻找存放孩子遗体的太平间的名字。

sentences.english: "They just drink tea inside, they just throw the bodies on the floor with some ice, " he said of officials in the morgue.
sentences.chinese: 谈到太平间的官员，他说：“那些人只是在里面喝喝茶，把尸体和冰块扔到地上就不管了。”

detailed_translations.english: a building or room, usually in a hospital, where dead bodies are kept until they are buried or  cremate d

sentences.english: Such a move is rare, but not unprecedented.
sentences.chinese: 这样的举动少见，但并非从来没有过。

detailed_translations.english: If something is unprecedented, it has never happened before

name: pocketbook
trans: 钱袋， 皮夹； 财政状况， 财力

sentences.english: The aim was to provide a car for every age and pocketbook .
sentences.chinese: 目标是为每个年龄层和收入层的人士提供汽车。

sentences.english: Older voters are most concerned about pocketbook issues (= that concern money ) .
sentences.chinese: 年纪较大的选民最关心钱的问题。

detailed_translations.chinese: 钱袋， 皮夹； 财政状况， 财力
detailed_translations.english: the amount of money that you have, or your ability to pay for things

sentences.english: cooking over a charcoal fire
sentences.chinese: 在炭火上做饭

detailed_translations.english: a black substance made of burned wood that can be used as  fuel

detailed_translations.chinese: 用木炭画（过去式charcoaled，过去分词charcoaled，现在分词charcoaling，第三人称单数charcoals）

name: disguise
trans: 掩饰； 伪装， 假装

sentences.english: He made no attempt to disguise his agitation.
sentences.chinese: 他无意掩饰他的不安。

sentences.english: He is a master of disguise.
sentences.chinese: 他是伪装高手。

detailed_translations.english: to hide sth or change it, so that it cannot be recognized
the art of changing your appearance so that people do not recognize you

name: imperial
trans: 帝国的， 帝王的； 至尊的； 专横的

sentences.english: Britain’s imperial expansion in the 19th century
sentences.chinese: 19世纪英帝国的扩张

detailed_translations.english: relating to an empire or to the person who rules it

name: wrap
trans: 披肩， 围巾； 包装材料

sentences.english: I’ve still got a few Christmas presents to wrap up.
sentences.chinese: 我还有一些圣诞礼物要包起来。

detailed_translations.english: to put paper or cloth over something to cover it
a piece of thick cloth that a woman wears around her shoulders

sentences.english: prehistoric burial grounds
sentences.chinese: 史前墓地

sentences.english: prehistoric animals
sentences.chinese: 史前动物

detailed_translations.english: relating to the time in history before anything was written down

sentences.english: The issues are complex and multi-faceted.
sentences.chinese: 这些问题很复杂，涉及诸多方面。

detailed_translations.english: one of several parts of someone’s character, a situation etc

sentences.english: a novel by Jane Austen
sentences.chinese: 简·奥斯丁的小说

sentences.english: What a novel idea!.
sentences.chinese: 多么新奇的想法呀！

detailed_translations.english: a long written story in which the characters and events are usually imaginary
not like anything known before, and unusual or interesting

sentences.english: We sang while we worked, to relieve the tedium .
sentences.chinese: 我们边唱歌边干活来排遣无聊。

detailed_translations.english: the feeling of being bored because the things you are doing are not interesting and continue for a long time without changing

name: liberal
trans: 自由的， 开明的； 慷慨的； 不严格的； 人文的

sentences.english: I had quite liberal parents.
sentences.chinese: 我的父母思想很开明。

sentences.english: a liberal supply of drinks
sentences.chinese: 饮料的充足供应

detailed_translations.english: willing to understand and respect other people’s ideas, opinions, and feelings

sentences.english: Students have to reach a certain standard or they won’t pass.
sentences.chinese: 学生必须达到某一标准，否则无法通过。

sentences.english: The airline has rigorous safety standards.
sentences.chinese: 这家航空公司有严格的安全标准。

detailed_translations.chinese: 标准；水准；旗；度量衡标准
detailed_translations.english: the level that is considered to be acceptable, or the level that someone or something has achieved

detailed_translations.chinese: 标准的；合规格的；公认为优秀的
detailed_translations.english: accepted as normal or usual

name: harmony
trans: 和声； 和谐， 融洽， 协调； 相符， 一致

sentences.english: the gorgeous vocal harmonies on ‘Mexicali Rose’
sentences.chinese: 《墨西哥玫瑰》的精彩和声演唱

sentences.english: three-part harmonies
sentences.chinese: 三部和声

detailed_translations.english: notes of music combined together in a pleasant way

name: genial
trans: 亲切的， 和蔼的； 温和的， 温暖的

sentences.english: a genial smile
sentences.chinese: 亲切的微笑

detailed_translations.chinese: 亲切的，友好的；和蔼的；适宜的
detailed_translations.english: friendly and happy

name: epitome
trans: 摘要， 梗概； 典型， 典范

sentences.english: She looked the epitome of elegance.
sentences.chinese: 她看上去像是优雅的典范。

sentences.english: He was the very epitome of evil.
sentences.chinese: 他是邪恶的典型。

detailed_translations.english: the best possible example of something

name: sharply
trans: 急剧地； 猛烈地； 尖刻地； 鲜明地

sentences.english: The report was sharply critical of the police.
sentences.chinese: 报道猛烈地抨击了警方。

detailed_translations.english: in a critical, rough or severe way
to do something that is not allowed or legal, or that is against people’s beliefs

sentences.english: There was a slight chill in the air .
sentences.chinese: 空气中有些微的寒意。

sentences.english: I turned on the heater in the hall to take the chill off the house (= to heat it slightly ) .
sentences.chinese: 我开了厅里的暖气给屋子驱寒。

detailed_translations.english: a feeling of coldness
unpleasantly cold

detailed_translations.chinese: 冷冻，冷藏；使寒心；使感到冷
detailed_translations.english: if you chill something such as food or drink, or if it chills, it becomes very cold but does not freeze

name: dominate
trans: 支配， 统治； 控制； 盛行

sentences.english: The industry is dominated by five multinational companies.
sentences.chinese: 这个行业受五家跨国公司控制。

sentences.english: New Orleans dominated throughout the game.
sentences.chinese: 新奥尔良队自始至终都控制着这场比赛。

sentences.english: Her loud voice totally dominated the conversation.
sentences.chinese: 她的大嗓门完全主导着这场谈话。

sentences.english: Education issues dominated the election campaign.
sentences.chinese: 教育问题成了这次选举活动的主要辩题。

detailed_translations.english: to control someone or something or to have more importance than other people or things

name: imitate
trans: 模仿， 效仿； 仿制， 仿造

sentences.english: She was a splendid mimic and loved to imitate Winston Churchill.
sentences.chinese: 她是个出色的模仿者，喜欢模仿温斯顿·丘吉尔。

sentences.english: The Japanese have no wish to imitate Western social customs and attitudes.
sentences.chinese: 日本人无意仿效西方的社会习俗和处事态度。

detailed_translations.english: to copy the way someone behaves, speaks, moves etc, especially in order to make people laugh

sentences.english: Final results had not yet been computed.
sentences.chinese: 最终的结果还未计算出来。

detailed_translations.chinese: 计算；估算；用计算机计算
detailed_translations.english: to calculate a result, answer, sum etc

sentences.english: pastel blue
sentences.chinese: 淡蓝色

sentences.english: The walls were painted in pastel shades.
sentences.chinese: 墙壁被粉刷成了柔和的色彩。

detailed_translations.chinese: 柔和的；彩色蜡笔的，粉蜡笔的
detailed_translations.english: pastel colours are light and pale
a small coloured stick for drawing pictures with, made of a substance like  chalk

name: homestead
trans: 家宅， 农庄； 宅地

sentences.english: He had seen the tribulation of the homestead and mankind from his own tribulation.
sentences.chinese: 海子从自身苦难体验出发目睹了家园和人类苦难。

sentences.english: Heavy clouds hang low over a dilapidated homestead in the Midwest, foretelling a possible tornado.
sentences.chinese: 厚厚的云层低低地悬在中西部残破的宅地上空，预示可能发生龙卷风。

sentences.english: The Xanadu complex is mutual to Shen Congwen and readers, is human's pursuit and expectation to ideal homestead.
sentences.chinese: “桃源”情结是沈从文和读者共有的，是人类对理想家园的追寻和期待。

detailed_translations.english: In United States history, a homestead was a piece of government land in the west, which was given to someone so they could settle there and develop a farm

name: middleman
trans: 中间人， 调解人； 经纪人

sentences.english: He acts as a middleman for British companies seeking contracts in the Gulf.
sentences.chinese: 他给在海湾地区寻找商机的英国公司当中间人。

sentences.english: Buy direct from the manufacturer and cut out the middleman (= avoid using a middleman ) .
sentences.chinese: 从厂家直接进货，绕开中间商。

detailed_translations.english: someone who buys things in order to sell them to someone else, or who helps to arrange business deals for other people

sentences.english: Working hours must not exceed 42 hours a week.
sentences.chinese: 工作时间每周不得超过42小时。

sentences.english: His performance exceeded our expectations.
sentences.chinese: 他的表现出乎我们的预料。

sentences.english: The riot police had exceeded their authority.
sentences.chinese: 防暴警察超越了他们的权限。

detailed_translations.chinese: 超过,胜过；越出 (限制、规定)
detailed_translations.english: to be more than a particular number or amount

name: avert
trans: 避免， 规避； 转移

sentences.english: The tragedy could have been averted if the crew had followed safety procedures.
sentences.chinese: 如果乘务人员按照安全规则操作，这场悲剧是可以避免的。

sentences.english: Henry averted his eyes as she undressed.
sentences.chinese: 她脱衣服的时候，亨利把目光转向别处。

detailed_translations.chinese: 防止，避免；转移(目光、注意力等)
detailed_translations.english: to prevent something unpleasant from happening

sentences.english: a telephone conversation
sentences.chinese: 电话交谈

sentences.english: Children quickly get bored by adult conversation.
sentences.chinese: 儿童对成年人的谈话很快就会厌倦。

sentences.english: They had a short conversation in German and seemed to be disagreeing about something.
sentences.chinese: 他们用德语说了一会儿，好像对什么事有分歧。

sentences.english: It’s impossible to carry on a conversation with all this noise in the background.
sentences.chinese: 在这么喧闹的环境中进行谈话是不可能的。

sentences.english: ‘Did you have a good journey?’ he said, trying to make conversation .
sentences.chinese: “你旅途愉快吗？”他问道，试图找话谈。

sentences.english: He was silent, no matter how hard Sofia tried to engage him in conversation .
sentences.chinese: 无论索菲娅怎么引他说话，他就是一声不吭。

sentences.english: After a while, the conversation turned to a friend’s coming wedding.
sentences.chinese: 过了一会儿，话题就转到一个朋友即将举行的婚礼上去了。

sentences.english: They were deep in conversation , relaxed and smiling.
sentences.chinese: 他们谈得很投入，很放松，脸上带着微笑。

sentences.english: He could hear snatches of conversation from across the room.
sentences.chinese: 他从房间对面听得到零星的对话。

detailed_translations.english: an informal talk in which people exchange news, feelings, and thoughts

sentences.english: the abolition of the monarchy
sentences.chinese: 君主制的废除

detailed_translations.chinese: 君主政体；君主国；君主政治
detailed_translations.english: the system in which a country is ruled by a king or queen

sentences.english: Different animals in the colony had different manifestations of the disease.
sentences.chinese: 同一群体的不同动物对同一疾病有不同的表现形式。

detailed_translations.english: a very clear sign that a particular situation or feeling exists

name: vicious
trans: 危险的， 罪恶的； 残酷的， 凶残的； 恶性的

sentences.english: Sarah can be quite vicious at times.
sentences.chinese: 萨拉有时相当狠毒。

sentences.english: a vicious personal attack on the Duchess
sentences.chinese: 对公爵夫人恶毒的人身攻击

sentences.english: She was shocked by the vicious tone in his voice.
sentences.chinese: 她对他恶毒的语气感到震惊。

detailed_translations.english: very unkind in a way that is intended to hurt someone’s feelings or make their character seem bad

sentences.english: a handkerchief trimmed with lace
sentences.chinese: 饰有蕾丝花边的手绢

sentences.english: lace curtains
sentences.chinese: 网眼窗帘

detailed_translations.chinese: 花边；鞋带；饰带；少量烈酒
detailed_translations.english: a fine cloth made with patterns of many very small holes

name: invitation
trans: 邀请； 请柬； 吸引， 诱惑

sentences.english: an invitation to speak at a scientific conference
sentences.chinese: 在科学大会上发言的邀请

sentences.english: We sent out more than 300 wedding invitations.
sentences.chinese: 我们发出了超过300份婚礼请柬。

detailed_translations.english: a written or spoken request to someone, inviting them to go somewhere or do something

sentences.english: Even the planet's outer skin, or lithosphere, has been transformed.
sentences.chinese: 甚至于地球的表层——岩石圈——也已经被改变了。

sentences.english: Since the size of the Earth is essentially constant, new lithosphere can be created at the mid-ocean ridges only if an equal amount of lithospheric material is consumed elsewhere.
sentences.chinese: 因为地球的大小本质上是不变的，只有同等数量的岩石圈物质在其它地方被吞没，新的岩石圈才能生成。

sentences.english: To physical science that has denatured reality the world is a material place of molecules and atoms, of solids, liquids and gases, of atmosphere, hydrosphere, lithosphere and biosphere.
sentences.chinese: 对于具有变性的物理学来说世界是由分子、原子，固体、液体、气体，大气圈、水圈、岩石圈和生物圈组成的物质世界；

detailed_translations.english: the rigid outer layer of the earth, having an average thickness of about 75 km and comprising the earth's crust and the solid part of the mantle above the asthenosphere

sentences.english: an enormous bunch of flowers
sentences.chinese: 巨大的花束

sentences.english: an enormous amount of money
sentences.chinese: 巨款

sentences.english: The team made an enormous effort.
sentences.chinese: 该队付出了巨大的努力。

detailed_translations.english: very big in size or in amount

name: revival
trans: 复兴， 再流行； 复苏； 苏醒， 复活； 重演

sentences.english: The US and the UK have expectations of economic revival.
sentences.chinese: 美国和英国对经济复苏有所期待。

detailed_translations.english: a process in which something becomes active or strong again

sentences.english: Plants use their roots to absorb moisture from the soil.
sentences.chinese: 植物利用根从土壤中吸收水分。

sentences.english: Your skin’s moisture content varies according to weather conditions.
sentences.chinese: 皮肤的水分含量随着天气状况而变化。

detailed_translations.english: small amounts of water that are present in the air, in a substance, or on a surface

name: sloth
trans: 树懒； 懒散， 怠惰

sentences.english: He admitted a lack of motivation and a feeling of sloth.
sentences.chinese: 他承认自己缺乏动力，感觉懒散。

detailed_translations.chinese: 怠惰，懒惰；[脊椎] 树懒
detailed_translations.english: an animal in Central and South America that moves very slowly, has grey fur, and lives in trees

sentences.english: Alex’s real problem is that he lacks confidence.
sentences.chinese: 亚历克斯的真正问题是缺乏信心。

detailed_translations.english: to not have something that you need, or not have enough of it

name: external
trans: 外部的， 外面的； 外来的； 对外的

sentences.english: The open cities will be testing grounds for our external policies.
sentences.chinese: 使开放城市成为对外政策的窗口。

sentences.english: The ear canal also named middle ear splays out at the external position.
sentences.chinese: 耳道亦称中耳，内小外大呈喇叭状。

sentences.english: Riddled with a thousand gaping wounds, this reactionary clique is now beset with difficulties and contradictions both in internal and external affairs.
sentences.chinese: 今天， 这个反动集团百孔千疮， 内外交困， 矛盾重重。

name: circumstance
trans: 环境， 条件； 境况， 经济状况

sentences.english: The Soviet Union had been forced by circumstances to sign a pact with Nazi Germany.
sentences.chinese: 苏联为形势所迫同纳粹德国签订了一项条约。

sentences.english: I can’t imagine a circumstance in which I would be willing to steal.
sentences.chinese: 我无法想象我在什么情况下会愿意去偷东西。

sentences.english: Grants are awarded according to your financial circumstances.
sentences.chinese: 补助金根据经济状况发给。

detailed_translations.english: the conditions that affect a situation, action, event etc

name: revise
trans: 修订， 修改； 复习

sentences.english: The college has revised its plans because of local objections.
sentences.chinese: 由于地方上的反对，学院已经修改了计划。

sentences.english: We have revised our estimates of population growth.
sentences.chinese: 我们已修正了对人口增长的估计。

detailed_translations.english: to change something because of new information or ideas

sentences.english: an agreement between the US and Colombian authorities
sentences.chinese: 美国和哥伦比亚当局的一份协议

sentences.english: Only the president has the authority to declare war.
sentences.chinese: 只有总统才有权宣战。

sentences.english: I need to speak to someone in authority (= who has a position of power ) .
sentences.chinese: 我得找管事的人谈谈。

detailed_translations.english: [plural] the people or organizations that are in charge of a particular country or area

name: paramount
trans: 至为重要的； 最高权力的， 至尊的

sentences.english: During a war the interests of the state are paramount, and those of the individual come last.
sentences.chinese: 战争时期国家利益是首要的，个人利益置于最后。

sentences.english: Women’s role as mothers is of paramount importance to society.
sentences.chinese: 女性作为母亲的角色对社会至关重要。

detailed_translations.chinese: 最重要的，主要的；至高无上的
detailed_translations.english: more important than anything else

name: emerald
trans: 祖母绿， 绿宝石； 翡翠绿

sentences.english: As far as colors go, this year we will be seeing some brights like orange, yellow, fuchsia, apple green, emerald, and amethyst.
sentences.chinese: 至于颜色的流行趋势，今年我们将会看到一些明亮的颜色如橘色、黄色、桃红色、苹果绿、翠绿色和紫色。

sentences.english: In terms of colour, black, red and jewel tones like sapphire blue and emerald GREen are in, while pumpkins and yellows are out, Ms Stanger said.
sentences.chinese: 至于衣服的颜色，斯坦格说，黑色、红色以及宝蓝、祖母绿这样的宝石色调比较时髦，而南瓜色和黄色则显得老土。

detailed_translations.english: a valuable bright green stone that is often used in jewellery

name: legislature
trans: 立法机关， 立法团体

sentences.english: The proposals before the legislature include the creation of two special courts to deal exclusively with violent crimes.
sentences.chinese: 摆在议会面前的提案包括建立两个特殊法庭专门审理暴力犯罪案件。

detailed_translations.english: an institution that has the power to make or change laws

name: sociable
trans: 好交际的， 合群的； 友善的， 友好的

sentences.english: a pleasant, sociable couple
sentences.chinese: 一对和善且喜欢与人交往的夫妇

detailed_translations.chinese: 社交的；好交际的；友善的
detailed_translations.english: someone who is sociable is friendly and enjoys being with other people

name: exhilarating
trans: 令人高兴的， 使人兴奋的

sentences.english: an exhilarating experience
sentences.chinese: 刺激的经历

sentences.english: an exhilarating walk
sentences.chinese: 让人精神焕发的散步

detailed_translations.chinese: 使人愉快的；令人喜欢的；爽快的
detailed_translations.english: making you feel happy, excited, and full of energy

detailed_translations.chinese: 使高兴，使兴奋（exhilarate的现在分词形式）

sentences.english: Saturn is my surroundings.
sentences.chinese: 土星是我的环境。

sentences.english: Jupiter, Saturn, Uranus and Neptune. Those are the gas giants, the four heavyweights of the solar system. But was there once a fifth?
sentences.chinese: 木星，土星，天王星和海王星。这些都是气体行星，太阳系的四个重量级。但曾经存在第五个行星吗？

sentences.english: Remember earlier when we talked about Saturn and how he teaches us about karma, cause and effect, and "tough love" style life lessons.
sentences.chinese: 记得早些时候曾当我们谈到土星，以及他如何讲授业，原因和影响我们，“严厉的爱”式的生活经验。

detailed_translations.english: the  planet  that is sixth in order from the sun and is surrounded by large rings

name: avenge
trans: 复仇， 报仇； 向…报仇

sentences.english: He wanted to avenge his brother’s death.
sentences.chinese: 他要为弟弟的死复仇。

detailed_translations.english: to do something to hurt or punish someone because they have harmed or offended you

sentences.english: obsolete weapons
sentences.chinese: 已被淘汰的武器

sentences.english: computer hardware that quickly became obsolete
sentences.chinese: 很快就变得过时的电脑硬件

sentences.english: Will computers render (= make ) books obsolete?
sentences.chinese: 计算机会把书籍淘汰掉吗？

detailed_translations.english: no longer useful, because something newer and better has been invented

name: instrument
trans: 仪器， 器械， 工具； 乐器

sentences.english: surgical instruments
sentences.chinese: 外科(手术)器械

detailed_translations.chinese: 仪器， 工具； 乐器
detailed_translations.english: a small tool used in work such as science or medicine

name: medium
trans: 〔大小、水平或数量〕中等的；中号的
传播媒介〔如报纸、电视等〕

sentences.english: Advertising is a powerful medium.
sentences.chinese: 广告是具有强大影响力的传播媒介。

sentences.english: hair of medium length
sentences.chinese: 中等长短的头发

detailed_translations.english: a way of communicating information and news to people, such as newspapers, television etc
of middle size, level, or amount

sentences.english: They ran short of gasoline.
sentences.chinese: 他们的汽油不够了。

sentences.english: It smelled like gasoline and flowers mixed together.
sentences.chinese: “咦~~~~”难闻死了，像是汽油和花香混在一起。

sentences.english: This system traps the gasoline vapor escaping from the fuel tank and carburetor .
sentences.chinese: 这个系统能收集从燃油箱和化油器泄漏出来的汽油蒸气。

detailed_translations.english: a liquid obtained from petroleum, used mainly for producing power in the engines of cars, trucks etc

name: interface
trans: 界面， 分界面； 接口

sentences.english: ...the development of better user interfaces.
sentences.chinese: …更好用户界面的开发。

detailed_translations.english: the way in which you see the information from a computer program on a screen, or how you type information into the program

detailed_translations.chinese: （使通过界面或接口）接合，连接；[计算机]使联系
detailed_translations.english: if you interface two parts of a computer system, or if they interface, you connect them

sentences.english: An artist sculpted a full-size replica of her head.
sentences.chinese: 一位艺术家雕塑了一尊她头部的全幅头像。

detailed_translations.english: to make a particular shape from stone, wood, clay etc

sentences.english: Cholesterol, a type of lipid, is found in foods from animal sources.
sentences.chinese: 胆固醇也是一种油脂，存在于动物来源的食物中。

sentences.english: The virus also increases lipid sensitivity and decreases leptin secretion of the new fat cells.
sentences.chinese: 该病毒还会增加新脂肪细胞的脂肪灵敏度，并降低其瘦素分泌。

sentences.english: Discard the yolk or a portion of it if you're trying to lower your fat intake, as the yolk is almost 100% lipid.
sentences.chinese: 如果你试图降低你的脂肪摄入，可以去掉整个蛋黄或者部份蛋黄，因为蛋黄几乎是 100% 的脂质。

detailed_translations.english: one of several types of fattysubstances in living things, such as fat, oil, or wax

name: fatal
trans: 致命的； 毁灭性的； 命中注定的

sentences.english: potentially fatal diseases
sentences.chinese: 潜在致命的疾病

sentences.english: If it is not treated correctly, the condition can prove fatal (= be fatal ) .
sentences.chinese: 如果治疗不当，这种病可能会致命。

detailed_translations.english: resulting in someone’s death

sentences.english: ...the male sex hormone testosterone.
sentences.chinese: …男性性激素睾酮。

detailed_translations.english: a chemical substance produced by your body that influences its growth, development, and condition

name: psychology
trans: 心理学； 心理， 心理特征

sentences.english: I understood the psychology of this, but it still hurt.
sentences.chinese: 我理解这种心理，但这仍然让我感到伤心。

sentences.english: It was not until the mid-twentieth century that psychology really came into its own.
sentences.chinese: 直到20世纪中叶心理学才得到应有的重视。

sentences.english: His speciality was psychology -- one important branch on the great tree of knowledge.
sentences.chinese: 他的专业是心理学，这是知识之树上的一个重要分枝。

detailed_translations.english: to undergo or cause to undergo the removal of adsorbed or absorbed gas from solids, often by heating in free space

name: ridge
trans: 脊； 山脊， 山脉； 高压脊； 隆起物

sentences.english: We made our way carefully along the ridge.
sentences.chinese: 我们沿着山脊小心前行。

detailed_translations.english: a long area of high land, especially at the top of a mountain

sentences.english: To explain this, they hypothesize that galaxies must contain a great deal of missing matter which cannot be detected.
sentences.chinese: 为了解释这一点，他们假定银河系一定包含了大量无法探测到的不明物质。

detailed_translations.english: to suggest a possible explanation that has not yet been proved to be true

sentences.english: a puritanical father who wouldn’t let his children watch television
sentences.chinese: 不让孩子看电视的清教徒式的父亲

sentences.english: The atmosphere at the school was oppressively puritanical.
sentences.chinese: 那所学校是清教徒式的风气，显得很压抑。

detailed_translations.english: very strict about moral matters, especially sex – used in order to show disapproval

name: twine
trans: 缠绕， 盘绕， 围绕

sentences.english: a bundle of papers tied up with twine
sentences.chinese: 用双股线捆扎起来的一摞文件

detailed_translations.english: strong string made by twisting together two or more threads or strings

sentences.english: mobile air-conditioners
sentences.chinese: 移动式空调器

sentences.english: a mobile shop/library (= one inside a vehicle)
sentences.chinese: 流动商店 / 图书馆

detailed_translations.english: that is not fixed in one place and can be moved easily and quickly

name: perform
trans: 做， 履行， 完成； 表演， 演出； 执行

sentences.english: Chenier and the band are performing at the Silver Palace tomorrow.
sentences.chinese: 车尼尔和乐队明天将在银宫演出。

sentences.english: The children perform two plays each school year.
sentences.chinese: 孩子们一学年表演两部话剧。

sentences.english: She was fired for not performing the duties outlined in her contract.
sentences.chinese: 由于没有履行合同中规定的职责，她被解雇了。

detailed_translations.english: to do something to entertain people, for example by acting a play or playing a piece of music

name: retrospective
trans: 回顾的， 追想的； 有追溯效力的

sentences.english: a retrospective study of 110 patients
sentences.chinese: 对110名病人进行的回溯研究

detailed_translations.chinese: 回顾的；怀旧的；可追溯的
detailed_translations.english: related to or thinking about the past
a show of the work of an  artist  , actor,  film-maker  etc that includes examples of all the kinds of work they have done

sentences.english: snow-capped mountain peaks
sentences.chinese: 白雪覆盖的山顶

sentences.english: jagged peaks
sentences.chinese: 嶙峋的山峰

sentences.english: It was a time of peak demand for the product.
sentences.chinese: 那是对该产品需求最旺的时期。

detailed_translations.english: the sharply pointed top of a mountain
used to talk about the best, highest, or greatest level or amount of something

name: evolution
trans: 发展； 演变， 进化， 进化论

sentences.english: the theory of evolution
sentences.chinese: 进化论

detailed_translations.english: the scientific idea that plants and animals develop and change gradually over a long period of time

name: lucrative
trans: 赚钱的， 获利的， 有利可图的

sentences.english: Thousands of ex-army officers have found lucrative jobs in private security firms.
sentences.chinese: 成千上万的退役军官在私人保安公司找到了薪水丰厚的工作。

detailed_translations.chinese: 有利可图的，赚钱的；合算的
detailed_translations.english: a job or activity that is lucrative lets you earn a lot of money

name: portrait
trans: 肖像， 画像； 描写， 描绘

sentences.english: a family portrait
sentences.chinese: 全家福

sentences.english: She’s been commissioned to paint Jackson’s portrait .
sentences.chinese: 她已受托为杰克逊画肖像。

detailed_translations.english: a painting, drawing, or photograph of a person

name: inanity
trans: 空虚， 空洞； 无意义的事物

sentences.english: Attempting to drown herself in inanity, she marries Peter Keating, only to leave him for newspaper tycoon Gail Wynand, publisher of the Banner, where Toohey's column appears.
sentences.chinese: 为了把自己淹没在空虚之中，她先嫁给了彼特·基廷，然后仅仅是为了离开他而选择了报业大亨盖尔·威纳德。 威纳德是巴纳出版社的老板，也就是图希的专栏出现的地方。

sentences.english: Blue cheese can be wrapped in foil, but remember to change the foil every few days as acidity will attack the foil.
sentences.chinese: 蓝纹奶酪可以包在箔纸中，但是切记每隔几天就要换一次箔纸，因为奶酪的酸性会腐蚀箔纸。 。

sentences.english: But even this method runs the risk of altering the acidity of soil or marine ecosystems unless precautions are taken with disposal.
sentences.chinese: 但是即便这种方法也面临着改变土壤酸性或海洋生态系统的风险，除非采取处理的预防措施。

sentences.english: Age-Worthy: Describes the small number of top wines that have sufficient flavor, acidity, alcohol and tannin to gain additional complexity with time in the bottle.
sentences.chinese: 值得陈年的： 形容少数具有充足风味，酸度，酒精和单宁的顶尖葡萄酒可随着在瓶中的陈年时间而增加其复杂度。

name: complaint
trans: 诉苦， 抱怨； 投诉； 控告

sentences.english: If you wish to make a complaint, you should see the manager.
sentences.chinese: 如果你要投诉，应该去找经理。

sentences.english: The sales assistants are trained to deal with customer complaints in a friendly manner.
sentences.chinese: 售货员都受过培训，要以友好的态度处理顾客的投诉。

detailed_translations.english: a statement in which someone complains about something

name: pinnacle
trans: 山顶， 顶峰； 鼎盛时期； 小尖塔

sentences.english: the pinnacle of academic achievement
sentences.chinese: 学术成就的顶峰

detailed_translations.english: a pointed stone decoration, like a small tower, on a building such as a church or castle

detailed_translations.chinese: 造小尖塔；置于尖顶上；置于高处

name: inject
trans: 注射； 注入， 灌输； 投入

sentences.english: His son was injected with strong drugs.
sentences.chinese: 他的儿子被注射了强效的药。

detailed_translations.english: to put liquid, especially a drug, into someone’s body by using a special needle

sentences.english: They were forced to practise cannibalism in order to survive.
sentences.chinese: 为了生存，他们被迫同类相食。

detailed_translations.english: If a group of people practise cannibalism, they eat the flesh of other people

sentences.english: Whether you stay or leave is a matter of total indifference to me (= I do not care ).
sentences.chinese: 你是留是走我根本无所谓。

detailed_translations.english: lack of interest or concern

sentences.english: He could drink copious amounts of beer without ill effect.
sentences.chinese: 他可以豪饮啤酒而无不适。

sentences.english: She listened to me and took copious notes .
sentences.chinese: 她边听我说话边记下大量笔记。

detailed_translations.english: existing or being produced in large quantities

sentences.english: a CD collection covering the band from its inception in 1994
sentences.chinese: 一套包括该乐队自1994年成立以来所有曲目在内的激光唱片

detailed_translations.english: the start of an organization or institution

name: channel
trans: 频道； 渠道， 途径； 通道； 海峡； 水道， 航道

sentences.english: the news on Channel 4
sentences.chinese: 第四频道播出的新闻

sentences.english: The kids are watching cartoons on the Disney Channel.
sentences.chinese: 孩子们在看迪士尼频道的卡通片。

sentences.english: What channel is ‘ER’ on?
sentences.chinese: 《仁心仁术》在哪个频道播放？

sentences.english: He changed channels to watch the basketball game.
sentences.chinese: 他转换频道看篮球比赛。

detailed_translations.english: a television station and all the programmes that it broadcasts

detailed_translations.chinese: 把〔钱、精力等〕导向〔特定目的〕；引导；把…用于
detailed_translations.english: to control and direct something such as money or energy towards a particular purpose

sentences.english: She tried to focus her mind on her work.
sentences.chinese: 她试图集中精神干活。

sentences.english: He focused his blue eyes on her.
sentences.chinese: 他那蓝色的眼睛注视着她。

sentences.english: Eggs became the focus for the food poisoning scare.
sentences.chinese: 鸡蛋成了食物中毒恐慌的焦点。

detailed_translations.english: to give attention, effort, etc. to one particular subject, situation or person rather than another
the thing, person, situation etc that people pay special attention to

sentences.english: She tried to run, but was hampered by her heavy suitcase.
sentences.chinese: 她想跑，但沉重的旅行箱拖累了她。

sentences.english: An attempt to rescue the men has been hampered by bad weather.
sentences.chinese: 对那几名男子的营救行动受到恶劣天气的阻碍。

detailed_translations.english: to make it difficult for someone to do something
a basket with a lid, which is used for carrying food or sending it to someone as a present

sentences.english: He decided to adopt a different approach and teach the Bible through story-telling.
sentences.chinese: 他决定采用一种不同的方法，通过讲故事来教授《圣经》。

sentences.english: This book takes an unorthodox approach to art criticism.
sentences.chinese: 这本书采用的是非传统的艺术评论方法。

sentences.english: organizations which take a positive approach to creative thinking
sentences.chinese: 对创造性思维采取积极态度的组织

detailed_translations.english: a method of doing something or dealing with a problem

sentences.english: He did part-time work as an usher in a theatre.
sentences.chinese: 他曾在一家剧院做兼职引座员。

detailed_translations.chinese: 引座员，带位员；接待员；门房
detailed_translations.english: someone who shows people to their seats at a theatre, cinema, wedding etc
to help someone to get from one place to another, especially by showing them the way

sentences.english: a decisive factor/victory/battle
sentences.chinese: 决定性的因素 / 胜利 / 战役

sentences.english: a decisive leader
sentences.chinese: 果断的领袖

detailed_translations.english: very important for the final result of a particular situation

sentences.english: flowers pollinated by bees
sentences.chinese: 由蜜蜂授粉的花

detailed_translations.english: to give a flower or plant pollen so that it can produce seeds

sentences.english: Your summary should be as clear and concise as possible.
sentences.chinese: 你的总结应该尽可能地明白简洁。

detailed_translations.english: short, with no unnecessary words

name: thesis
trans: 论文； 论题， 论点

sentences.english: Cynthia’s still working on her thesis.
sentences.chinese: 辛西娅还在写论文。

sentences.english: Their main thesis was that the rise in earnings was due to improvements in education.
sentences.chinese: 他们的主要论点是收入增加得益于教育状况的改善。

detailed_translations.english: a long piece of writing about a particular subject that you do as part of an advanced university degree such as an MA or a PhD

sentences.english: She has a bump on the back of her head.
sentences.chinese: 她的后脑勺上肿起了一块。

sentences.english: He had a few injuries, mostly bumps and bruises.
sentences.chinese: 他有几处受了伤，大都是肿块和瘀青。

detailed_translations.english: an area of skin that is raised because you have hit it on something
to hit or knock against something

name: precursor
trans: 先驱； 先兆， 前兆； 前身

sentences.english: Error is often the precursor of what is correct.
sentences.chinese: 错误常常是正确的先导。

sentences.english: Viewed as a precursor to a wider open data movement, it could be as important as any we have seen in the web era.
sentences.chinese: 它被视为更宽泛的数据开放运动的先导，它将像我们在互联网时代看到的所有重要的事物一样重要。

detailed_translations.english: something that happened or existed before something else and influenced its development

name: revive
trans: 恢复； 苏醒； 重新利用

sentences.english: Local people have decided to revive this centuries-old tradition.
sentences.chinese: 当地人决定复兴这一延续了数个世纪的传统。

sentences.english: an attempt to revive the steel industry
sentences.chinese: 复苏钢铁工业的努力

sentences.english: The doctors revived her with injections of glucose.
sentences.chinese: 医生给她注射葡萄糖，使她苏醒过来。

detailed_translations.english: to bring something back after it has not been used or has not existed for a period of time

sentences.english: Also good for seed's long-term preservation. 7. There is a top dosage limit for AITC to fumigate different crop seeds.
sentences.chinese: 辣根精油活性成分AITC对不同的作物种子熏蒸时，其使用浓度有一定的限制。

sentences.english: Heat the vinegar, close doors and windows, fumigate in the room from time to time, which can effectively kill the flu virus.
sentences.chinese: 把陈醋加热，关上门窗，隔一段时间在房间里熏蒸一次，可有效杀除感冒等病毒。

detailed_translations.english: to remove disease,  bacteria  , insects etc from somewhere using chemicals, smoke, or gas

name: arid
trans: 干旱的； 贫瘠的； 无趣的

sentences.english: Water from the Great Lakes is pumped to arid regions .
sentences.chinese: 五大湖中的水被输往干旱地区。

detailed_translations.chinese: 干旱的；不毛的，[农] 荒芜的
detailed_translations.english: arid land or an arid  climate  is very dry because it has very little rain

name: fiber
trans: 纤维素； 纤维制品； 纤维

sentences.english: And remember nuts like almonds with their skins on have more fiber than those without.
sentences.chinese: 记住，向杏仁那样有皮的坚果比那些没有皮的更富含纤维素。

sentences.english: While they bite into the fruit, they could savor the various blends of fiber and juices.
sentences.chinese: 当他们咬一口水果，他们可以尝到各种水果纤维和汁液的混合。

sentences.english: Not only do they offer antioxidants, they contain higher content of vitamins, minerals, and fiber.
sentences.chinese: 它们不仅提供抗氧化剂，还含有较高含量的维生素、矿物质和纤维。

name: proceed
trans: 进行下去， 继续做； 发生； 继续下去； 行进， 前往

sentences.english: Before proceeding further, we must define our terms.
sentences.chinese: 我们必须先定义术语，然后再往下展开。

detailed_translations.english: to continue to do something that has already been planned or started

name: musical
trans: 音乐的；悦耳的；有音乐天赋的，爱好音乐的

sentences.english: a musical version of the fairy tale ‘Cinderella’
sentences.chinese: 童话故事《灰姑娘》的音乐剧版

sentences.english: When he began his musical career, King played only for black audiences.
sentences.chinese: 金在音乐事业的开始阶段只为黑人观众演奏。

detailed_translations.english: relating to music or consisting of music

sentences.english: It is a scenic art integrating music, performance, literature, aria, and face-painting.
sentences.chinese: 这是一个风景艺术集音乐，表演，文学，咏叹调，和画脸。

sentences.english: I hope my poem is about loss, not nostalgia, that the tenor singing an Italian aria, like the ruined pilasters of the theater, suggests an historical dimension of loss.
sentences.chinese: 我希望我的诗表现的是失落，而非乡愁，如同那名男高音唱着意大利咏叹调，宛如剧院的断壁颓垣，都流露出历史的失落。

detailed_translations.english: a song that is sung by only one person in an  opera  or  oratorio

name: bulb
trans: 鳞茎； 鳞茎状物； 灯泡

sentences.english: a 100-watt bulb
sentences.chinese: 一个100瓦的灯泡

detailed_translations.english: the glass part of an electric light, that the light shines from

name: dismiss
trans: 不再考虑， 不接受； 消除， 摒除； 免职， 解雇； 解散， 遣散； 驳回， 不受理

sentences.english: He just laughed and dismissed my proposal as unrealistic.
sentences.chinese: 他只是笑了笑，认为我的建议不切实际，拒绝考虑。

sentences.english: Bryant was unfairly dismissed from his post.
sentences.chinese: 布赖恩特被无理免职了。

detailed_translations.english: to refuse to consider someone’s idea, opinion etc, because you think it is not serious, true, or important

name: abysmal
trans: 深不可测的； 极坏的， 糟透的

sentences.english: The reunion was an abysmal failure.
sentences.chinese: 重逢聚会弄得一团糟。

detailed_translations.english: very bad or of bad quality

name: verbiage
trans: 冗词， 赘言， 废话

sentences.english: meaningless verbiage
sentences.chinese: 不知所云的冗词

detailed_translations.english: speech or writing that has many unnecessary words in it

sentences.english: To stop a problem you have to understand its underlying causes.
sentences.chinese: 要解决问题，你得了解其潜在原因。

detailed_translations.english: The underlying features of an object, event, or situation are not obvious, and it may be difficult to discover or reveal them

name: intelligence
trans: 智力， 智慧； 情报

sentences.english: To be good at the game, you need a reasonable level of intelligence.
sentences.chinese: 要想把这种游戏玩好，需要一定的智力水平。

sentences.english: According to our intelligence, further attacks were planned.
sentences.chinese: 根据我们的情报，还会有更进一步的攻击。

detailed_translations.english: the ability to learn, understand, and think about things

sentences.english: ugly utilitarian buildings
sentences.chinese: 丑陋但实用的建筑物

sentences.english: One of the greatest utilitarians was Claude Helvetius.
sentences.chinese: 最伟大的功利主义者之一是克劳德·爱尔维修。

detailed_translations.chinese: 功利的；功利主义的；实利的
detailed_translations.english: intended to be useful and practical rather than attractive or comfortable
A utilitarian is someone with utilitarian views

name: even
trans: 平滑的，平坦的；平稳的，均匀的；均衡的；平均的；偶数的

sentences.english: Most companies have suffered a drop in their profits, even very large companies.
sentences.chinese: 大多数公司的利润都出现下滑，甚至连很大的公司也不例外。

sentences.english: It was quite difficult to see, even with the light on.
sentences.chinese: 这很难看得见，即使开着灯也没有用。

sentences.english: He became quite successful and even appeared on a television show once.
sentences.chinese: 他相当成功，甚至还上了一次电视节目。

sentences.english: She did not even bother to phone us.
sentences.chinese: 她甚至连电话都没打给我们。

sentences.english: He never even acknowledged my letter.
sentences.chinese: 他收到我的信甚至从不会告知一声。

detailed_translations.english: used to emphasize something that is unexpected or surprising in what you are saying

sentences.english: The overall ambience of the room is cosy.
sentences.chinese: 这个房间的整体氛围是舒适的。

detailed_translations.english: the qualities and character of a particular place and the way these make you feel

sentences.english: They’ve installed the new computer network at last.
sentences.chinese: 他们终于安装了新电脑网络。

sentences.english: Security cameras have been installed in the city centre.
sentences.chinese: 在市中心已安装了一些监控摄像机。

detailed_translations.english: to put a piece of equipment somewhere and connect it so that it is ready to be used

sentences.english: How do you analyze this change?
sentences.chinese: 你该如何分析这种变化？

sentences.english: You have to hoover anything before you can analyze it.
sentences.chinese: 在你不具备分析能力之前，你只得胡乱吸收你所能学到的东西。

sentences.english: We should learn to discern and analyze the essentials of complicated questions.
sentences.chinese: 我们应该学会认识和分析复杂问题的本质。

name: cuneiform
trans: 〔古代美索不达米亚人使用的〕楔形文字的

sentences.english: The chicken scratch is cuneiform.
sentences.chinese: 鸡爪印是楔形文字。

sentences.english: She wrote hymns to the gods in cuneiform.
sentences.chinese: 她用楔形文字写下了献给神祇的颂歌。

sentences.english: A 1913 statute, still on the books, sought to thwart propaganda by forbidding the hiring of "publicity experts, " a ban that has as much to do with modern communication as cuneiform tablets.
sentences.chinese: 一项1913年颁布、至今有效的法律旨在通过禁止雇用“公关专家”来阻止宣传，这道禁令涵盖的是从现代通讯到楔形文字泥板的一切。

detailed_translations.chinese: 〔古代美索不达米亚人使用的〕楔形文字的
detailed_translations.english: relating to the writing used by the people of ancient Mesopotamia

name: bulk
trans: 容积， 体积； 主体， 大部分

sentences.english: The bulk of consumers are based in towns.
sentences.chinese: 大多数消费者都是城镇居民。

sentences.english: The dough will rise until it is double in bulk.
sentences.chinese: 面团会发酵到原来的两倍大。

detailed_translations.english: the main or largest part of something

name: vacancy
trans: 空房间； 空位， 空缺； 空虚

sentences.english: There are still two vacancies on the school board.
sentences.chinese: 学校董事会还有两个职位空缺。

sentences.english: The council is making every effort to fill the vacancies.
sentences.chinese: 地方议会正想方设法填补这些职缺。

sentences.english: information about job vacancies
sentences.chinese: 招聘信息

detailed_translations.english: a job that is available for someone to start doing

sentences.english: the world heavyweight boxing champion
sentences.chinese: 世界重量级拳击冠军

sentences.english: the Olympic champion
sentences.chinese: 奥运会冠军

sentences.english: He passionately championed the poor.
sentences.chinese: 他曾热情地捍卫穷人。

detailed_translations.english: someone or something that has won a competition, especially in sport
If you champion a person, a cause, or a principle, you support or defend them

sentences.english: This takes a little while to switch all of your plastic storage containers over to ceramic, glass or stainless steel but its definitely worthwhile.
sentences.chinese: 把你所有的塑料存储容器换成陶瓷的，玻璃的，或者不锈钢的你会浪费你一点时间。 但这绝对是值得的。

sentences.english: ...ceramic tiles.
sentences.chinese: …瓷砖。

detailed_translations.chinese: 陶瓷的；陶器的；制陶艺术的

detailed_translations.english: Ceramic is clay that has been heated to a very high temperature so that it becomes hard

sentences.english: the parrot’s brilliant blue plumage
sentences.chinese: 那只鹦鹉亮丽的蓝色羽毛

detailed_translations.english: the feathers covering a bird’s body

name: circuit
trans: 电路； 线路； 巡回； 环行； 环行路线

sentences.english: We did a circuit of the old city.
sentences.chinese: 我们绕着老城走了一圈。

detailed_translations.english: a path that forms a circle around an area, or a journey along this path

name: piracy
trans: 海盗行为； 抢劫行为； 剽窃行为

sentences.english: software piracy
sentences.chinese: 软件盗版

detailed_translations.chinese: 海盗行为；剽窃；著作权侵害；非法翻印
detailed_translations.english: the crime of illegally copying and selling books, tapes, videos, computer programs etc

sentences.english: Flight is the form of locomotion that puts the greatest demands on muscles.
sentences.chinese: 飞行是对肌肉要求最高的运动形式。

detailed_translations.english: movement or the ability to move

name: magnificent
trans: 极好的； 宏伟的， 华丽的； 崇高的， 高尚的

sentences.english: The magnificent beau is dancing to the light of chandeliers.
sentences.chinese: 这个衣着华丽的花花公子在枝形吊灯灯光下翩翩起舞。

sentences.english: These magnificent ancient buildings demonstrate the great intelligence of the labouring people.
sentences.chinese: 这些壮丽的古代建筑显示了劳动人民的高度智慧。

name: irregular
trans: 不规则的， 无规律的； 不整齐的； 不合常规的

sentences.english: a jagged, irregular coastline
sentences.chinese: 锯齿状不规则的海岸线

sentences.english: It has a highly irregular shape, covered in bumps and indentations.
sentences.chinese: 它的外形极不规则，满是凸起和凹陷的地方。

detailed_translations.english: having a shape, surface, pattern etc that is not even, smooth, or balanced

sentences.english: The new law restricts the sale of hand guns.
sentences.chinese: 新法规限制手枪的销售。

sentences.english: You may need to restrict access to certain files (= limit the number of people who can read them ) .
sentences.chinese: 某些档案可能需要限制查阅。

sentences.english: The agreement will restrict competition.
sentences.chinese: 这个协议将限制竞争。

sentences.english: The cramped living conditions severely restricted the children’s freedom to play.
sentences.chinese: 拥挤的居住条件严重限制了孩子们玩耍的自由。

detailed_translations.english: to limit or control the size, amount, or range of something
A mason is a person who is skilled at making things or building things with stone or bricks

name: recharge
trans: 充电； 休整； 再装弹药

sentences.english: The device can recharge a battery in about 25 minutes.
sentences.chinese: 该充电器可在约25分钟内完成给电池充电。

detailed_translations.english: to put a new supply of electricity into a  battery

name: legislate
trans: 制定法律； 通过立法

sentences.english: Most member countries have already legislated against excessive overtime.
sentences.chinese: 大部分成员国已经立法禁止过度加班。

detailed_translations.english: to make a law about something

name: imperative
trans: 迫切的，重要紧急的；必要的；命令的；

sentences.english: It is imperative that politicians should be good communicators.
sentences.chinese: 政治家应该是很好的沟通者，这很重要。

detailed_translations.chinese: 必要的；紧急的，极重要的；命令的
detailed_translations.english: extremely important and needing to be done or dealt with immediately

detailed_translations.chinese: 必要的事， 必须完成的事； 【语】祈使语气
detailed_translations.english: something that must be done urgently

name: documentary
trans: 文件的，文献的；记录的，纪实的

sentences.english: One of the most useful sources of documentary evidence is maps.
sentences.chinese: 最有价值的文献证据之一就是地图。

sentences.english: ...a TV documentary on homelessness.
sentences.chinese: …一部关于无家可归现象的电视记录片。

detailed_translations.english: consisting of or written on documents
a film or television or a radio programme that gives detailed information about a particular subject

sentences.english: a species of fish hitherto unknown in the West
sentences.chinese: 迄今在西方还不为人知的一种鱼

detailed_translations.english: up to this time

name: consequence
trans: 结果； 影响； 推理； 重要， 重大

sentences.english: Her lawyer said she understood the consequences of her actions and was prepared to go to jail.
sentences.chinese: 她的律师说她明白自己行为的后果并准备去坐牢。

detailed_translations.english: something that happens as a result of a particular action or set of conditions

name: linear
trans: 线的， 直线的； 线性的； 长度的

sentences.english: a linear diagram
sentences.chinese: 线形图

sentences.english: linear measurements
sentences.chinese: 长度量度

detailed_translations.english: consisting of lines, or in the form of a straight line

sentences.english: a robust man of six feet four
sentences.chinese: 一个身高六英尺四英寸的壮汉

detailed_translations.english: a robust person is strong and healthy

sentences.english: The violet eyes, Taylor's white skin and raven hair may be captivating on their own, but Etcoff said that it was the combination of them that likely boosted her allure.
sentences.chinese: 泰勒蓝紫色的眼睛、白皙的皮肤和乌黑的头发本身就颇为迷人，但是在艾科夫看来，很可能是所有这些的结合，更增添了她的魅力。

detailed_translations.english: a large shiny black bird
raven hair is black and shiny
to seize or seek (plunder, prey, etc)

name: dominant
trans: 统治的， 支配的， 占优势的； 有统治权的

sentences.english: The dominant male gorilla is the largest in the group.
sentences.chinese: 领头的公猩猩是这群大猩猩中体形最大的一个。

sentences.english: Japan became dominant in the mass market during the 1980s.
sentences.chinese: 20世纪80年代日本在大众市场上开始占据优势。

sentences.english: its dominant position within the group
sentences.chinese: 它在该组织中的突出地位

detailed_translations.chinese: 显性的；占优势的；支配的，统治的
detailed_translations.english: more powerful, important, or noticeable than other people or things

sentences.english: chapter headings
sentences.chinese: 章节标题

detailed_translations.english: the title written at the beginning of a piece of writing, or at the beginning of part of a book

name: denounce
trans: 谴责， 公开指责， 抨击； 告发

sentences.english: The group denounced the failure by the authorities to take action.
sentences.chinese: 该团体谴责当局没有采取行动。

sentences.english: She denounced him to the police.
sentences.chinese: 她向警方告发了他。

detailed_translations.english: to express strong disapproval of someone or something, especially in public

name: swampy
trans: 沼泽的， 湿地的； 松软的

sentences.english: Alternatively, the dead could have been killed on the spot in "the swampy valley environment", the paper concludes.
sentences.chinese: 另一种可能是，这些死者是在有“沼泽河谷环境”的地点被杀害的——论文总结道。

sentences.english: On rare clearings in this swampy hell a few Finno-Ugric tribes eventually appeared and left many burial mounts behind, with some of them still belowground because of impassibility of the swamp.
sentences.chinese: 在这难得如此空旷的沼泽地狱里，几个芬兰乌戈尔部落终于出现了，身后留下了许多坟墓，其中有些还是地下，因为的沼泽是那么不近人情。

sentences.english: The car skidded across the road and came to a stop on the grass verge.
sentences.chinese: 汽车滑过路面，在路缘草带上停了下来。

sentences.english: His love of James Dean movies verged on fanaticism.
sentences.chinese: 他对詹姆斯·迪恩影片的喜爱近乎狂热。

detailed_translations.english: an edge or rim; margin
to be very close to a harmful or extreme state

name: framework
trans: 框架， 构架； 原则， 准则； 机制， 结构

sentences.english: We have to act within the existing legal framework.
sentences.chinese: 我们必须在现行的法律框架下行事。

detailed_translations.english: a set of ideas, rules, or beliefs from which something is developed, or on which decisions are based

name: milieu
trans: 出身背景； 社会环境

sentences.english: Proust’s work reflected his own social and cultural milieu.
sentences.chinese: 普鲁斯特的作品反映了其所在的社会和文化背景。

sentences.english: She never felt happy in a student milieu.
sentences.chinese: 在学生中间她从不觉得快乐。

detailed_translations.english: the things and people that surround you and influence the way you live and think

sentences.english: This is actually just a microorganism. But it has roughly 500 genes.
sentences.chinese: 这其实只不过是一个微生物，却拥有约500个基因。

sentences.english: Spread the contents of the amber onto a petri dish containing a microorganism food like starch or soy.
sentences.chinese: 把琥珀内嵌标本放在皮氏培养皿中，并加入微生物食品，比如淀粉或大豆。

sentences.english: Slight mutations that allow a microorganism to resist the full killing power of a medicine are an evolutionary advantage that greatly expedites the development of drug resistance.
sentences.chinese: 略微的突变即可使微生物具有抵抗力，使药物完全失去杀伤力，这种突变是一个进化优势，大大加快了耐药性的产生。

detailed_translations.english: a living thing that is so small that it cannot be seen without a  microscope

sentences.english: The mind exists as a separate entity.
sentences.chinese: 思想作为一个独立的实体存在。

sentences.english: Good design brings a house and garden together as a single entity.
sentences.chinese: 优秀的设计能把一所房子和花园合为一体。

detailed_translations.english: something that exists as a single and complete unit

sentences.english: His life is chronicled in a new biography published last week.
sentences.chinese: 他的生平被写成一本新传记，于上周出版。

sentences.english: The book chronicles the events leading up to the war.
sentences.chinese: 该书记述了导致战争爆发的一系列事件。

detailed_translations.english: to describe events in the order in which they happened

name: tide
trans: 潮， 潮汐； 潮流， 趋势

sentences.english: Is the tide going out or coming in ?
sentences.chinese: 现在是退潮还是涨潮？

sentences.english: We went for a walk and got cut off by the tide .
sentences.chinese: 我们去散步，结果被潮水困住了。

detailed_translations.english: the regular rising and falling of the level of the sea

sentences.english: Smoking is strictly prohibited inside the factory.
sentences.chinese: 厂区严禁吸烟。

detailed_translations.english: to say that an action is illegal or not allowed

name: frugal
trans: 节约的， 节俭的； 少量的

sentences.english: As children we were taught to be frugal and hard-working.
sentences.chinese: 我们小时候被教育要节俭和勤劳。

sentences.english: He led a remarkably frugal existence.
sentences.chinese: 他过着极其节俭的生活。

detailed_translations.chinese: 节俭的；朴素的；花钱少的
detailed_translations.english: careful to buy only what is necessary

name: franchise
trans: 特权，特许；特许经销权；选举权
赋予特权； 赋予选举权

sentences.english: a franchise holder
sentences.chinese: 特许经营权持有人

sentences.english: a franchise agreement
sentences.chinese: 特许经营协议

detailed_translations.chinese: 特权；公民权；经销权；管辖权
detailed_translations.english: permission given by a company to someone who wants to sell its goods or services

detailed_translations.chinese: 给…以特许（或特权）；赋予公民权
detailed_translations.english: to give or sell a franchise to someone

sentences.english: replica guns
sentences.chinese: 仿真枪

detailed_translations.english: an exact copy of something, especially a building, a gun, or a work of art

sentences.english: Some of these bacteria are actually good for you.
sentences.chinese: 实际上，这些细菌有的对你是很有好处的。

sentences.english: When you eat off the plate, all of those bacteria go into your stomach.
sentences.chinese: 当你吃掉了盘子里的食物时，这些细菌就会进入你的肚子。

sentences.english: But she correctly points out that bacteria are everywhere: on us, in us and all around us.
sentences.chinese: 但是她正确地指出细菌无处不在：在我们身上，在我们体内以及在我们周围。

detailed_translations.english: very small living things, some of which cause illness or disease

sentences.english: He is a laureate of corruption, and his friends have introduced him at dinner parties as a writer of pornography.
sentences.chinese: 他是腐败的桂冠作家，而他的朋友在吃饭的时候将他介绍成一个黄色作家。

detailed_translations.english: crowned with laurel leaves as a sign of honour

sentences.english: Last night confusion reigned about how the debate, which continues today, would end.
sentences.chinese: 昨晚，这场在今天继续进行的辩论将如何结束的问题令人困惑。

detailed_translations.chinese: 当政， 统治； 占主导地位
detailed_translations.english: If you say, for example, that silence reigns in a place or confusion reigns in a situation, you mean that the place is silent or the situation is confused

detailed_translations.chinese: 君主的统治，君主的统治时期
detailed_translations.english: the period when someone is king, queen, or  emperor

sentences.english: ...her aging, infirm husband.
sentences.chinese: …她那年迈体弱的丈夫。

detailed_translations.chinese: 衰弱的；意志薄弱的；不坚固的
detailed_translations.english: A person who is infirm is weak or ill, and usually old

name: tempo
trans: 速度， 节奏； 行进速度

sentences.english: In a new recording, the Boston Philharmonic tried the original tempo.
sentences.chinese: 在一张新唱片中，波士顿爱乐乐团尝试了音乐原本的节奏。

sentences.english: the easy tempo of island life
sentences.chinese: 岛上生活的轻松节奏

detailed_translations.english: the speed at which music is played or should be played

sentences.english: He felt some guilt over the manner of her death.
sentences.chinese: 她以这种方式死去，他心里有些内疚。

sentences.english: The issue will be resolved in a manner that is fair to both sides.
sentences.chinese: 这个问题将用对双方都公平的方式来解决。

sentences.english: criticism of the manner in which the bishop was appointed
sentences.chinese: 对主教任命方式的批评

sentences.english: She has a calm relaxed manner.
sentences.chinese: 她举止镇定而从容。

sentences.english: Her children all had such good manners.
sentences.chinese: 她的孩子都很有礼貌。

detailed_translations.english: the way in which something is done or happens

sentences.english: Through science we've got the idea of associating progress with the future.
sentences.chinese: 通过科学我们已有了将进步与未来联系起来的观念。

detailed_translations.chinese: 把…联系在一起；使联合，结合；交往	[ə'səuʃiət]

someone who you work or do business with

name: scrupulous
trans: 多顾虑的， 谨慎的； 一丝不苟的， 严谨的； 审慎正直的， 恪守道德规范的

sentences.english: scrupulous attention to detail
sentences.chinese: 对细节的一丝不苟

detailed_translations.chinese: 细心的；小心谨慎的；一丝不苟的
detailed_translations.english: doing something very carefully so that nothing is left out

name: gleam
trans: 闪光， 闪烁； 流露出

sentences.chinese: 他们看到一道微光一闪而过。

sentences.english: The wooden panelling was gleaming with wax polish.
sentences.chinese: 木嵌板上过蜡显得很光亮。

detailed_translations.english: a small pale light, especially one that shines for a short time

trans: 点滴搜集， 四处收集

sentences.english: At present we're gleaning information from all sources.
sentences.chinese: 目前我们正从所有渠道慢慢收集信息。

detailed_translations.english: to collect grain that has been left behind after the crops have been cut
