trans: 最初的； 主要的， 首要的

sentences.english: Yet some of the most radical ideas about our primal urges have been harnessed by those who want everyone to drink the same brand of beer.
sentences.chinese: 然而，那些恨不得人人都喝同一品牌啤酒的守旧派们，则给人类原始冲动中的某些最本质的欲望，套上了枷锁。

sentences.english: Data can be pasted into word processing documents.
sentences.chinese: 数据可以粘贴到文字处理文件中。

detailed_translations.english: to make words that you have removed or copied appear in a new place on a computer screen

detailed_translations.chinese: 面团，膏；糊状物，[胶粘] 浆糊
detailed_translations.english: a soft thick mixture that can easily be shaped or spread

name: directory
trans: 人名地址录， 电话号码簿； 目录

sentences.english: I couldn’t find your number in the telephone directory.
sentences.chinese: 我在电话簿上找不到你的电话号码。

sentences.english: a new business directory
sentences.chinese: 新的商业名录

detailed_translations.english: a book or list of names, facts etc, usually arranged in alphabetical order

sentences.english: ...a young man in jeans and a worn T-shirt.
sentences.chinese: …一个穿着牛仔裤和破旧T恤衫的年轻人。

detailed_translations.english: trousers made of denim(= a strong, usually blue, cotton cloth )

sentences.english: Britain's head of state is a constitutional monarch.
sentences.chinese: 英国的国家元首是君主立宪的国王或女王。

detailed_translations.english: a king or queen

name: overnight
trans: 通宵的， 一整夜的； 一夜之间的

sentences.english: He became a millionaire overnight.
sentences.chinese: 他一夜之间就成了百万富翁。

detailed_translations.english: suddenly or surprisingly quickly
happening during the night or for the night

name: behave
trans: 行为， 表现； 表现得体， 有礼貌； 作出反应

sentences.english: She behaved in a very responsible way .
sentences.chinese: 她表现得很有责任心。

sentences.english: I couldn't believe these people were behaving in this way.
sentences.chinese: 我无法相信这些人竟这样行事。

detailed_translations.chinese: 表现，举止；运转，做出反应
detailed_translations.english: to do things that are good, bad, sensible etc
The way that you behave is the way that you do and say things, and the things that you do and say

sentences.english: laser surgery
sentences.chinese: 激光(外科)手术

detailed_translations.english: a beam of light produced by a laser

name: scope
trans: 范围， 界限； 眼界， 见识； 余地， 机会

sentences.english: measures to limit the scope of criminals’ activities
sentences.chinese: 限制罪犯活动范围的措施

detailed_translations.english: the range of things that a subject, activity, book etc deals with

name: notate
trans: 以符号表示， 把…写成记号

detailed_translations.chinese: 以符号表示， 把…写成记号
detailed_translations.english: to write (esp music) in notation

sentences.english: He specializes in archaeology.
sentences.chinese: 他专修考古学。

sentences.english: In my recent research, I found that all three come together and, what is more, they help me to show that archaeology has relevance – it is not just old stones and bones.
sentences.chinese: 我在最近的研究中发现，这三点综合发生着作用，除此之外，它们也帮助我发现考古学的重要意义，它不仅仅意味着一堆石头和骨头。

sentences.english: "There was no access to clean water, there was no access to basic education especially in the rural areas where the archaeology was," she says.
sentences.chinese: 在那里的考古学特别是农村地区，我们并没有获得干净的水，有没有基本的教育的机会，“她说。

detailed_translations.english: the study of ancient societies by examining what remains of their buildings,  grave s  , tools etc

name: molecular
trans: 分子的； 摩尔的； 由分子组成的

sentences.english: ...the molecular structure of fuel.
sentences.chinese: …燃料的分子结构。

detailed_translations.english: Molecular means relating to or involving molecules

sentences.english: A win is always good for morale.
sentences.chinese: 胜利总是可以鼓舞士气。

sentences.english: The failed coup caused a loss of morale within the army.
sentences.chinese: 政变未遂挫伤了军队的士气。

sentences.english: the Prince’s morale-boosting (= intended to raise morale ) mission to the war﹣torn country
sentences.chinese: 王子去这个饱受战争磨难的国家鼓舞士气的使命

detailed_translations.english: the level of confidence and positive feelings that people have, especially people who work together, who belong to the same team etc

sentences.english: extremists on the periphery of the animal rights movement
sentences.chinese: 处于动物权利运动边缘的极端分子

detailed_translations.chinese: 外围，边缘；圆周；圆柱体表面
detailed_translations.english: the edge of an area

sentences.english: The medium of fresco makes great demands on a painter's techinical skill.
sentences.chinese: 壁画这种绘画形式对画家的技巧有很高要求。

sentences.english: We show this in a scene in the Sistine Chapel [in Rome] where we create a big crack in the fresco of God and Adam.
sentences.chinese: 我们将这个观点放到了发生在罗马西斯廷教堂的一幕里——一幅绘有上帝与亚当的壁画发生严重断裂。

sentences.english: Today, much of it is occupied by government offices and only vestiges of its beauty endure – admittedly including Gozzoli's fresco of the journey of the Magi.
sentences.chinese: 如今政府办公室占据了它很多的建筑，而梅迪奇·里卡尔第宫也仅保留一丝当年的痕迹--这其中包括戈佐利所绘的壁画《三圣贤之旅》。

detailed_translations.english: a painting made on a wall while the  plaster  is still wet

name: identify
trans: 识别； 鉴定； 找到， 发现

sentences.english: He was too far away to be able to identify faces.
sentences.chinese: 他离得太远，没法看面孔认出谁是谁。

sentences.english: The police took fingerprints and identified the body.
sentences.chinese: 警方采集了指纹，对尸体作了身份确认。

detailed_translations.english: to recognize and correctly name someone or something

sentences.english: We hope these regions will embrace democratic reforms.
sentences.chinese: 我们希望这些地区会乐意接受民主改革。

sentences.english: Most West European countries have embraced the concept of high-speed rail networks with enthusiasm.
sentences.chinese: 大多数西欧国家都表现出极大的兴趣，欣然接受修建高速铁路网的想法。

detailed_translations.english: to eagerly accept a new idea, opinion, religion etc

sentences.english: Well, we know nitrogen has what?
sentences.chinese: 对于氮气我们知道什么？

sentences.english: The plant requires nitrogen in order to make proteins.
sentences.chinese: 植物需要氮以便制造蛋白质。

sentences.english: All of these from the group one and two through the group five and six elements, but what about elements, what about molecules like hydrogen, or nitrogen, or maybe oxygen?
sentences.chinese: 所有的这些都是来自于第一主族和第二组主族,到第五主族和第六组主族的悬殊，那么元素呢，比如氢气，氮气或氧气那样的分子呢？

detailed_translations.english: a gas that has no colour or smell, and that forms most of the Earth’s air. It is a chemical element: symbol N

sentences.english: Each guestroom also features celebrated local and regional works of art, paying tribute to the true artesian nature of the indigenous painters, sculptors, and basket-weavers.
sentences.chinese: 每个客房还设有著名的地方和地域性的艺术作品，赞颂的土著画家、雕塑家真正的自流性，和编织篮子。

sentences.english: a luggage label
sentences.chinese: 行李标签

detailed_translations.english: a piece of paper or another material that is attached to something and gives information about it
to attach a label onto something or write information on something

sentences.english: We saw a ray at the aquarium.
sentences.chinese: 我们在水族馆看见了一只鳐。

sentences.english: In Amsterdam the girls all stand in the windows shimmering as tantalising as tropical fish beyond the gleam of aquarium glass.
sentences.chinese: 在阿姆斯特丹，姑娘们都站在窗后，光芒四射柔情撩人宛如水族馆玻璃背后脉脉含情的热带鱼。

sentences.english: Recently the bakers created an octopus complete with tentacles and suckers for a charity event held for a local aquarium.
sentences.chinese: 最近，面包师为当地水族馆举行的慈善活动制作了这只章鱼，它拥有完整的触手和吸盘。

detailed_translations.english: a clear glass or plastic container for fish and other water animals

name: modify
trans: 修改， 更改； 缓和； 【语】修饰

sentences.english: The feedback will be used to modify the course for next year.
sentences.chinese: 这些反馈意见将用于修改明年的课程。

sentences.english: The regulations can only be modified by a special committee.
sentences.chinese: 这些法规只能由特别委员会来修改。

detailed_translations.english: to make small changes to something in order to improve it and make it more suitable or effective

sentences.english: She sings soprano .
sentences.chinese: 她唱女高音。

detailed_translations.chinese: 女高音；最高音部；女高音歌手
detailed_translations.english: a very high singing voice belonging to a woman or a boy, or a singer with a voice like this
a soprano voice or instrument has the highest range of notes

name: mortify
trans: 使蒙受屈辱， 使难堪

sentences.english: Jane mortified her family by leaving her husband.
sentences.chinese: 简的家人为简离开丈夫感到奇耻大辱。

detailed_translations.chinese: 使蒙受屈辱， 使难堪
detailed_translations.english: If you say that something mortifies you, you mean that it offends or embarrasses you a great deal

name: cram
trans: 填塞， 塞满； 匆忙准备， 临时死记硬背

sentences.english: She’s been cramming hard all week.
sentences.chinese: 她整个星期都在拼命准备应付考试。

detailed_translations.chinese: 狼吞虎咽地吃东西；死记硬背功课

name: clone
trans: 克隆动物，无性繁殖动物；复制品，翻版
克隆， 以无性繁殖技术复制

sentences.english: The idea of cloning extinct life forms still belongs to science fiction.
sentences.chinese: 对绝种的生命形式进行克隆的想法仍然属于科学幻想。

detailed_translations.english: to make an exact copy of a plant or animal by taking a cell from it and developing it artificially

detailed_translations.chinese: 无性繁殖系，克隆；复制品，翻版
detailed_translations.english: an animal or plant produced by scientists from one cell of another animal or plant, so that they are exactly the same

sentences.english: The two men detested each other.
sentences.chinese: 两个男人互相厌恶。

detailed_translations.english: to hate something or someone very much

name: enunciate
trans: 清晰地发音； 表达， 阐明

sentences.english: His voice was harsh as he enunciated each word carefully.
sentences.chinese: 他用刺耳的声音小心地一字一句地念着。

sentences.english: She enunciates very slowly and carefully.
sentences.chinese: 她慢慢地、仔细地读着。

detailed_translations.english: When you enunciate a word or part of a word, you pronounce it clearly

name: reservoir
trans: 水库， 蓄水池； 储备， 储藏

sentences.english: All these earthquakes happened when the water level in Zipingpu reservoir was low.
sentences.chinese: 所有这些地震都发生在紫坪铺水库水位很低的时候。

detailed_translations.english: a lake, especially an artificial one, where water is stored before it is supplied to people’s houses

sentences.english: So we have the current argument over how much of the derivative market will be exempt from regulation.
sentences.chinese: 所以我们就看到了当前有关衍生产品市场到底有多大份额可以得到规则的豁免的辩论。

sentences.english: All the new rules do is exempt the user from legal liability - something Apple does not appear to be pursuing anyway.
sentences.chinese: 新法规做到的仅仅是免除了用户的法律责任 - 看起来苹果本来也不打算追究这种责任。

sentences.english: So empirical approaches to literature, the simple observation of data from which one can generalize -they exempt these from the general charge against literary theory.
sentences.chinese: 文学的经验主义研究方法，对我们所概括的事物的简单数据观察,对文学理论的普遍控诉中,他们免除了这些。

name: degenerative
trans: 衰退的， 堕落的； 变性的

sentences.english: ...degenerative diseases of the brain, like Alzheimer's.
sentences.chinese: ... 大脑退化的疾病，就像老年痴呆症一样。

detailed_translations.chinese: 衰退的， 堕落的； 变性的
detailed_translations.english: a degenerative illness gradually gets worse and cannot be stopped

sentences.english: crab meat
sentences.chinese: 蟹肉

detailed_translations.english: a sea animal with a hard shell, five legs on each side, and two large claws
to hunt or catch crabs

sentences.english: She’s been an outspoken feminist for over twenty years.
sentences.chinese: 20多年来，她一直是个直言不讳的女权主义者。

detailed_translations.english: someone who supports the idea that women should have the same rights and opportunities as men
Feminist groups, ideas, and activities are involved in feminism

name: aesthetic
trans: 审美的， 美学的； 美的， 艺术的

sentences.english: From an esthetic point of view, it’s a nice design.
sentences.chinese: 从美学角度看，这是个不错的设计。

sentences.english: a work of great aesthetic appeal
sentences.chinese: 极富美之神韵的作品

detailed_translations.english: connected with beauty and the study of beauty

sentences.english: There is no emergency back-up immediately available.
sentences.chinese: 没有立即就能获得的后备。

detailed_translations.english: Backup consists of extra equipment, resources, or people that you can get help or support from if necessary

sentences.english: He's not very good at arithmetic.
sentences.chinese: 他不太擅长算术。

sentences.english: a quick bit of mental arithmetic
sentences.chinese: 快速心算

detailed_translations.english: the type of mathematics that deals with the adding, multiplying, etc. of numbers

name: hardy
trans: 强壮的； 耐寒的； 能吃苦耐劳的

sentences.english: hardy mountain goats
sentences.chinese: 能适应恶劣环境的石山羊

detailed_translations.chinese: 坚强的；勇敢的；能吃苦耐劳的；鲁莽的
detailed_translations.english: strong and healthy and able to bear difficult living conditions

detailed_translations.chinese: 强壮的人；耐寒植物；方柄凿
detailed_translations.english: any blacksmith's tool made with a square shank so that it can be lodged in a square hole in an anvil

sentences.english: The local paper featured me standing on a stepladder with a caption, "Wendy climbs the ladder to success."
sentences.chinese: 当地的报纸刊登了一幅我站在活梯上的特写，下面写着：“温迪登上了成功之梯。”

detailed_translations.english: words printed above or below a picture in a book or newspaper or on a television screen to explain what the picture is showing

name: mismanage
trans: 对…管理不当， 处理不当

sentences.english: The nation’s finances had been badly mismanaged.
sentences.chinese: 国家的金融管理非常混乱。

detailed_translations.chinese: 对…管理不当， 处理不当
detailed_translations.english: if someone mismanages something they are in charge of, they deal with or manage it badly

sentences.english: Around one third of our meals should be based on carbohydrate, with roughly one half of these grains being whole.
sentences.chinese: 我们每餐食物应当差不多有三分之一是碳水化合物，大概有一半谷物食品为全麦的。

sentences.english: There have been no studies of the effects of a low carbohydrate diet on pregnancy, so its effect on the fetus, if any, are unknown.
sentences.chinese: 目前为止还没有关于怀孕时低碳水化合物饮食影响的研究，因此如果对胎儿有什么影响也是不知道的。

sentences.english: The reason for this is that carbohydrate consumption stimulates insulin production, which aids the production of muscle glycogen.
sentences.chinese: 这是因为是碳水化合物的消耗刺激了胰岛素的分泌，后者对于肌肉糖原产生有帮助。

detailed_translations.english: a substance that is in foods such as sugar, bread, and potatoes, which provides your body with heat and energy and which consists of oxygen,  hydrogen  , and  carbon

name: subconscious
trans: 下意识的， 潜意识的

sentences.english: a subconscious fear of failure
sentences.chinese: 对失败下意识的恐惧

detailed_translations.english: subconscious feelings, desires etc are hidden in your mind and affect your behaviour, but you do not know that you have them

name: eject
trans: 逐出， 驱赶； 喷出， 喷射； 弹出

sentences.english: The demonstrators were ejected from the hall.
sentences.chinese: 示威者被赶出大厅。

sentences.english: Two engines cut out and the plane started to eject fuel as it lost height.
sentences.chinese: 两个发动机突然熄火，飞机在下降的同时开始喷出燃料。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone leave a place or building by using force

sentences.english: "This is probably one of the worst storms since 1990," a meteorologist in Seattle said.
sentences.chinese: 西雅图气象专家表示，这也许是自1990年以来最严重的暴风雪。

sentences.english: At the time, he noted that "One meteorologist remarked that if the theory were correct, one flap of a seagull's wings could change the course of weather forever".
sentences.chinese: 在文中，他写道：“一位气象学者注意到，如果这个理论是正确的，那就意味着一只海鸥扇动一下翅膀能够永久地改变天气的进程”。

sentences.english: By e-mail and earphone, he confers with Jack Parrish, chief meteorologist, and they order the NOAA technician to slip a dropsonde into the shoot.
sentences.chinese: 通过电子邮件和耳机，他与首席气象学家杰克·帕里什联络，指挥NOAA的技术人员发射下投式探空仪。

name: defect
trans: 瑕疵， 缺陷； 过失

sentences.english: All the cars are tested for defects before they leave the factory.
sentences.chinese: 所有汽车在出厂前都经过品质检验。

sentences.english: a genetic defect
sentences.chinese: 遗传缺陷

detailed_translations.english: a fault or a lack of something that means that something or someone is not perfect
to leave your own country or group in order to go to or join an opposing one

sentences.english: obedience classes for dogs and their owners
sentences.chinese: 为狗和主人安排的服从训练课

detailed_translations.english: when someone does what they are told to do, or what a law, rule etc says they must do

name: reinforce
trans: 加固， 加强； 增援

sentences.english: I hope this will reinforce Indonesian determination to deal with this kind of threat.
sentences.chinese: 我希望这会加强印度尼西亚对付这类威胁的决心。

sentences.english: Both sides have been reinforcing their positions after yesterday's fierce fighting.
sentences.chinese: 在昨天的激战后，双方一直在增援各自的阵地。

detailed_translations.english: to give support to an opinion, idea, or feeling, and make it stronger

name: casual
trans: 非正式的， 随便的； 漫不经心的； 漠不关心的， 冷淡的； 偶然的， 碰巧的； 临时的

sentences.english: a casual manner
sentences.chinese: 漫不经心的态度

sentences.english: His eyes were angry, though he sounded casual.
sentences.chinese: 虽然他的语气满不在乎，但他的眼神充满怒气。

sentences.english: Marsha was quite casual about appearing on TV.
sentences.chinese: 玛莎对于上电视很无所谓。

sentences.english: a casual conversation
sentences.chinese: 随便的谈话

sentences.english: He made some casual remark (= one without thinking much about it ) about her holiday.
sentences.chinese: 他随口提到了她度假的事。

detailed_translations.chinese: 漫不经心的，随便的；偶然的
detailed_translations.english: relaxed and not worried, or seeming not to care about something

sentences.english: She looked at him over the rim of her glass.
sentences.chinese: 她沿玻璃杯口看着他。

detailed_translations.english: the outside edge of something circular
to be around the edge of something

name: decline
trans: 下降； 衰退； 拒绝， 谢绝

sentences.english: Offered the position of chairman, Smith declined, preferring to keep his current job.
sentences.chinese: 对担任主席的邀约，史密斯拒绝了，他宁愿留在现在的职位上。

sentences.english: Mary declined a hot drink and went to her room.
sentences.chinese: 玛丽谢绝了热饮料，到自己的房间去了。

sentences.english: The minister declined to comment (= refused to speak to people who report the news ) about the progress of the peace talks.
sentences.chinese: 部长拒绝就和谈进程发表评论。

detailed_translations.english: to say no politely when someone invites you somewhere, offers you something, or wants you to do something

sentences.english: Her clothes had all been ripped.
sentences.chinese: 她的衣服都被撕破了。

sentences.english: The sail ripped under the force of the wind.
sentences.chinese: 船帆被狂风刮破了。

sentences.english: Impatiently, Sue ripped the letter open .
sentences.chinese: 休急不可待地撕开信封。

detailed_translations.english: to tear something or be torn quickly and violently
a long tear or cut

name: property
trans: 财产， 所有物； 所有权； 房产， 地产； 特性

sentences.english: The hotel is not responsible for any loss or damage to guests’ personal property .
sentences.chinese: 宾馆对住客个人财物的丢失和损坏概不负责。

sentences.english: Some of the stolen property was found in Mason’s house.
sentences.chinese: 在梅森家里找到了部分被盗财物。

detailed_translations.english: the thing or things that someone owns

name: debris
trans: 岩屑； 残骸； 碎屑

sentences.english: She was hit by flying debris from the blast.
sentences.chinese: 她被爆炸产生的飞散碎片击中。

detailed_translations.english: the pieces of something that are left after it has been destroyed in an accident, explosion etc

sentences.english: Police scuffled with some of the protesters.
sentences.chinese: 警察和一些抗议者打了起来。

detailed_translations.english: to have a short fight with someone, in a way that is not very serious or violent
a short fight that is not very violent

name: luster
trans: 光亮， 光泽； 荣耀

sentences.english: Then it’s really no more than a means of transportation, it too loses its luster.
sentences.chinese: 然后它就仅仅是一个名符其实的交通工具，失去了它的光彩。

sentences.english: College graduates may be losing some of their luster for reasons beyond technology and trade.
sentences.chinese: 大学毕业生也许会因为技术和贸易之外的原因失去一些光彩。

sentences.english: No one knows for sure when the tide started to turn, or the exact moment when American gold started its slow but seemingly irreversible loss of luster.
sentences.chinese: 无人确切知晓这波潮汐的消退始于何时，也没有人精确的得知美金的光泽从何时起开始缓慢，但不可逆转的褪色。

sentences.english: I handled most of the paperwork.
sentences.chinese: 大部分文书工作是我做的。

sentences.english: The case is being handled by a top lawyer.
sentences.chinese: 此案正由一位顶尖律师负责处理。

sentences.english: The finance department handles all the accounts.
sentences.chinese: 财务部处理所有账目。

sentences.english: Computers can handle huge amounts of data.
sentences.chinese: 计算机能处理大量数据。

detailed_translations.english: to do the things that are necessary to complete a job

sentences.english: Much of this, she says, is due to increased urbanization.
sentences.chinese: 而这些，主要是由于不断增加的都市化造成的。

sentences.english: These diseases are now everywhere, driven as they are by universal forces, like urbanization and the globalization of unhealthy lifestyles.
sentences.chinese: 现在，在城市化和不健康生活方式的全球化等普遍因素的影响下，这些疾病无处不在。

sentences.english: Countries and regions all over the world face the challenge of urbanization.
sentences.chinese: 全球各地的国家和地区都面临城市化的挑战。

detailed_translations.english: Urbanization is the process of creating cities or towns in country areas

name: tough
trans: 坚韧的； 棘手的， 困难的； 强健的， 吃苦耐劳的； 粗暴的； 严格的； 老的

sentences.english: It was a tough race.
sentences.chinese: 比赛打得很艰难。

sentences.english: She’s had a tough life.
sentences.chinese: 她的生活十分艰辛。

sentences.english: The company admitted that it had been a tough year.
sentences.chinese: 公司承认那是艰难的一年。

sentences.english: Tough decisions will have to be made.
sentences.chinese: 必须作出艰难的决定。

sentences.english: The reporters were asking a lot of tough questions .
sentences.chinese: 记者们问了很多难以回答的问题。

sentences.english: (= a difficult decision ) , but we had to cancel the game because of the weather.
sentences.chinese: 尽管是一个艰难的决定，但由于天气不好我们只得取消比赛。

sentences.english: I find his books pretty tough going (= difficult to read ) .
sentences.chinese: 我发现他的书很难读。

sentences.english: Gage predicted the president’s proposal would be a tough sell (= something that is difficult to persuade someone about ) before Congress.
sentences.chinese: 盖奇预言总统的提议在国会很难通过。

detailed_translations.english: difficult to do or deal with

sentences.english: Flour, , milk, butter and yeast are some ingredients in bread.
sentences.chinese: 面粉、牛奶、黄油和酵母是做面包的一些原料。

sentences.english: However in another book I found a graph showing yeast cell population growth and specific gravity plotted against time .
sentences.chinese: 然而，在另一本书，我发现一个图表显示人口增长与酵母细胞比重密谋对付时间。

detailed_translations.english: a type of fungus used for producing alcohol in beer and wine, and for making bread rise

name: script
trans: 剧本，脚本，广播稿；笔迹；字母表

sentences.english: a diary entry written in neat black script
sentences.chinese: 用工整的黑色字写下的一则日记

sentences.english: ...James Cameron, who scripted and directed both films.
sentences.chinese: …为这两部电影写脚本并执导的詹姆斯·卡梅伦。

detailed_translations.chinese: 脚本；手迹；书写用的字母
detailed_translations.english: writing done by hand
The person who scripts a movie or a radio or television play writes it

name: melody
trans: 旋律， 曲调； 乐曲， 歌曲

sentences.english: They played some lovely melodies.
sentences.chinese: 他们演奏了一些动听的曲子。

sentences.english: a haunting melody
sentences.chinese: 难以忘怀的曲调

detailed_translations.english: a song or tune

sentences.english: part 2 of a trilogy
sentences.chinese: 三部曲的第二部

detailed_translations.english: a series of three plays, books etc that are about the same people or subject

name: spot
trans: 地点； 斑点； 少量

sentences.english: a nice quiet spot on the beach
sentences.chinese: 海滩上一个安静的好地方

sentences.english: I chose a spot well away from the road.
sentences.chinese: 我选了一个远离马路的地点。

detailed_translations.english: a particular place or area, especially a pleasant place where you spend time

detailed_translations.chinese: 认出， 发现； 玷污
detailed_translations.english: to notice someone or something, especially when they are difficult to see or recognize

name: sterile
trans: 不育的； 贫瘠的； 无菌的； 无结果的， 没有实际价值的； 刻板的

sentences.english: The classrooms are sterile, with no artwork on the walls.
sentences.chinese: 这些教室毫无生气，墙上一张画都没有。

detailed_translations.chinese: 不育的；无菌的；贫瘠的；不毛的；枯燥乏味的
detailed_translations.english: a person or animal that is sterile cannot produce babies

sentences.english: chemicals that pollute the local watercourse
sentences.chinese: 污染当地河道的化学品

detailed_translations.english: a place where water flows, for example a river or canal

name: catholic
trans: 广泛的，包罗万象的；[C-]天主教的

sentences.english: She has catholic tastes (= likes a lot of different things ) .
sentences.chinese: 她的兴趣非常广泛。

sentences.english: a catholic collection of records
sentences.chinese: 包罗万象的唱片收藏

sentences.english: At least nine out of ten Mexicans are baptized Catholics.
sentences.chinese: 至少十分之九的墨西哥人是受过洗礼的天主教徒。

detailed_translations.english: including a very wide variety of things
A Catholic is a member of the Catholic Church

sentences.english: the mighty Mississippi river
sentences.chinese: 浩荡的密西西比河

sentences.english: a mighty army
sentences.chinese: 强大的军队

detailed_translations.chinese: 有力的；强有力的；有势力的
detailed_translations.english: very strong and powerful, or very big and impressive
very

name: partial
trans: 部分的， 不完全的； 偏爱的， 癖好的； 偏袒的

sentences.english: The exhibition was only a partial success.
sentences.chinese: 那次展会只获得部分成功。

sentences.english: a partial solution to traffic congestion in Oxford
sentences.chinese: 部分解决牛津地区交通拥堵问题的方法

sentences.english: I might be accused of being partial.
sentences.chinese: 我可能会被人指责是偏袒的。

detailed_translations.english: not complete

name: pictorial
trans: 图示的，有图片的；绘画的，图画的

sentences.english: a pictorial record of their journey
sentences.chinese: 他们旅程的照片记录

detailed_translations.english: using or relating to paintings, drawings, or photographs

name: slough
trans: 泥坑， 沼泽； 绝境

sentences.english: All reptiles have to slough their skin to grow.
sentences.chinese: 所有爬行动物都必须自然脱皮才能成长

detailed_translations.english: When a plant sloughs its leaves, or an animal such as a snake sloughs its skin, the leaves or skin come off naturally

detailed_translations.chinese: 泥坑， 沼泽； 绝境
detailed_translations.english: an area of land covered in deep dirty water or mud

sentences.english: They turned fire hoses on the people and drenched them.
sentences.chinese: 他们打开消防水龙头朝人群喷去，把他们浇湿。

sentences.english: ...the idea of spending two whole days hanging on to a raft and getting drenched by icy water.
sentences.chinese: …在筏子上飘流整整两天并让冰冷的水湿透的想法。

detailed_translations.english: To drench something or someone means to make them completely wet

sentences.english: You have the right to retain possession of the goods.
sentences.chinese: 你有权保留这些物品。

sentences.english: The state wants to retain control of food imports.
sentences.chinese: 政府想保留对食品进口的控制权。

detailed_translations.english: to keep something or continue to have something

name: drastic
trans: 剧烈的， 猛烈的， 激烈的

sentences.english: drastic cuts in government spending
sentences.chinese: 政府开支的急剧削减

sentences.english: Drastic changesare needed if environmental catastrophe is to be avoided.
sentences.chinese: 要想避免环境灾难就需要重大的变革。

detailed_translations.english: extreme and sudden

sentences.english: the Victorian epoch
sentences.chinese: 维多利亚时代

sentences.english: The king’s death marked the end of an epoch.
sentences.chinese: 这位国王的去世标志着一个时代的结束。

sentences.english: the beginning of a new epoch
sentences.chinese: 新纪元的开始

detailed_translations.english: a period of history

sentences.english: a retail price of £8.99
sentences.chinese: 8.99英镑的零售价

sentences.english: The retail value would be around $500.
sentences.chinese: 零售价在500美元左右。

sentences.english: Retail sales fell by 1.3% in January.
sentences.chinese: 1月份零售额下降了1.3%。

sentences.english: The wine retails at £6.95 a bottle.
sentences.chinese: 这种葡萄酒每瓶的零售价为6.95英镑。

detailed_translations.english: the sale of goods in shops to customers, for their own use and not for selling to anyone else
to be sold for a particular price in a shop

name: crew
trans: 全体船员； 全体工作人员

sentences.english: The plane crashed, killing two of the crew and four passengers.
sentences.chinese: 飞机坠毁，造成两名机组人员和四名乘客死亡。

sentences.english: a crew member
sentences.chinese: 一名机组人员

detailed_translations.english: all the people who work on a ship or plane

sentences.english: I fended off his sword thrust with my spear.
sentences.chinese: 他一刀砍来， 我拿枪架住。

sentences.english: He transfixed the enemy's heart with a spear.
sentences.chinese: 他用长矛刺穿了敌人的心脏。

sentences.english: Yes,of course. My shield is the strongest.It can stop any spear in the world.
sentences.chinese: 当然是了。我的盾是最结实的，它能抵挡住世界上任何矛。

detailed_translations.english: a pole with a sharp pointed blade at one end, used as a weapon in the past
to push or throw a spear into something, especially in order to kill it

sentences.english: the need for large businesses to innovate
sentences.chinese: 大公司革新的需要

sentences.english: The company has successfully innovated new products and services.
sentences.chinese: 公司成功地创出了新产品和服务。

detailed_translations.english: to start to use new ideas, methods, or inventions

name: extravagant
trans: 放肆的， 过分的； 奢侈的， 铺张的

sentences.english: Would it be too extravagant to buy both?
sentences.chinese: 把两个都买下会不会太奢侈了？

sentences.english: an extravagant lifestyle
sentences.chinese: 奢侈的生活方式

sentences.english: an extravagant display of loyalty
sentences.chinese: 过分表露忠诚

sentences.english: Don’t be too extravagant with the wine.
sentences.chinese: 不要酗酒。

detailed_translations.english: spending or costing a lot of money, especially more than is necessary or more than you can afford

name: accommodate
trans: 提供； 容纳； 适应， 顺应

sentences.english: He bought a huge house to accommodate his library.
sentences.chinese: 他买了一座大房子来放他的藏书。

sentences.english: The ballroom can accommodate 400 people.
sentences.chinese: 那个舞厅可容纳400人。

detailed_translations.english: if a room, building etc can accommodate a particular number of people or things, it has enough space for them

sentences.english: When water boils, bubbles rise to the surface.
sentences.chinese: 水烧开时，水面会冒泡泡。

sentences.english: soap bubbles
sentences.chinese: 肥皂泡

sentences.english: She was blowing bubbles in her milk with a straw.
sentences.chinese: 她用吸管在牛奶里吹泡泡。

sentences.english: Heat the cheese until it bubbles.
sentences.chinese: 把奶酪加热到冒泡。

detailed_translations.english: a ball of air or gas in liquid
to produce bubbles

name: yield
trans: 生产，出产；屈服，顺从；让出，放弃；变形，弯曲

sentences.english: Our research has only recently begun to yield important results.
sentences.chinese: 直到最近我们的研究才开始取得重要成果。

detailed_translations.english: to produce a result, answer, or piece of information

name: protagonist
trans: 主角， 主人公； 领导者， 倡导者

sentences.english: the main protagonists in the conflict
sentences.chinese: 主要的冲突方

detailed_translations.chinese: 主角，主演；主要人物，领导者
detailed_translations.english: the most important character in a play, film, or story

sentences.english: What will you do this vacation?
sentences.chinese: 你这个假期将干什么？

sentences.english: Do you have any vacation plans?
sentences.chinese: 您假期有什么安排吗？

sentences.english: Do you have any idea for this vacation?
sentences.chinese: 这个假期你有什么想法吗？

detailed_translations.english: to go somewhere for a holiday
a holiday, or time spent not working

name: sacred
trans: 宗教的； 上帝的， 神圣的

sentences.english: a sacred vow
sentences.chinese: 神圣的誓言

sentences.english: the miraculous powers of sacred relics
sentences.chinese: 圣物的神奇力量

sentences.english: Certain animals were considered sacred.
sentences.chinese: 有些动物被认为是神圣的。

detailed_translations.chinese: 神的；神圣的；宗教的；庄严的
detailed_translations.english: relating to a god or religion

sentences.english: People who had heard the evidence at the trial were surprised at the outcome.
sentences.chinese: 在审判过程中听过证词的人都对此结果感到吃惊。

detailed_translations.english: the final result of a meeting, discussion, war etc – used especially when no one knows what it will be until it actually happens

name: polar
trans: 极的， 极地的； 磁极的； 正好相反的， 截然对立的

sentences.english: Well, what is the equation of this circle in polar coordinates?
sentences.chinese: 那么，这个圆方程在极坐标系下相当于什么呢？

sentences.english: This image shows part of a polar crater that still holds on to some summer ice, as well as beautiful sand dunes sculpted by the wind.
sentences.chinese: 这张照片展示了某个极地陨坑，陨坑中还保存着一些夏季冰的痕迹，在风的作用下形成了一些美丽的沙丘。

sentences.english: Yet, while not wanting to begrudge the polar bear his ice, we should be at least somewhat concerned at this recent shift in thinking.
sentences.chinese: 然而，虽然我们并不想希望北极熊失去它的冰，我们至少应该对近期的这些意识上的转变有一点担心。

name: tender
trans: 嫩的；脆弱的；温柔的，亲切的

sentences.english: Continue cooking until the meat is tender.
sentences.chinese: 把肉一直烧到松软为止。

detailed_translations.chinese: 嫩的；脆弱的；疼痛的，一触即痛的；温柔的
detailed_translations.english: tender food is easy to cut and eat, especially because it has been well cooked
to formally offer or show something to someone
a formal statement of the price you would charge for doing a job or providing goods or services

sentences.english: This system traps the gasoline vapor escaping from the fuel tank and carburetor .
sentences.chinese: 这个系统能收集从燃油箱和化油器泄漏出来的汽油蒸气。

sentences.english: The phenomenon of vapor explosions threatens the safe storage and transportation of liquefied petroleum gas.
sentences.chinese: 液化石油气蒸汽爆炸是对其安全储运构成很大威胁的一种观象。

sentences.english: And so, you make not only water vapor, NOX but you make some nitrous oxides, NOX, or nox as it is known, and this is the precursor to smog.
sentences.chinese: 这样不仅仅得到的水蒸气，但是你会得到一些氮氧化物，或者如大家所知到的nox，这是烟雾的前驱体。

sentences.english: Languages are an essential part of the school curriculum.
sentences.chinese: 语言是学校课程中必不可少的部分。

sentences.english: curriculum planning
sentences.chinese: 课程安排

detailed_translations.english: the subjects that are taught by a school, college etc, or the things that are studied in a particular subject

name: meditate
trans: 沉思， 冥想； 考虑； 谋划

sentences.english: She sat quietly, meditating on the day’s events.
sentences.chinese: 她静静地坐着，思考着这一天发生的事。

sentences.english: I try to meditate for half an hour every evening.
sentences.chinese: 我每天晚上尽量默想半小时。

detailed_translations.chinese: 想,考虑；(尤指宗教上的)沉思,冥想
detailed_translations.english: to think seriously and deeply about something

sentences.english: How do you test the prototype of the vending machine?
sentences.chinese: 你如何测试一个自动售货机的原型?。

sentences.english: What is the difference between these prototype declaration?
sentences.chinese: 这些原型声明的区别是什么？

sentences.english: But how do you come up with the architecture for this evolutionary prototype?
sentences.chinese: 但是你将如何为这个进化的原型提出系统的架构呢？

detailed_translations.english: the first form that a new design of a car, machine etc has, or a model of it used to test the design before it is produced

sentences.english: My first novel was rejected by six publishers. In the meantime I had written a play.
sentences.chinese: 我的第一部小说遭到六家出版商的拒绝。其间我又完成了一部戏剧。

sentences.english: The doctor will be here soon. In the meantime, try and relax.
sentences.chinese: 医生很快就来，现在尽量放松一下。

sentences.english: I'll contact them soon. Meantime don't tell them I'm back.
sentences.chinese: 我会尽快和他们联系。在此期间，不要告诉他们我回来了。

detailed_translations.english: in the period of time between two times or two events
英文释义: meanwhile

sentences.english: The substance is dehydrated and stored as powder.
sentences.chinese: 该物质经脱水处理后以粉末形式储存。

detailed_translations.chinese: 使…脱水；使极其口渴；使丧失力量和兴趣等
detailed_translations.english: to remove the liquid from a substance such as food or a chemical

name: cite
trans: 引用， 引证； 传唤， 传讯； 表彰， 嘉奖

sentences.english: The judge cited a 1956 Supreme Court ruling in her decision.
sentences.chinese: 法官在她的判决中引用了1956年最高法院的一项裁决。

sentences.english: The passage cited above is from a Robert Frost poem.
sentences.chinese: 以上的引文出自罗伯特•弗罗斯特的一首诗。

sentences.english: She was cited in the divorce proceedings.
sentences.chinese: 她在离婚诉讼中被传唤。

detailed_translations.chinese: 引证；引用；〔法院〕传召，传讯
detailed_translations.english: to mention something as an example, especially one that supports, proves, or explains an idea or situation

sentences.english: "I was looking for Sally," he blurted, and his eyes filled with tears.
sentences.chinese: 他眼含热泪，突然脱口说道：“我在找莎丽。”

detailed_translations.chinese: 未加思索地冲口说出；突然说出
detailed_translations.english: If someone blurts something, they say it suddenly, after trying hard to keep quiet or to keep it secret

name: atom
trans: 原子； 微粒， 微量

sentences.english: carbon atoms
sentences.chinese: 碳原子

detailed_translations.english: the smallest part of an  element  that can exist alone or can combine with other substances to form a  molecule

sentences.english: ...an internship in surgery in New York.
sentences.chinese: …一个在纽约做外科实习的职位。

detailed_translations.english: a job that lasts for a short time, that someone, especially a student, does in order to gain experience

sentences.english: ...matters pertaining to naval district defence.
sentences.chinese: …与海军区域防卫有关的问题。

detailed_translations.english: If one thing pertains to another, it relates, belongs, or applies to it

name: shed
trans: 抛弃；摆脱；流出；散发；发出；脱落

sentences.english: The company is planning to shed about a quarter of its workforce.
sentences.chinese: 这家公司正计划裁减约四分之一的人员。

sentences.english: The magazine is desperately trying to shed its old-fashioned image.
sentences.chinese: 这份杂志急于摆脱其过时的形象。

sentences.english: a diet to help you shed pounds
sentences.chinese: 帮助你减肥的食谱

detailed_translations.chinese: 脱落，脱去；流出，流下；发出，散发
detailed_translations.english: to get rid of something that you no longer need or want
a small building, often made of wood, used especially for storing things

sentences.english: As the nebula collapsed because of its gravity, it spun faster and flattened into a disk.
sentences.chinese: 随着由于重力引起的星云坍缩，它旋转得越来越快，并变成了盘状。

name: tolerable
trans: 可忍受的， 可容忍的； 尚好的， 过得去的

sentences.english: The heat in this room is barely tolerable.
sentences.chinese: 这房间里热得让人要受不了了。

detailed_translations.english: unpleasant or painful and only just able to be accepted

name: bicameral
trans: 两院制的， 有两个议院的

sentences.english: On legislative system for a bicameral legislature, both Chambers of the elected directly by the voters in a house of representatives of the senate and state elected;
sentences.chinese: 在立法体制上实行两院制，两院由一个选民直接选举产生的众议院和各州选举产生的参议院组成；

detailed_translations.chinese: 两院制的， 有两个议院的
detailed_translations.english: a bicameral  legislature (=  part of the government that makes laws  )  consists of two parts, such as the Senate and the House of Representatives in the US Congress

name: correspond
trans: 相一致， 符合； 相当于； 通信

sentences.english: The two halves of the document did not correspond.
sentences.chinese: 这份文件的前后两部分不相符。

sentences.english: The French ‘baccalauréate’ exam roughly corresponds to English A levels.
sentences.chinese: 法国的毕业会考大致相当于英国的高级程度考试。

detailed_translations.english: if two things or ideas correspond, the parts or information in one relate to the parts or information in the other

name: spur
trans: 激励， 鼓舞； 刺激， 促进

sentences.english: The crowd’s reaction only acted as a spur.
sentences.chinese: 人群的反应不过起了刺激作用。

sentences.english: The band were spurred on by the success of their last two singles.
sentences.chinese: 乐队因最近两张单曲唱片的成功而深受鼓舞。

sentences.english: It was an article in the local newspaper which finally spurred him into action .
sentences.chinese: 是当地报纸上的一篇文章最终促使他行动起来。

detailed_translations.english: a fact or event that makes you try harder to do something
to encourage someone or make them want to do something

name: mode
trans: 方式， 形式； 风格； 时尚

sentences.english: the most efficient mode of transport
sentences.chinese: 最高效的运输方式

sentences.english: Set the monitor to 256 colour mode.
sentences.chinese: 把显示器调成256色彩模式。

detailed_translations.english: a particular way or style of behaving, living or doing something

sentences.english: It’s a good place to rear young children.
sentences.chinese: 这地方非常适合抚养小孩子成长。

sentences.english: The birds have been successfully reared in captivity.
sentences.chinese: 这些鸟笼养成功。

detailed_translations.english: to look after a person or animal until they are fully grown

sentences.english: Several months elapsed before his case was brought to trial.
sentences.chinese: 过了几个月他的案子才开审。

sentences.english: The assignment must be completed within an overall elapsed time of one week.
sentences.chinese: 这项任务总的时限为一周，必须按时完成。

detailed_translations.english: if a particular period of time elapses, it passes

name: symmetry
trans: 对称； 相似， 相仿

sentences.english: the symmetry of the design
sentences.chinese: 图案的对称性

detailed_translations.english: the quality of being symmetrical

sentences.english: an insect bite
sentences.chinese: 昆虫的叮咬

sentences.english: flying insects
sentences.chinese: 飞虫

sentences.english: Don’t forget to bring insect repellant (= a chemical to keep insects away ).
sentences.chinese: 不要忘记带上驱虫剂。

detailed_translations.english: a small creature such as a fly or ant, that has six legs, and sometimes wings

name: complement
trans: 补充， 补足， 使完善； 与…相配
补充物， 补足物； 足数， 足额； 补足语

sentences.english: The team needs players who complement each other.
sentences.chinese: 球队需要能够相互取长补短的队员。

sentences.english: This wine would be a nice complement to grilled dishes.
sentences.chinese: 这种葡萄酒配烧烤食物会很不错。

detailed_translations.english: to make a good combination with someone or something else
someone or something that emphasizes the good qualities of another person or thing

name: qualify
trans: 具有资格， 合格； 有权； 限定， 修饰

sentences.english: Free school lunches are given to children who qualify.
sentences.chinese: 符合条件的儿童可获得免费的学生午餐。

detailed_translations.english: to have the right to have or do something, or to give someone this right

sentences.english: She says the way the bill was passed bodes ill for democracy.
sentences.chinese: 她说议案通过的方式预示民主的恶运。

detailed_translations.english: If something bodes ill, it makes you think that something bad will happen in the future. If something bodes well, it makes you think that something good will happen.

sentences.english: ‘Lunch? ’ ‘No thanks, I've already eaten. ’
sentences.chinese: “午餐？”“不，谢谢，我已吃过了。”

sentences.english: We got there early but Mike had already left.
sentences.chinese: 我们及早到了那里，但是迈克已经离开了。

detailed_translations.english: before now or before a particular time in the pas

name: Pueblo
trans: 普韦布洛印第安人村落； 普韦布洛人

sentences.english: There are several dozen Indian pueblos near Santa Fe.
sentences.chinese: 圣达菲附近有几十个印第安人村庄。

detailed_translations.chinese: 普韦布洛印第安人村落； 普韦布洛人
detailed_translations.english: A pueblo is a village, especially in the southwestern United States

name: applicable
trans: 可应用的， 可实施的； 适当的， 合适的

sentences.english: What is a reasonable standard for one family is not applicable for another.
sentences.chinese: 对一个家庭合理的标准对于另一个家庭并不适用。

detailed_translations.english: if something is applicable to a particular person, group, or situation, it affects them or is related to them

name: admission
trans: 准许进入； 入场费； 承认

sentences.english: Reese, by his own admission , lacks the necessary experience.
sentences.chinese: 里斯自己也承认缺乏必要的经验。

sentences.english: No admission after 10 pm.
sentences.chinese: 晚上10点以后免进。

sentences.english: The Museum has no admission charge .
sentences.chinese: 那家博物馆不收门票。

detailed_translations.chinese: 承认；准许进(加)入；入场费
detailed_translations.english: a statement in which you admit that something is true or that you have done something wrong

name: adhere
trans: 黏附， 附着； 坚持； 遵守

sentences.english: Small particles adhere to the seed.
sentences.chinese: 微小的粒子紧贴着种子。

sentences.english: We adhere to the principles of equal rights and freedom of expression for all.
sentences.chinese: 我们坚持人人平等和言论自由的原则。

detailed_translations.english: to stick firmly to something

sentences.english: a thick layer of sediment
sentences.chinese: 一层厚厚的沉积物

detailed_translations.english: solid substances that settle at the bottom of a liquid

name: tremulous
trans: 发抖的， 颤抖的； 害怕的

sentences.english: She fidgeted in her chair as she took a deep, tremulous breath.
sentences.chinese: 她在椅子上坐立不安，轻颤着深吸了一口气。

detailed_translations.english: If someone's voice, smile, or actions are tremulous, they are unsteady because the person is uncertain, afraid, or upset

name: hybrid
trans: 杂交产生的；混合的，合成的
杂交植物； 混合物， 合成物

sentences.english: hybrid architecture
sentences.chinese: 具有混合风格的建筑

sentences.english: ...the hybrid corn seed.
sentences.chinese: …杂交玉米种子。

detailed_translations.english: an animal or plant produced from parents of different breeds or types
Hybrid is also an adjective

name: panorama
trans: 全景， 全貌； 概观， 综述

sentences.english: Horton looked out over a panorama of fertile valleys and gentle hills.
sentences.chinese: 霍顿眺望着那一片肥沃山谷和平缓山脉的景象。

sentences.english: a panorama of life in England 400 years ago
sentences.chinese: 400年前英格兰生活的全景图

detailed_translations.english: an impressive view of a wide area of land

name: adaptable
trans: 能适应的； 可改编的

sentences.english: The American Constitution has proved adaptable in changing political conditions.
sentences.chinese: 事实证明美国宪法能适应政治形势的变化。

detailed_translations.english: able to change in order to be successful in new and different situations

sentences.english: She writes a lot of contemporary music for people like Whitney Houston.
sentences.chinese: 她为惠特尼·休斯敦等人创作大量当代音乐作品。

detailed_translations.chinese: 现代的， 当代的； 同时代的
detailed_translations.english: belonging to the present time

sentences.english: Opposition MPs mocked the government’s decision.
sentences.chinese: 反对党议员讥笑政府的这一决策。

sentences.english: ‘Running away?’ he mocked.
sentences.chinese: “想逃跑？”他取笑道。

sentences.english: It’s easy for you to mock, but we put a lot of work into this play.
sentences.chinese: 你讲风凉话是很轻松，但我们这出戏可是费了很大力气的。

detailed_translations.english: to laugh at someone or something and try to make them look stupid by saying unkind things about them or by copying them

detailed_translations.chinese: 仿制的， 假装的；模拟的， 演习的
detailed_translations.english: not real, but intended to be very similar to a real situation, substance etc
school examinations taken as practice before official examinations

name: credence
trans: 可信性， 真实性； 信任； 信念

sentences.english: Good studies are needed to lend credence to the notion that genuine progress can be made in this important field.
sentences.chinese: 要有优秀的研究才能使人相信在这一重大领域能取得真正的进步。

detailed_translations.chinese: 信任；凭证；祭器台（等于credence table，credenza）
detailed_translations.english: the acceptance of something as true

sentences.english: His mountain bike had 18 gears.
sentences.chinese: 他的山地自行车有18挡。

sentences.english: Andy drove cautiously along in third gear.
sentences.chinese: 安迪挂着三挡小心地行驶。

sentences.english: Does this thing have a reverse gear?
sentences.chinese: 这玩意儿有倒挡吗？

sentences.english: Any cyclist can climb a difficult hill; you just change gear.
sentences.chinese: 谁都能骑上难爬的山坡，只要换挡就行了。

sentences.english: Don’t turn off the engine while you’re still in gear.
sentences.chinese: 还挂着挡的时候不要关发动机。

sentences.english: It’s a good habit to take the car out of gear while you’re at a stoplight.
sentences.chinese: 等红灯时换空挡的习惯很好。

sentences.english: Colleges are not always geared to the needs of mature students.
sentences.chinese: 大学并不总是去适应成年学生的需要。

sentences.english: My training was geared toward winning gold.
sentences.chinese: 我的训练是为赢得金牌去规划的。

detailed_translations.chinese: 齿轮，传动装置，排挡；用具，设备；衣服
detailed_translations.english: the machinery in a vehicle such as a car, truck, or bicycle that you use to go comfortably at different speeds
If someone or something is geared to or toward a particular purpose, they are organized or designed in order to achieve that purpose

sentences.english: The new trade agreement should facilitate more rapid economic growth.
sentences.chinese: 新贸易协定应当会加快经济发展。

sentences.english: Structured teaching facilitates learning.
sentences.chinese: 有条理的教导有利于学习。

detailed_translations.english: to make an action or a process possible or easier

name: rob
trans: 抢夺， 抢掠； 剥夺， 使失去

sentences.english: They killed four policemen while robbing a bank.
sentences.chinese: 他们抢劫一家银行的时候杀了4名警察。

sentences.english: A 77-year-old woman was robbed at knifepoint.
sentences.chinese: 一名77岁老妪遭到持刀抢劫。

detailed_translations.english: to steal money or property from a person, bank etc

sentences.english: a measuring rod
sentences.chinese: 测量杆

detailed_translations.english: a long thin pole or bar

sentences.english: ...cod's roe.
sentences.chinese: ...鳕鱼子。

detailed_translations.english: fish eggs eaten as a food

sentences.english: The child was quivering in her arms.
sentences.chinese: 那孩子在她怀里发抖。

sentences.english: Her mouth quivered slightly as she turned away.
sentences.chinese: 她嘴唇微微哆嗦着，转过头去。

sentences.english: I recognized it instantly and felt a quiver of panic.
sentences.chinese: 我立刻认出它了，感到一阵惊恐的颤抖。

detailed_translations.english: to shake slightly because you are cold, or because you feel very afraid, angry, excited etc

detailed_translations.chinese: 颤抖， 抖动， 颤声
detailed_translations.english: Quiver is also a noun

sentences.english: When nuclear fuel is manufactured it is encased in metal cans.
sentences.chinese: 核燃料生产出来时被装在金属罐中。

detailed_translations.english: to cover or surround something completely

sentences.english: Once he knew where we were, Lewis telegraphed every few hours.
sentences.chinese: 一知道我们在哪里，刘易斯就每隔几小时发一份电报来。

detailed_translations.english: an old-fashioned method of sending messages using radio or electrical signals
to send a message by telegraph

sentences.english: I hated to disappoint her.
sentences.chinese: 我不愿意让她失望。

sentences.english: Great things were expected of this band, and they didn’t disappoint.
sentences.chinese: 大家对这支乐队的期望很高，而他们也不负众望。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone feel unhappy because something they hoped for did not happen or was not as good as they expected

name: rebellious
trans: 反叛的， 叛逆的； 叛乱的

sentences.english: rebellious teenagers
sentences.chinese: 叛逆的青少年

sentences.english: He’s always had a rebellious streak (= a tendency to rebel ) .
sentences.chinese: 他向来个性叛逆。

detailed_translations.chinese: 反抗的；造反的；难控制的
detailed_translations.english: deliberately not obeying people in authority or rules of behaviour

sentences.english: This gel will add gloss to even the dullest hair.
sentences.chinese: 用了这种发胶，即使最干枯的头发也会增添光泽。

detailed_translations.english: a bright shine on a surface

sentences.english: Fuel was rationed during the war.
sentences.chinese: 战争期间，燃油定量供应。

detailed_translations.english: to control the supply of something because there is not enough
a fixed amount of something that people are allowed to have when there is not enough, for example during a war

name: construction
trans: 构造， 结构； 建筑物

sentences.english: a road construction project
sentences.chinese: 道路修建计划

sentences.english: construction workers
sentences.chinese: 建筑工人

detailed_translations.english: the process of building things such as houses, bridges, roads etc

sentences.english: Sales were five percent lower than predicted.
sentences.chinese: 销售额比预期低5%。

sentences.english: As Liz had predicted , the rumours were soon forgotten.
sentences.chinese: 正如利兹所预料的，流言很快就被淡忘了。

detailed_translations.english: to say that something will happen, before it happens

name: dump
trans: 丢弃，倾倒；抛弃；推卸；倾销

sentences.english: We dumped our bags at the nearby Grand Hotel and hurried toward the market.
sentences.chinese: 我们把包扔在附近的格兰德旅馆，急匆匆地向市场赶去。

sentences.english: a campaign to stop cheap European beef being dumped in West Africa
sentences.chinese: 阻止在西非倾销廉价欧洲牛肉的运动

detailed_translations.english: If you dump something somewhere, you put it or unload it there quickly and carelessly.

name: universal
trans: 普遍的， 全体的； 通用的， 万能的； 宇宙的， 全世界的

sentences.english: free universal healthcare
sentences.chinese: 免费的全民保健制度

sentences.english: These stories have universal appeal.
sentences.chinese: 这些故事人人都喜欢。

sentences.english: a topic of universal interest
sentences.chinese: 人们普遍感兴趣的一个话题

sentences.english: a universal truth
sentences.chinese: 普遍的真理

detailed_translations.chinese: 宇宙的，全世界的；普遍的
detailed_translations.english: involving everyone in the world or in a particular group

sentences.english: As a critic, he is far too subjective.
sentences.chinese: 作为评论家，他过于主观。

sentences.english: a highly subjective point of view
sentences.chinese: 相当主观的看法

detailed_translations.english: a state-ment, report, attitude etc that is subjective is influenced by personal opinion and can therefore be unfair

sentences.english: pale pink blossoms
sentences.chinese: 淡粉色的花朵

sentences.english: The cherry tree was covered in blossom.
sentences.chinese: 樱桃树花满枝头。

detailed_translations.english: a flower or the flowers on a tree or bush
if trees blossom, they produce flowers

name: radical
trans: 根本的；激进的，极端的；全新的，不同凡响的
激进分子； 游离基， 自由基

sentences.english: They are proposing radical changes to the way the company is run.
sentences.chinese: 他们建议对公司经营模式进行重大改革。

sentences.english: a radical reform of the tax system
sentences.chinese: 税收制度的彻底改革

sentences.english: There are radical differences between the two organizations.
sentences.chinese: 这两个组织有着根本差异。

detailed_translations.chinese: 根本的，基本的；激进的，激进派的
detailed_translations.english: a radical change or difference is very big and important
someone who has new and different ideas, especially someone who wants complete social and political change

sentences.english: Sharpen all your blunt knives.
sentences.chinese: 把你所有的钝刀子都磨一磨。

sentences.english: a blunt pencil
sentences.chinese: 钝铅笔

detailed_translations.chinese: 钝的；率直的，直言不讳的
detailed_translations.english: not sharp or pointed

detailed_translations.chinese: 使迟钝； 使减弱； 使钝
detailed_translations.english: to make a feeling less strong

name: irresistible
trans: 无法抗拒的， 诱人的； 不能自已的

sentences.english: I was overcome by an irresistible urge to cry.
sentences.chinese: 我控制不住想大哭一场。

detailed_translations.chinese: 不可抵抗的,不能压制的
detailed_translations.english: too strong or powerful to be stopped or prevented

sentences.english: He looked across at Jackson, doodling on his notebook.
sentences.chinese: 他一边看着对面的杰克逊，一边在笔记本上信手涂鸦。

sentences.english: Dillworthy was staring into space, with a scrawl of doodles on the pad in front of him.
sentences.chinese: 迪尔沃西凝望着天空，面前的纸上满是涂鸦。

detailed_translations.english: When someone doodles, they draw doodles
A doodle is a pattern or picture that you draw when you are bored or thinking about something else

sentences.english: He seemed to have an intuitive awareness of how I felt.
sentences.chinese: 他好像凭直觉就知道我的感受。

detailed_translations.english: an intuitive idea is based on a feeling rather than on knowledge or facts

name: minute
trans: 细微的， 极小的； 细致入微的， 详细的
分， 分钟； 一会儿， 片刻； 时刻

sentences.english: It takes me ten minutes to walk to work.
sentences.chinese: 我步行上班要用十分钟。

sentences.english: The train arrived at four minutes past eight.
sentences.chinese: 火车于八点零四分到达。

sentences.english: He returned a few minutes later.
sentences.chinese: 几分钟后他回来了。

sentences.english: I’ll meet you at the car in five minutes.
sentences.chinese: 五分钟后我在车那儿和你见面。

sentences.english: Sam thought for a minute, then smiled at his brother.
sentences.chinese: 萨姆想了一下，然后冲着他的兄弟笑了。

detailed_translations.english: a unit for measuring time. There are 60 minutes in one hour

sentences.english: analogies between human and animal behaviour
sentences.chinese: 人类行为与动物行为的类同

sentences.english: She drew an analogy between childbirth and the creative process.
sentences.chinese: 她将分娩和创造过程进行类比。

detailed_translations.english: something that seems similar between two situations, processes etc

sentences.english: the transcendent genius of Mozart
sentences.chinese: 莫扎特的超凡天才

detailed_translations.chinese: 卓越的；超常的；出类拔萃的
detailed_translations.english: going far beyond ordinary limits

sentences.english: ...small swirls of chocolate cream.
sentences.chinese: …小块旋涡形的奶油夹心巧克力。

detailed_translations.english: a swirling movement or amount of something

detailed_translations.chinese: 盘绕；打旋；眩晕；大口喝酒
detailed_translations.english: to move around quickly in a twisting circular movement, or to make something do this

name: application
trans: 请求， 申请； 应用， 运用； 敷用

sentences.english: We receive hundreds of job applications each year.
sentences.chinese: 我们每年收到数百封求职信。

sentences.english: I filled in the application form and sent it off.
sentences.chinese: 我填完申请表后把它寄了出去。

sentences.english: You have to submit your application before the end of the month.
sentences.chinese: 月底之前必须递交申请。

sentences.english: I’ve put in an application for a transfer.
sentences.chinese: 我已递交了调动申请。

sentences.english: He received a letter saying that his application had been rejected .
sentences.chinese: 他收到一封信，告知他的申请已被拒绝。

sentences.english: It can take a long time for your visa application to be processed .
sentences.chinese: 办理签证申请可能需要很长时间。

sentences.english: The Council is currently reviewing the way it deals with planning applications .
sentences.chinese: 市政会目前正在审查其处理规划申请的方式。

sentences.english: Thank you for your letter of application , which we received yesterday.
sentences.chinese: 你的申请信昨天收悉，谢谢。

detailed_translations.chinese: 申请， 申请书； 施用， 涂抹； 应用， 实施； 实用性
detailed_translations.english: a formal, usually written, request for something such as a job, place at university, or permission to do something

name: productive
trans: 生产的； 能产的， 多产的； 富有成效的

sentences.english: the economy’s productive capacity
sentences.chinese: 该经济体的生产能力

detailed_translations.english: relating to the production of goods, crops, or wealth

sentences.english: In a presumably posthumous voiceover, Bwana Beast says he would do it all again, in a hummingbird's heartbeat.
sentences.chinese: 在大概是死后的画外音里，比斯特说他愿意再来一次，不过这次是以蜂鸟的心跳。

sentences.english: Implanted sensors show that a hummingbird’s wing flaps so fast that the brain is generating the muscle signal for the downbeat of its wing while the wing is still going up.
sentences.chinese: 植入的传感器表明，蜂鸟翅膀击打的速度如此之快，以至于当其脑部发出的肌肉信号命令翅膀向下挥动时，但翅膀还是向上挥。

sentences.english: The smaller the bird, for example, the more agile the flying — a swan may need the equivalent of two football fields to take off and get lift, while a hummingbird can rise like a helicopter.
sentences.chinese: 例如，鸟类的体型越小，飞行动作就越灵敏——天鹅就需要两个足球场大的面积才能完成起飞和抬升动作，而蜂鸟就可以像直升机一样垂直起飞。

detailed_translations.english: A hummingbird is a small brightly coloured bird found in North, Central and South America. It has a long thin beak and powerful narrow wings that can move very fast.

sentences.english: the fall semester
sentences.chinese: 秋季学期

detailed_translations.english: one of the two periods of time that a year at high schools and universities is divided into, especially in the US

name: hypothesis
trans: 假设， 假说； 前提

sentences.english: One hypothesis is that the victim fell asleep while driving.
sentences.chinese: 一种假设是受害人开车时睡着了。

detailed_translations.english: an idea that is suggested as an explanation for something, but that has not yet been proved to be true

name: collapse
trans: 崩溃， 倒塌； 虚脱

sentences.english: Uncle Ted’s chair collapsed under his weight.
sentences.chinese: 椅子承受不了特德叔叔的重量，塌架了。

sentences.english: The roof had collapsed long ago.
sentences.chinese: 屋顶早就塌了。

detailed_translations.english: if a building, wall etc collapses, it falls down suddenly, usually because it is weak or damaged

name: dull
trans: 乏味的， 单调的； 迟钝的； 无光泽的； 萧条的； 阴沉的， 昏暗的

sentences.english: Life is never dull when Elizabeth is here.
sentences.chinese: 有伊丽莎白在这里生活绝不会无聊。

sentences.english: a dull movie
sentences.chinese: 一部沉闷的电影

sentences.english: It sounded pretty dull to me.
sentences.chinese: 在我听来，这很无聊。

sentences.english: The weekly meeting tends to be deadly dull (= very dull ) .
sentences.chinese: 每周一次的会议总是十分无聊。

sentences.english: The bird is dull brown and gray in colour.
sentences.chinese: 这只鸟是暗淡的棕灰色。

detailed_translations.english: not interesting or exciting

name: ferment
trans: 发酵； 动乱， 骚动

sentences.english: The whole country has been in a state of political ferment for some months.
sentences.chinese: 整个国家几个月来一直处在政治骚动的状态中。

detailed_translations.english: a situation of great excitement or trouble in a country, especially caused by political change
if fruit, beer, wine etc ferments, or if it is fermented, the sugar in it changes to alcohol

name: comprehend
trans: 理解， 领会； 包括， 由…组成

sentences.english: She cannot comprehend the extent of the disaster.
sentences.chinese: 她无法理解这场灾难的严重程度。

sentences.english: I did not fully comprehend what had happened.
sentences.chinese: 我没有完全理解发生了什么事。

detailed_translations.english: to understand something that is complicated or difficult

name: potency
trans: 影响力， 支配力； 效力

sentences.english: The myth of male superiority was losing its potency.
sentences.chinese: 男性优越的错误观念在逐渐失去影响力。

detailed_translations.english: the power that something has to influence people

name: accurate
trans: 正确无误的， 精确的

sentences.english: The brochure tries to give a fair and accurate description of each hotel.
sentences.chinese: 该手册尽量公正、准确地介绍每一家酒店。

detailed_translations.english: correct and true in every detail

sentences.english: ...plates of octopus.
sentences.chinese: …一盘盘章鱼肉。

detailed_translations.english: a sea creature with eight tentacles (= arms )

name: prostitution
trans: 卖淫； 出卖灵魂， 堕落； 滥用

sentences.english: She eventually drifted into prostitution.
sentences.chinese: 她最终沦落风尘。

detailed_translations.english: the work of prostitutes

name: legend
trans: 传奇故事， 传说； 传奇文学

sentences.english: Local legend has it that (= says that ) the island was the original Garden of Eden.
sentences.chinese: 当地传说这个岛就是伊甸园的原型。

detailed_translations.english: an old, well-known story, often about brave people, adventures, or magical events

sentences.english: The last two clauses were an exact quote rather than a paraphrase of Mr. Forth's remarks.
sentences.chinese: 最后两个分句是对福思先生言论的准确引用而不是改述。

detailed_translations.english: a statement that expresses in a shorter, clearer, or different way what someone has said or written
to express in a shorter, clearer, or different way what someone has said or written

sentences.english: an imposing town hall, erected in 1892
sentences.chinese: 一座气势宏伟的市政厅，建于1892年

sentences.english: Police have erected barriers across the main roads into the town.
sentences.chinese: 警察在进城的主要道路上设立了路障。

sentences.english: It took a couple of hours to erect the tent.
sentences.chinese: 搭帐篷花了几个小时。

detailed_translations.english: to build something such as a building or wall

name: exalted
trans: 崇高的， 高贵的， 显赫的

sentences.english: I felt shy in such exalted company.
sentences.chinese: 我与如此显贵的人在一起觉得拘束。

detailed_translations.english: having a very high rank and highly respected

detailed_translations.chinese: 高举；赞扬；使激动（exalt的过去分词）

name: identification
trans: 身份证明； 辨认， 鉴定

sentences.english: Do you have any identification?
sentences.chinese: 你有什么身份证明文件吗？

sentences.english: His body was taken to Brighton mortuary for identification.
sentences.chinese: 他的尸体被送到布赖顿停尸所确认身份。

detailed_translations.english: official papers or cards, such as your passport, that prove who you are

sentences.english: Where do you get your protein?
sentences.chinese: 你从哪里获得蛋白质？

sentences.english: Dairy source of protein and calcium.
sentences.chinese: 奶牛的蛋白质来源和钙。

sentences.english: So, what happens, this is another view of a sodium channel, so this is actually looking a little bit more at the protein structure .
sentences.chinese: 那么，这里发生了什么，这是钠离子通道的另一张图片，在这种蛋白质结构中，它看起来更复杂一点。

detailed_translations.english: one of several natural substances that exist in food such as meat, eggs, and beans, and which your body needs in order to grow and remain strong and healthy

name: annual
trans: 年报， 年刊， 年鉴； 一年生植物

sentences.english: The school trip has become an annual event.
sentences.chinese: 学校组织的旅行成了一年一度的活动。

detailed_translations.english: happening once a year

detailed_translations.chinese: 年报， 年鉴； 一年生的植物
detailed_translations.english: a plant that lives for one year or season

name: exclusive
trans: 独占的；除外的，排他的；奢华的

sentences.english: Bel Air is an exclusive suburb of Los Angeles.
sentences.chinese: 贝莱尔是洛杉矶郊外一处高级住宅区。

detailed_translations.chinese: 奢华的，高级的；独有的，独享的；排斥的，排他的；不包括…的，不把…计算在内的
detailed_translations.english: available or belonging only to particular people, and not shared
an important or exciting story that is printed in only one newspaper, because that newspaper was the first to find out about it

name: jar
trans: 震动；冲突，抵触；感到不快

sentences.english: a jam jar
sentences.chinese: 果酱罐

sentences.english: half a jar of peanut butter
sentences.chinese: 半瓶花生酱

sentences.english: The ship jarred a little.
sentences.chinese: 船轻微震了一下。

sentences.english: The sudden movement jarred the box and it fell off the table.
sentences.chinese: 这突然一动震动了那个箱子，然后它从桌上掉了下去。

detailed_translations.english: a glass container with a wide top and a lid, used for storing food such as jam or honey, or the amount it contains

detailed_translations.chinese: 冲突；不一致；震惊；发刺耳声
detailed_translations.english: If an object jars, or if something jars it, the object moves with a fairly hard shaking movement

sentences.english: Millions of elderly people live in poverty .
sentences.chinese: 数百万老年人生活在贫困之中。

sentences.english: We need an effective strategy to fight poverty .
sentences.chinese: 我们需要制定一个有效的对策来与贫困作斗争。

sentences.english: continued efforts to alleviate poverty and raise living standards
sentences.chinese: 缓解贫困和提高生活水平的不懈努力

sentences.english: scenes of abject poverty
sentences.chinese: 极度贫困的情景

sentences.english: the causes of urban poverty
sentences.chinese: 造成城市贫困的原因

detailed_translations.english: the situation or experience of being poor

name: repertoire
trans: 常备剧目， 保留剧目； 可表演节目； 全部才能

sentences.english: the behavioural repertoire of infants
sentences.chinese: 婴幼儿的行为能力

detailed_translations.english: all the plays, pieces of music etc that a performer or group knows and can perform

sentences.english: His punishing work schedule had made him resort to drugs.
sentences.chinese: 他那累人的工作日程已经使他不得不求助于毒品了。

sentences.english: Congress has a responsibility to ensure that all peaceful options are exhausted before resort to war.
sentences.chinese: 国会有责任确保在所有和平的手段用尽之后再诉诸武力。

detailed_translations.english: when you must use or depend on something because nothing better is available
The action of resorting to a course of action in a difficult situation

sentences.english: The elephant population is dwindling.
sentences.chinese: 大象的数量在减少。

sentences.english: His money had dwindled away.
sentences.chinese: 他的钱在逐渐变少。

detailed_translations.english: to gradually become less and less or smaller and smaller

sentences.english: a lightning attack
sentences.chinese: 闪电式突袭

detailed_translations.english: very fast, and often without warning
a powerful flash of light in the sky caused by electricity and usually followed by thunder

sentences.english: He punched him on the jaw.
sentences.chinese: 他一拳打在他的下巴上。

sentences.english: a rugged physique and a strong square jaw
sentences.chinese: 强健的体格以及结实的方下巴

sentences.english: She’s got a very determined jaw.
sentences.chinese: 她一脸坚毅。

detailed_translations.english: the lower part of your face. Its shape is sometimes thought to show your character

sentences.english: a proposal to protect several miles of thousand-year-old coral reef
sentences.chinese: 保护绵延数英里的千年古珊瑚礁的提案

detailed_translations.chinese: 暗礁；[地质] 矿脉；收帆
detailed_translations.english: a line of sharp rocks, often made of  coral  , or a raised area of sand near the surface of the sea
to tie up part of a sail in order to make it smaller

name: margin
trans: 边缘； 页边空白； 差数， 差额； 余地， 余裕

sentences.english: Someone had scribbled a note in the margin .
sentences.chinese: 有人在页边写了条批注。

sentences.english: Use double spacing and wide margins to leave room for comments.
sentences.chinese: 采用双倍行距和宽阔的页边空白，以便留出地方写评注。

sentences.english: the western margin of southern Africa
sentences.chinese: 非洲南部的西隅

detailed_translations.english: the empty space at the side of a page

sentences.english: The key was hanging on a nail by the door.
sentences.chinese: 钥匙挂在门边的一颗钉子上。

sentences.english: Stop biting your nails!
sentences.chinese: 别咬指甲！

sentences.english: A sign saying ‘No Fishing’ had been nailed to the tree.
sentences.chinese: 树上钉着一块写有“禁止钓鱼”的牌子。

detailed_translations.english: a thin pointed piece of metal with a flat top, which you hit into a surface with a hammer, for example to join things together or to hang something on
to fasten something to something else with nails

sentences.english: His regime was tarnished by human rights abuses.
sentences.chinese: 他的政权因践踏人权而形象受损。

detailed_translations.english: dullness of colour, or loss of brightness

detailed_translations.chinese: 玷污；使……失去光泽；使……变灰暗
detailed_translations.english: if an event or fact tarnishes someone’s  reputation  , record, image etc, it makes it worse

sentences.english: a sunlit garden
sentences.chinese: 阳光灿烂的花园

detailed_translations.chinese: 被日光照射了的, 阳光照射的
detailed_translations.english: made brighter by light from the sun

name: refine
trans: 精炼， 精制； 使完善； 净化， 提纯

sentences.english: Oil is refined to remove naturally occurring impurities.
sentences.chinese: 油经过提炼去除天然生成的杂质。

detailed_translations.english: When a substance is refined, it is made pure by having all other substances removed from it

name: mount
trans: 增加；登上，攀登；骑上，乘上；发起，组织，开展
山， 山峰； 支架， 底座

sentences.english: He mounted the stairs and looked around him slowly.
sentences.chinese: 他登上楼梯，慢慢环顾四周。

sentences.english: Mount Qomolangma
sentences.chinese: 珠穆朗玛峰

detailed_translations.english: to go up a step or stairs
used as part of the name of a mountain

sentences.english: But I think both can coexist.
sentences.chinese: 但是我认为两者可以共存。

sentences.english: In fact, both do coexist.
sentences.chinese: 事实上，两者是共存的。

sentences.english: We must coexist with them, but not let them take us over.
sentences.chinese: 我们必须与之共存，但不要让它们将我们压垮。

detailed_translations.english: if two different things coexist, they exist at the same time or in the same place
