sentences.english: The danger of being caught added a certain zest to the affair.
sentences.chinese: 被捉奸的危险为这件风流韵事增添了一些刺激性。

detailed_translations.english: eager interest and enjoyment

sentences.english: ...a country where drought and famines have killed up to two million people during the last eighteen years.
sentences.chinese: …过去18年来干旱和饥荒致死达两百万人的一个国家。

detailed_translations.english: a long period of dry weather when there is not enough water for plants and animals to live

sentences.english: She made periodical visits to her dentist.
sentences.chinese: 她定期去看牙医。

detailed_translations.english: Periodical events or situations happen occasionally, at fairly regular intervals
a magazine, especially one about a serious or technical subject

name: bluff
trans: 悬崖，峭壁；虚张声势，唬人

sentences.english: The threat was only a bluff.
sentences.chinese: 这种威胁不过是吓唬人而已。

sentences.english: Whatever you say, you must do it. This isn’t a game of bluff .
sentences.chinese: 不管你说什么，你一定得去做，这可不是在唬人。

detailed_translations.english: an attempt to deceive someone by making them think you will do something, when you do not intend to do it
to pretend something, especially in order to achieve what you want in a difficult or dangerous situation
a bluff person, usually a man, is pleasant but very direct and does not always consider other people

sentences.english: She’s always very punctual for appointments.
sentences.chinese: 她一向准时赴约。

sentences.english: the punctual payment of invoices
sentences.chinese: 准时结清费用清单

detailed_translations.english: arriving, happening, or being done at exactly the time that has been arranged

sentences.english: She admitted that she was unable to compromise.
sentences.chinese: 她承认自己无法作出妥协。

detailed_translations.chinese: 妥协； 危及； 放弃
detailed_translations.english: to reach an agreement in which everyone involved accepts less than what they wanted at first
an agreement that is achieved after everyone involved accepts less than what they wanted at first, or the act of making this agreement

name: advertise
trans: 为…做广告， 宣传； 公告， 公布

sentences.english: They no longer advertise alcohol or cigarettes at sporting events.
sentences.chinese: 他们不再在体育赛事上做烟酒广告了。

sentences.english: Colleges and universities have found that it pays to advertise (=  advertising brings good results  ) .
sentences.chinese: 大专院校发现做广告效果很好。

detailed_translations.chinese: 为…做广告， 宣传； 公告； 登广告
detailed_translations.english: to tell the public about a product or service in order to persuade them to buy it

sentences.english: If you like cottage cheese, add some fruit and/or yogurt!
sentences.chinese: 如果你喜欢农家鲜干酪，那就加些水果和酸奶吧！

sentences.english: Not bad. It seems you are super yogurt lover. You have so many in your cart.
sentences.chinese: 不错。似乎你是超级喜欢酸奶。你的手推车上放了如此多的酸奶。

sentences.english: It has yogurt powder but it is mostly made up of sugar and palm-kernel oil-and all the fat is mostly saturated.
sentences.chinese: 那其中确实含有一部分酸乳酪粉，但主要成分确是糖和棕榈核油，而且脂肪也以饱和脂肪为主。

detailed_translations.english: Yogurt is a food in the form of a thick, slightly sour liquid that is made by adding bacteria to milk. A yogurt is a small container of yogurt.

name: comparative
trans: 比较的；比较级的；相对的

sentences.english: After a lifetime of poverty, his last few years were spent in comparable comfort.
sentences.chinese: 他穷了一辈子，最后几年还算过得比较舒适。

detailed_translations.english: the comparative form of an adjective or adverb shows an increase in size, quality, degree etc when it is considered in relation to something else. For example, ‘bigger’ is the comparative form of ‘big’, and ‘more slowly’ is the comparative form of ‘slowly’.

the form of an adjective or adverb that shows an increase in size, degree etc when something is considered in relation to something else. For example, ‘bigger’ is the comparative of ‘big’, and ‘more slowly’ is the comparative of ‘slowly’

name: hesitant
trans: 犹豫的， 吞吞吐吐的， 犹豫不定的

sentences.english: Gail gave me a hesitant little smile.
sentences.chinese: 盖尔迟疑地对我微微一笑。

detailed_translations.chinese: 迟疑的；踌躇的；犹豫不定的
detailed_translations.english: uncertain about what to do or say because you are nervous or unwilling

sentences.english: How can I provide feedback without making someone angry?
sentences.chinese: 我怎样才能提出反馈意见又不会得罪人呢？

detailed_translations.english: advice, criticism etc about how successful or useful something is

sentences.english: In Chinese folklore the bat is a symbol of good fortune.
sentences.chinese: 在中国民间传说中，蝙蝠是好运的象征。

detailed_translations.chinese: 民俗学；民间传说；民间风俗
detailed_translations.english: the traditional stories, customs etc of a particular area or country

name: credential
trans: 证书； 文凭； 资格

detailed_translations.chinese: 外交使节所递的国书, 信任状

name: justify
trans: 证明…是正当的； 为…辩护

sentences.english: Ministers must appear before Parliament and justify their actions.
sentences.chinese: 大臣们必须就自己的行为向议会作出解释。

detailed_translations.english: to give an acceptable explanation for something that other people think is unreasonable

name: review
trans: 审查； 复习； 回顾； 评论； 检阅

sentences.english: The government will review the situation later in the year.
sentences.chinese: 政府将在今年晚些时候对形势重新加以研究。

sentences.english: The decision will be reviewed by the Supreme Court.
sentences.chinese: 这个判决将由最高法院复核。

sentences.english: The team manager’s position will be reviewed at the end of the season.
sentences.chinese: 球队主教练的人选将在赛季末重新考虑。

sentences.english: If you have to cover 12 chapters in American history, begin by planning on three two-hour reviews with four chapters per session.
sentences.chinese: 如果你必须涵盖美国史的12个章节，首先计划3次2小时的复习，每次4章。

detailed_translations.english: to carefully examine or consider sth again, especially so that you can decide if it is necessary to make changes
(North Amercian English) a lesson in which you look again at sth you have studied, especially in order to prepare for an exam

name: entrench
trans: 使根深蒂固， 牢固确立

sentences.english: ...a series of measures designed to entrench democracy and the rule of law.
sentences.chinese: …一系列旨在巩固民主和法制的举措。

detailed_translations.chinese: 确立，牢固；用壕沟围住；挖掘
detailed_translations.english: If something such as power, a custom, or an idea is entrenched, it is firmly established, so that it would be difficult to change it

sentences.english: a bench made of timber
sentences.chinese: 木制长椅

detailed_translations.english: wood used for building or making things

sentences.english: Chickens and geese roam freely in the back yard.
sentences.chinese: 鸡和鹅在后院随意溜达。

sentences.english: You shouldn’t let your children roam the streets .
sentences.chinese: 你不应该让孩子在街上游荡。

detailed_translations.english: to walk or travel, usually for a long time, with no clear purpose or direction

name: simulate
trans: 模仿， 模拟； 假装， 伪装

sentences.english: a machine that simulates conditions in space
sentences.chinese: 一台模拟太空环境的机器

sentences.english: Interviews can be simulated in the classroom.
sentences.chinese: 可以在教室里模拟面试。

detailed_translations.english: to make or produce something that is not real but has the appearance or feeling of being real

name: tenet
trans: 原则； 信条； 教义

sentences.english: Non-violence and patience are the central tenets of their faith.
sentences.chinese: 非暴力和忍耐是他们信仰的基本原则。

detailed_translations.english: a principle or belief, especially one that is part of a larger system of beliefs

name: spectacle
trans: 精彩的表演；壮观的场面；奇观；壮丽的景象；

sentences.english: a multimedia dance and opera spectacle
sentences.chinese: 盛大的多媒体舞蹈戏剧表演

sentences.english: The trial was turned into a public spectacle.
sentences.chinese: 审判变成了一场公开的闹剧。

detailed_translations.english: a very impressive show or scene

sentences.english: considerable advancements in energy efficiency
sentences.chinese: 能源效率的显著提高

detailed_translations.chinese: 效率； 功效， 效能
detailed_translations.english: the quality of doing something well and effectively, without wasting time, money, or energy

sentences.english: The school teaches pupils from different ethnic groups.
sentences.chinese: 该校教授不同种族的小学生。

sentences.english: ethnic Russians in Estonia
sentences.chinese: 居住在爱沙尼亚的俄罗斯人

sentences.english: plans to partition the republic along ethnic lines
sentences.chinese: 按种族分割该共和国的计划

detailed_translations.english: relating to a particular race, nation, or tribe and their customs and traditions

sentences.english: Do you like lettuce in sandwiches?
sentences.chinese: 你喜欢在三明治里放生菜吗？

sentences.english: Do you like lettuce in sandwiches?
sentences.chinese: 你喜欢吃莴苣三明治吗?。

sentences.english: We have fresh cabbage, celery, lettuce and spinach.
sentences.chinese: 有新鲜的卷心菜、芹菜、生菜和菠菜。

detailed_translations.english: a round vegetable with thin green leaves eaten raw in salads

sentences.english: Only the medieval tower had remained intact.
sentences.chinese: 只有这座中世纪塔楼保存完好。

sentences.english: His reputation survived intact.
sentences.chinese: 他的声望丝毫未受影响。

detailed_translations.chinese: 完整的；原封不动的；未受损伤的
detailed_translations.english: not broken, damaged, or spoiled

name: motto
trans: 座右铭； 箴言， 格言

sentences.english: ‘Be prepared’ is the motto of the Boy Scouts.
sentences.chinese: “时刻准备着”是童子军的格言。

detailed_translations.english: a short sentence or phrase giving a rule on how to behave, which expresses the aims or beliefs of a person, school, or institution

name: juvenile
trans: 幼稚的， 不成熟的； 少年的， 未成年的

sentences.english: juvenile crime
sentences.chinese: 少年犯罪

sentences.english: a juvenile court
sentences.chinese: 少年法院[法庭]

sentences.english: The number of juveniles in the general population has fallen by a fifth in the past 10 years.
sentences.chinese: 在过去的10年中，青少年在总人口中所占的比重下降了1/5。

detailed_translations.chinese: 少年的，少年特有的；幼稚的，不成熟的
detailed_translations.english: law relating to young people who are not yet adults
A juvenile is a child or young person who is not yet old enough to be regarded as an adult

name: pervasive
trans: 普遍深入的； 遍及的， 弥漫的

sentences.english: the pervasive influence of television
sentences.chinese: 电视无所不在的影响

sentences.english: the all-pervasive mood of apathy
sentences.chinese: 到处弥漫的冷漠情绪

detailed_translations.chinese: 普遍的；到处渗透的；流行的
detailed_translations.english: existing everywhere

sentences.english: The forests have changed into bare little hills; the riverbed has become a high tableland.
sentences.chinese: 森林变成了光秃秃的浅山，河床变成了高高的台地。

sentences.english: Few of tropical Africa's rivers are navigable from the ocean, dropping as they do from interior tableland to coastal plains by a series of falls and rapids.
sentences.chinese: 酷热的非洲，几乎没有适于航海的河流，这些河流从内陆高原到海岸平原一路穿瀑布、过险滩，倾流而下。

sentences.english: If stand Gong pawn mountain on look down at first gulf, can see the tableland in gulf and the king issue ridge that is linked like a millenary giant half body that roamed in sea picture.
sentences.chinese: 如果站贡当山上俯瞰第一湾，就会看见湾中的台地和相连的王期山梁如同一只在海中遨游的千年巨人半身像。

detailed_translations.english: a large area of high flat land

name: hive
trans: 蜂箱， 蜂房； 闹市， 忙碌之地

sentences.english: The most important member of any hive is the queen bee.
sentences.chinese: 任何一个蜂房中最重要的成员都是蜂王。

sentences.english: What people must remember is that one hive quickly become two, two become four and four become eight.
sentences.chinese: 人们一定要记住的是，一个蜂巢很快会变成两个，两个变成四个，四个变成八个。

detailed_translations.english: a small box where  bees  are kept, or the bees that live in this box

name: laborious
trans: 艰苦的， 费力的， 艰难的； 勤劳的

sentences.english: the laborious business of drying the crops
sentences.chinese: 把收获的庄稼晒干这一艰苦的工作

detailed_translations.english: taking a lot of time and effort

sentences.english: Children waving flags greeted the Russian leader.
sentences.chinese: 孩子们挥舞着旗帜，欢迎俄罗斯领导人。

sentences.english: the flag of Kenya
sentences.chinese: 肯尼亚国旗

sentences.english: the Spanish flag
sentences.chinese: 西班牙国旗

detailed_translations.english: a piece of cloth with a coloured pattern or picture on it that represents a country or organization

sentences.english: watching the racing on television
sentences.chinese: 在电视上看赛马

sentences.english: today’s racing results
sentences.chinese: 今天的赛马结果

detailed_translations.english: the sport of racing horses
designed or bred to go very fast and be used for racing

name: sympathetic
trans: 感应的， 交感的； 有同情心的； 体谅的

sentences.english: a sympathetic friend
sentences.chinese: 一个有同情心的朋友

sentences.english: a sympathetic attitude
sentences.chinese: 一种同情的态度

sentences.english: We hope always to provide a friendly sympathetic ear (= someone willing to listen to someone else’s problems ) .
sentences.chinese: 我们希望总能做到友善地倾听。

detailed_translations.english: caring and feeling sorry about someone’s problems

name: freight
trans: 运送， 货运； 使充满

sentences.english: freight services
sentences.chinese: 货运公司

sentences.english: We’ll send your personal belongings by air freight and your furniture by sea freight .
sentences.chinese: 你的个人物品我们将以空运方式运送，家具将以海运方式运送。

detailed_translations.english: goods that are carried by ship, train, or aircraft, and the system of moving these goods
to send goods by air, sea, or train

name: wear
trans: 穿，戴；留；面露，面带；磨损，用旧
穿戴， 衣着； 服装， 穿戴物； 磨损， 损坏

sentences.english: The cushions are starting to wear a little.
sentences.chinese: 这些靠垫开始有点磨破了。

sentences.english: His jeans have worn thin at the knees.
sentences.chinese: 他牛仔裤的膝盖处已经磨薄了。

sentences.english: You’ve worn a hole in your sock.
sentences.chinese: 你的袜子磨出了个洞。

detailed_translations.english: to become thinner or weaker after continuous use, or to make something do this

sentences.english: He studied botany at university.
sentences.chinese: 他在大学学习植物学。

sentences.english: To what degree are you interested in botany?
sentences.chinese: 你对植物学的兴趣达到什么程度?

sentences.english: The first of these in the field of botany were the herbals.
sentences.chinese: 在植物学领域，这些最早的著作是本草书。

detailed_translations.english: the scientific study of plants

name: range
trans: 变动； 散布； 漫游
范围；山脉；一系列；射程，距离

sentences.english: a temperature range of 72-85˚
sentences.chinese: 72 度到85度之间的温度范围

sentences.english: Even the cheapest property was out of our price range (= too expensive for us ) .
sentences.chinese: 即使是最便宜的房子也超出了我们能承受的价格范围。

sentences.english: There were 120 students whose ages ranged from 10 to 18.
sentences.chinese: 有120名学生，年龄在10至18岁之间。

detailed_translations.english: the limits within which amounts, quantities, ages etc vary
if prices, levels, temperatures etc range from one amount to another, they include both those amounts and anything in between

sentences.english: Dump the topsoil here.
sentences.chinese: 把表土倒在这里。

sentences.english: Stone is the foundation, above which is soil, and then topsoil.
sentences.chinese: 石头是基础，上面是泥土，再上面是表土。

sentences.english: After shoveling out the topsoil, Garfinkel uncovered coins and other artifacts from the time of Alexander the Great.
sentences.chinese: 在铲去了表层土以后，加芬克尔发现了来自亚历山大大帝时期的硬币和其他人工制品。

detailed_translations.english: the upper level of soil in which most plants have their roots

sentences.english: The light creates the aurora that we see.
sentences.chinese: 这些光亮造就了我们所看到的极光。

sentences.english: A vast dawn of ideas is the peculiarity of our century, and in that aurora England and Germany have a magnificent radiance.
sentences.chinese: 思想的广泛昌明是我们这一世纪的特征，在那曙光里，英国和德国都有它们辉煌的成就。

detailed_translations.english: an atmospheric phenomenon consisting of bands, curtains, or streamers of light, usually green, red, or yellow, that move across the sky in polar regions

name: glamorous
trans: 富有魅力的， 迷人的

sentences.english: She led an exciting and glamorous life.
sentences.chinese: 她生活奢华，充满刺激。

sentences.english: the most glamorous neighborhood in the city
sentences.chinese: 城里最繁华的街区

sentences.english: On television, she looks so glamorous.
sentences.chinese: 她在电视里看上去光彩照人。

detailed_translations.chinese: 富有魅力的, 迷人的
detailed_translations.english: attractive, exciting, and related to wealth and success

name: disprove
trans: 证明…不成立， 证明…是错误的

sentences.english: These figures disproved Smith’s argument.
sentences.chinese: 这些数据证明史密斯的论点是错误的。

detailed_translations.english: to show that something is wrong or not true

sentences.english: Mr. Ying is one of those happy people who derive pleasure from helping others.
sentences.chinese: 英先生是那种助人为乐的快活人。

detailed_translations.english: to get something, especially an advantage or a pleasant feeling, from something
to develop or come from something else

sentences.english: Chris is going to work overseas.
sentences.chinese: 克里斯要去国外工作。

sentences.english: Most applications came from overseas.
sentences.chinese: 大部分申请来自海外。

detailed_translations.english: to or in a foreign country that is across the sea

name: leak
trans: 漏洞， 裂缝； 泄露； 走漏

sentences.english: The roof is leaking.
sentences.chinese: 屋顶在漏水。

sentences.english: A tanker is leaking oil off the coast of Scotland.
sentences.chinese: 苏格兰海岸附近有一艘油轮漏油。

sentences.english: 英语例句：The boat had sprung a leak (= a hole had appeared in it ).
sentences.chinese: 小船出现了漏洞。

detailed_translations.english: if a container, pipe, roof etc leaks, or if it leaks gas, liquid etc, there is a small hole or crack in it that lets gas or liquid flow through
a small hole that lets liquid or gas flow into or out of something

sentences.english: What you’re hearing is the voice of complacence.
sentences.chinese: 你听到的是沾沾自喜的声音。

sentences.english: Satire jars us out of complacence into a pleasantly shocked realization that many of the values we unquestioningly accept are false.
sentences.chinese: 讽刺作品使我们排除了自满情绪，并愉快地惊叹道许多我们毫无疑问地接受的价值观是错误的。

sentences.english: She continued to assert that she was innocent.
sentences.chinese: 她仍然坚称自己无辜。

sentences.english: to assert your independence/rights
sentences.chinese: 维护独立 / 权利

detailed_translations.english: to state firmly that something is true

name: recall
trans: 回忆起，回想起；召回，叫回；收回，撤销
记忆力， 记性； 召回

sentences.english: You don’t happen to recall his name, do you?
sentences.chinese: 你不会恰巧还想得起他的名字吧？

sentences.english: As I recall, it was you who suggested this idea in the first place.
sentences.chinese: 我记得，是你首先提出这个想法的。

sentences.english: Cole was recalled to the squad to replace the injured Quinn.
sentences.chinese: 科尔被召回队里代替受伤的奎因。

sentences.english: The cars had to be recalled due to an engine fault.
sentences.chinese: 由于发动机缺陷，那些汽车必须召回。

detailed_translations.english: to remember a particular fact, event, or situation from the past

sentences.english: The flags were flapping in the breeze.
sentences.chinese: 旗帜在微风中飘扬。

detailed_translations.chinese: 飘动， 拍动； 振翅
detailed_translations.english: if a bird flaps its wings, it moves them up and down in order to fly

detailed_translations.chinese: 片状垂悬物；飘动，摆动，振动；激动，慌忙状态
detailed_translations.english: a thin flat piece of cloth, paper, skin etc that is fixed by one edge to a surface, which you can lift up easily
to move quickly up and down or from side to side, often making a noise

name: leap
trans: 跳跃； 急速行动； 骤变； 激增

sentences.english: She leapt over the fence.
sentences.chinese: 她跳过篱笆。

sentences.english: He threw a stick into the river and the dog went after it in a flying leap.
sentences.chinese: 他把一根枝条扔到河里，那条狗一个飞跃就追了过去。

detailed_translations.english: to jump high into the air or to jump in order to land in a different place
a big jump

name: regular
trans: 规则的， 有规律的； 整齐的， 匀称的； 频繁的， 经常的； 正常的； 经常的； 正规的， 正式的

sentences.english: The company holds regular meetings with employees.
sentences.chinese: 公司定期召集雇员开会。

sentences.english: His breathing was slow and regular.
sentences.chinese: 他的呼吸缓慢而均匀。

sentences.english: Trains will run at regular intervals from 11 am to 4 pm.
sentences.chinese: 火车从上午11点到下午4点每隔一定时间开行。

sentences.english: We hear from him on a regular basis .
sentences.chinese: 我们定期收到他的来信。

sentences.english: He phones us every Sunday at six, regular as clockwork (= always at the same time ) .
sentences.chinese: 他每逢星期天6点钟打电话给我们，非常准时。

sentences.english: a regular job
sentences.chinese: 固定的工作

detailed_translations.english: happening every hour, every week, every month etc, usually with the same amount of time in between

name: glacial
trans: 冰川期的， 冰河时代的； 寒冷的， 冰冷的； 冷若冰霜的

sentences.english: a glacial valley
sentences.chinese: 冰川谷

sentences.english: glacial deposits
sentences.chinese: 冰川沉积

detailed_translations.chinese: 冰的；冰冷的；冰河时代的
detailed_translations.english: relating to ice and glaciers, or formed by glaciers

name: picturesque
trans: 如画的； 别致的； 生动的

sentences.english: a quiet fishing village with a picturesque harbour
sentences.chinese: 拥有一座美丽港口的宁静渔村

detailed_translations.english: a picturesque place is pretty and interesting in an old-fashioned way

name: informed
trans: 有学识的； 见多识广的， 有见识的

sentences.english: Informed sources said it was likely that the president would make a televised statement.
sentences.chinese: 据消息灵通人士说，总统可能会发表电视声明。

detailed_translations.chinese: 消息灵通的；见多识广的
detailed_translations.english: having a lot of knowledge or information about a particular subject or situation

detailed_translations.chinese: 通知；使了解；提供资料（inform的过去分词）

sentences.english: It is beyond dispute that advances in medicine have enabled people to live longer.
sentences.chinese: 医学的发展使人们更加长寿，这是无可置疑的。

sentences.english: What happened next is hotly disputed .
sentences.chinese: 关于后来发生了什么，争论很激烈。

detailed_translations.english: a serious argument or disagreement
to argue or disagree with someone

name: aggression
trans: 侵略； 敌对的情绪或行为

sentences.english: an unprovoked act of aggression
sentences.chinese: 无端的侵犯

detailed_translations.english: the act of attacking a country, especially when that country has not attacked first

sentences.english: We have spent money on refurbishing the offices.
sentences.chinese: 我们已在这些办公室的翻新上花了钱。

detailed_translations.english: To refurbish a building or room means to clean it and decorate it and make it more attractive or better equipped

name: rugged
trans: 崎岖的， 凹凸不平的； 艰难的； 粗犷的； 结实的， 耐用的； 粗野的， 不文雅的

sentences.english: a rugged coastline
sentences.chinese: 崎岖不平的海岸线

sentences.english: the rugged beauty of the Highlands
sentences.chinese: 苏格兰高地崎岖起伏的美景

detailed_translations.chinese: 崎岖的；坚固的；高低不平的；粗糙的
detailed_translations.english: land that is rugged is rough and uneven

name: lead
trans: 领导，引导；领先，占首位；通向，导致，

sentences.english: drinking water supplied by old-fashioned lead pipes
sentences.chinese: 由老式铅管输送的饮用水

detailed_translations.english: a chemical element. Lead is a heavy soft grey metal, used especially in the past for water pipes or to cover roofs.

name: fraction
trans: 小部分， 一点儿， 少许

sentences.english: I got these shoes at a fraction of the original price.
sentences.chinese: 我以原价的一个零头买到了这双鞋子。

detailed_translations.english: a very small amount of something

name: token
trans: 表示，标志，象征；记号；信物；代币；礼券，代价券

sentences.english: slot-machine tokens
sentences.chinese: 自动贩卖机使用的代用币

sentences.english: Please accept this gift as a small token of our appreciation.
sentences.chinese: 区区薄礼，略表谢意，还请笑纳。

detailed_translations.english: a round piece of metal that you use instead of money in some machines

name: filter
trans: 过滤；筛选；走漏；渗入，透过

sentences.english: The water in the tank is constantly filtered.
sentences.chinese: 鱼缸里的水在不停地被过滤。

sentences.english: The ozone layer filters harmful UV rays from the sun.
sentences.chinese: 臭氧层过滤掉有害的太阳紫外线。

sentences.english: coffee filter papers
sentences.chinese: 咖啡滤纸

sentences.english: filter cigarettes (= with a filter at the end )
sentences.chinese: 过滤嘴香烟

detailed_translations.english: to remove unwanted substances from water, air etc by passing it through a special substance or piece of equipment
something that you pass water, air etc through in order to remove unwanted substances and make it clean or suitable to use

name: expect
trans: 预期， 期望， 指望

sentences.english: He will be hard to beat. I fully expect (= am completely sure about ) that and I’m ready.
sentences.chinese: 他很难击败。我确信这一点，不过我准备好了。

sentences.english: ‘Who are you?’ he murmured, only half expecting (= thinking it was possible, but not likely ) her to answer.
sentences.chinese: “你是谁？”他低声问道，预计她可能不会回答。

sentences.english: to expect a visit/call/letter from sb
sentences.chinese: 等待某人的来访 / 电话 / 来信

detailed_translations.english: to think that something will happen because it seems likely or has been planned

name: emotion
trans: 感情， 激情， 情绪

sentences.english: Her voice was full of emotion.
sentences.chinese: 她的声音充满了激情。

sentences.english: She was good at hiding her emotions.
sentences.chinese: 她很会掩饰自己的情感。

sentences.english: Kim received the news without showing any visible sign of emotion.
sentences.chinese: 金接到消息时丝毫不露声色。

detailed_translations.english: a strong human feeling such as love, hate, or anger

name: soothe
trans: 缓和， 减轻； 抚慰， 安慰

sentences.english: Lucy soothed the baby by rocking it in her arms.
sentences.chinese: 露西把宝宝抱在怀里摇晃着，让他安静下来。

sentences.english: She made a cup of tea to soothe her nerves.
sentences.chinese: 她泡了杯茶让自己平静下来。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone feel calmer and less anxious, upset, or angry

name: cease
trans: 结束， 终止， 停止

sentences.english: The things people will do for charity never cease to amaze me (= I am always surprised by them ) .
sentences.chinese: 人们的慈善义举总是让我感到惊讶。

sentences.english: The rain ceased and the sky cleared.
sentences.chinese: 雨过天晴。

sentences.english: without cease
sentences.chinese: 不停地，持续地

detailed_translations.english: to stop doing something or stop happening
(it is a noun only in the phrase `without cease') end

sentences.english: The test was to assess aptitude rather than academic achievement.
sentences.chinese: 该测试将评估能力而不是学业成绩。

detailed_translations.chinese: 对估价； 评价， 评论
detailed_translations.english: to make a judgment about a person or situation after thinking carefully about it

sentences.english: strict rules of professional etiquette
sentences.chinese: 严格的行规

detailed_translations.english: the formal rules for polite behaviour in society or in a particular group

name: prescription
trans: 处方， 药方； 开处方， 开药方

sentences.english: The new drug will not require a physician's prescription.
sentences.chinese: 这种新药不需要医生的处方。

sentences.english: If you’re pregnant, you can get free prescriptions.
sentences.chinese: 要是怀孕的话可以获得免费的处方药。

detailed_translations.english: a piece of paper on which a doctor writes what medicine a sick person should have, so that they can get it from a pharmacist

sentences.english: The match attracted over 40,000 spectators.
sentences.chinese: 这场比赛吸引了四万多名观众。

detailed_translations.english: someone who is watching an event or game

name: submission
trans: 屈服， 服从； 提交， 呈递； 提交物； 看法， 意见

sentences.english: The deadline for the submission of proposals is May 1st.
sentences.chinese: 呈交提案的最后期限是 5 月 1 日。

sentences.english: Plans were drawn up for submission to the housing council.
sentences.chinese: 计划已起草，要提交给住房委员会。

sentences.english: Submissions will not be accepted after May.
sentences.chinese: 过了5月再提交将不予接受。

detailed_translations.chinese: 投降；提交（物）；服从；（向法官提出的）意见；谦恭
detailed_translations.english: when you give or show something to someone in authority, for them to consider or approve

name: scarce
trans: 缺乏的； 稀有的， 罕见的

sentences.english: Food was often scarce in the winter.
sentences.chinese: 冬季常常粮食短缺。

sentences.english: There was fierce competition for the scarce resources .
sentences.chinese: 对这些紧缺资源的争夺非常激烈。

detailed_translations.chinese: 缺乏的， 不足的； 稀少的， 罕见的
detailed_translations.english: if something is scarce, there is not very much of it available

sentences.english: The project seems to obsess him.
sentences.chinese: 这项工程似乎令他着迷。

detailed_translations.english: if something or someone obsesses you, you think or worry about them all the time and you cannot think about anything else – used to show disapproval

sentences.english: That’s utter nonsense!
sentences.chinese: 真是一派胡言！

sentences.english: This company treats its employees with utter contempt.
sentences.chinese: 这家公司对其员工不屑一顾。

sentences.english: I watched in complete and utter horror as he pulled out a gun.
sentences.chinese: 我惊恐万分地看着他拔出枪来。

sentences.english: fifteen years of utter confusion
sentences.chinese: 15年的大混乱

detailed_translations.english: complete – used especially to emphasize that something is very bad, or that a feeling is very strong
to make a sound with your voice, especially with difficulty

name: adequate
trans: 适当的； 足够的； 适当的， 胜任的

sentences.english: Farmers have been slow to make adequate provision for their retirement.
sentences.chinese: 农民们迟迟没有为退休做好适当安排。

sentences.english: Some creams we tested failed to give adequate protection against UV light.
sentences.chinese: 我们检测的有些防晒霜不能提供足够的防紫外线保护。

sentences.english: The standard of his work is barely adequate .
sentences.chinese: 他的工作水准勉强合格。

sentences.english: The company has yet to provide an adequate explanation for its actions.
sentences.chinese: 该公司对其行动仍未作出充分解释。

detailed_translations.chinese: 足够的； 可以胜任的
detailed_translations.english: enough in quantity or of a good enough quality for a particular purpose

sentences.english: ...the flora and fauna of the African jungle.
sentences.chinese: …非洲丛林的植物群和动物群。

detailed_translations.english: all the animals living in a particular area or period in history

name: uniformity
trans: 同样， 一致； 一致性

sentences.english: There seems to be no uniformity among the various systems.
sentences.chinese: 各系统之间似乎没有统一性。

detailed_translations.english: the quality of being or looking the same as all other members of a group

sentences.english: My mother bustled around the kitchen.
sentences.chinese: 我母亲在厨房里忙得团团转。

detailed_translations.english: to move around quickly, looking very busy

detailed_translations.chinese: 喧闹；活跃；裙撑；热闹的活动
detailed_translations.english: busy and usually noisy activity

sentences.english: a dozen eggs
sentences.chinese: 一打鸡蛋

sentences.english: Chris, Helen, and half a dozen others went on holiday together.
sentences.chinese: 克里斯、海伦和其他六个人一起去度假了。

sentences.english: (= about 12 ) cars were parked near the entrance.
sentences.chinese: 入口附近停了大约十二辆汽车。

detailed_translations.english: twelve

sentences.english: Suddenly, there was a tremendous bang, and the whole station shook.
sentences.chinese: 突然一声巨响，整个车站都晃动了。

sentences.english: She was making a tremendous effort to appear calm.
sentences.chinese: 她竭力表现出平静的样子。

sentences.english: She praised her husband for the tremendous support he had given her.
sentences.chinese: 她称赞丈夫给了她巨大支持。

sentences.english: Sales have been tremendous so far this year.
sentences.chinese: 今年到目前为止，销售额十分惊人。

sentences.english: This plan could save us a tremendous amount of money.
sentences.chinese: 这个计划能给我们节省一大笔钱。

detailed_translations.english: very big, fast, powerful etc

sentences.english: This whole chapter could be condensed into a few paragraphs.
sentences.chinese: 这一整章可以压缩成几个段落。

detailed_translations.english: to make something that is spoken or written shorter, by not giving as much detail or using fewer words to give the same information

sentences.english: Katzen offered little evidence to substantiate his claims .
sentences.chinese: 卡曾拿不出什么证据来证明他的说法。

detailed_translations.english: to prove the truth of something that someone has said, claimed etc

name: divert
trans: 转移…的注意力， 使分心； 使娱乐； 使转向， 使改道

sentences.english: Northbound traffic will have to be diverted onto minor roads.
sentences.chinese: 北行车辆将不得不绕次要道路行驶。

sentences.english: The war diverted people's attention away from the economic situation.
sentences.chinese: 战争把民众的注意力从经济状况上移开了。

detailed_translations.english: to make sb/sth change direction

sentences.english: the importance of personal hygiene
sentences.chinese: 个人卫生的重要性

sentences.english: a food hygiene training course
sentences.chinese: 食品卫生培训课程

detailed_translations.english: the practice of keeping yourself and the things around you clean in order to prevent diseases

sentences.english: Not everybody is a sage. Who can be entirely free from error?
sentences.chinese: 人非圣贤，孰能无过?

detailed_translations.english: someone, especially an old man, who is very wise
very wise, especially as a result of a lot of experience

sentences.english: ...a self-made Irish-American property tycoon.
sentences.chinese: …一个靠自己奋斗成功的爱尔兰裔美国房地产大亨。

detailed_translations.english: someone who is successful in business or industry and has a lot of money and power

sentences.english: The notice must be displayed in a conspicuous place.
sentences.chinese: 通告一定要贴在显眼的地方。

sentences.english: a bird with conspicuous white markings
sentences.chinese: 一种长有醒目白斑的鸟

sentences.english: I felt very conspicuous in my red coat.
sentences.chinese: 我穿着红外套，感觉自己十分显眼。

detailed_translations.english: very easy to notice

name: justice
trans: 法官； 司法； 正义， 公正

sentences.english: Children have a strong sense of justice.
sentences.chinese: 儿童有很强的正义感。

sentences.english: His people came to him demanding justice.
sentences.chinese: 他的手下来找他，寻求公正。

detailed_translations.english: fairness in the way people are treated

name: verse
trans: 诗歌； 韵文； 诗节

sentences.english: Let’s sing the last verse again.
sentences.chinese: 我们把最后一节再唱一遍吧。

sentences.english: Learn the first two verses of the poem by heart.
sentences.chinese: 把这首诗的头两节背下来。

sentences.english: Genesis chapter 3, verse 13
sentences.chinese: 《创世记》第3章第13节

detailed_translations.english: a set of lines that forms one part of a song, poem, or a book such as the Bible or the Koran

name: furious
trans: 狂怒的， 狂暴的； 强烈的， 猛烈的

sentences.english: She was absolutely furious .
sentences.chinese: 她怒不可遏。

sentences.english: There was a furious row over the proposals.
sentences.chinese: 关于这些提议的争论非常激烈。

detailed_translations.english: very angry

sentences.english: Each individual leaf on the tree is different.
sentences.chinese: 树上每片叶子都不相同。

sentences.english: the needs of the individual customer
sentences.chinese: 每位顾客的需求

detailed_translations.english: considered separately from other people or things in the same group
a person, considered separately from the rest of the group or society that they live in

sentences.english: The salmon was brought to the table whole, garnished with parsley and slices of tomato and cucumber.
sentences.chinese: 整条大麻哈鱼被端上了桌，并用欧芹、西红柿片和黄瓜片作为花色配菜。

sentences.english: State authorities have ordered cutbacks in deliveries of water from the delta because of the threat to endangered species of salmon and smelt.
sentences.chinese: 由于鲑鱼和胡瓜鱼这些濒危物种受到威胁，国家当局已经要求消减从该三角洲往外输水的量。

detailed_translations.english: a large fish with silver skin and pink flesh that lives in the sea but swims up rivers to lay its eggs

name: bouquet
trans: 花束； 香味， 芬芳

sentences.english: The woman carried a bouquet of dried violets.
sentences.chinese: 那个女子拿着一束干紫罗兰花。

detailed_translations.english: an arrangement of flowers, especially one that you give to someone

sentences.english: The relationship between a parent and a child is instinctual and stems from basic human nature.
sentences.chinese: 父母与孩子之间的关系是本能的，源于人类的本性。

detailed_translations.english: instinctive

sentences.english: Poor soil has constrained the level of crop production.
sentences.chinese: 贫瘠的土地限制了农作物的产量。

sentences.english: Women’s employment opportunities are often severely constrained by family commitments.
sentences.chinese: 女性的就业机会常常受到家庭责任的严重限制。

detailed_translations.english: to limit something

sentences.english: In today’s painting, we can almost touch the texture of the dress and the cloth of the empress…. However, Veronese is not only known for his technique but also for the use of the color.
sentences.chinese: 时至今日，当我们观看这幅画时，还是几乎可以触及皇后衣裙上的纹理……然而，委罗内塞不只因其绘画技巧为人所知，他对色彩的运用也闻名于世。

detailed_translations.english: a female ruler of an empire, or the wife of an emperor

name: informant
trans: 提供消息或情报的人， 线人； 提供资料的人； 合作者

sentences.english: One of the witnesses was a paid informant for the FBI.
sentences.chinese: 目击者之一是联邦调查局出钱雇用的线人。

detailed_translations.chinese: 被调查者；告密者；提供消息者
detailed_translations.english: someone who secretly gives the police, the army etc information about someone else

sentences.english: ...a torn tendon in his right shoulder.
sentences.chinese: …他右肩一根被拉伤的腱。

detailed_translations.english: a thick strong string-like part of your body that connects a muscle to a bone

sentences.english: an interim report
sentences.chinese: 中期报告

sentences.english: He received an interim payment of £10,000.
sentences.chinese: 他收到暂时支付的一万英镑。

sentences.english: An interim government was established.
sentences.chinese: 一个临时政府成立了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 临时的，暂时的；中间的；间歇的
detailed_translations.english: intended to be used or accepted for a short time only, until something or someone final can be made or found

detailed_translations.chinese: 过渡时期，中间时期；暂定
detailed_translations.english: in the period of time between two events

name: testimony
trans: 证词； 证据， 证明

sentences.english: Barker’s testimony is crucial to the prosecution’s case.
sentences.chinese: 巴克的证词对控方的指控起到了关键作用。

sentences.english: In his testimony, he denied that the company had ignored safety procedures.
sentences.chinese: 他在证词中否认公司忽视了安全程序。

detailed_translations.english: a formal statement saying that something is true, especially one a  witness  makes in a court of law

name: enforce
trans: 实施， 生效， 执行； 强迫， 迫使

sentences.english: Parking restrictions will be strictly enforced.
sentences.chinese: 停车限制将会严格执行。

sentences.english: It is unlikely that a record company would enforce its views on an established artist.
sentences.chinese: 唱片公司未必能强迫一位已出名的艺人接受他们的意见。

detailed_translations.english: to make people obey a rule or law

name: glitter
trans: 灿烂的光辉； 诱惑力， 魅力

sentences.english: The river glittered in the sunlight.
sentences.chinese: 阳光下河面波光粼粼。

detailed_translations.english: to shine brightly with flashing points of light

detailed_translations.chinese: 闪光， 灿烂的光辉； 耀眼， 辉煌
detailed_translations.english: brightness consisting of many flashing points of light

name: destined
trans: 注定的； 以…为目的地的

sentences.english: The flight was destined for Cairo.
sentences.chinese: 本次航班飞往开罗。

detailed_translations.chinese: 命中注定的， 预定的； 以…为目的地的
detailed_translations.english: seeming certain to happen at some time in the future

name: fragile
trans: 易碎的； 脆弱的； 纤巧的； 虚弱的

sentences.english: The economy remains extremely fragile.
sentences.chinese: 经济仍然极其脆弱。

sentences.english: Her father is now 86 and in fragile health.
sentences.chinese: 她的父亲现在86岁，身体虚弱。

detailed_translations.english: weak and uncertain; easily destroyed or spoilt

name: painstaking
trans: 煞费苦心的， 勤勉的

sentences.english: You said in your address that "developing excellence is a slow, painstaking process".
sentences.chinese: 你在你的致词中说“发展卓越性是一个缓慢艰苦的过程”。

sentences.english: In order to transform their environment, he drew up the project with painstaking accuracy.
sentences.chinese: 为了改造环境， 他苦心孤诣地制订了这个计划。

sentences.english: Out with every theory of human behavior, from linguistics to sociology.
sentences.chinese: 从语言学、社会学的人类行为原理里解脱吧。

sentences.english: Basic courses in sociology and psychology as well as other humanities courses give students plenty of opportunity to explore their own emotions.
sentences.chinese: 社会学和心理学的基础，以及其他人文学科的课程，赋予学生大量的机会去探索其个人情感。

sentences.english: And I spent part of my second grade year in Sweden, where my father was on sabbatical as a professor of sociology.
sentences.chinese: 因为我父亲休假的缘故，我的小学二年级有一段时间是在瑞典上的，那个时候他是一名社会学教授。

detailed_translations.english: the scientific study of societies and the behaviour of people in groups

name: stout
trans: 结实的， 强壮的； 肥胖的； 顽强的

sentences.english: a stout pair of shoes
sentences.chinese: 一双厚实耐穿的鞋子

detailed_translations.chinese: 结实的；矮胖的；勇敢的；激烈的
detailed_translations.english: strong and thick
strong dark beer

sentences.english: a gigantic skyscraper
sentences.chinese: 摩天大楼

detailed_translations.english: extremely big

name: distinct
trans: 明显的， 清楚的； 确实的； 截然不同的

sentences.english: The outline of the ship became more distinct.
sentences.chinese: 船的轮廓变得更加清晰了。

detailed_translations.english: easily or clearly heard, seen, felt, etc.

sentences.english: Do notlet animals graze until you are notified that forage in your area is safe.
sentences.chinese: 得到你所在区域的饲料安全的通知前，不要让动物吃青草。

detailed_translations.english: food supplies for horses and cattle
to go around searching for food or other supplies

sentences.english: nomadic herdsmen
sentences.chinese: 游牧民

detailed_translations.english: nomadic people are nomads

sentences.english: He was visiting professor of geology at the University of Georgia.
sentences.chinese: 他曾是佐治亚大学的地质学客座教授。

sentences.english: the geology of the British Isles
sentences.chinese: 不列颠群岛的地质

detailed_translations.english: the scientific study of the earth, including the origin and history of the rocks and soil of which the earth is made

name: hedge
trans: 用篱笆围； 避免直接回答
树篱；防止损失的措施；防备

sentences.english: You’re hedging again - have you got the money or haven’t you?
sentences.chinese: 你又在闪烁其词了，你究竟有没有钱？

sentences.english: ‘That depends on my partner,’ she hedged.
sentences.chinese: “那取决于我的合伙人。”她避重就轻地答道。

detailed_translations.chinese: 避免直接回答；   套头交易； 以套期保值避免损失
detailed_translations.english: to avoid giving a direct answer to a question

detailed_translations.chinese: 保值措施；套期保值；树篱；防备；障碍物；套头，两面下注以避免损失
detailed_translations.english: a row of small bushes or trees growing close together, usually dividing one field or garden from another

sentences.english: A dragonfly sows its eggs while skimming the surface of the water.
sentences.chinese: 蜻蜓总是在水面上撒卵。

sentences.english: Could that dragonfly flying above that drain be the answer to my prayers?
sentences.chinese: 那只在排水沟上空飞着的蜻蜓能作为我祈求的答案吗？

sentences.english: It looks like a blue dragonfly.
sentences.chinese: 它看上去像只蓝色蜻蜓。

detailed_translations.english: a brightly-coloured insect with a long thin body and transparent wings which lives near water

sentences.english: I don't think people are really aware of just how much it costs.
sentences.chinese: 我认为人们并不真正明白这要花多少钱。

sentences.english: Were you aware that something was wrong?
sentences.chinese: 你有没有意识到已经出了问题？

detailed_translations.english: knowing or realizing sth

name: eligible
trans: 符合条件的， 合格的； 适合的

sentences.english: Stephen was regarded as an eligible bachelor.
sentences.chinese: 斯蒂芬被认为是一个钻石王老五。

detailed_translations.english: someone who is eligible for something is able or allowed to do it, for example because they are the right age

sentences.english: I forgot to set the burglar alarm.
sentences.chinese: 我忘记打开防盗警报器了。

sentences.english: Car alarms are always going off in the street.
sentences.chinese: 街上总有汽车警报器在响。

sentences.english: a sophisticated alarm system
sentences.chinese: 精密的警报系统

sentences.english: We could not see what had alarmed him.
sentences.chinese: 我们不明白是什么吓着他了。

detailed_translations.english: a piece of equipment that makes a loud noise to warn you of danger
If something alarms you, it makes you afraid or anxious that something unpleasant or dangerous might happen

sentences.english: the constant battle against weeds
sentences.chinese: 对付杂草的长期斗争

sentences.english: I've been weeding the flower beds.
sentences.chinese: 我一直在除花坛里的杂草。

detailed_translations.english: a wild plant growing where it is not wanted that prevents crops or garden flowers from growing properly
to remove unwanted plants from a garden or other place

sentences.english: So too the stories of Moses and of Samson have Sumerian and Babylonian parallels.
sentences.chinese: 同样，关于摩西和参孙的传说在苏美尔和巴比伦也有相似的版本。

sentences.english: The early Babylonian's most popular resolution was to return borrowed farm equipment.
sentences.chinese: 早期巴比伦人最普遍的计划是归还借来的耕种工具。

sentences.english: In the years around 2000 BC, the Babylonian New Year began with the first New Moon (actually the first visible crescent) after the Vernal Equinox (first day of spring).
sentences.chinese: 大约在公元前2000年，巴比伦的新年随着春分（春天的第一天）之后的第一个新月（实际上第一个看得见的新月）开始了。

detailed_translations.english: of, relating to, or characteristic of ancient Babylon or Babylonia, its people, or their language
an inhabitant of ancient Babylon or Babylonia

sentences.english: The glacier calved a large iceberg.
sentences.chinese: 冰川崩解而产生一个大冰山。

sentences.english: The glacier dislocated great stones.
sentences.chinese: 冰川使许多大石块移位了。

sentences.english: A river or glacier debouches on the plains.
sentences.chinese: 一条河流或冰川流向平原。

detailed_translations.english: a large mass of ice which moves slowly down a mountain valley

sentences.english: The club gave him an ultimatum – either he apologized, or he would be expelled from the team.
sentences.chinese: 俱乐部给他下了最后通牒——要么道歉，要么等着被开除出队。

sentences.english: The army issued an ultimatum for all weapons in the city to be surrendered on October 26th.
sentences.chinese: 军队发出最后通牒，必须于 10 月 26 日交出该市的全部武器。

detailed_translations.chinese: 最后通牒；最后结论；基本原理
detailed_translations.english: a threat saying that if someone does not do what you want by a particular time, you will do something to punish them

name: horde
trans: 一大群人； 游牧部落

sentences.english: This attracts hordes of tourists to Las Vegas.
sentences.chinese: 这吸引了一群群的旅客来到拉斯维加斯。

detailed_translations.english: a large crowd moving in a noisy uncontrolled way

sentences.english: We’ve had a long period of low rainfall.
sentences.chinese: 我们已有很长一段时间雨量偏低。

sentences.english: The city has received only half its average rainfall of four inches.
sentences.chinese: 该市目前的降雨只有往常四英寸平均雨量的一半。

detailed_translations.english: the amount of rain that falls on an area in a particular period of time

name: racism
trans: 种族主义， 种族歧视

sentences.english: The government has promised to continue the fight against racism.
sentences.chinese: 政府已承诺继续打击种族歧视。

sentences.english: the problem of racism in schools
sentences.chinese: 学校里的种族歧视问题

detailed_translations.chinese: 种族主义，种族歧视；人种偏见
detailed_translations.english: unfair treatment of people, or violence against them, because they belong to a different race from your own

name: orientation
trans: 方向， 方位； 定位； 培训； 情况介绍

sentences.english: The company needs to develop a stronger orientation towards marketing its products.
sentences.chinese: 公司需要针对其产品的营销设定一个更为明确的目标。

sentences.english: How can we get students to adopt a serious orientation to learning?
sentences.chinese: 我们怎样才能让学生对学习采取认真的态度呢？

detailed_translations.english: the type of activity or subject that a person or organization seems most interested in and gives most attention to

sentences.english: a luxurious 30-room villa
sentences.chinese: 一栋有30个房间的豪华度假别墅

detailed_translations.english: very expensive, beautiful, and comfortable

name: motion
trans: 运动，移动；动作；提议，动议

sentences.english: She motioned for the locked front doors to be opened.
sentences.chinese: 她打手势示意把锁着的前门打开。

sentences.english: He stood aside and motioned Don to the door.
sentences.chinese: 他站在一边，示意唐到门口。

detailed_translations.english: If you motion to someone, you move your hand or head as a way of telling them to do something or telling them where to go

detailed_translations.chinese: 运动；手势，眼色，动作；提议
detailed_translations.english: the process of moving or the way that someone or something moves

name: idle
trans: 懒散的；没有工作的，闲散的；空闲的；漫无目的的；无用的，无效的

sentences.english: I cannot afford to leave the land lying idle.
sentences.chinese: 我不能让土地闲置。

sentences.english: The whole team stood idle, waiting for the mechanic.
sentences.chinese: 整队人干站着等技工来。

sentences.english: The workers have been idle for the last six months.
sentences.chinese: 最近六个月工人们都很闲。

detailed_translations.english: not working or producing anything

sentences.english: the country’s economic plight
sentences.chinese: 该国的经济困境

sentences.english: he plighted his word to attempt it

detailed_translations.english: a very bad situation that someone is in
to give or pledge (one's word)

sentences.english: It’s our last match of the season.
sentences.chinese: 这是我们本赛季最后一场比赛。

sentences.english: They’re preparing for a big match tomorrow.
sentences.chinese: 他们在为明天的一场大赛做准备。

sentences.english: McClaire’s goal earned him the title of man of the match (= the person in a team who plays best ) .
sentences.chinese: 麦克莱尔的进球为他赢得了“本场最佳球员”的称号。

sentences.english: Carlos was no match for the champion.
sentences.chinese: 卡洛斯根本不是冠军的对手。

detailed_translations.english: an organized sports event between two teams or people

name: fault
trans: 过错， 过失； 缺点， 弱点； 断层

sentences.english: I’m really sorry - it’s all my fault.
sentences.chinese: 我真的很抱歉——都是我的错。

sentences.english: I didn’t sleep well that night, but it was my own fault .
sentences.chinese: 那天晚上我没有睡好，但这是我自己的问题。

detailed_translations.english: if something bad that has happened is your fault, you should be blamed for it, because you made a mistake or failed to do something

name: interplay
trans: 相互作用， 相互影响

sentences.english: The law bring into effect is an organism concerned with the interplay among society, economic and culture.
sentences.chinese: 实际运作中的法律制度是一个社会、经济和文化互相作用的有机体。

sentences.english: The equipment design must grow by continual interplay between the technical specification and the packaging .
sentences.chinese: 仪器设计必须根据工艺指标和装配之间不断地交互影响而发展。

sentences.english: To date, most research into the interplay of exercise and anxiety has focused on the actions of various neurotransmitters or chemical messengers within the brain, like serotonin and dopamine.
sentences.chinese: 迄今为止，大多数有关锻炼和焦虑的相互影响的研究都集中在大脑内的各种神经递质或化学信使，如血清素、多巴胺上。

detailed_translations.english: the way in which two people or things affect each other

name: hail
trans: 招呼； 高呼； 赞扬， 称颂； 下冰雹

sentences.english: heavy showers of rain and hail
sentences.chinese: 夹着冰雹的阵阵大雨

detailed_translations.english: frozen raindrops which fall as hard balls of ice

detailed_translations.chinese: 致敬；招呼；向欢呼；猛发；使像下雹样落下（过去式hailed，过去分词hailed，现在分词hailing，第三人称单数hails）
detailed_translations.english: to call to someone in order to greet them or try to attract their attention

name: accent
trans: 重音； 口音； 重音符号

sentences.english: He had a strong Irish accent
sentences.chinese: 他有浓重的爱尔兰口音。

detailed_translations.chinese: 口音；重音；强调；特点；重音符号
detailed_translations.english: the way someone pronounces the words of a language, showing which country or which part of a country they come from
to make something more noticeable so that people will pay attention to it

name: passive
trans: 被动的， 消极的； 被动语态的

sentences.english: Kathy seems to take a very passive role in the relationship.
sentences.chinese: 凯茜在这一关系中似乎扮演着十分被动的角色。

sentences.english: their passive acceptance of their fate
sentences.chinese: 他们对命运的消极接受

detailed_translations.english: someone who is passive tends to accept things that happen to them or things that people say to them, without taking any action

name: nauseous
trans: 恶心的； 令人作呕的， 令人厌恶的

sentences.english: I felt slightly nauseous.
sentences.chinese: 我觉得有点恶心。

sentences.english: The taste made me nauseous.
sentences.chinese: 那味道让我恶心。

detailed_translations.english: feeling that you are going to vomit

sentences.english: glass fragments
sentences.chinese: 玻璃碎片

detailed_translations.chinese: 碎片；片断或不完整部分
detailed_translations.english: a small piece of something that has broken off or that comes from something larger
to break something, or be broken into a lot of small separate parts – used to show disapproval

sentences.english: He was very skilled at pointing down the blocks of granite.
sentences.chinese: 他善于把花岗岩石凿平。

sentences.english: If you're working in steel or granite, redesigning or adding onto something is very expensive.
sentences.chinese: 如果你用钢或花岗岩来工作，重新设计或增加一些东西是很贵的。

sentences.english: Everything you see, from the cobblestones the characters walk on to the granite within the buildings, all those details help to bring you into that era.
sentences.chinese: 影片里你所见之处，从角色走过的鹅卵石路到大楼的花岗石，所有的细节都能帮助将你置身于那个年代。” 克罗尔解释道。

detailed_translations.english: a very hard grey rock, often used in building

name: response
trans: 回答； 反应， 响应

sentences.english: His immediate response was one of disbelief.
sentences.chinese: 他的第一反应是不相信。

sentences.english: Carl made no response , and carried on with his meal.
sentences.chinese: 卡尔没有回答，继续吃饭。

detailed_translations.english: something that is done as a reaction to something that has happened or been said

name: refreshing
trans: 使人耳目一新的； 提神的， 使人精神振作的

sentences.english: a refreshing drink
sentences.chinese: 一杯提神的饮料

sentences.english: The breeze felt refreshing.
sentences.chinese: 微风让人神清气爽。

detailed_translations.chinese: 提神的；使清爽的；使人重新振作的
detailed_translations.english: making you feel less tired or less hot

detailed_translations.chinese: 使清新；恢复精神（refresh的ing形式）

name: oblivious
trans: 遗忘的； 未注意的， 不知不觉的

sentences.english: She lay motionless where she was, oblivious to pain.
sentences.chinese: 她一动不动地躺在原地，感觉不到疼痛。

detailed_translations.english: If you are oblivious to something or oblivious of it, you are not aware of it

sentences.english: people in the over-45 age category
sentences.chinese: 属45岁以上年龄组的人

sentences.english: Seats are available in eight of the ten price categories .
sentences.chinese: 座位共有10种票价，现有8种可售。

sentences.english: Williams’ style does not fit easily into the category of jazz.
sentences.chinese: 威廉斯的风格不能轻易归入爵士乐的范畴。

detailed_translations.english: a group of people or things that are all of the same type

sentences.english: This gives the company a competitive advantage over its rivals.
sentences.chinese: 这使该公司与其对手相比具有一项竞争优势。

sentences.english: He finished 39 seconds ahead of his main rival .
sentences.chinese: 他比主要对手早39秒到达终点。

sentences.english: She was 2 minutes faster than her nearest rival .
sentences.chinese: 她比紧随其后的对手快两分钟。

sentences.english: a game against their old rivals , Manchester United
sentences.chinese: 和他们的老对手曼联队的比赛

sentences.english: They still remain bitter rivals (= hate each other ) .
sentences.chinese: 他们仍是死敌。

sentences.english: Their sales have now overtaken those of their arch-rival (= main or strongest rival ) .
sentences.chinese: 他们的销售额现已超过了主要竞争对手。

detailed_translations.english: a person, group, or organization that you compete with in sport, business, a fight etc
